temporall commoditie taken man glory sought thereby rather spirituall inwarde supportation soulehealth helpe religion restoring true doctrine repayring christes church repressing corrupt abuse agayne light v rather light wherfore printer mynde defrauded due commendation pretermitting light triflyng pamflets matter vnneedful impertinent little seruing purpose lesse necessitie doe employe endeuour workemanship chiefly restore fruitfull workes monumentes auncient writer blessed martyr godly lyfe constant death gaue testimonie trueth tyme wherein suffered doctrine learning geeue lesse inclosed workes meane william tyndall iohn frith robart barnes chiefe ryngleaders latter tymes thys church england wherein haue much prayse god good bookes left church also printer preseruing industrie charge bookes perishing haue exhorte studious reader wyth lyke diligence embrace benefite god offered seriously occupie selues markyng folowing valiaunt actes excellent wrytinges sayd godly person concernyng prayse whereof shall neede thys place bestow much commendation neither prayse men profite godly doe seeke yet contempt vngodly doe feare moreouer sayde thought rather owne workes men wordes readyng bookes preface seene perusing whereof thou shalt fynde gentle reader whether thou bee ignoraunt learne whether thou learned folowe sticke briefly whatsoeuer thou art thou yong iohn frith thou middle age w tyndall elder yeares barnes matter founde onely doctrine enforme thee comfort delyte thee godly ensample directe thee also speciall admiration make thee wonder workes lord mightely workyng men oportunely stirryng vp graciously assisting albeit diuers also besides say nay well secrete operation god mighty prouidence haue beene raysed vp famous learnyng florishyng witte stout zeale labouryng cause haue lesse valiantly doughtely stoode like defence christes true religion agaynst blynde errour pestilent superstition perillous hypocrisie namely agaynst arche enemye powred vppon hys church heauenly souldiours onely number exceedyng knowledge also excellyng preaching printing doe garnishe church euery respecte may seeme peraduenture wil thought time stand little neede bookes momumentes former antiquitie yet notwithstandyng mynde thinke albeit increasing learning tonges science wyth quicknes wit youth doth maruailously shut vp seene sufficient furnishyng christes church yet happeneth tell farther looke backe former tymes tyndall frith others lyke simplicitie wyth true zeale humble modestie see wyth lesse corruption affection yet wyth dayes finde fault handsomely learned conformable pointz perceauing bare fauour vnto sayd thinking hee beene brought acquainted frende sayd phillipes towne iij iiij dayes depart court bruxelles andwarp x iiij myles much procured bring thence andwarp procuror generall emperours attorney certaine officer first sayd phillipes seruaunt came vnto poyntz demaunded whether tyndall master would come dyne foorthwith came phillipes asked poyntz wife tyndall shewed chamber sayd good meate shall haue dinner entend dyne aunswered haue market would geue went phyllipes straight vp tyndale chamber tolde way came lost pursse therefore prayed lend xl shilling foorthwith lent easie inough wilie subtilnes world simple vnexpert sayd phillipes shall gest day sayd tyndall got forth day dynner shall goe gest shall welcome dynner tyme came tyndall phillipes went forth togither going forth poyntz house long narrow entrey ij coulde goe front tyndall would haue put phillipes phillipes would wise put tyndall beefore hee pretended shew greate humanitie tyndall man great stature went phillipes tall person folowed behinde set officer either syde dore vpon ij seates beeing might see came entrye comming ye sayd entrye phillipes pointed finger ouer tyndale head downe hym officer sat dore might see hee take officer tooke tyndall afterward tolde fore sayde poyntz sayd pit ed see simplicitie tooke tyndall hee came tyndals simplicitie pitied officer nere dore espied officer woulde haue shronke backe nay sayd phill ipes leaue shall goe forth force bare hym forward vpon officer assone officer taken forthwith brought vnto amend thing see daylye experience lyuynges doyngs rebuked trouthe saye impossible translate scripture englishe lawfull lay people haue mother toug would subtile shift pope clergy couer euill make heretickes would nodoubt many thynges whiche long tyme haue falsely taught whole cause wherefore forbid though clokes pretende rather euery one say would make rise agaynst king selues vnto damnation neuer yet obeyed lest temporall ruler see falsehode scripture came lyght causeth lie translation affirme vnto lay people haue heard say wotte many thousand heresy papistes vexed tindal translation new testament mended correct haue yet taken great payne examine compare vnto would fayne haue owne imagination iugglyng termes haue somewhat rayle vnder cloke blaspheme truth might litle labour suppose haue translated part bible tymes past wont looke scripture foud theyr dun papistes shamed wrest scripture suche like deuilishe doctrine haue yet narowly loked tra slation yt much one therin lack title ouer hed haue noted nomber vnto ye ignoraunt people heresy finally agreed driue knowledge scripture ye shall haue text therof mother toug kepe world still darkenesse entent might sit conscience people thorow vayne superstition false doctrine satisfie filthy lustes proude ambition vnsatiable couetousnes exalte owne honour aboue kyng emperour yea aboue god hym selfe papistes haue wrought wonderfully haue suppressed scripture thousand bookes leuer put foorth agaynst abhominable doynges doctrine scripture come light long may keepe wil darken ye right way mist sophistry ta gle yt either rebuke despise abhominations argumentes philosophie worldly similitude apparent reason naturall wisedome wrestyng scripture vnto owne purpose cleane contrary vnto processe order meanyng text delude descantyng vpo allegory amase expoundyng owles abide brightnes day cannot papist abide lyght gospell many sens vnlearned lay people hath one simple litterall sense whose light owles abide thoughe thou feele thine harte arte sure false say yet couldest yu solue subtle rydles whiche thyng onely moued translate new testament perceaued experience howe impossible stablishe first moued w tyndale translate scripture englssh laye people truth excepte scripture playnely layd eye mother toung might see processe order meanyng text el soeuer truth taught enemy truth quench agayn partly smoke thou see processe order meanyng therof eue byshops london house entented haue done bishop lo tunstall afterward bishop durham turmoyled cou trey could le ger dwell processe whereof long rehearse wise thought selfe suffer priestes countrey vnlearned god knoweth full ignoraunt sorte whiche haue sene latin read porte missales yet many scarcely read except albertus de secretis mulieru yet though neuer sorily learned poore day night make note therein teach mydwiues say linwode booke constitution gather tithe mortuary offeringes customes pillage whiche call god part duety holy church discharge meod hebrew excedyngly diligence might power haue made mad iugglyng charmes craftie persuasios thinke ful satisfactio wicked lyuing torment tell trouth burne yt word soules health slea soeuer beleue thereon notwithstandyng yet submitte booke haue tyndals submission submit themselues god either made translated shall tyme come bee god shall labour haruest vnto submit selues vnto word god corrected yea moreouer disalowed also burnt seme worthy haue examined hebrue first put forth owne traslatyng correct prologue willia tyndall shewyng vse scripture wrote fiue bookes moses though man precious iuell rich yet hee wiste value therof wherfore serued neither better richer straw eue though read scripture bable neuer much yet know vse wherfore geuen therein sought profiteth v nothyng enough therfore read talke onely must also desire toung life proueth true gospeller god day night instantly open eye make v vnderstand feele wherefore scripture geuen may applye medicine scripture euery man glorious according promise blessing law shal auoyde temporal punishment law threatnynges cursinges also neyther lawe tenne commaundementes yet ceremony iustified hart god purified vnto lyfe come much moses death euen fourtye yeares lawe ceremony geuen complaineth saying god hath geuen hart vnderstande eye see eares heare vnto day shoulde law could geue lyfe haue sayd god hath geuen ceremony ye knowe vse hath geuen lawe god hath writen harte wherfore serueth law geue v power law paul answereth geuen vtter sinne onely make appeare corosie layd vnto old law vtterer sinne sore heale stirre vp make disease alyue man myght feele eopardie nye death aware make way vnto healing playster euen sayth paul gal law geuen bycause transgression make sinne alyue might felt sene vntill seede came vnto whome promised saye vntill child fayth came vntill christ sede god promised abraham natios world blessed came law geuen vtter sinne death damnation cursse law geuen god shewe sinne driue v vnto christ forgeuenes lyfe iustifiyng blessynges promised might see great loue god v ward christ hence forth ouercome kindnes might loue agayne loue kepe commaundementes goeth quiet consciece iustifie selfe law doth heale hys woundes freatyng coroseis hee goeth aboute purchase grace ceremony geuen iustify hart signifie iustificatio christ ceremony doth sucke ale pole quench thyrst much ceremony geuen iustifie hart signifie iustifiyng forgeuenesse christes bloud ceremony iustifie thou readest hebr x impossible sinne done away bloud ox goates ceremony cannot iustify law thou readest galla iij bene lawe geuen could haue quickened geuen lyfe righteousnes iustifiyng come lawe deede law onely quickeneth hart also woundeth conscience sinne ministreth death damnation vnto ij cor iij must nedes dye damned except find remedy farre iustified holpen law new testament euerlastyng promise whiche made v new testament euerlastyng promise made v christ christ lorde throughout scripture testament built fayth workes said testament worketh shall lyue beleueth shall lyue thou readest iohn iij god loued world faith iustifieth gaue onely begotten sonne none beleue hym perishe haue lyfe euerlastyng testament preached beleued spirit entreth hart quickeneth geueth life iustifieth spirite also maketh law liuely thyng hart man bringeth foorth good workes owne accord without compulsion lawe without feare threatenynges good workes spryng loue haue god cursings yea without maner respect loue vnto te porall pleasure power spirite receiued thorough fayth thou readest iohn gaue power sonnes god beleued name power worke hath spirit christ child neither learneth worketh loger payne yt rod feare bugges pleasure apple doth thynges owne courage christe sayeth iohn vij beleueth shall haue riuers liuyng water flowyng hys belly good workes giftes grace sprynge true fayth good workes flow abound hym naturally owne accord thou nedest wrest good woorkes hym man would wryng veriuce crabbes nay flowe naturally hym sprynges rockes new testamet euer euen begynnyng world alwaies promise christ new testament beginnyng come fayth promise elect iustified inwardly god outwardly world kepyng law ceremony conclusion thou seest blessynges cursynges folowe breaking keping law moyses euen naturally blessynges cursynges folowe breakyng keping law nature temporall lawes spring law nature spryng temporall lawes people kepe temporall lawes land temporal prosperitie maner temporall blessynges thou readest moyses accompany fall vpon contrarywise sinne vnpunished ruler haue respect vnto equitie honestie god sendeth cursse among hunger dearth morein bannyng pestilence warre oppression straunge wonderful disease new kyndes misfortune euill lucke man aske seing faith iustifieth worke aunswere loue copelleth log loue counselleth faythfull worke soule feeleth loue god hath shewed christ loue god agayne wil commaundements loue worke hor seme hard vnto thinke selfe better woorkyng seeke heauen higher place heaue bycause christia worketh make weake brother perfecter seeke higher place heauen compare selfe vnto hym woorketh hee worketh day shall haue grace turne woorke morow meane tyme pitie must presume well codene others run astray last turneth god farre forward first hym pray hym wrought god thousad yeares wrought deuill long day turne bee well willyng suffer christ hee hath day ouer sorowest yt thy member moue thee vnto contrary hast thou part christ thou repent thy sinne impossible thou faith foloweth repentaunce sinne shouldest beleue christe deliuered thee daunger therof thou haue appoynted yet spirituality pillage theyr standing stiped sufficiente liuyng whether tythes rente yearely wage ought content require yet receaue ensample sobernesse despising worldly thing vnto ensample hys parishioner wilte thou vowe offer vnto poore people pleasaunt good vowe kepe god commaundementes sight god left almes vpon christes stead right heyres aboundaunce ouerplus moreouer must commaundement howe thou mayst lawfully goe pilgrimage thou wilt vowe pilgrimage thou must put salt therto like manner shall accepted thou vowe go visite poore heare god word whatsoeuer edifieth thy soule vnto loue good worke knowledge whatsoeuer god commaundeth wel done sacrifice sauoureth well ye wil happly say ye go place god hath chosen one place another wyll heare petition one place another prayer must according god worde ye may desire god take vengeaunce hym whome god worde teacheth pity pray glose god one god heareth al call vppon tymes al place alyke place another suppose sal infatuatum salt vnsauery wisdome could excuse yt deth steuen act died article god dwelleth temple made handes yt beleue god temple god sayeth paul man loue god keepe hys worde temple god hath god presently dwellyng witnesseth christ iohn saying man loue wyll keepe worde father wyll loue hym wyll come vnto hym dwel hym saith ye abyde wordes also abyde aske ye wyll god regardeth hart place wee pray ye shall haue thou beleue christe hast promise whiche god hath made thee thine hart go pilgrimage vnto thyne owne hart pray god wil heare thee hys mercy truthes sake sonnes christes sake stone sake careth god temple beastes haue life much better heape stone couched together speake chastity gift wilfull chastitie mete person vow geuen vnto persones testifieth christ also apostle paul wherfore person may vow moreouer bee cause wherefore many person may better lyue chast one tyme many may lyue chast twenty thirtie certayne cold disease folowyng xl health come many occupyed wilde phantasy youth care mariage waxen sad shalbe greatly desirous daungerous thyng make sinne none forsweare benefite god bynde thy self vnder payne danation thy soule yu wouldest vse remedy god hath created nede required thyng beware thou get thee false fayned chastitie false fayned chastitie made vngodly persuasios hierome ouide filthy booke remedy agaynst loue l st throughe imaginatios thou hast vtterly despised defied abhorred womankynde thou come case thoroughe fierce wrath god thou canst neither lyue chast finde thy hart mary compelled fall abhomination pope nature kynde moreouer god wise father pope restrayned god permitted setteth liberty god forbiddeth knoweth infirmity child also mercyfull therefore hath created remedy without sinne geuen therto fauour blessyng let v wyser god imaginatios tempt godly chastitie euery ma gift euen hath day hath power continue owne pleasure neither hath god promised geue stil cure infirmity without hys naturall remedy hath promised slake hys hunger without meate thyrst without drinke wherfore either let good adminition wil make vowes thynges byde free god hath created neither vowe god permitteth thee fauour blessing also el thou wilte nedes vowe vow godly vnder condition thou wilt continue chast long god geueth thee gift long neither thyne necessitie neither charitie toward thy neighbour authoritie vnder whose power thou art driue thee vnto contrary purpose thy vowe must bee salted also wisedome god thou mayest vowe iustified wherunto howe apply vowes thereby make satisfaction thy sinnes wynne heaue hyer place diddest thou wrong vnto bloud christ thy vowe playne idolatry abhominable sight god thy vow vow made must onely vnto furtheraunce commaundementes god haue said nothing tamyng thy member seruice thy neighbour thou thincke thy backe weake burthen wedlocke thou canst rule thy wife child seruauntes make prouision godly without ouermuch busying vnquietyng thy selfe drownyng thy selfe worldly busynesse vnchristenly thou canst serue thy neighbour office better beyng chast maryed thy vowe fasteth ende tame body may waite vpon god deceiueth hym selfe good lawfull euen must thou vowe abstinence meates drinkes farre forth profitable vnto thy neighbour vnto tamyng thy fleshe thou mayst vowe neither vnto slaying thy body paule commaundeth tymothe drincke wyne water disease thou wilt say timothy happely forsworne wyne thinke apostle forsware wedlocke thoughe many lyued chast neither yet meate drincke though absteined good v folow example howbeit though vowe sweare thinke none exception doynges must tende honour god loue neighbour yet breakyng god co maundemets except chaunces hange god sweare certain place certain houre make loueday without exception yet king meane tyme commaunde way must goe god commaundement yet breake myne othe like case father mother sicke require presence wife child houshold visited ny assistance required neighbour house fire houre thousand chaunces whiche breake myne othe forsworne forth read god word diligently good hart shall teach thee thynges prologue fifte booke moses called deuteronomy booke worthy read daye night neuer handes excellent bokes moses boke preachyng fayth loue easy also lyght pure gospell yt wit preachyng fayth loue deducyng loue god fayth loue man neighbour yt loue god herein also thou mayst learne right meditation thou mayest learne right meditation contemplation contemplation nothyng el saue yt calling minde repeatyng harte glorious wonderfull dedes god terrible handling enemy mercyfull entreatyng come hee calleth whiche thyng booke doth almost nothyng elles foure first chapter rehearseth benefites god done vnto prouoke loue workes god supernatural mightie dedes done aboue natural capacitie faith might beleue god trust strength thirdly rehearceth fierce plague god vppon enemyes impatiencie vnbeliefe fell hym partly tame abate appetite flesh alway fight agaynst spirite partely bridle wilde ragyng lustes spirite though must abstaine fro outward euill though loue yet feare vengeance god power good loue yet lest way abstaine outward euill feare wrath cruell vengeaunce whiche fall vpo shortly finde cast vp god nurter runne riotte beyond lawes ordinaunces vnto law god may neither adde minish moreouer chargeth put nought take ought away god wordes diliget onely keepe reembraunce hart teach childre feare forgettyng beware either co maunded abstayne image makyng imagery bowyng selues vnto image saying ye saw image god spake vnto heard voyce onely voyce keepe thereunto cleaue lyfe shall saue finally frailtie fleshe shal haue fallen god haue brought trouble aduersitie combraunce necessitie yet repent turne hee god mercyful repent promiseth god shall reme ber mercy receaue grace agayne fifte repeateth x commaudementes might see cause loue biddeth remember bound egypt god deliuered mighty hande stretched arme serue kepe maundementes paule sayth christ hath deliuered v therfore ought serue neyghbour sake wee bought christes bloud therefore seruauntes owne ought seeke wil honour onely loue serue one sake sixte setteth fountaine commaundementes beleue one god doth therfore ought onely bee loued hart soule might loue onely fulfillyng loue onely fulfillyng lawes god comaundementes paule also sayth vnto romaine galathians likewise warneth also forget comaundementes teache child shew child also god deliuered bondage egiptians serue commaundements child might see cause worke loue likewise seuenth together faith must trust onely god selues hee remoueth occasion might withdrawe faith pulleth also confidence selues sturreth vp trust god boldly onely eight chapter thou seest cause temptation man might see hart whe brought extremity must either suffer forsake god shall feele much beleue trust much loue like maner brother howe may trye examine hym selfe much loueth god neighbour euill good loue cause see loue god euen hate feele perceaue loue wordly finally hee sturreth fayth loue god driueth fro confidence owne selues ninth also hee moueth god styrreth vp people vnto fayth vnto fayth put trust god draweth confidece selues rehearsing ye wickednesse whiche wrought first day knew vnto day end repeteth right way prayer howe coniured god horeb ouercame prayer thou mayest learne right maner pray tenth reckeneth vppe pith lawes keping pith effect ye lawes god law hart feare god loue serue hym hart soule might kepe co maundementes loue sheweth reason euen god lord heauen earth hath also done owne goodnesse without deseruyng loue vnto god bringeth loue vnto wee firste loue god loue wee must nedes loue neighbour man neighbour saying god lord aboue lordes loueth al seruauntes indifferetly well poore feble strauger rich mighty therfore loue poore straunger addeth cause ye straungers god deliuered hath brought vnto land ye bee home loue straunger therefore sake xj exhorteth loue feare god rehearceth terrible dedes god vpo enemyes loue feare god despise hym rebelled agaynst hym testifieth vnto wil folow loue feare god also despise hym breake commaundement xij hee commaundeth put word god may altered way might occasion hurt fayth forbiddeth ought owne myndes alter word god xiij forbiddeth herken vnto ought saue vnto god word let draw v god worde though whiche counseleth contrary come miracle paule doth vnto galathians xiiij beast forbidden partly vncleannesse partly cause hate betwene heathen haue conuersation together one abhorreth eateth vnto xv chapter pertaine vnto faith mater common weal loue chiefly xv hee begynneth entreate specially thinges pertainyng vnto common welth equitie exhorteth vnto loue man neighbour xvj among forgetteth xvij entreateth right equitie chiefly much hee looketh vnto faith vnto punishment idolater hee yet endeth law loue equitie forbiddyng condemne man vnder lesse two witness lest none may condemned vnder two witnessed commaundeth bryng trespasser vnto open gate citie men go men might heare cause see right pope hath founde better way euen oppose accuser secretly man know whether hee haue right either heare article aunswere feare lest people searche whether xviij hee forbiddeth false deuilish craft hurt true faith moreouer people could heare voyce law spoken christ sauiour declared old testament fire promiseth prophet bring better tydynges whiche spoken christ sauiour xix forth vnto end xxvij almost altogether loue vnto neighbour lawes equitie honesty respect vnto faith xxviij terrible chapter trembled chrisren ma hart curse wrath god ouer al break lawes might well bleed sorrow readyng feare wrath like come vpon v accordyng vnto curse thou readest accordyng vnto curse hath god delt nation fallen abhominations blindnesse xxix like terrible godly lesson end shold leaue may curious searchyng worldly law satisfied outwarde worke whiche turke may also fulfill yet god law neuer ceaseth condemne man vntil written hys harte vntill keepe naturally without compulsion respect saue onely pure loue god neighbour naturally eateth hungred without compulsion respect saue slake hys hunger onely come gospell papisticall corrupt doctrine papist mingle leuen say god receiueth v mercy mercy receueth v saintes cruell euer heathe man wreakeful vengeable po te fayne goddes fury torment soules bell euens fasted image visited saluted wyth pater noster prayer onely lippes acquainted harte vnderstandyng day went faire easyly preachyng sermon another rebuked sinne people must perish thou art come vnto repentauce niniuites hast thou sure earnest soeuer angry god yet remembreth mercy vnto truly repent beleue mercy whiche ensample sauiour christe also casteth christ mercyfull repent call mercy teeth indurate iewes saying niniuites shall rise iudgemet nation condemne repented preachyng ionas behold greater ionas meanyng selfe whose preachyng yet thoughe neuer mightie pearce hart miracle thereto hard harted iewes could repent heathen niniuites repeted bare preachyng ionas rebukyng sinnes without miracle iewes leuened spirituall law god gloses made altogether earthly doctrine phariseis papist make sinne sinne fleshly set vaile coueryng moses face shadow darken glorious brightnes hys countenaunce sinne steale robbe widowes house vnder colour long praying polle name offerynges snare yt people intollerable constitution agaynst loue catche theyr money theyr purse synne smite father mother doctrine yt papistes hypocriticall monkes day sinne withdraw helpe theyr nede blynde zeale offring vnto profite ye holy pharises meritorious let thy kinne chuse whether wil sincke swimme thou buildest makest goodly foundation holy people whiche thou hast chosen thy christ supple thy soule yt oyle swete blessinges thy iesus blynd fruteles workes papistes saue thy soule purgatory bloud onely purgeth sinne watching fasting wolward goyng rising midnight c wherwith yet purge themselues couetousnes pride lechery vice thou seest among lay people great sinne christ heale papisticall sinnes people sabaoth day vnto glory god hys father none helpe cattell vnto owne profite sinne eate vnwashed handes vnwashed table vnwashed dishe eate purified dishe whiche came bribery thefte extortion sinne exceeding meritorious make many disciple teach feare god hys ordinaunces care hye prelate defended papistes taught selues theyr workes withall crueltie right holy church feared people curse god terrible paynes hell man durst leaue vilest herbe garden vntithed offeringes thinges dedicate vnto god profite holy vicar estimatio reuerence much grete sinne sweare truly forsweare thy selfe god false wicked doctrine papistes vengeaunce god terrible cruell damnation thynke ye preached fall stolen holy thinges yet sayth christ righteousnes fayth kepyng promise mercy indifferent iudgement vtterly troden vnder foote clean despised blessed father whiche mightelye maintained aaron patrimony made prosperous enuironed walled euery side feare god durst touche great holines garnish blinde btpocritical doctrine sepulcher prophetes condemne owne father slaying yet themselues blynde zeale owne constitution redy father slea whosoeuer testified vnto truth prophet testified vnto father yt christ compareth al righteousnes holy patriarckes vnto outwarde beauy painted sepulcher full stenche vncleannes within finally beguile ma neighbor subtle bargaining wrap compasse hym cautels law kyngdome pope reason wherof excluded law loue harte consequently true repentaunce coulde repent could see sinne side set vp phariseto set vp righteousnes workes clese soules withall righteousnes holy furnace fire could receiue neither repentance fayth moysture grace heathen niniuites though blinded lustes yet werin two poyntes vncorrupte vnhardened therfore repented preachyng ionas preachyng ionas marke diligently must note wordes law sinne c law vnderstand maner speakyng apostle aboue thing know paul meaneth wordes law sinne grace fayth righteousnes flesh sprite lyke el read thou neuer ofte thou shalt loose thy labor word lawe may vnderstand common manner vse paul terme maner men man wayes thou wouldest say law place nothyng learnyng techeth ought done ought done goeth man law law fulfilled outward workes though harte neuer far god iudgeth grounde harte ye thoughtes secret mouinges mynde therfore hys law requireth grounde hart loue bottome therof law god requireth bottom harte content outward worke onely rebuketh workes spryng loue ground low bottome hart though appeare outward neuer honest good christ gospell rebuketh pharises aboue open sinner calleth hipocrites say simulars paynted sepulcher pharises yet liued men pure pertayning outward dedes workes yt law ye paul third chapter epistle vnto philippias confesseth himselfe touching lawe one man coulde complayne notwithstandyng yet murderer christen per paul great persecutor christian secuted tormented sore compelled blaspheme christ altogether mercilesse many fayne outward good workes cause psalme calleth men lyers man kepeth law ground harte neither kepe men naturally inclyned vnto euill hate law fynde selues vnlust tediousnes good lust delectation euill free lust good bottom hart fulfilleth law doute willing good doth sinne raign v also sinne wrathe deserued god though neuer great outwarde shew apparance honest liuing cause concludeth paule second chapter iewes sinner transgressor law thoughe make men beleue thorow hipocrisie outward work fulfill law sayth onely whiche doth law righteous god meanyng therby man fulfill law christ onely outward workes fulfilleth law thou saith iewe teachest breake wedlocke yet breakest wedlocke thy selfe wherin thou iudgest man therein condemnest thou thy selfe thou thy selfe doest euen thynges whiche thou iudgest thoughe hee would say thou liuest outwardly well workes law iudgest liue thou teachest men seest mote ma eie art ware beame thyne owne eye though thou keepe lawe outwardly work feare rebuke shame punishment either loue reward vantage vayne glory yet doest thou without lust loue toward law haddest leuer great deale otherwise thou diddest feare lawe ye inwardly thine harte thou wouldest law p e perfect kepyng law e yet god author venger lawe possible paynefull vnto thee haue thyne appetite refrayned bee kepte downe wherfore playne conclusion thou grounde bottome thyne hart art enemy law preuayleth thou teachest man steale thou thyne owne selfe art thefe thyne hart outwardly wouldest fayne steale thou durst though outward dedes abyde alway behind hypocrite dissimulers breake forth among euen euill scabbe pocke alwayes kept violence medicine thou teachest man teachest thy selfe ye inward loue thou w est thou teachest thou vnderstadest law right fulfilled satisfied inward loue affection much lesse fulfilled outward deedes workes onely law encreaseth sinne moreouer law encreaseth sinne sayth fift chapter enemie law much requireth many thinges cleane contrarie nature wherof able fulfill one pointe title law requireth therfore prouoked haue greater lust breake whiche cause sake sayth seuenth chapter lawe law spiritual spirituall though would say law wer fleshly man doctrine might fulfilled satisfied stilled outward deedes law ghostly man fulfilleth except doth spryng loue bottome hart new hart lusty courage vnto law ward canst thou neuer come thyne owne strength enforcement operation workyng spirite spirite god onely maketh man spirituall spirite god maketh spirituall like vnto law hence forth hee doth nothyng feare lucre vantage sake vaine glory free hart inward lust law spirituall wilbe loued fulfilled spirituall hart therefore necessitie requireth spirit maketh man hart free geueth lust courage vnto law ward law good righteous holy spirite remaineth sinne grudging hatred law law neuerthelesse good righteous holy acquaint thy selfe therfore maner speakyng apostle let sticke fast thyne hart one dedes workes law fulfill law worke yt law workes law fulfilling law two thing soeuer man doth doe owne free owne proper strength enforcing notwithstandyng thoughe neuer great workyng yet long remaineth hart vnlust tediousnes grudgyng grief payne loths nne compulsion toward law long workes vnprofitable lost ye damnable sight god meaneth paule iij chapter sayth dedes lawe shall fleshe iustified sight god hereby perceauest thou sophisters disceauers whiche teach man may must prepare selfe grace fauour god good workes workes law man iustified ca prepare selues vnto fauour god whiche good selues good thinke good thought consent good deuill possessing harte myndes thoughtes captiue pleasure ca workes please god thinkest thou whiche done grief payne tediousnes euill contrary grudgyng mynde holy saint prosperous mightely scripture paule diddest thou confound heresie twelue hundred yeares goe therupon fulfill law yt workes therof soeuer lawe commaundeth law spiritual must fulfilled spiritually loue lust inward affection delectation lyue godly well freely willyngly without compulsion lawe euen thoughe lawe lust free libertie loue law commeth onely workyng spirite hart hee sayth first chapter spirite none otherwise geuen fayth onely beleue promise god without waueryng god true fulfill hys good promise toward v christes blonde sake playne first chapter ashamed sayth paule christes true fayth spirit god glad tydynges power god vnto saluation many beleue together euen beleue glad tydynges preached v holy ghost entreth harte looseth bondes deuill whiche possessed harte captiuitie held could haue lust yt god law spirite commeth fayth onely euen fayth commeth hearyng word glad tidynges god christ preached hee god sonne man also dead risen againe sake iustification fayth christ sayth thyrd fourth tenth chapter iustifying commeth faith faith spirite come god v hereof commeth fayth onely iustifieth maketh righteous fulfilleth law bringeth spirit christes deseruinges spirite bringeth lust looseth hart maketh free setteth hym libertie geueth strength worke deedes lawe loue euen law requireth last fayth workyng hart spryng good workes owne accorde meaneth thyrd chapter hath cast away true fayth springeth good worke workes law soundeth though would breake disanulle law fayth aunswereth might bee layd agaynst saying destroy law fayth mayntaine stablish law fayth say fulfill law thorough fayth sinne scripture called synne outward worke onely committed body whole busines euer accompanyeth moueth stirreth vnto outward sinne deede whence workes spring vnbelefe pronenes readynes vnto deede grounde hart power affection appetite wherwith sinne say man sinneth caried awaye headlong sinne together much poyson inclination corrupt nature wherein hee conceiued borne none outward sinne committed except caried away together life soule hart body lust mynde thereunto scripture loketh singularly vnto hart vnto roote originall fountaine synne vnbelefe bottom hart fayth onely iustifieth bryngeth spirit lust vnto outward good workes euen vnbelefe onely damneth keepeth spirit prouoketh flesh styrreth vp lust vnto euill outwarde work fortuned adam eu paradise gene cause christ calleth synne vnbelefe notablie sinne scripture chiefly called vnbe liefe iohn spirite sayth shall rebuke world sinne beleue wherefore good workes good frutes must needes fayth hart whence spryng bad deedes bad frutes must nedes vnbelief hart roote fountain pith stregth sinne whiche vnbelefe called head serpent old dragon woman seede christ must treade vnderfoote promised vnto adam grace gift haue difference grace properly god fauour beneuolence kynd minde grace vnderstand scripture owne selfe without deseruyng v beareth v whereby moued inclined geue christ vnto v giftes grace gift yt holy ghost working gift hee poureth harte hath mercy fauoureth though giftes spirit encrease v dayly haue yet ful perfection ye though remaine v yet euill lustes synne fight agaynst sprite sayth chapter galath spoken chapter gen debate betwene woman sede seed yt serpent yet neuertheles god fauour great strong ouer v christes sake counted full whole perfect god god fauour towarde v deuideth selfe encreasyng little little giftes receiueth v whole altogether ful loue christes sake intercessour god christes sake receaueth v mediator yt giftes sprite battell betwene sprite euill lustes begonne v already vnderstandest thou chapter paul accuseth hymselfe sinner yet chapter damnation christ sayeth damnation christ spirite giftes sprite begonne v sinner fleshe full killed mortified neuertheles muche beleue christ haue earnest beginning sprite god louyng fauourable faining euen profiteth neither followe good workes amendmet liuing right fayth thing wrought holy ghost v chaungeth v turneth v new nature begetteth v new god maketh v sonnes god thou readest first iohn killeth olde adam maketh v altogether new hart mynde wyll lust affectios power soule bringeth holye gost fayth liuely thing true faith liuely mighty working valiant strong euer doyng euer fruitfull vnpossible whiche endued therwith worke alwayes good workes without ceasing asketh fayth idle whether good workes done hath done already ere mention made alway nature quicke fayth hys hart liuely mouyng sprite driue hym stirre hym therunto whosoeuer doth good woorkes vnbeleuyng person faithles loketh roud groping faith good work woteth faith good workes meane though bable neuer many thinges faith good workes fayth liuely stedfast trust fauour god wherewith true definition fayth commit selues altogether vnto god trust surely grounded sticketh fast harte would doubt though die thousand tymes therefore suche trust wrought holy gost faith maketh man glad lusty chereful true harted vnto god vnto creature meanes wherof willingly without compulsion glad redy good euery man seruice euery man suffer thinges yt god may loued praysed hath geuen hym grace impossible separate good workes good worke cannot separate true fayth fayth euen impossible separate heat burning fire therfore take hede thy selfe beware thyne owne fantasy imagination iudge fayth good workes wyll seme wyse dede starke blind thing foolish pray god wyll vouchsafe worke faith thine hart el shalte thou remayne euermore faythlesse fayne thou imagine thou enforce thou wrastle thy self thou wilt canst righteousnes euen faythe righteousnes vnderstad called god righteousnesse righteousnes value god god gift altereth man chaungeth new spiritual nature maketh free liberall pay euery man duety fayth purged sinnes obteyneth luste vnto law god whereby geueth god hys honor payeth hym oweth hym vnto men doth seruice willingly wherwith soeuer payeth euery man duety righteousnes nature freewill owne strength neuer bring passe man geue himselfe faith take away vnbeliefe take away sinne wherefore false hipocrisie sinne whatsoeuer done without fayth vnbeliefe euident chapter vnto romains though appeare neuer glorious beautiful outwardes fleshe sprite mayest thou flesh spirite ow vnderstand vnderstand though flesh onely pertayneth vnto vnchastitie spirite inwardly pertayneth harte paul calleth flesh christ doth iohn borne fleshe witte whole man lyfe soule body wit reason whatsoeuer doth within without man study worlde flesh call fleshe therfore whatsoeuer long without yt spirite god thinke speake god fayth good workes spirituall matter call fleshe also word fleshe vnderstand scripture work done without grace without working sprite howsoeuer good holy spirituall seeme thou mayest proue chapter vnto galathians paule numbreth worshipping idoles witchcraft enuy hate among dedes flesh vnto romaine sayth law reason fleshe weake vnderstand vnchastitie onely sinnes incredu tie chief sinnes specially vnbeliefe vice spirituall grounde synnes thou callest whiche renewed spirit borne fleshe well described agayne christ flesh dedes euen motion hart minde learning doctrine contemplation hye thinges preaching teaching study scripture buildyng church foundyng abbeyes geuing almes masse matte soeuer doth though seme spiritual lawes god contrarywise call spirituall renewed christ deedes whiche spryng fayth seme neuer grose washyng disciple feete done christ peter fishing resurrection yea al dedes matrimony euer procedeth faith spirituall pure spiritual procede faith soeuer done lawes god though wrought body wiping shooes like soeuer grose appeare outward vnderstadyng wordes canst thou neuer vnderstand epistle paule neither place holy scripture take hede therfore soeuer vnderstadeth wordes otherwise vndersta deth paule soeuer prepare selues vnto epistle much becommeth preacher christes glad tydings first necessary profitable instruction preacher openyng law rebuke thinges proue thynges sinne procede spirite faith christ proue men sinner child wrath inheritaunce howe sinne nature nature otherwise doe sinne therewith abate pride man bring vnto knowledge selfe miserie wretchednes might desire helpe euen doth paule beginneth first chapter rebuke vnbelefe maner paules doctrine grose sinnes men see idolatrie grose sinnes heathen sinnes whiche liue ignoraunce without fayth without fauour god sayth wrath god heauen appeareth gospell vpon men vngodly vnholy lyuyng though knowe dayly vnderstad nature blinde ca see vnderstand goodnes god hys mercy shewed vnto v christ iesu hys owne creature one god yet nature spirit grace corrupt poysoned men neither thanke neither worship neither geue due honor blind selues faule without ceasyng worse case euen vntill come vnto worshipping image workyng shamefull sinnes whiche abhominable agaynst nature moreuer suffer shame vnrebuked hauing delectation pleasure therein second chapter procedeth rebuketh holy people also whiche without lust loue law liue wel outwardly paule codemneth hipocrisi face world condemne gladly nature hypocrite thinke selues pure respect open sinner yet hate law inwardly full couetousnes enuy vnclenes math xxiij whiche despise goodnes god accordyng hardenes harte heape together selues wrath god furthermore paule paul rebuketh hypocrite true expounder law suffreth man without sinne declareth vnder sinne whiche freewill nature liue well suffreth better open sinner yea calleth hard harted repent thyrd chapter mingleth together iewes gentile sayth one difference betwene iewe gentile sinner difference betwene saue onely iewes word god committed vnto though many beleued thereon yet god truth promise thereby neither hurt minished taketh way allegeth saying psalme god might abyde true wordes ouercome iudged returneth purpose agayn proueth men sinner scripture men without difference exceptio sinner workes law iustified law geuen vtter declare sinne onely hee begynneth sheweth right way vnto righteousnes meanes waye howe wee must bee made righteous must made righteous safe sayth sinner without prayse god must without deseruyng made righteous throughe fayth christe hath deserued righteousnes v become vnto v god mercystole remission sinnes past thereby prouyng christes righteousnes commeth v fayth helpeth v onely whiche righteousnes sayth declared gospell testified lawe prophetes furthermore sayth faith obteineth fulfillyng law law holpe furthered thorough fayth thoughe workes therof boast brought nought iiij chapter first chapter sinnes opened way faith vnto rightuousnes layd begynneth aunswere vnto certain obiections cauillations first putteth forth blinde reason whiche commonly wilbe iustified owne workes wont make heare faith onely without workes iustifieth saying shall men good paule auswereth caueling question papistes vse agaynst iustificatio faith onely workes yea fayth onely iustifieth nedeth man studie good workes putteth forth therfore abraham ensample saying abraham workes vayne came workes profite concludeth abraham without al workes iustified made righteous much worke circumcisio praysed scripture called righteous fayth onely gene xv worke circumcision bee holpen vnto righteousnesse whiche yet god commaunded hym good worke obedience likewise doubt none workes helpe thyng vnto ma iustifiyng abraham circumcisio outward signe wherby declared righteousnes fayth obedience readynes vnto god euen good workes outward signes outward frutes fayth good workes ou ward signes true fayth spirite iustifie man man iustified already god inwardly hart faith spirite purchased christes bloud herewith stablisheth paul doctrine faith afore rehearsed thyrd chapter bringeth also testimony dauid xij psalme whiche calleth man blessed workes sinne rekened fayth imputed righteousnes though abide afterward without good workes iustified iustified wee first iustified foloweth good workes receiue spirite good workes neither otherwise possible good workes except first spirite howe possible doe thyng well sight god yet captiuitie bondage vnder deuill deuill possesseth v together holdeth harte consent vnto god man therfore preuent spirite doyng good spirite must first come wake sleepe thunder law feare shew miserable estate wretchednes make abhorre hate selfe desire helpe comfort agayne pleasaut rayne gospell say sweete promise god christ stirre vp faith beleue promise beleueth god mercy moueth v fayth promise god al thing worketh iustification promise god mercyfull promise true fulfill wil geue spirite strength loue god worke see god onely whiche accordyng scripture worketh thinges woorketh man iustifiyng saluation health yea poureth fayth belefe lust loue god strength fulfill v euen water poured vessell good purpose deseruynges merites god god mercy saueth v selues mercy promising truth fulfilling promise saueth v ourselues therfore al laude prayse glory geuen vnto god mercy truth vnto v merites deseruynges stretcheth hys example agaynst good workes law cocludeth iewes arahams heyres bloud kinred onely much lesse workes law must inherite lack abraham fayth cannot abraham child abraham fayth wilbe right heyres abraham much abraham law moses also circumcision faith made righteous called father beleue worke moreouer law causeth wrath much fulfill loue lust longe grudgyng hate indignation agaynst law remayneth hart take away sprite commeth fayth long doubt workes law fayth onely receaueth grace cometh abraham declare euidetly wrath god vpon v fauour wherfore fayth receyueth grace promised vnto abraham ensamples written abraham sake onely sayth oures also beleue fayth shallbe reckened lykewise ryghteousnesse sayth end chapter chapter commendeth frutes workes fayth fruit workes faith peace reioycing conscience inwarde loue god moreouer boldnesse trust confidence strong lusty mynd stedfast hope tribulation suffering follow right fayth aboundant grace sake giftes sprite god hath geuen v christ suffred hym die v yet enemy haue fayth workes iustifieth fayth workes iustifieth followeth yet therfore man good workes yt right shape workes abide behind accompany fayth euen brightnesse doth sunne called paul fruites sprite yt spirite alwayes sommer good workes fruites fayth alwayes good fruites say good workes paules order good work spring sprite ye spirit commeth fayth faythe commeth hearyng worde god glad tidings promise god hath made vnto v christ preached truely receiued ground hart waueryng doub ing law hath passed vpon v hath damned conscience worde god preached purely true fayth good workes receiued hart faith spirit god also good workes necessitie whensoeuer occasio geue god word purely preached men dreames tradition imagination inuentios ceremony superstition fayth consequently spirite commeth god god spirite bee good workes euen apple tree grow apple vnbeliefe diuels sprite euill workes god sprite hys fruites haue holy hipocrites knowen neither yet tasted swete though fayne many good workes imaginatio iustified withal one cromme true fayth spiritual fayth lacketh euill workes loue inward ioy peace quietnes conscience much haue worde god workes please god euen rotten fruites rotten tree breaketh forth runneth large sheweth whence sinne righteousnesse death life come compareth adam christ together thus wise reasonyng disputyng christ must nedes come seconde adam make v heyres righteousnesse new spiritual birth without deseruinges euen first adam made v heyres synne bodily generation without oure deseruyng wherby euidently knowne came sinne christ came saluation proued vttermost man bryng himselfe synne vnto righteousnesse could haue withstad borne bodily yt proued herewith much yt law god right haue helped thyng could haue holpe onely came brought helpe also encreased synne euil poisoned nature offeded vtterly displeased law yt forbid lawe prouoked set fyre fulfill satisfie lustes law see clearely must needes haue christ iustify v grace helpe nature vi setteth forthe chiefe principall worke fayth battayle principall work faith battaile betwen spirite flesh sprite agaynst fleshe sprite laboureth enforceth kyll remnaunt sinne lust remayne fleshe iustifiyng chapiter teacheth v free sinne fayth henceforth go vp idle carelesse sure selues thoughe synne v yes sinne remayning v reckoned fayth sprite fyght agaynste wherefore haue inough doe lyues long tame body compell member obey sprite appetite therby myght like vnto christes death resurrection might fulfill baptisme signifieth mortifiyng sinnes new lyfe grace battayle ceaseth v vntill last breath vntyll sinne vtterly slayne deth body thyng meane tame body forth able doe sayth seyng vnder grace vnder lawe vnder lawe himselfe expoundeth vnder lawe vnderstand euery may hym lusteth vnder law haue fre hart vnder law renewed sprite thou hast lust inwardly thine owne accorde lawe commaundeth without compulsion yea though law grace say god fauour bringeth v sprite maketh v loue lawe sinne neither law agaynst v one agreed v vnder law vnder lawe deale workes law worke without sprite grace long doubt sinne raigneth v law say lawe declareth yt wee vnder sinne sinne hath power dominion ouer v seyng fulfill law namely within hart much man nature fauoureth law consenteth therunto deliteth therein thyng exceedyng great synne cannot consent law law nothyng el saue god right freedome libertie right fredome libertie fro sinne law sinne lawe whereof writeth vnto ende chapter freedom good onely lust liue well without compulsion law wherfore freedome spirituall freedome destroyeth lawe ministreth law requireth wherwith law fulfilled vnderstand luste loue wherewith law stilled accuseth v compelleth v neither hath ought craue v euen thoughe thou debt man wer example able pay two maner wayes mightest thou losed one way would require nothyng thee break thine obligation way good man woulde paye thee geue thee muche thou mightest satisfie thyne obligation wyse hath christe made v fre law therfore wylde fleshly libertie yt nought doth thynges free crauyng debt law seuenth confirmeth yt similitude state matrimony whe husband dyeth wyfe libertie one losed departed woman haue power mary vnto man rather first free hath power mary vnto man could till loosed first husband euen conscience bound daunger lawe olde adam log liueth v conscience bound daunger law vnder olde adam long liueth v law declareth yt harte bound cannot disconsent hym mortified killed sprite conscience free libertie conscience shall nought doe nowe first cleaueth vnto witte christ bringeth forth fruites lyfe vnder lawe able fulfill law detter able pay lawe requireth lose lawe fulfill pay lawe demaundeth henceforth aske thee nought consequently paul declareth largely nature synne law requireth v cannot pay law law synne reuiueth moueth selfe gathereth strength olde man corrupt nature forbidden kept vnder law offended displesed therwith much cannot pay yt required lawe synne nature himselfe cannot sinne therefore law death hym torment martirdom lawe euill euill nature suffer yt good cannot abyde law require good thing like sicke cannot suffer man desire hym runne leape doe deedes whole man cause paule concludeth law vnderstand perceiued best wise doth vtter synne bryng v vnto knowledge selues therby kyl v make v bond vnto eternall damnation detters euerlastyng wrath god euen well feeleth vnderstandeth whose conscience truely touched law daunger ere law doth vtter declare sinne law came knew sinne ment neither yet knowe wrath god vppon sinner tyll law vttered seest thou man must haue thyng ye greater mighty thing law make hym righteous safe vnderstand law wise blinde go worke presumptuously supposing satisfie law workes know law requireth free willing lusty louing hart therfore see moses right yt face vayle hangeth betwene hideth face behold glorie countenaunce law spiritual requireth hart may myne strength refraine myne enemy hurt loue myne hart put awaye wrath cleane w may selues may mind ca mine strength maye refuse money myne owne strength put away loue vnto rich myne hart myne owne strength abstaine adultery concernyng outward dede doe myne owne stregth desire mine hart vnpossible vnto chose whether hungre thrust yet law requireth wherfore man owne strength law neuer fulfilled must haue therunto god fauour spirite purchased christes bloud neuerthelesse saye man may many thing outwardly clean agaynst hart must vnderstand driuen diuers appetite greatest appetite ouercometh lesse carieth away violently desire vengeaunce feare also incouenience like folowe feare bee greater abstaine appetite desireth vengeaunce greater prosecute dede see experiece many murtherers theeues though brought neuer great perill death yet haue feare shame away wickednes committed escaped euen agayne common woman prosecute lustes feare shame away whiche haue appetite harte abstaine lest way outwardly worke secretly beyng ouercome feare shame likewise appetite furthermore declared spirite flesh fight together one man maketh ensample self might learne know worke right meane kill sinne selues calleth spirit also flesh law like nature god law fleshe contrary sprite driue compell craue euen flesh driueth compelleth craueth rageth agaynst spirite wil haue lustes satisfied side driueth spirite crieth fighteth flesh haue lust satisfied strife dureth sprite lusteth contrary flesh v long liue lesse spirite flesh stronger man owne selfe spirite fleshe fighteth owne self vntil sinne vtterly slayne together spirituall viij chapter comforteth fighter dispayre cause fleshe either thinke lesse fauour god shewed sinne remaynyng v hurteth daunger christ daunger christ whiche walke flesh fight agaynst expoundeth largely nature flesh spirit spirite commeth christ whiche spirite maketh v spirituall tameth subdueth mortifieth flesh certifieth v neuerthelesse sonnes god also beloued though sinne rage neuer much v long folow spirite fight agaynst sinne kill mortifie chastisyng flesh crosse sufferyng nothyng pleasaut comforteth v passion affliction assistance spirite maketh intercessio god v mightely gronynges passe man vtteraunce man speach comprehed creature morne also v great desire haue loosed sinne corruption flesh see three chapter vj vij viij none othyng right worke fayth mortify flesh much driue v vnto right worke faith whiche kill old man mortifie flesh ix x xj chapter treateth god predestinatio whece springeth together whether shall beleue beleue loosed fro sinne loosed whiche predestinatio iustifiyng saluatio cleane taken hand put hand god onely thyng necessary predesti cion handes god weake vncertaine stode v would truth man saued deuill doubt would deceaue v god sure predestinatio deceaue neither man withstand let therefore haue hope trust agaynst sinne must marke set vnto vnquiet busie hye climyng spirites farre shall go first bryng hether hye reason pregnaunt wittes begyn first hye search bottomlesse secretes god predestination whether bee predestinate must nedes either cast selues headlong desperation el commit selues fre chaunce carelesse folow thou order farre may proceede predestination epistle noosell thy selfe christ learne vnderstand law yt gospell meane office two thou mayest one know thy selfe thou hast thy selfe strength sinne grace christ see thou fight agaynst sinne flesh vij first chapter teach thee thou art come viij chapter art vnder crosse suffryng tribulation necessitie prestination waxe sweete thou shalt well feele precious thyng except thou haue borne crosse aduersitie temptation hast felt thy selfe brought vnto brimme desperation yea vnto hell gate thou canst neuer medle sentece predestination without thyne owne harme without secret wrath grudgyng wardly agaynst god otherwise shall possible thee thinke god righteous iust therefore predestin tion rashly disputed must adam well mortified fleshely wytte brought vtterly nought yet thou mayest awaye thyng drinke strong wyne take hede therefore vnto thy selfe thou drinke wyne thou art yet sucklyng euery learning hath tyme measure age christ certaine childhode whiche man must content milke season vntill waxe stronge growe vp vnto perfect man christ able eate strong meate xij chapter geueth exhortation maner obserueth paul epistle first teacheth christ fayth exhorteth good workes vnto continuall mortifiyng flesh teacheth good workes deede true seruyng god maketh men priestes offer vp money beastes maner tyme law body good workes mete done killyng mortifiyng lustes fleshe describeth outward conuersation christen men ought behaue selues spirituall thinges teach preach rule co gregation christ serue one suffer thing patiently commit wreake vengeaunce god conclusion christen ought behaue selfe vnto men frend foe whatsoeuer right workes christen whiche spryng fayth fayth keepeth holy day neither suffreth man idle wheresoeuer dwelleth xiij teacheth honour worldly temporall sword though man law ordinauce make man good god neither iustifie hart yet ordeined furtheraunce co mon wealth mainteine peace punish euill defend good therfore ought good honor temporal sword haue reuerence though concernyng selues neede would abstaine euill owne accord yea good without man lawe law spirite gouerneth hart guideth vnto god finally comprehendeth knitteth vp loue loue nature bestoweth hath euen selfe whiche loued thou loue fulfilling law nedest bid kynd mother belouyng vnto onely sonne much lesse spiritual loue hath eye geuen god nedeth man law teach duetie yt begynnyng put forth christ cause author righteousnes saluation euen setteth hym forth ensample counterfaite hath done v eue one xiiij chapter teacheth deale soberly conscience weake fayth whiche yet vnderstand libertie christ perfectly enough fauour must deale louingly weake brother christen loue vse libertie faith vnto hinderace vnto furtheraunce edifiyng weake consideratio foloweth debate despising gospell better forbeare weake vntill waxe strong learnyng come altogether vnder fote worke singular work loue ye loue perfecte must nedes respect vnto weake thing christ commaunded charged aboue thinges chapter setteth forthe christ agayne counterfaited also hys ensample suffer yet weake weaknes brother considered fraile open sinner vnlearned vnexpert lothesome maners cast away forthwith suffer til waxe better exhort meane tyme delte christ gospel dealeth v dayly suffering vnperfectnes weaknes conuersation maners yet fashioned doctrine gospell smell flesh ye sometyme breake forth outward deedes conclude withall wisheth encrease fayth peace ioye conscience prayseth committeth god magnifieth office administration gospell soberly great discretion desireth succour ayde poore sayntes ierusalem pure loue speketh dealeth withall fynde epistle romaine conteyned sufficient doctrine christen man epistle plentuously vnto vttermost whatsoeuer christen man woman ought know witte law gospell sume grace fayth righteousnes christ god good workes loue hope hope crosse euen wherin pith pertayneth christen fayth standeth christen ought behaue himselfe vnto euery man perfect sinner good bad strong weake frend foe conclusio behaue selues towarde god toward oure selues also thynges profoundly grounded scripture declared ensamples hymselfe father prohets man desire wherfore appeareth euidently paules mynde comprehende brieflye hys epistle whole learnyng christes gospell prepare introduction vnto olde testament without doubte whosoeuer hath epistle perfectly hys harte hath light effect olde testament wyth hym wherfore let euery man without exception exercise himselfe therein diligently recorde night day continually vntill full acquainted therwith last chapter chapiter recommendation wherein yet mingleth dyed without mercy much worse punishment worthy treadeth sonne god vnderfoote counteth bloud couenaunt whiche bloud sanctified vnholy thyng blasphemeth spirite grace wordes manifest meaneth none fore wordes sinne blasphemy spirite sinne ignoraunce infirmitie remedy knoweth truthe yet willingly yeldeth selfe sinne consenteth vnto lyfe sinne soule body rather lye sin haue poysoned nature healed mercy locked vp hym wilfully yeldeth body soule sinne helpe spirite grace maliciously persecuteth truth say remedy way mercy locked vp spirite taken vnthankefulnesse sake geuen truthe turne god beleue christ must forgiuen deepe soeuer hath sinned wil without spirite blasphemer shall haue spirite offred let euery man therefore feare god beware yeld self serue sinne oft soeuer sinne let gyn agayne vnto god restored vnto byrth right agayn though sought teares text must haue spirituall eye esau sellyng byrthright despised onely temporall promotion haue bene lord ouer brother kyng countrey also vnderstandyng hath bene chiefly receiued papistes yet circumstance well pondered wyll appeare author entent farre otherwise toke saith chapter fayth without deedes dead self meaneth none thyng scripture doth fayth hath good dedes following false fayth none fayth iustifieth receyueth forgeuenesse sin god promised forgeuenes theyr sinnes onely whiche turne god keepe lawes wherfore purpose cotinue still synne haue part promise deceyue themselues beleue god hath forgeuen olde synnes christes sake sayth man iustified deedes faith faith doth iustify euery nothyng iustifieth saue fayth perceiued beleued god loued feared god hebr yt scripture affirmeth raab iustified god faith doth iames affirme workes whiche sheweth fayth iustified world true epistle iudas though men haue yet doubt beneth earth graue sepulchre caue hell called hebrue valley hennon place ierusalem brent child fyre vnto idoll moloch vsurped taken place wicked vngodly shalbe tormented soule body generall iudgement haue rather done new testament folowed counsell christ exhorteth men math doe good deedes secretly contente consciece well doyng god seeth v patiently abyde reward last day christ hath purchased v would fayne haue done likewise compelled otherwise aboade faythfull companion hath taken another voyage vpon preach christ suppose neuer yet preached god put hys hart thether go sende spirite hym comforte hym bryng hys purpose good effecte one william roye man william roye fal e disciple somewhat crafty commeth vnto new acquayntance knowne namely spent came vnto offred hys helpe long money somwhat could rule hym soone gotten hym money became lyke hymselfe agayne neuerthelesse suffered thynges tyll ended coulde doe alone without one write helpe copare textes together ended toke leaue bade hym farewell two lyues men say day longer departed went gate new frendes thyng doe passeth euer yet knew stored hym money gate hym argentine professed wonderfull faculty maketh boast small thing yeare xij monthes printyng worke came one ierome brother grenewich also ierome brother grenewich wormes argentine saying intended christes disciple another whyle kepe nye god would geue grace profession hys baptisme get hys liuyng hades lyue loger idlely sweate labour captiues whiche taught beleue christe cut shooes russet coat ierome diligence warned royes boldnes exhorted beware hym walke quietly wyth patiece long sufferyng according haue christ hys apostle ensaple thyng also promised neuerthelesse whe commyng argetine willia roye whose toung able onely make fooles starke mad also deceaue wisest first sight acquaintaunce gate hym hym set hym worke make rymes hym selfe translated dialogue latin englishe whose prologue promiseth great deale feare euer pay paule sayth timo seruaut timo lord must striue peaceable vnto men ready teach one suffer euill mekenesse informe resiste god tyme geue repentaunce know trouth becommeth lordes seruaunt vse rayling rymes god worde right weapon slay sinne vice iniquitie scripture god good teach improue ij timo iij ij thes ij paule speakyng timo thess antechrist sayth lord shall destroy sprite breath mouth word god ij cor x cor weapon warre carnall thynges sayth mighty god cast downe strong holdes forth destroy high building false doctrine word god day wherof paul speaketh cor iij shall declare thing cor fire shal try euery man worke consume false doctrine sword ought men sharply fight rayle foolishe rymes let offende thee walke inordinatly let wickednes iudas cause thee despise doctrine fellowes man ought thinke stephen false preacher nicolas whiche chosen felow hym act vj minister vnto actes widowes fell great heresy history make mention good euill go alwayes together one ca knowen without marke also aboue thinges antechrist antechrist outward thyng say man sodely appeare wonder father talked hym verely antichrist spirituall thyng much say agaynst christ yt one preacheth false doctrine contrarie christ antechrist old testamet fought prophetes also tyme christ apostle thou readest epistle iohn paule corinthian galathians epistle antechrist shall doubt endure till worldes ende nature vttered ouercome ye beguile people hipocrisie like thynges prelate haue yet gotten new name garmentes otherwyse disguised difference name betwene pope cardinall bishop forth say scribe pharisey seniour forth thyng one christ sendeth seke iohn iohn also spied antechrist long ago looked doctrine christ hys apostle beast seeth selfe sought roareth seketh new hole hyde hymselfe chaungeth hymselfe thousand fashion maner wilinesse falshode suttletie craft hys excommunication antechrist accompteth treason bee acquainted wt christ come lyght maketh treason vnto kyng bee acquaynted christe christe may raigne together one hope haue christ shal liue euer olde antichristes brought christ vnto pilate saying lawe ought die whe pilate bade iudge hym lawe aunswered lawfull v kyll man whiche dyd intent whiche regarded shame beare recorde vnto thou also feelest thine hart good comfort geue god thankes god word condemne hold accursed doe doctrine paule counseleth galathians beleue euery sprite sodenly iudge word god whiche trial doctrine lasteth euer amen parable wicked mammon certain luke rich man whiche steward accused vnto hym hee wasted goodes called hym sayd vnto heare thee geue accoumptes thy stewardshyp thou mayst longer steward steward sayd selfe shall master take away fro stewardshyp digge begge ashamed wote doe put stewardshyp may receaue theyr house called master detters sayd vnto first much owest thou vnto master sayd hudred tonne oyle hee sayd hym take thy bill sit downe quickely write fiftie sayd owest thou sayd hundred quarter wheate sayd hym take thy bill write foure score lord commended vniust steward done wisely child world kynde wiser child light say also vnto make frendes wicked mammon ye shall haue neede may receaue euerlastyng habitation luke xvi chapter much diuers textes many tree must afore hand good made good yer bryng forth good frute also sayth math xij either mat make tre good frute good also either make tree bad hys frute bad also ye speake wel ye selues euil whiche thou readest gospel possessed deuils could laude god till deuils cast precious thing must hart yer man worke good worke word god gospell preacheth profereth fayth beyng ioyned worde god hart free loue god hath lust god therfore called word lyfe word grace word health word redemption word forgiuenes word peace heareth beleueth ca meanes made righteous god confirmeth peter xv actes romaine fleshe shalbe iustified deedes law meaneth ceremony sacrifice vntrue saying foloweth immediatly law commeth knowledge sinne ceremony vtter sinne law co maundementes iiij sayth law causeth wrath whiche bee vnderstand ceremony geuen reconcile people god agayne sinned say ceremony law cannot iustify v geuen purge sinne reconcile iustifie neither blesse temporally onely much law commaundementes iustifieth whiche proueth man sick health neither doth cause wrath bring fauour neither whiche damneth saue man mother commaundeth childe euen rocke cradle grudgeth commaundement doth vtter poyson lay hid setteth bate hys mother maketh hym beleue shee loueth commaundements also thou shalt couet thy neighbour house thou shalt lust desire wishe thy neighbour wife seruaunt mayde oxe asse soeuer pertaineth vnto thy neyghbour geue power doe vtter poyson damne proue god wrath seing wil mine contrary therefore sayth paul gal iij ben geuen gal law could haue geuen lyfe doubt righteousnes come law scripture concluded vnder sinne sayth promise might bee geuen vnto beleue fayth iesus christ promise beleued fayth christes promise doth iustify v iustifie bring spirite whiche looseth hart giueth lust law certifieth v yt good god vnto v ward submit selues vnto god desire heale v wil meane tyme consent hart vnto law count v full whole wil hate v pitie v cherish v tender harted v loue v doth christ selfe christ redemer sauiour peace attonement satisfactio hath made amendes satisfaction godward sinne whiche repet consentyng law beleuyng promise haue done shal christ storehouse mercy v fragilitie fall thousand tymes day yet repent agayne haue alway mercy layd vp v store iesus christ lord shall say scripture whiche go sore vpo good workes read math xxv hungred ye gaue meate c like whiche sound though iustified accepted vnto fauour god christ good workes aunswere many whe heare read fayth cosent therunto haue certaine imagination opinion fayth man telleth story thyng done straunge lande pertayneth yet heleue tell true thyng imagination opinion definition true fayth call faith thinke fayth thyng standeth power haue naturall workes whiche men worke feele maner workyng spirite neither terrible sentence law fearefull iudgements god horrible damnation captiuitie vnder sathan therefore soone haue opinion imaginatio harte sayth verely doctrine semeth true beleue eue thinke right fayth afterward feele selues also see none alteration workes folow altogether eue abide old estate thinke yt faith sufficient must greater thing fayth iustifie man faule away fayth forth fruite dreame thing imagination call fayth dreamyng fayth opinion owne imagination wrought without grace god must nedes worse latter end begynnyng old vessel rent new wyne poured math ix heare mat god word hold therfore waxe worse right fayth spryngeth man fantasie neither ma power obtaine together faith gift god pure gift god poured v freely without maner doyng v without deseruing merites yea without sekyng v sayth paul second ephesian euen god gift grace ephe purchased christ therfore mighty operation full vertue euer working also renueth man begetteth fresh altereth chaungeth hym turneth altogether new nature conuersation man feeleth hys hart together altered chaunged farre otherwise disposed hath power loue whiche could hate deliteth abhorred hateth could loue setteth soule libertie maketh free folow god doth soule euen health doth vnto body man pined wasted away long sokyng disease legges cannot beare hym cannot lift vp handes helpe hymself taste corrupt suger bitter hys mouth stomacke abhorreth longyng slibbersause swashe whole stomacke readye cast hys gorge helth commeth changeth altereth hym cleane geueth hym strength hys member lust owne accord could neither example simo bad christ house condemned christe defeded iustified saying simon haue certayne thyng say vnto thee sayd maister say certayne lender whiche two detters one ought v c penny fiftie nothing thee many sinnes forgeuen loueth much lesse forgeuen doth loue lesse c hereby see dedes work outward signes inward grace bounteous plenteous mercy god frely receyued without merites deedes ye dedes christ teacheth know inwar fayth loue outward deedes deedes fruites loue loue fruit fayth loue also deedes great smal according proportion fayth fayth mighty strong loue feruent dedes plenteous done excedyng mekenes fayth weake loue cold dedes seldom beare flower blossomes winter symon beleued fayth yet weakly according proportion fayth loued coldly dedes therafter christ vnto simple bare feast onely receaued great humanitie mary strong fayth therfore burning loue notable dedes done excedyng profound depe mekenes one side saw differece betwene true faith fained faith selfe clearely law notable sinner neither curious hipocrisie phariseis whiche euer disdaine weake sinner neither costlines oyntment humblenes run vnto feete washed teares eye wyped heares head anoynted precious oyntment pleteousnes infinite mercy god receaued christe vnsought wished hym selfe banished christ damned saue yt iewes might haue ben man feeleth god hym selfe hys neighbour marke thyng also part grossenes knowledge procede fro whiche last hi ost vnto first begynnyng latter end disputyng makyng argumentes backeward begyn effect worke procede vnto naturall cause ensample first see moone darke search cause find puttyng earth betwene sunne moone naturall cause darknes earth stoppeth backeward disputation light dispute backeward saying moone darkned therfore earth directly betwene sunne moone yet darkenes moone naturall cause earth betwen sunne moone effect therof cause declaratiue declaryng leadyng v vnto knowledge earth betwene sunne moone directly causeth darknes stopping light sunne moone contrarywyse beyng earth directly betwene sunne moone naturall cause yt darknes likewise hath sonne therfore father yet soone cause father contrarywise notwithstandyng yt sonne cause declaratiue sure euidet signe fayth hart dead imagination dreame whiche falsly call fayth wise saying christ vnderstande make outward workes declare true fayth frendes vnrighteous mammo shew fayth openly ye within harte outward geuing bestowyng goodes poore ye may obtayn frendes poore whome thou hast shewed mercy may day iudgement testify witnesse thy good woorkes thy fayth thou waste within thy harte shall iudged openly outwardly presence men accordyng dedes workes without cause thou mayest call thy frendes testifye daye thee thou liuedst true right christen man folowedst steppe christe shewyng profite profite honour god father euen workes may seke profite neither worlde heauen must ought freely worke honoure god withall must duety good workes without hope reward without maner respecte seeke shame vnto hymselfe would haue done good workes wrought haue bene made thereby fayth maketh v sonnes child god god sonne heyre ouer thing alredy doth fayth make v sonnes childre god iohn gaue might power yt sonnes god beleued name sonnes also heires rom viij gala iiij ought rom worke purchase inheritaunce gala withall whereof heyres already fayth shall say scripture whiche sound though man good whiche vnderstand neither feele harte fayth meaneth talke thinke reward euen worke neither suppose yt man ought worke respect reward imagine kyngdome seeke heau theyr workes vnderstand treasure christ christ world among must deserue heauen good woorkes howbeit thoughtes dreames false imagination men speaketh malachias chap among shutteth doore pleasure nought yt without respect reward seruauntes
