beleued name gaue power sonnes god god fulnes rich dwelleth christ christ must fetch thynges thou readest also iohn iij beleueth iohn sonne hath eternal life beleueth shall see lyfe wrath god abydeth vpon seest thou wrath vengeance god possesseth euery man till fayth come fayth trust christ expelleth faith doth expell wrath god wrath god bringeth fauour yt spirite power good euerlastyng lyfe moreouer vntill christ hath geue thee light thou knowest wherein stadeth goodnes thy workes vntill spirite hath loosed thyne hart thou canst consent vnto good woorkes good v wil work commeth fauour god christ laude amen man meaneth father shall know doctrine whether god whether speake selfe iohn vij text meaneth iohn man owne strength power free call god hath receaued spirite strength christ sayth ment spokenin thyrd iohn nicodemus marueiled possible man borne agayn christ aunswered borne flesh flesh whiche borne spirite spirite say hath spirite thorough fayth borne agayne made new christ vnderstandeth thynges spirite spirituall meaneth flesh paul sayth cor ij cor naturall man led blind reason onely neuer ascend capacitie spirite geueth ensa ple saying winde bloweth lysteth thou hearest voyce wottest whence cometh whether euery naturall man fleshe sauoureth thinges spirite borne spirite speaketh spirite neuer vnderstand naturall man flesh sauoreth thynges flesh meaneth christ man haue spirite consenteth vnto god one wotteth meane ye vnderstand thinges happy ye ye iohn xiij iohn christen man hart wyll god lawe commaundementes god hongreth thyrsteth strength fulfill mourneth day night desiring god according promise geue power fulfill god loue lust testifieth deede blessed spirite blesseth v christ hym ministreth strength outward deede testifieth within v thou readest iohn v deedes iohn testifie sayth christ ioh hereby shall men know ye disciple ye loue one ioh hath iohn commaundements keepeth loueth agayne loueth keepeth commaundementes loueth keepeth comaundementes outward deede testifiing inwarde hart ioh xv ye shall kepe commaundemets ye shall cotinue loue kepe father commaundemet continue loue ye see loue haue father keepe commaundementes shal ye see loue ye haue ye kepe commaundemetes thou mayest thinke blessed god onely christ sauiour workes deedes blesse v first preuent god grace christ though naturall giftes beyng borne adam looked lawe god owne strength fulfilled bebecame righteous righteousnes obtayned fauour god philosopher write righteousnes righteousnes temporall lawe lawe satisfied hipocrisy outward deede cotrarie readest thou ioh xv ye haue chosen iohn sayth christ haue chosen ye goe bring forth fruite fruite remayne chapter vine ye braunches without ye nothing v therefore goeth adam wilde crab tree god chuseth plucketh adam planteth garden mercy stocketh grafteth spirite christ bringeth forth fruite god fruite testifieth god hath blessed v christ note also long liue yet partly carnall fleshly notwithstading christ though imputed vnto v christes sake abideth remaineth v yet olde adam stocke crabe tree euer among occasion geuen hym shoteth forth braunches leues budde blossome fruit must fight subdue must wrestle olde man may put christ mat hym chaynge nature little little prayer fasting watching vertuous meditation holy workes vntill altogether spirite kingdome heauen sayth christ math like leuen woman taketh hideth three peckes meale till leuened leuen spirite meale must seasoned spirite little little till throughout spirituall shall rewarde euery man according deede rom rom according deedes shall euery man rewarde deedes declare fruite tree according fruite shall tree praysed reward geuen mercy truth god deseruyng merites christ whosoeuer repenteth beleueth gospell putteth trust christes merites heyre christe eternall lyfe assurance whereof spirite god poured hart earnest looseth bondes sathan geueth lust strength euery day according diligent aske god christes sake eternall life followeth good liuing suppose sayth paule epistle viij chapter rom affliction worlde worthy glory shalbe shewed v say suffer neuer deserue reward shalbe geuen v moreouer reward deped hang workes man shoulde saued much best deedes compared lawe best workes damnable sight god christ damnable sinne deedes lawe fleshe iustified written thirde chapter rom lawe iustifieth vttereth sinne onely compelleth driueth penitent repentyng sinner flee vnto sanctuary mercy bloud christ also repent neuer much neuer well willyng vnto law god yet weake snare occasios innumerable fall dayly hourely coulde dispeire rewarde hanged worke whosoeuer ascribeth eternall life vnto deseruing merite workes must faule one two incoueniences either must blinde pharisey seing lawe spirituall carnall looke reioyce outward shining deedes despising weake respect iustifie himselfe el see lawe spirituall neuer able ascend vnto yt yt law requireth must nedes despaire let euery christen therfore christ hope righteousnes reioyce christ hope trust righteousnes loued chose accept vnto yt enheritaunce eternall lyfe neyther presuming perfectnes neither despayring weakenes perfecter man clearer sight seeth thousand thinges displease also perfectnes obtayned life therefore desireth christ sinne let hym let despayre put hope christ shalbe safe weake doe would fayne doe despayre turne strong hath promised geue strength aske christes name complayne god desire hym fulfill promise god committe hym selfe shall mercy truth strength make feele loue beloued christes sake though neuer weake righteous god heare lawe lawe shall iustified rom ij text playner tha rom needeth expounded chapter paule proueth law naturall holpe gentile appeareth lawes statute ordinaunces made city yet kept great keepe small vnder owne profite violence lawe euery man prayseth lawe farre forth profitable pleasant vnto owne appetite refrayned grudgeth law moreouer proueth knowledge holpe gentile though learned philosopher came knowledge god creature world yet power worshippe god thys secod chapter proueth yt iewes though lawe written yet holpe coulde keepe idolater also murtherers adulterer whatsoeuer lawe forbad concludeth therfore yt iewe well daned gentill hearing lawe onely might haue iustified iewes bene righteous required lawe righteous iewe lesse daned getill publishing declaring ye lawe doth vtter ma sin geueth neither stregth help fulfill law law killeth thy coscience geueth man fulfill ye law hee beleueth christ thee lust fulfill law faith christ geueth lust power ye law true yt doth ye law righteous yt doth saue yt beleueth putteth trust christ man worke hath builte vpon abide shall receaue rewarde cor cor circumstance chapter witt goeth foloweth declareth playnely ment paule talketh learning doctrine preaching sayth himselfe hath layde foundation christ ye sure foundation iesus christ man laye exhorteth therfore euery man take hede buildeth vpon boroweth similitude goldsmith trieth thyne hart euil shall thy reward thou repent feare therfore crye god grace thou mayst loue hys lawes whe thou louest cease til thou haue obtained power god fulfill shalt thou sure good reward shall folow christ rewardeth owne workes v whiche reward thy deedes christes haue purchased thee whose purchasing also lust thou hast god law might thou fulfillest remember also reward rather called giuen iaco haue deedes fayth saue hym agayne fayth without deedes dead selfe deuils beleue tremble body without spirite dead euen fayth without deedes dead manifest cleare meaneth fayth whereof peter paule begat v worde life beleuing promise wherein life made sonnes god thing also wise proue paule sayth shall beleue without preacher preach except set pray whe heard god sent preach vnto deuils made good promise threatneth oft neuer sent embassadours preach atonemet betwene hym take ensample example thou mayest vnderstand let two poore men destitute rayment colde winter one strong feleth griefe receaueth world pleasure worlde seeketh nothing possession worlde aucthoritie world beare rule world persecuteth worde god wilinesse driueth people false sophisticall reason maketh afeard curseth man reason whiche written paule sayth rom learning deceauing patience comfort scripture might haue hope nature god word god word sighteth agaynst hipocrites fight agaynst hypocrite beganne abell hath euer since continued shall doubte vntyll laste daye hypocrite haue alway world side thou seest time christ elder witte ruler nowe master christ entreated iewes theyr side pilate emperor power theyr side herode also theyr side moreouer brought theyr worldlye wysedome passe coulde thinke imagine serue theyr purpose fyrst feare people withal excommunicated beleeued put craft hypocrite temple thou seest iohn secondly founde meanes haue condemned emperor power made treason cesar beleeue thirdly obtayned haue hanged theefe murtherer theyr belly wisedome cause aboue cause man beleeue iewes take sure token euerlasting damnation man hanged written theyr lawe deutero cursed whosoeuer hangeth tree moyses also place commaundeth man hanged take downe day bury feare polluting defiling countrey least shoulde bring wrath curse god vpon therfore wicked iewes themselues venemous hate persecuted doctrine christ shame coulde vnto though would fayne haue christ hang still crosse rotte shoulde haue done emperor lawe yet feare defiling theyr sabboth bringing wrath curse god vpon begged pilate take downe ioh selues finally done coulde thought sufficient christ hart earth many billes pollares keepe past man helpe holpe god man coulde bring god truth worketh w ders maketh wisedome hypocrite foolishnes agayne god truth fetched agayne oth god sworne abraha dauid holy father prophetes raysed vp bring naught hath sworne true fullfill promise hath made vnto abraham isaac iacob written god truth fighteth v learning verely true god god well theyres promise v well presente v well aske shal obtain knocke open seeke wee shall finde thyrst truth shall fullfill lust christ v vntill worldes ende math last let little flock bold therefore god side matter maketh v byshops cardinalles pope euer name goodnes alwayes fayre weather thou neuer brought ieoperdy whece mercy onely deliuered thee thy fayth presumption thou shouldest euer vnthanckfull god mercilesse vnto thy neighbour god promise ritches looke diligently whereunto wherunto christian called called deceaue selues called dispute pope disciple dye christ may liue suffer may raigne called vnto kingdome must wonne wt suffring sicke man winneth health fighting suffer god fighteth v god doth thing v fighteth v suffer onely christ sayth iohn xx father sent sende iohn xv persecute shall persecute christ sayth math x send forth sheepe partes wherein life resteth christ head god word wherin life resteth cleaue therfore fast vnto christ vnto promise god hath made v sake wisedome beware men sayth shall deliuer vp vnto theyr counsel shall scourge ye shall brought ruler kinges sake brother shall betray deliuer brother death father sonne child shall rise father mother put death heare christ sayth disciple greater master neyther seruaunte greater better lorde haue called goodman house beelzebub much rather shall call household seruants luke xiiij sayth christ disposed builde tower sitteth downe fyrst counteth cost whether haue sufficient performe lest hath layd foundation able performe al behold begin mocke maketh mocke selfe casteth ende begin saying man beganne builde able make ende likewise none forsaketh hath disciple whosoeuer therefore casteth aforehand must ieoberd life good honor worship al christes sake deceaueth selfe maketh mocke himselfe vnto godles hipocrites infidel man serue two maisters god mammon say wicked rich also mathew vj thou must loue christ aboue thing doest thou pope ure whiche taketh christes sake forsaketh nought thou ready forsake hys sake thou haue forsaken sake art thou sure thou louest tribulation right baptisme signified plunging water wee baptized name christ sayth paule rom vj baptized dye tribulation ou baptisme spirite tribulation purgeth v killeth fleshly witte worldly vnderstadyng belly wisedome filleth v full wisedome god tribulation blessing commeth god witnesseth christ math v blessed tribulation blessing suffer persecution righteousnes sake theyrs lyfe goodes yet might thinke lawful resist hipocrites rise agaynst kyng kyng deliuer kyng bondage captiuitie wherin hipocrites hold hym wyles falsehode man may bee suffered come tell trouth seest thou bloudy doctrine pope causeth disobedience pope doctrine bloudy rebellion insurrectio hee teacheth sight defende hys tradition soeuer dreameth fire water sworde disobey father mother master lorde kyng emperour yea inuade christes doctrine peaceable euer lad natio receaue admit godhead peaceable doctrine christe teacheth obey suffer word god remit vengeaunce defense word god mighty able defende also soone god auengeth hys doctrine selfe worde openly preached testified witnessed vnto world hath geuen season repent ready take vengeaunce enemy shoteth arrowes heades dipte deadly poyson poureth hys plague heauen downe vpon sendeth moren pestilence among sinketh city maketh earth swalow copasseth wyles taketh theyr owne trappes snare casteth pittes whiche digged men sendeth dasyng head vtterly destroyeth owne suttle councell prepare ought behaue selfe readyng doctours also scripture thy mynde therefore vnto litle treatise read discretly iudge indifferently alledge scripture loke thou text whether interprete right whiche thou shalt easely perceaue circumstance processe thou make christ foundation ground build referrest hym findest also expositio agreeth vnto common article faith ope scripture god father mercy whiche hys truthes sake raysed sauiour christ vp agayne iustifie v geue thee hys spirite iudge righteous eye geue strength abyde mayntayne withall patience long sufferyng vnto example edifying congregation glory name amen obedience degree proued god word first child vnto theyr elder god worketh thynges secrete iudgement purpose hys godly pleasure prouided houre thy father mother come together make thee throughe present thee thy mother wombe fashioned thee brethed lyfe thee yt great loue vnto thee prouided milke thy mother brestes thee agaynst thou borne moued also thy father mother loue thee pitie thee care thee made thee hath cast thee vnder power authoritie obeye serue stede saying honor thy father mother exo xx father mother v god stede vnderstand bowyng knee puttyng cappe onely thou loue al thyne hart feare drede wayte commaundementes seke worshyp pleasure profite thynges geue thy life counting worthy honour remembryng thou art theyr good possession thou owest vnto thine owne selfe thou art able yea thou art able doe vnderstand also soeuer wee doe father mother god thou doest vnto good bad thou doest vnto god whe thou pleasest pleasest god whe thou displeasest thou displeasest god whe angry thee god angry wt thee neither possible thee come vnto fauour god againe though augels heaue pray thee vntil thou haue submitted thy self vnto thy father mother agayne thou obey though carnally reward obedience either feare vayne glorie profite thy blessyng shalbe long lyfe vpon earth sayth honour thy father mother thou mayest liue long vpon earth exod xx contrarywise reward disobedience thou disobey thy life shalbe shortned vpon earth foloweth exod xxj smiteth father mother shalbe put death curseth say rayleth dishonoured hys father kynges geue either byshops receaue exemption contrarie god ordinaunces christes doctrine math xvij christ also peter pay tribute meanyng christes question vnto peter prince take tribute straungers onely child verily ought free whiche sonne god whose seruautes minister haue authoritie yet neither knew neither christ came vse authoritie bee seruaunt beare burthen obey ordinaunces right wrong sake teach v therfore sayd peter pay thee melest offend moreouer though christ peter poore might haue escaped yet would feare offendyng hurtyng conscience might well haue geuen occasion vnto tribute gatherer haue iudged amisse doctrine yea iewes might happely haue bene offended thereby haue thought ben lawful haue payd tribute vnto heathen prince idolater seyng great prophet payd yea thyng causeth lay litle regarde prince see spiritualitie payeth tribute despised disobeyed spiritualtie prelate whiche care none offendyng conscience lesse god ordinaunces pay nought prince must fight holy father quarell agaynst christ first also none poore hath somewhat geue marke past shame shameles iugglers schole doctours rochester sermon agaynst martin luther text mathew dispute peter payd tribute greater apostle hath authority power head vnto cotrary vnto many cleare textes christ rebuketh saying heathenish thyng one clyme aboue desire greater great kingdome heaue seruaunt humbleth hym selfe becommeth seruaunt vnto ensample christ meane apostle pope apostle cardinal byshops ye greatest kingdome peter paying tribute became greatest commeth pay none pay tribute signe subiectio verely cause christ payed houshold cause payed peter also house shippe nettes thou readest gospell let v go paul agayne wherfore ye must needes obey feare vengeaunce onely also conscience though thou naughty nowe many yeares pope prelate euery thou nedest obeye temporall sword feare make consciece euill doyng vengeaunce yet must thou obey consciece first thine owne conscience though thou able resiste yet shalt thou neuer haue good coscience log god care theyr neighbour wolfe doth shepe word law ordinaunce thee secondarily thy neighbour conscience though craft violence thou mightest escape obteyne libertie priuilege free euill ensample spiritualtie causeth lay beleue bound obey maner dueties yet oughtest thou neither sue seeke thing neither yet admit accept profered lest thy fredome make thy weake brother grudge rebell seeth thee go emptie selfe lade thy part also layd shoulder seest thou man fauour one sonne one seruaunt rest grudge loue peace vnitie broken christenly loue thy neighbour ward thou canst christe loue finde thyne hart go vp empty day long see ouer charged yea fal vnder burthen yet wilt set thyne hand helpe good conscience ca among spiritualtie gather great treasure together hypocrisie false learnyng robbe almost euery man house landes yet therewith content craft wilenes purchase great liberty exemption maner bearyng brother seekyng christ nothyng lucre passe ouer silence teach prince purpose euen flatter prince may abuse authoritie sle soeuer beleueth christ mainteine pope euery lande lade new exaction tyranny subiectes dayly neither purpose say god trust shall shortly disclose iugglynge bryng falshode light lay medecine make scabbes breake neuerthelesse say haue robbed realmes god word onely also wealth prosperitie haue driuen peace landes withdrawen selues obediece prince haue separated selues lay men countyng viler dogges haue set vp great idole whore babylo antichrist rome call pope haue conspired agaynst common wealthes haue made seuerall kyngdome wherin lawfull vnpunished woorke abhomination euery parish haue spyes euery great man house euery tauerne alchouse thorough confessi confession knowe secretes man may open mouth rebuke soeuer shalbe shortly made hereticke prelate know men secretes man coucels one yea part chief ruler councels councell man euen cause pay ye tribute witt conscience sake thy neighbour cause foloweth god minister seruyng purpose god haue must obey doe looke haue christes spirite v good profitable glorious honorable v neither owne god onely geue euery man therefore dutie tribute tribute belongeth custome custome due feare feare belongeth honour honor perteineth thou mightest feele workyng spirite god thee lest bewtie deed deceaue thee make thee thinke law god whiche spirituall contet fulfilled outward bodyly dede foloweth owe nothyng loue oue fulfilleth law god outward dede one loueth fulfilleth law commaundementes thou shalt commit adultery thou shalt kill thou shalt steale thou shalt beare false witnes thou shalt desire forth commau dement comprehended contained saying loue thy neighbour agaynste workemen therfore loue fulfillyng law hast thou sufficient agaynst sophisters workeholy iustifiers world magnifie dedes law spirituall requireth hart neuer fulfilled dede sight god ye dede thou fulfillest law deede fulfilleth law world world liuest thereby enioyest preset life auoydest wrath vengeaunce death punishment law threatneth breake god thou keepest law thou loue onely shal make v loue faith maketh man loue verely shall fayth thou behold much god loueth thee christ vengeaunce hath deliuered thee sake kyngdome hath made thee heyre shalt thou see cause inough loue thy enemie without respect reward either lyfe lyfe come god haue christ hath deserued yet thou shouldest feele thyne harte thy deedes come abundantly recompensed ready christ thou wilt say haply loue fulfill lawe iustifieth say wherewith man fulfilleth law declareth hym iustified geueth wherewith fulfill law iustifieth hym iustifiyng iustifiyng vnderstande forgeuenesse sinnes fauour god sayth text rom x ende law cause wherfore law made christ iustifie beleue law geuen vtter office dutie law sinne kill conscience damne deedes bryng repentaunce driue vnto christ god hath promised fauour forgeuenesse sinne vnto repente consent law good beleuyng god promise iustifieth thou beleue promise doth god truth iustifie thee forgeueth thee receaueth thee fauour christes sake suretie wherof certifie thine hart sealeth thee spirite ephe iiij ij cor v sayth paul whiche gaue v spirite pacience long sufferyng obedience could neuer sene without outward experience thou brought sometime combraunce whence god onely could deliuer thee thou shouldest neuer see thy fayth yea except thou foughtest sometyme agaynst desperation hell death sinne power worlde thy faythes sake thou shouldest neuer know true fayth dreame except thy brother offended thee thou couldest know whether thy loue godly turke angre till hurt offended thou loue doth thee euill thy loue god likewise thy ruler alway kinde thou shouldest know whether thyne obedience pure thou canst paciently obeye euill ruler thyngs dishonour god thou hurtest thy neighbour art thou sure god spirite worketh thee thy fayth dreame false imagination therfore counceleth paule rom xij recompense man euill part haue peace men dearely beloued auenge selues geue rowme vnto wrath god written vengeaunce myne reward sayth lord therfore thy enemie hungre ouercome thyne enemy well feede hym thurst geue hym drinke doyng thou shalt rochester proueth contrary shadow shadow verely shadowes walke shame light walke shadowes come enforce stoppe quench craft falshod lest abhominable iugling shoulde sene man looke light ye new testament shal clearely see shadow may vnderstad vnderstand therfore one thing scripture representeth diuers thynges serpent figureth christ one place deuill lyon doth lykewise christ leuen signifieth god worde one place signifieth thereby tradition yt phareseis sowred altered god word theyr auauntage moyses verely sayd place representeth christ aaron aaron euery true preacher yet hye priest represeted peter onely hys successour lord rochester woulde haue peter litle beare christes message vnto world signifieth euery disciple christ euery true preacher god worde moyses put aaron mouth say aaron moyses prophet spake hys owne message pope byshoppes doe moyses receaued god deliuered vnto hym exod also ought euery preacher preach god worde purely neither adde minish true messenger must doe message truely say neither lesse commaunded aaron aaron representeth christ hye priest offereth purgeth people worldly sinne falle touching vncleanly thynges eating meates forbidden sinne handling chalice alter stone purged wyth bishop blessing representeth christ purgeth v sinne sight god epistle vnto hebrues maketh mentio moyses gone vp mounte aaron left behynde made golden calfe aaron representeth false preacher namely holy father pope like maner maketh v beleue bull yt bishop rochester ful wel alleageth place hys sermon pope signified aaron christ moyses pope well content christes aaron addeth nothyng moses law law doctrine aaron moyses cause bishop preach pope christ seyng apostle preached peter christ paul ij cor iiij sayth hym selfe felowapostles apostle preached peter christ preache selues christ iesus lord preach selues seruauntes iesus sake cor iij let reioyse men thynges whether bee paul apollo peter whether world life death whether present thinges thynges come ye christes christ god leueth ye peter ye pope chapter folowyng sayth let men thus wise esteme v eue minister christ c ij cor xj paul gelous ouer corinthian fell christ maried cleaue vnto authoritie men eue false prophetes sought authoritie name hye apostle sayth gelouse ouer godly gelousie coupled one make chast virgine christ feare lest serpent deceaued e suttiltie euen wittes corrupt singlenesse christ followeth commeth preached iesus ye receaue spirite another gospell might ye well haue ben content ye might haue well suffered haue authoritie aboue suppose sayth behynd hye apostle rule paul disputeth saying minister christ labour aboundaunt stripe measure prison plenteously death oft forth paul preached christ paule greater peter peter suffered hys congregation greater peter ye testimony christ xij sayth nothing inferior vnto hye apostle though paul proued apostleshyp preachyng sufferyng byshops proue apostleshyp wt bulles shadowes nothing yet toke apostle wrought amog pacience signes woders mighty dedes proued authority bulle fro peter sealed cold lead either shadowes old testament falsly expounded moreouer apostle sent immediatly christ christ receaued authoritie paul boasteth selfe euery christ apostle sent christ wt like authoritie sayth sent preach gospell corint receaued lord deliuered vnto cor xi gal certifie brethre gospell preached maner men witte carnal fleshly neither receaued man neyther taught receaued yt reuelation iesus christ gal ij mighty peter apostleship ouer circumcision mighty among getiles timoth readest thou lykewyse iohn xx christ sent forth indifferently gaue lyke power father sent sayth send preach suffer haue done conquer enemyes kyngdomes subdue temporall power vnder wyth disguised hypocrisie gaue holy ghost bynde loose indifferently thou seest afterward sent forth paule wyth like authority thou seest actes last mathew sayth power geuen heaue earth goe therfore teach nacios baptising name father sonne holy ghost teaching obserue whatsoeuer commaunded authoritie authoritie christ gaue preache christes word christ gaue preach yet would imagine commaunded loe sayth alwayes euen vnto ende world sayde goe way loe peter stede sent euery man sundry countrey whether soeuer spirite caried went self wrought peter went wrought went paul boasteth selfe vnto galathians seyng haue christes doctrine christes holy promise seyng christ euer present v owne selfe commeth christ may raigne immediatly ouer v well pope commeth neuer v seyng also office apostle preach onely pope chalenge right authoritie preacheth commeth also rochester let v called one congregation reason one god one christ one spirite one gospell one fayth one hope one baptisme well one pope naturall beast hys worldly wisedome striue one greater congregation one sent see actes auswere peter sent man sent selfe iohn sent paul sylas barnabas sent howbeit maner sendynges worldly prince send ambassadours frier send limiter gather brethrenhedes must obey whether thyng free willyngly holy ghost bringeth together whiche maketh willes free ready bestow selues vpon neighbour profit come offer selues haue ca serue lord brethre euery found apt meete serue neighbour sent put office holy ghost sent consent brother owne conset also god word ruleth congregation vnto word euery man confirmeth christ alway present head bishop heare christes voyce see byshops make god earth present therfore make god earth kinde suppose aaron calfe bringeth forth aaro made calfe pope maketh bulles frute bulles much also christ great peter seate great peter head empire ben ierusalem ben mention made peter verely paul sayth xj chap ij epistle corinthian false apostle disceatful worker fashion selues like vnto apostle christ shaue nation hath put christ hys owme kinges emperour shauen nation preached christ falsly yea vnder name christ preached selues raigne christes stede haue also taken away keye knowledge haue wrapped people ignoraunce haue taught beleue selues tradition false ceremony christ vayne name christ vaine name put christ rowme gate selues emperour kyngs long ministred busines till haue also put rowmes haue got proper minister authority raigne also stede emperour kynges vayne name shadowes christ hauyng nothyng world thus raygne stede god man haue power vnder list let v see poynt great clarke litle beginning authoritie terrible thyng curse blacke maketh soules holydayes ordeined preach god word set vp long ceremony long matines long mass log euensonges latin vnderstand latine roule darkenes ye may lead preach swyne men thou preach toung vnderstand shall prepare selfe god commaundementes shal thankefull christ kindnes shall beleue truth promise god hath sworne thou tellest vnto toung vnderstand saith lord caunterbury priest would haue quod lord canterbury new testament gone forth englishe sayth wouldest thou lay people wete fighter suppose signified crosse borne crosse hye prelate borne procession also false signe realme peace turmoylers litle turmoylers parishe picke one quarell either syrplis cresome mortuary either one trifle cyte arch traytors creature haue secret conspiration betwene selues one craft prelate craft haue make many kyngdomes small norish olde title quarels may euer moue warre pleasure much landes chaunce fall one man euer cast bone way shall neuer able obteine see ye empeperour log kyngs small god would open eye set reformation realme pope interdict interdict land send prince conquere geuen filthy lucre abhorryng couetousnes peter sayth pet v takyng ouersight though ye compelled thereunto willingly desire filthie lucre good minde though ye lordes ouer parish ouer parish quoth peter peter thou wast peter neuer schole arch long fisher thou wast neuer brought god word stronger ye world world kill v shall make v aliue agayne possible worlde cast v hell thence yet shall god worde bring v agayne herby seest thou workes neuer glorious iustifie worke promise bone euen went earth saue coate yet wot many place pray thee helpeth promise deuils know christ dyed fryday iewes also holpe thereby haue promise christ body bloud suffered sacrifice raunsome full satisfaction sinnes god sake wyll thinke haue power repent beleue holy worke men thinke god reioyceth deede selfe without respecte thinke also god cruell tyrant reioyceth hath delectation payne takyng without respect therefore many martyr themselues wythout cause ensample baal priestes iij reg xviij cut themselues please theyr god olde heathen pagan sacrificed child fyre vnto god monkes charterhouse thinke eating fishe selfe pleaseth god referre eating vnto chastening body haue slayne bodyes wyth colde fleme fisheating yet eate fleshe sley themselues dayes also offer sonnes daughter compell perswade vowe professe chastitie thinke payne rage burning suffer absteining make pleaseth god referre chastitie vnto neighbour profet see thousandes fall innumerable disease therby die dayes yea though see breake commaundementes god dayly also impatiency worke abhominations nature shamefull spoken yet wyll let marry compell continue still wyth violence thus teach deuines appereth argumentes taketh payne say greatest forth people throughly brought beliefe deede selfe without respect saueth long church say many pater nosters reade much toung whtch vnderstand goe much pilgrimage take much payne fast superstitious fast obserue superstitious obseruauce neither profitable himselfe hys neyghbour done good entent onely say please god withall ye kisse paxe thinke meritorious deede loue neyghbour forgeue hym thyng signified thereby studie doe haue power doe thinke bounde doe offended hym fore haue false prophet brought people wittes haue wrapped darcknes haue rocked sleepe blyndnes ignorauncy doctrine false doctrine fayth false fayth deede pleaseth farre forth deede acceptable god farre forth applyed vnto neyghbours profet taming bodyes keepe commaundement must body tame onely wyth remedy god hath ordeined kylled thou must forswere naturall remedy god hath ordeined bryng thy selfe case thou shouldest eyther breake god commaundement kyll thy selfe burne nyght day wythout rest thou cast thinke godly thought neyther lawfull forsake thy neyghbour withdraw thy selfe seruing get thee den lyue idlely profitable man robbing men first fayth goodes land hath wyth makyng hym beleue hypocrisy thy superstitious prayer popeholy deedes prayer fayth ye deedes thereof spring loue accepted god prayer good according proportion prayer acceptable according fayth ou deedes according measure loue fayth deede according measure loue bideth world monkes call hath fayth cloysterer hangeth god thynges must trust god sende hym good speede good lucke fauour helpe good mayster good neyghbour good seruaunt good wyfe good chapman marchaunt send hys marchaundice safe land thousand like loueth also appeareth hee doth seruice alwayes vnto neighbour pray one equally boud pray thyng may alwayes doe euer haue hand may man hyre christes bloud hath hyred v ready thus deede deliteth god farforth either serue neighbour haue sayd tame flesh may fulfill commaundement bottome hart payne takyng god reioyseth therin tyraunt pitieth v morneth v alway ready hand helpe v call mercyfull father kynd mother neuer later hee suffereth v fall many temptation much aduersitie yea selfe layeth crosse tribulatio backes reioyseth sorrow driue sinne flesh none otherwise cured phisition surgion many thinges paynefull sicke reioyse paynes poore wretch persecute driue disease otherwise purged true purgatory crosse christ thou must hate thine hart desyre god take thee whatsoeuer crosse god putteth thy backe beare paciently whether pouertie sickenes persecution soeuer take right sitte owne seate ought beware well pestilent docrine abhominable lining likewise finde mention e asword turne vnto pope power disciple sayd vnto christ luke xxij loe two swordes christ aunswered two inough loe say pope hath ij swordes spirituall sword teporall sword therfore lawfull hym fight make warre christ litle went hys passion asked hys disciple saying sent without proiusion lacked ye thyng sayd nay aunswered let hym hath walet take hath scrippe likewise let hym hath neuer sword sell co e one shuld say shall go otherwise ye went foorth fayth word father promise fed made prouision sword shilde defender shall go thou readest zacharias xiij smyte shephearde sheepe flocke shalbe scattered shall father leaue handes theswicked ye also shalbe forsaken destitute faith shall trust selues prouisio owne defence christ gaue co maundement prophesied happen vnderstode hym aunswered two swordes christ make ende babblyng aunswered two inough commau ded euery man sword two bene inough also two inough pertained pope onely commaunded buy euery man sword sword therefore christ prophesied left vnto defence two swordes inough yea neuer one bene inough euery one ten swordes would haue fied ere mydnight chapter luke christ rebuked desire preheminence disciple pope chalengeth aboue men hy owne inheritaunce xij line foresayd text disciple euen last supper asked greatest christ rebuked sayd darknes sit god coscieces hadle v pleasure leade v whether lust therfore read thee get thee god word therby trye doctrine agaynst receaue nothyng neither exposition contrary vnto open textes neither thre pope one bishop went law one cursed owne fantasy thing falsly gotte greatest samts defeded liberty church call falsly gote blynding king neither world rest many hundred yeares reformyng frier monkes ceasyng schismes among clergy holy doctours augustine hierome cyprian chrisostomus bede heare wrote thyng negligently men drawe cleane contrary meanyng therof triumphe doctours knew none condened father set thou thee saying peter pet iij aske ready geue aunswere hope mekenes father iewes bishop whiche great authoritie ouer haue ouer v condemned christ doctrine inough say father haue conde ned iewes beholde excused yea yet right way false iewes bound loke scripture see whether father haue done right wrong likewise bound looke scripture whether father haue done right wrong ought wil patietly abide iudgement shewed authoritie prince god stede may resisted doe neuer euill must reserued vnto wrath god neuer latter commaunde euill must disobey say otherwise comau der god rise agaynst wil kil v sayest thou therfore say christen called suffer euen bitter death hys hope sake euill soeuer kyng vnto th great gift god shewed also kynges ruler neuer euill yet great gift goodnes god defende v thousand thynges see proued also men without exception vnder temporall sword soeuer name geue selues priest chosen lay men teach obedience lawfull cause disobey preacheth lay steale therfore lawfull hym steale vnpunished thou teachest may kill kyng must kill agayn therfore lawfull thee kil go free either whether rather mete thou whiche guide teache rightwaye shouldest walke first principall keye open dore scripture law way bringeth vnto dore christ lawe way leadeth christ writte gala iij law scholemaster bring v christ might iustified fayth rom x ende lawe say thyng cause law geuen christ iustifie beleue say lawe geuen proue v vnrighteous driue v christ made righteous row forgeuenes sinne hym lawe geuen make sinne knowen sayth lawe office saint paule rom iiij sinne committed vnder law might sinfull rom vij law thyng paule inward grauted good yet compelled oft tymes bers thinges good lawe condemned euill rom vij law maketh man loue law law reth sinne condemneth deedes drinketh v christ lesse commit sinne gendereth lust rom vij increaseth sinne rom v cannot hate lawe much finde power neuerthelesse condemneth lawe setteth one god causeth wrath rom iij lawe geue moses grace veritie iesus christ ioh j behold though moses gaue law yet gaue moses law christ onely geueth grace vnderstand aright man grace vnderstand aright wrote man hart consent good wishe power fulfill christ geueth grace vnderstand aright writeth wyth holy spirite table harte men maketh true thing none hypocrisie lawe truely vnderstoode fierie serpentes strong child israell present death christ brasen serpent whosoeuer beyng stoge ser ent num coscience sinne looketh ure fayth healed immediatly stinging saued paynes sorrowes hell one thyng codemne pronouce contra pe acio sentence death flyng conscience feare euerlastyng payne thing iustifie sinne say forgeue remitte sinne heale conscience certifie man deliuered eternall death also made sonne god heire euerlastyng lise first office lawe second pertayneth vnto christ onely thorow fayth thou geue lawe false glose ure looked vp say lawe thyng man may owne strength euen power free wyll dedes law thou mayst deserue forgeuenes thy foresinnes dyed christ vayne galat ij made almost sleade seyng thou art become thyne owne sauiour nether christ glose admitted otherwise take estemed christen men passion promise made v bloude turkes holy prophet prayeth v saintes saue christen thinke somewhat fauour saintes though imagine hym proude heare v thorow de mother holy saintes count much meeke mercifull hym might hath also higher place heauen graye fryer obseruaunts set hym fro chinne vpward aboue fraunces false interpretation lawe christ doore christ doore way foundation scripture way ground foundation scripture lost concerning chiefest frute hys passion sene owne likenes scripture locked vp henceforth extreame darcknes maze wherein thou walke thou wottest neither thou art canst finde way confused chaos minglyng thinges together without order euery thyng contrary hedge groue brier wherin thou caught impossible get thou lowse thy selfe one place thou art tangled caught wise scripture locked vp gloses owne imaginacio darken cleare text god word scripture locked v scribe phareseis iewes could see christ came yet though christ iij chapter open agayne yet gloses vnthankfulnes sake lust lyue accordyng haue christen lost christ agayne vnderstanding cleare text wherewith christ expoundeth restoreth lawe agayne hipocrites whatsoeuer semeth impossible corrupt nature vnrenued christ couer ouerwith mist gloses light therof shuld seene haue interpreted word christ wherwith restoreth law agayne good councelles onely preceptes binde conscience thereto haue ruffled tangled temporall spirituall regiment together christ vsed temporal regiment made thereof confusion man know one entent would seme haue aucthoritie christ neuer vsurped temporall regiment vnto notwithstanding deare reader thou reade exposition good hart onely know truth amendyng cheifely thine owne liuing mennes charitie requireth occasion geuen shalt thou perceaue falshod see mist expelled brightnes incuytable truth conclusion good promise made v thorow christ g geuen onely loue law professe scripture christes sake hys loue passion suffering bloudsheding death made v condition couenaunt party henceforth loue law god walke expounde hath part promise haue true faith bloud christ promise made onely promise keepe lawe thou wilt happely say agayne cannot haue sinnes forgeuen except loue lawe loue endeuour selfe keepe forbidden thou mayst pure harted haue wife get childre iudge condemne death haue deserued hang behead euil doer iust processe condepned thou mayst pure harted drudge world lot pure harted amog sodomite nicodem beyng councell among conspired death christ pure harted consented death innocent law written thyne hart ende lawe iusti leue driue thee christ end law iustifie beleue rom x christ shew thee father man seeth father sonne sonne shew luke x thou beleue christ thy sauiour faith wil leade thee immediatly shew thee god louely amiable countenaunce make thee feele see thy father al together mercyfull thee one thee thou sonne highly fauour grace sure thou pleasest thou doest hundred thinges whiche holy people would suppose selues defiled thinke see god blessing pure hart impure vncleane harted study breake god impure harted commaundementes impure harted beleue christ iustified impure harted hypocrite yt worke false purpose either prayse profite iustified thereby paynted sepulchre christ calleth neuer see god bee sure state grace theyr workes accepted haue god word cleane agaynst blessed peacemaker shalbe called child god inherite blessing peacemaking onely required thou haue peace thy selfe thou take best offeded lightly euery small trifle alway ready forgeue sowe discorde aduenge thyne owne wrong also thou feruent diligent make peace go betwene thou knowest hearest malice enuie seest bate strife arise betwen person person thou leaue nothing vnsought set one though christ speake temporall sword teacheth euery man shall liue selfe toward neighbour yet prince prince ought yet make warre wilbe god child must onely giue cause warre begyn also though haue iust cause suffer selfe entreated gaue cause repent must also seke al wayes peace fight howbeit sought nothing helpe ought bound defend land subiectes doyng peacemaker well whe causeth theeues murtherers punished euill doyng breakyng common peace land subiectes thou haue peace thy selfe whe thou maist assure thy selfe sonne heyre god louest peace thy brother maner god christ peace thee thou beloued sonne heyre also moreouer wrong done thee greater thou mayst beare whe thou art person thy selfe onely respect soeuer worldly degree hast office committed thee thou hast warned good maner none amendement wilbe kepe peace thyne hart loue still complaine set reforme thing art thou yet peacemaker still sonne god thou aduenge thy selfe desirest wronges forbidden vengeauce pertayneth god onely thou sinnest god taking authoritie god vpon thee without commaundemet god father ouer right iudge ouer child onely partayneth adueging therfore without commaundemet aduengeth either hart hand doth cast hym selfe handes sword loseth right cause side cursed peacebreakers picquarels whisperer hateth brother lawe w hart hand murtherer ioh iij blynde hand deserue death much partes haue sight reason sayth racha lewde whatsoeuer signe wrath racha prouoketh wrath hath onely deserued men shoulde immediatly pronouce sentece death vpon also death pronouced shuld gather coucell decree horrible death shuld suffer calleth hys brother foole hath sinned downe hell shall man angry rebuke punishe yes thou father mother master sse may angry without sinning husband lord ruler yet loue mercy angre rebuke punishment exceede fault trespasse may man angry loue ye mother wyth child louyng anger hateth onely vice studieth mende person forbidde onely wrath father mother haue gouernauce ouer thee angry grudge agaynst god himselfe ruler shall wrath without cause agaynst subiect also priuate wrath thy neighbour ouer thou hast rule ouer thee though thee wrog doth wrong lacketh witte discretion cannot amende till enformed taught louingly therefore thou must refrayne thy wrath tell fault louingly kyndenesse winne thy father thy brother well made deare bought thou well beloued though yet childishe lacke discretion wil say wil hate neighbour yet loue hym loue keeping lawe good yes must loue first comaundement flow thou shalt loue lorde thy god thyne hart thy soule thy might thou must keepe commaundemetes loue loue must kepe thee killing hurting thy neighbour couetyng thyne hart soeuer iohn iiij commaundement haue loueth god loue brother also agayne iohn iij hath substaunce world seeth brother haue necessity shutteth vp compassion loue god hym helpeth neede loueth god breaketh first commaundemet let v loue therefore sayth iohn word toung dede truth agayne iohn sayth sayd place loueth brother abydeth yet still death loue hath moyses textes inough phariseis glosed saying good councelles man desired perfect preceptes exod xxiij thou mete thyne enemyes oxe asse goyng astraye thou shalt wise bryng agayne thou see thyne enemyes asse fall downe vnder hys burthen thou shalt helpe vp agayne leuit xix thou shalt hate thy brother thyne hart shalt wise rebuke thy neighbour thou beare sinne sake thou sinnerse helpeth nde sinner must suffer punished study amed thy neighbour whe sinneth art thou partaker sinnes therfore whe god taketh vengeaunce sendeth soeuer plage punish ope sinner thou must perish thou dyddest sinne light god deepe thou dyddest loue law god mainteine withall thiue hart soule power might seeth neighbour house ieopardie set fire warneth helpeth time auoide perill worthy neighbour house burnt vp burnt also seing power haue kept al ieopardy wold would doubt loued neighbour eue whe god sendeth doyng best neighbour vertue although preuaile excused generall pestilence warre thy citie punish sinne thereof art worthy thine house shuld infected perish thou mightest haue kept sinnyng thou haddest bene willyng thereto thou thy best law god kepe thy land neighbour fro sinnyng god though helpe thou shalt beare synne sake punished therfore yt loueth law god may bold tyme pestilence ieopardy beleue god agayne place thou shalt aduege thy self beare hate minde child thy people shalt loue thy felow thy selfe lord say sake shalt thou deut x lord god god god lord lordes great god mightie terrible regardeth ma person degree taketh giftes doth right fatherlesse widow loueth straunger geue rayment fode loue therfore straunger ye straungers ye lad egypt leuit straunger soiourne thee land see ye vexe let strauger dwelleth among one selues loue thy selfe ye straungers land egypt lord say loue sake notwithstandyng thy neighbour hate man may hate hys neighbour hath shewed thee vnkyndnesse god hath loue mayst thou hate must loue god sake till fight agaynst god destroye name glorie god therfore thou offerest thy gift alter remembrest thy brother hath ought agaynst thee leaue thy gift alter goe first reconcile thy selfe vnto thy brother come offer thy gift agre thine aduersarie whyle thou arte waye hym least thyne aduersarie deliuer thee iudge iudge deliuer thee minister thou cast prison verely say vnto thee thou shalt come thence till thou haue payd vttermost farthyng text yt similitude somwhat suttle bindeth hath offended reconcile selfe great ferme lambe calfe let thy wife visit thy landladye three foure tymes yeare wyth spised cake apple peares cheries like thou ready thyne ox horse three foure halfe dosen dayes yeare set home wood plow lad yea thou haue good horse let haue hym good cheape take worse hym shal thy shilde defende thee though tyrautes care god man else shall dare polle thee thereto thou maist wisdome get shall recompence thou doost thys meane thou patient wise feare god thereto loue thine neighbour none euill thou keepe thy selfe fauour hurting thy neighbour thine ende euill last desperation thys worlde spiritualtie temporalitie vnder regimentes first regiment thou art person thyne owne selfe vnder christ doctrine mayst neither hate angry much lesse fight aduenge must ensample christ humble thy selfe fayre meanes foule thou must haue obedience thy wife thy seruauntes thy subiectes must obey wil obey loue thou must chide fight farre law god law land suffer thee yu cast rule thou art bound many case deliuer vnto hyer officer thou dyddest take charge ouer purpose whether violence resist violece vnderstode may resist violence defend aduenge selfe say nay first state thou art person thy selfe alone christes disciple thou must loue loue studie enforce yea suffer thynges christ dyd make peace blessyng god may come vpon thee sayth blessed peace maker shalbe child god thou suffer keepest peace thy selfe onely thy blessyng possession world thou loue peace thy brethre thou leaue nothyng vndone vnsuffred thy blessyng thou shalt god sonne consequently possesse heauen worldly state thou art priuate man person respect thou onely mayest also must art bounde vnder payne dauation execute thyne office thou art father thou must haue obedience fayre meanes foule thou art husband thou must require obedience chastitie get attept law land commaundeth thy seruauntes thou must exact obedience feare mayest suffer thy selfe despised thou art ruler therto ruler must punishe ut malice defence people maintenaunce lawes appoynted thou must take prison slea malice hate aduenge thy selfe defend thy subiectes mainteine thine office concernyng thy selfe oppresse thy subiectes rent fynes custome neither pitie tax like mainteine thyue owne lustes louyng kinde christ thee price bloud euill doer among vexe brother know thee iudge feare thy law smite vpon draw thy sword put vp vntill thou haue thyne office yet without hate thee person maisters sake first regiment thy brother amende euely canot thou must lose one saue many execute thine office assertion compassion sorow hart thou wouldest thine vse office person sinne agaynst thy father euen thou art temporal person thou puttest spirituall therfore thou must euer loue loue wil helpe thou must loue execute office temporall person sinne agaynst god mother smite loue mayst thou loue execute office thy seconde state wife sonne seruaut subiect brethre first state put person reason secod degree therfore must loue euer loue pay custome tribute soeuer thou art bound loue feare honour obedience belong paule teacheth rom xiij though doe dutie loue thee rule rigorousnesse deale vnkindly thee thou deseruyng yet cleaue thou christ loue stil let euill ouercome thy goodnesse make thee euill also example aboue thy father hath power ouer thee commaund thee vse power ouer thy brother euen hath thy master geue thee hys authoritie ouer thy felowes whiche thou hast thou must remember thou art felow still bound loue still loue alone helpe put thy master authoritie vnto thy loue hath ruler power ouer thee send thee vse violence vppon thy neighbour take prison hym happly kill thou must euer loue thy neighbour thyne hart reason thy brother first state yet obey thy ruler go costable like officer breake open thy neighbour doore ope kynges name yea yeld kyngs name thou must lay smite ground till subdued loke harme getteth yea though slayne owne head thine hart loued yt desiredest louingly obey hast adueged thy selfe state thou art brother worldly state thou art maner person case thou executed authoritie hath power god commaunde thee thou damned god thou diddest obey like thy lord prince warriour send thee warfare land thou must obey god commaundement go aduege thy prince quarell whiche thou knowest right thou commest thether remember thou art first state agaynst thou must fight thy brother deepely bought christes bloud thou christes sake beloued thyne hart see thou desire neither life goodes saue aduege thy prince quarell bryng vnder thy prince power content thy prince wage thou parte spoyle thou hast wonne thy prince deputie appointeth thee thou hate thyne hart couetest goddes art glad occasion founde thou carest whether right wrong thou mayst go robbyng murtheryng vnpunished art thou murtherer ye sight god thy bloud wil shed agayne either warre folowyng thou art come home thou dyddest thyne hart shalt thou robbe steale hanged thy labour slayne mischief cocernyng goodes world easie iudge goodesin first state degree yt oughtest thankfull christ loue geue lend bought precious bloud thou art able thou owest christ whose seruaut thou art must pay thou doest math xxv thou doest christ thou art ready denyest thou christ thy brother hold take away force aboue thou mayst spare reason office thou hast second state inuade thee violently lay thy backe thou canst beare hold thyne hart hand thou neither hate smite speake fayre louingly let neighbour goe betwene thou hast proued meanes loue vayne complaine law officer set thy father defend thee iudge betwene thee thy brother go lawethou wilt say text forbiddeth go law sayth man law thee take thy coate thou must let haue gowne must suffer selfe robbed ye law wilt thou say right law recouer myne aunswere behold text diligently right law man take thy coate fro thee ye law ordeyned god mainteine thee thy right forbydde wrong done thee wherfore text meaneth thus law vniustly ministred gouerners iudges corrupt take brybes parciall pacient ready suffer euer much soeuer vnright done thee rather rise agaynst iudge magistrate resiste god impaciencie thou shouldest aduenge thy selfe thy neighbour rayle make insurrection agaynst superiours whiche god hath set ouer thee rise agaynst rebell god thy father scourgeth thee thyne offece thousad tymes sinne aduege thee thy neighbour rayle rayle god though thou wouldest blasp made sicke poore ow degree otherwise thou wouldest made thy selfe thou wilt happely say subiectes euer chose ruler make prince whether may resisted put downe subiectes case hym sweare keepe law mainteine priuilegies erties vpon submit selues vnto hym ergo rule amisse bounde obey may resist put downe agayne aunswere argument nought husband sweareth wife yet though forsweare selfe hath power compell hym also though maister keepe couenaunt seruaunt one neighbour yet hath neither seruaunt yet neighbour though vnder none obedience power aduenge vengeaunce pertayneth euer higher officer thou must complayne yea ay like whole body subiectes chose ruler cuius est ligare eius est soluere ergo rule amisse set vp may put hym downe agayne answere god common people chuseth prince though chuse hym deut xvi god commaundeth chuse set vp officer therefore god chiefe chuser setter vp must chiefe putter downe agayne without speciall commaundement may put downe agayne hath god geuen commaundement put downe agayne contrariwise haue annointed kyng ouer v commaundement sayth touch myne annointed ieopardy rise agaynst thy prince annointed ouer thee euill euer see story kyng dauid thoroughout bookes kinges authority kyng authority god subiectes king hath god authoritie compared king subiectes still though king neuer euill thousand sonnes gathered together sinnes still commaundement obey father goeth ouer well ouer one euen goeth commaundement ouer subiectes obey prince higher power resisteth resisteth god getteth dampnation vnto argument cuius est ligare eius est soluere aunswere bindeth aunswere former argument wyth absolute power without higher authoritie might louse agayne bindeth man commaundement may louse agayne without commaundement london chuse maior may put downe agayne euill euer without authority hym whose licence chose long power officer one vnder inferior thee wrong complayne higher hyghest thee wrong thou must complayne god onely wherefore onely remedy euill ruler thou turne thine eye thy selfe thyne owne sinne looke vp god say father sinne sinne father misery come vpon v know thee father obey thee walke thy wayes therfore thou knowest v thy sounes set louing scholemasters ouer v hate thy law therefore hast thou thorough wickednes vnrighteous iudges made law defence tyraunt cruel oppresse v v iniury aboue kindes violence robbing amende thy liuing meeke patient let robbe much yet shall god geue thee foode raiment honest possession earth mayntaine thee thine withall moreouer concerning thy good goodes thou must remember thou art person temporall regimet kyng ouer thy body eue lord thy good kyng ee lord thy body hee thy goodes hym thou holdest thy selfe onely maintaine thy wife child seruauntes maintaine kyng realme countrey towne citie tho dwellest wherefore thou mayst suffer wasted thou able thy dutie seruaut may suffer master good go wracke neghgently prouideth namely hys owne housholde sayth paule denieth fayth worse infidell euery man bounde labour diligently truely therewith soberly e may haue inough hym somwhat aboue labour chaunce fallen necessitie geue lende looke againe suffice thy neighbour necessitie speake make labour thy brother helpe also common prouerbe many handes make light worke many may beate one alone cannot thy wife thy child seruauntes art thou bounde defende man would force thy wife thy daughter thy mayde inough thee looke say god amede nay thou must execute thine office authoritie kyng geueth thee way must defede thy master good king good thou hast maintaine thy wife housholde withall thine neighbour goeth thee agaynst theues murtherers person lay thee thou wouldest thou vnder kinges standard enemy inuaded realme person mortall enemy realme seeke put downe king law altogether make might lawfull sinne vnpunished maner thou marke well difference two state regimentes thou mayst soyle like doubtes shalbe layde agaynst thee moreouer whe say two regimets regiment spirituall temporall euen say euery person euery vnder regimentes baptised keepe lawe god beleue christ vnder rigimentes spirituall person also teporall vnder officer regimetes kynge deepe vnder spirituall officer heare ou god worde ought beleue liue rule poorest begger realme euen spirituall officer sinne neighbour teach spiritualitie may rebuke king vice may kyngs vse temporall correctio agaynst spiritualtie false doctrine vnder kinges temporall correction high euer looke dampnable king withdraw himselfe fro obedience spirituall officer say hearing hys duty fro hearing vice rebuked amende dampnable spirituall officer high euer withdraw hymself fro vnder kinges correctio teach false sinne agaynst temporall lawe finally ye must consider christ preacher e ce teacheth disciple light salt lyuing doctrine shi e weake feble eye worlde diseased mygrim accustomed darcknesse wyth great paine beholde light salte olde feasterd sore frete rotten fleshe euen harde quicke sinert agayne spare degree tell men hie low ye sheepe v e regiment among wolues thou sheepe thou art taking thou canst bring passe wolfe content thy ese onely shere thee yearely geue asketh would borow turne away luke sayth geue whosoeuer asketh thee say whersoeuer thou seest neede seest cotrary may neede vttermost thy power open thine hart mercifull onely mercifulnes set god thy father christ thy lord master ensample enforce like thou canst thou mercifull god hath bound himselfe mercifull thee agayne lo excceding great thyng god right ought bound hys creature hath yet put whole thyne owne hand bynd hym day thy tribulation shew thee mercy concerning lending proceede yt foresayd rule mercy many extreame lending must folow rule mercy neede yet ashamed begge shall desire thee lende vnto steede lending geue say thus lo much ye require ye pay agayne well ye shall finde ready tyme lende geue neede much ye shall able pay agayne trouble conscience geue one man child one man hath bought v al bloud bound v helpe one doyng thou shalt wynne hart thy father concernyng marchaundise chapman lesse borowyng among better common wealth possible would ware ware money ware part money part ware man get liuyng must nedes lende call agayn finde houshold pay dettes lendyng first single harmeles doue wise serpent take hede thou lendest thou hast lent honest god visite take away hys good chaunce whether sea land able pay thee prison thy ordes thy fayth praying god doth respect thy faith promise goodnes neither yet multitude thy wordes long habling knoweth thy matter better thou thy selfe though iewes heathen foolishe thorough benefites god therefore vnthankfull obey hys commaundementes thou mayst know pray geueth thee short instruction ensample saying maner pray father art heaue dater noster expounded first thou must goe mercifull father owne goodnes fatherly loue beareth thee ready thee thou cast desire though thou haue merites thy father onely thou wilt turne henceforth submitte thy selfe learne hys wyll honoured thy name honour god name honoured praysed thy name honoured praysed thou honour god honour yt name god one honour name god dread loue hym keepe hys commaundementes whe childe obeyeth father honoureth prayseth hys father rebellion disobedient dishonoureth hys father vnderstandyng meaning father seing thou art father ouer powre thy spirite vppon flesh make men feare dread loue thee father keeping thy commaundementes honour thee thy holy name thy kingdome come kinges must commaunde nothyng forbid thing contrary god worde seyng thou art kyng ouer make know thee make kynges ruler thy substitute commaunde nothyng according thy worde make subiectes obey thy fulfilled earth heauen one goeth much thou art father kyng ouer thy child brother among selues make v obedient seeke thy aungelles heauen make man seeke hys owne thine thou withdraw thyne tempt thy child ruler comaunde ought contrary thy make subiectes stand fast thy worde offer themselues suffer extremitie rather obey finally pray thee temptation request thing god must pray done aduersities desiring thee whatsoeuer thyng meane truely yet thou knowest seest better way thy glory profite thy thy sonne iesus gaue v ensample desired bene possible cuppe bitter death might haue departed fro hym saying yet thou wilt geue v dayly bread bread vnderstoode maner dayly breade whereby vnderstoode pertaineth vnto necessitie lyfe sustinaunce ebrue speach yea vnderstand therby pertayneth vnto necessitie thys life haue bread dearth nothing yt pinch namely land geue v dayly bread geue v necessitie life dayly requireth geue v day day nede desire haue store many yeares exclude necessitie praying thee thy daunger forget thee minister day day may dayly feele thy benefites neuer forget thee thou geue v aboundaunce aboue desire geue v hart vse bestow purpose thou gauest deale neighbour loue inordinatly thinke thyne thou mayst take away euery houre content thou ac thy pleasure euer haue dayly bread forgeue v trespass forgeue trespasser knoweth nature weake cannot sinne dayly therefore teacheth v dayly repet reconcile selues together dayly aske god forgeuenesse seing comaundeth v aske may behold beleue forgeue v therfore nedeth dispayre repent aske forgeuenesse euer deepe hath sinned thinketh looked somewhat nerer text neded make pope great god pardon christ man beleued sheweth v sure surer way pardon way yea sensible way may feele pardoned sinnes forgeuen haue experiece pope thyngs whether pardon deliuer man purgatorie god putteth v vnto world ca blesse heale man much poore agew totheach disease yet hys owne confession god putteth v purge v sinne cannot see feele haue experience hee mightie come land neuer sure neuer come might tel many wonder master doth vtopia man could rebuke christ maketh thee sure thou mayst bee sure pardon thy sinnes pardon thou canst forgeue thy brother god hath bound selfe forgeue thee man haue sinned agaynst hard lyfe neuerthelesse yet profession thyne hart yu knowest thy dutie forgeue thy brother thy father sake art obedient thy father ordinaunce wouldest forgeue thy brethre offended thee aske thee forgeuenesse hast thou spirit god desireth marke christ sayth aboue begynnyng fift chap blessed mercyfull shall haue mercy doest thou pitie thy brethen sinne doest thy best amend thy father name may honoured hast thou whereby thou art sure mercy soone thou desirest agayne blessed peace maker shall god child lo variaunce among thy brother one haue offended thy best set one thou hast thing god desireth thee hathe bound himselfe forgeue thee leade v temptation let v slippe thy lease hold v fast geue v vp cease gouerne v take thy spirite v hounde folow game seeth cannot selues lowse fall sinne occasio geuen v thou withdraw thine hand v lead v temptatio let temptation fall vpon v greater thine helpe v thou stroger v temptation thou sendest lettest come vppon v lead v teptations father though negligent yea vnthankfull disobediet thy true prophetes yet let deuill lowse vpon v deceaue v false prophetes harden v way gladly walke thou diddest pharao false miracle sorcerer thine apostle paule threateneth v ij thes ij litle threde holdeth strong man gladly litle pullyng draweth whether gladly goeth litle wynde dryneth small occasion dr v ly prone great shyp streame light persuasion inough make lecherous beleue fornication sinne angry lawfull aduege selfe forth corrupt nature man litle miracle able consirme harden man opinion saith blind reason beleueth ready false miracle suffici persuade couetousnesse pharao gredynesse hold child israell bodage seruice thy true miracle shewed moyses deliuerauce thee kynd done craft miracle sorcerer harden hart euen father thou geue v ouer vnkyndnesse seyng blynd nature man deliteth euill ready beleue lye litle thyng inough make loue thee ready walke thy truth therfore neuer able vnderstand thy sonnes doctrine iohn vij beleue yt fayninges holy father superstition poperie inuisible blessinges harde stone cast vp ayre neither go higher neither yee abyde whe power hurler ceaseth driue euen father seyng corrupt nature go downeward onely deuill world driueth therto waye procede vertue stand thy power cease v leade v therfore mercyful father temptation cease tyme gouerne v seyng god al mercy knoweth thine infirmitie commaundeth thee pray temptation aduersitie hath promised helpe thou trust excuse say whe thou hast sinned could stand selfe power ready helpe thee thou haddest asked deliuer v euill first aboue let v fall temptation secondarely fallen liueth falleth neuer neuer fall inough make shuld thinke hym selfe without sinne euill lucifer euill lucifer beleue stode owne power therfore fallen euen bottome euer deepe put thine arme long strong inough plucke v agayne thirdly deliuer v fro euill plucke v flesh world power deuill place v thy kyngdome past ieopardy sinne kingdome power glorie thyne euer amen thou onely art king substitute power thyne men power borowed thee therfore ought honour obedience thyne right chief lord none geuen men onely office hold thee neither ought creature seeke world brother till thou haue put office brotherlynesse helpe whiche ought first proue let hym execute thy power neither may take authoritie selfe till god haue chose til chosen ordinauce god hath set world rule finally king lord master ruler hath absolute power world thyng whiche called ceased bee brother still neither could sinne soeuer commaunded authoritie limered power transgresse sinne agaynst brother ought reconcile selues brother aske forgeuenesse bounde forgeue finally let kynges ruler officer kynges subiectes one afore god remember god kyng referre honour geuen office sake humble selues knowledge confesse hart brother euen better god worst subiectes amen ye forgeue men theyr fautes heauenly father shall forgeue also ye forgeue men fautes shall father forgeue fautes god couenaunt v couenaut god bounde forgeue v forgeue ech confirmation petition aboue rehearsed pater noster forgeue v trespass forgeue trespasser thou wilt enter couenaut thy lord god forgeue thy brother soeuer thou hast committed agaynst god thou repet aske forgeuenesse thou art sure thou art thy god therfore feare bugges thon wilt god couenaunt sure absolution keepe come within couenaunt god whe thou hast professed receaued signe therof thou cast yoke lord thy necke thou sure thou art commaundement inferiour contrary superiour commaude contrary thing mayst thou obey two cotrary master god mammon mammon god two cotrary master yea two contrary god contrary commaundementes god sayth thy lord god one shalt yu serue alone yu shalt loue thyne hart thyne whole hart thy soule thy might thou shalt neither serue obey loue thyng saue byd thee farre byd thee mammon sayth mammon wilbe god also serued loued alone god sayth see thou loue thy neighbour thou labour thine hads get thy liuyng somewhat aboue helpe mamon sayth called thy neighbour nye thee nye thee thy self ergo proximus esto tibi loue thy selfe make lewde vyle wretch labour diligently get thee much thou mayst scrappes aboue selues wilt thou perfect disguist thy selfe put mammon maketh disguise selues gray coate blacke pyed geue thy selfe deuotion despise world take couetous would say contemplatiue life vpon thee tell people hoate purgatorie paynes must suffered small fantes geue mercyfully thousad folde one spirituall temporall geue heauen take house land foolish temporall thynges god sayth iudge truly betwene thy brother therefore take giftes mammon sayth good maner apoynt curtesie take offered geueth thee loueth thee better chur e geueth thee naught yea thou ar bound fauour cause god sayth fell geue almose mammon sayth lay vp haue inough mainteyne thyne estate defed thee thyne enemyes serue thee thyne age c much god mammon seruauntes mammon chri e church two contrary master whosoeuer serue god must geue vp mammon serue mammo must forsake god foloweth sworne seruauts mammon haue holy spirite faithfull church true seruaunts god haue spirite truth true church moreouer seing god mammon contrary god worde seruaunt mammon true preacher death mammon eare doctrine poyson mammon mouth foloweth minister god word fauour mammon fashion speach sound wordes may pleasaunt eares mammon finally alonely haue richesse bee mammos seruaunt seruaut mammon loue clea e thyne hart thou haue good onely maint ine office whiche god hath put thee rest helpe thy neighbour nede art thou lord ouer thy mammon seruaunt rich shalt thou know mammos seruaunt knowen master mammon seruaunt verely first gettyng secondarely poore neighbour complaineth mammon seruaunt mammon wil shut vp hart make hym without compassion thirdly crosse christ trye one whe persecution ariseth word true seruaunt christ byd mammon dew faithfull seruaunt mammon vtter hypocrisie onely renounce doctrine christ also cruel sharpe persecuter therof put away surmise fidelitie hath master mammon map openly appeare therfore say vnto care lyues ye shall eate ye shall drinke neither bodyes ye shall put lyfe meate body rayment bundeth costely house eue tylyng leaue lose great cost small trifle gaue thee precious soule bewtifull body goodnes god towarde mankynd let either perish agayne ye day small thnig foode rayment god neuer made mouth made meate body made rayment also howbeit mon blindeth eye neither see iudge right behold foules ayre sow neither reape gather storehouse yet heauenly father fedeth ye farre better takyng thought able put one cubite vnto stature careth least creature much care yt greatest byrdes beastes teache v put away care byrdes ayre beast preach v leaue caring put trust father mammon hath made v dull cleane without capacitie none example argument neuer vehement ca enter wittes v make v see iudge right finally madnes take great thought fode rayment wealth health life thy body together thy power world thyne thou couldest make thy selfe one inche leger thy stomacke shall disgeste meate thou puttest thou art sure whiche thou puttest thy mouth shall go thee whether shall choke thee thou canst make thou lyest sittest thou shalt arise agayn thou slepest thou shalt awake agayne thou shouldest liue one houre loger cared thee thou couldest care must care thee still el thou shouldest perish care thee thy soules profite thou mistrust care thy selfe rayment take ye thought behold lyly field grow labour neither spynne yet say euen salomon glorie apparelled lyke one wherefore grasse whiche day fieldes morow shalbe cast furnace god clothe howe much shal vnto ye litle fayth onely foule beast also care tree herbe floures earth crye vnto v trust god cast away care coupled couetousnesse sufficient beare charge whiche haue handes reason state world care annexed mistrust god shuld minister inough beare charge endeuer selues keepe commaundementes euery man craft office truly god proue v suffereth v haue neede neighbour first complayne god desire prepare harte neighbour agaynst come desire helpe mamon pypeth song saying thou shouldest make mammon maner labour benefice thou careddest whether thou dest haddest would log ere thou gattest one would take thyne hand aunswere thy labour get shalbe thy hauiour thou flatteredest haue shalt thou thou boughtest souldest get shalt thou sell bye auour set world thy principall tent thou seekest benefice lucre take hede example thy forefather symon magus let thy actes care therefore office god putteth thee trulye blessyng coupleth thereto take thankes neither care couet take thought therefore saying shall eate shall drinke shall put thynges heathen seke yea heauenly father knoweth ye neede thing seke first kyngdome god righteousnesse therof thynges shalbe ministred vnto like heathen haue trust god word beleue life come let vexe selues ech deuill sor worldly thynges comfort conenaut keepe couenaunt god shal keepe promise wyth thee thou thy self hope better life another worlde euer assured shalt haue sufficient onely thou keepe couenaunt lord thy god seke kyngdome righteousnesse therof aboue thing kyngdome god gospel doctrine christ righteousnesse kingdome heauen therof beleue christes bloud remission sinnes righteousnesse springeth loue god thy neighbour sake also righteousnesse haue sayd afore farre perfect lacketh supplied faith god word hath promised accept til come righteousnes kingdome heauen foloweth outward righteousnesse workes diligent recording god word together grow waxe perfect keepe selues goyng backe losyng spirite agayne haue spiritualtie corrupt doctrine myngled together say righteousnes kyngdome god fayth christ bloud outward righteousnes mebers ascribe one pertaineth seke kingdome heauen therfore righteousnesse sure thou shalt euer haue sufficient thynges shalbe ministred vnto say shall come owne accord promise god yea christ promiseth thee hu dredfolde euen life thou leauest sake true would say would rather serue mammon yet true first thou seruaunt mammo thou must kepe thy god thy god thee euery man stroger thou take thy god thee moreouer god take either thee thy mammon thy mammon thee ere thou wouldest aduenge selfe thy blynd vnkyndnesse hath made thee geuen thee thou forsakest seruest mortall enemy thou folow christ world let take deuils thou folow christ thou canst sufficient liuing hell shall able disappointe thee sufficiet lyuing though persecute thee house house thousand tymes yet shall god prouide thee thing sufficient liue compare ye suretie incertaintie blessed end heaue promised thee also miserable departyng sore agaynst thy desperation thy hart eeleth thou art ready hell may wel called thousand fold care day folowyng let day folowyng care selfe day present hath euer inough owne trouble thou looke well conenaut care betwene thee thy lord god one side temptation worlde fleshe satan thou shalt soone perceiue day present hath euer inough cared thou must ry instantly god helpe also though thou thy best seing yt day present ouercharged owne care madnesse lade vpon also care day folowing yea care yeare ye xx yeare though thou neuer entendest die torment vexe soule thorow mistrust vnbeliefe make thy life soure hym care himselfe beleue thou wordes stedfastly sure heauen earth shal sooner perishe one iote bide behinde hath promised thine owne part also care maner though thou shouldest alone nay god hath first promised helpe thee secondarily accept thine hart little thou art able neuer imperfect thirdly though wynde weather streame cary thee cleane contrary thy purpose yet thou bidest still thy profession shalt see clearely plucke mote thy brother eye ment temporall iudgyng iudgemetes christ forbad oft stablishe peter paule epistle also forbidden iudge deedes manifest lawe god ought euery christe therefore thou kepest none truely lawes require mercy sacrifice moreouer thou hast false entent workes doost therefore dampnable sight god hipocrite cast beame thine owne eye learne vnderstand lawe god truely thy workes aright entent god ordayned thou shalt see whether thy brother haue mote eye haue plucke el knoweth entent ceremony hee breaketh vnitie zeale ceremony vnder slandeth god law lawe losse iugglyng termes matter bottes brede gnaw belyes make vnquiet like maner word penaunce penaunce make people vnderstand holy deedes enioynyng must make satisfactio penaunce profit papistes vnto godward sinnes scripture preacheth christ hath made full satisfactio sinnes godward must thakfull god agayne kill lustes flesh holy workes god enioynyng take paciently god layeth back haue rue penaunce hurt neighbour bounde shr e selfe vnto make amendes haue wherewith aske sorgeuenesse bounde forgeue penauce scripture knoweth greke hath metanoia metanoite repentaunce repente forthinkyng forthinke say english forthinketh forthinke repent repeteth sory dyd scripture ayth repent let forthinke come beleue gospell glad tydynges brought christ shall forgeuen henceforth lyue new lyfe folow rebuke like maner depart fayth true church heretickes eue depart fro depart fayth hypocrite true church church heretickes false fayned fayth hypocrite true church thou shalt alway know fayth examined beleue church erre thyng perteyneth vnto soules health man tell note popish argument maruelous thyng whereof haue knowledge mouth onely geue credence except beleued honest could lye would lye wherfore must beleue right church erre el beleue nought wise reason shoteancre hold refuge flye vnto chief stone foundation wheron haue built lye al mischief haue wrought viij hudred yeares reason iewes lay vnto charge day reason doth chiefly blynd hold still obstinacie spirites first falsifie pope sect say church erre scripture stablish lye scripture commeth light restored vnto true vndersta dyng iugglyng spied like suffer shipwracke cast ancre church erre authoritie greater scripture scripture true say admitte therfore soeuer affirme great authoritie scripture notwithstandyng sayd solution kyngdome heauen standeth word ma wisedome power spirite therfore loke vnto example scripture shalt thou vnderstand hundred example betwene moyses christ israelite fell iohn baptist true expositor law god eue restored one prophet let v take one euen iohn baptist iohn went christ prepare way bryng vnto knowledge sinnes vnto repentaunce true expoundyng law onely way vnto christ except man knowledge
