excused better offer god thy father mother much meritorious god greater yea god hath done thee thy father mother affirme meritorious offer god holy dead saintes vnto poore liuyng saintes whe god promised people sauiour come blesse saue theyr sinnes phariseis taught beleue holy woorkes saued offered gaue prayd oft haue promise forgeue repentaunce hart christes bloud shedding put thou must first shriue thy selfe v euery abe must lay handes thine head whistell pa doctrine thy sinnes enioyne penaunce make satisfaction yet art thou loused synne onely thou shalt come hell thou must yet false worshipping child israell iewes let signification ceremony goe lost meaning turned vnto workes serue saying holy workes co maunded god offerer thereby iustified obtayned forgeuenes sinnes ghost reuell gamboldes mayd ipswich also matter maketh whether man haue deuill holy ghost ye say deuill likewise deuill holy ghost moreouer possessed christ possessed deuils fled fro christ holpe auoyded christ fled fro beleued fame bryng vnto agaynst willes cause many moe might made thou mayst coclude deuill vexed preached confirmed fayned confession dome ceremony sacramentes without signification damnable sectes shewed false delusion bryng v idolatry reuelations assoone brought ladyes image departed delude v turne faythes christ vnto old blocke read legend bartholomew deuils cardinal hat aunswered vnto already xviij chapter xviij would fayne tradit proue pope churche erre alledgeth thynges wherof might ashamed past shame proue byshops haue authoritie lade v traditios neither profitable soule body bringeth false allegorie vppon ouerplus samaritane layde promised pay came agayn byshops tradition nay besides allegory euery man may fayne allegory pleasure proue nothing christ interpreteth selfe betokeneth kynde mynde louyng neighbour loued straunger neuer left caryng absent well present vntill full whole common necessitie signifieth prelate true apostle begger realmes false idolatry imagese uice haue left wherewith beare cost common charge moreouer scribe phariseis taught owne doctrine sat vpon moses seate owne therfore christ far would haue v chapter chapter folowyng vttereth fleshly mynded beastly imagineth god paule sayth cor cor naturall man vnder stand thyngs spirite god thinketh god doth hys naturall carnall man sauoreth thinge god cardinall monster pleased men flatter whatsoeuer frailtie men breake co maundementes ragyng mad pope seketh venged nay god euer fatherly minded toward elect mebers church loued yer world began christ ephe loueth yet euill enemy rom god fatherly elect member harte yer come vnto knowledge sonne christ yer law written harte father loueth young sonne yet euill yer know father law consent therto actually church law god faith christ written harte harte neuer sinne though paul sayth rom vij flesh doth rom spirit would sinne frailtie god ceaseth sinne frailtie god mercifull ready forgeue loue layd vp mercy hym store though angry scourge teach better neither thing layd backe suffered make satisfaction foresinnes onely serue brother keepe flesh vnder neither new life doth tame fleshe serue infidel longed fayth come thereby whether wandereth fleshly mynde though first god seketh v hym sought god nay god kitoweth seketh sendeth messenger vnto geueth hart vnderstand heathe nation seke christ nay christ sought sent apostle vnto thou seest storyes begynnyng world parable similitude gospell declare sayth neuer founde heard v would lying papist forsweare saue lyfe aunswere wrath god wil light cruelly delite torment craftely beguile weake neuerthelesse yet vntrue hath heard sir thomas hitton sir thomas hitton byshops rochester caunterbury slew maydstone many yt suffered braband holand colen quarter dutchland dayly sayth church hath many martyr let hym shewe pope hath martyr one dyed pardon purgatory pope hath fayned let take mastrie maketh say church sinneth man sinneth whiche yet true read iohn iij borne god sinneth iohn ephes v men loue wiues lord doth churche gaue selfe sanctifie church sinneth clense fountaine water word make glorious church vnto hym selfe without spot wrincle iohn say haue sinne deceaue selues make lyer hys word v also wil vnderstand church time taken churh double elect onely whiche haue law god written harte fayth saued christ written also say paule good would euill hate sinne dwelleth flesh gala v flesh lusteth cotrary ye spirit spirit cotrary flesh gal two fightyng betwene selues ye ye would neuer consent sinne good hate law cease fight flesh assoone fallen rise fight fresh church tyme taken como rascal beleue whether mouth onely carnally spirite neither louyng law carnall church sinneth hart feelyng mercy christ either runne together riot keepe law cautels exposition owne faynyng yet loue feare hell theues feare galowes make recompence god sinnes holy dedes also vnderstand two maner faithes two maner faythes one fayth elect purgeth sinnes euer ye see iohn xv ye cleane sayth christ iohn reason word thorough beleuyng christ doctrine iohn gaue power sonnes god beleuyng name iohn iij beleueth sonne hath euerlastyng lyfe thousand like textes called aith called elect neuer electe faith iudas symon magus deuill pope whose harte law god written appeareth workes therfore beleue many thynges christ yet whe come vnto saluation bloud iewes turkes forsake christ runne vnto iustifying ceremony iewes turkes therefore remayne euer sinne within harte elect hauing law written brestes leuyng theyr spirites sinne neuer without flesh agaynst whiche sinne fight continually minishe dayly helpe spirite thorough prayer fasting seruing neighbour louyngly maner seruice law writte hart hope forgeuenesse christ onely bloud ceremony v chapter vnto hys v chapter answere pope scripture pope hideth scripture hid brought ignoraunce true sence corrupt ye call heretickes know scripture true sence thereof say pope keepeth scripture ye phariseis make marchaundise agayne heretickes become scribe phariseis came apostle christ himselfe iohn baptist plucked graffed christ built vppon foundation apostle prophetes end sayth heretikes fallen mist heretickes fallen christes misticall body pope hys aunswere ye misticall body walke mist wyll come light heretikes departed mist walke cleare light god worde vj chapter vj sayth heretikes nought periure abiure yet saith vntrue many abyde vnto death many theyr many weakenesse kept hads many ouer much boldnesse owne strength deliuered handes fall fleshe harte abiding still truth peter thousandes repent lesse christen though ye haue derision vnto owne damnation many come christ fleshly liberty loue truth fall becommeth vnder handes iudas balam beginning take christes parte afterward fynde eyther losse vauntage get vnto contrary part profession cruell enemyes subtellest persecuters truth looke maister reade marke well vij chapter vij sayth hath holy saintes holy counsel hys side name saintes proue name counselles holy prelate councels thereof thou shalt shew none pope cardinal haue obey neyther god law made god man compell men follow strengthning kyngdome layde agaynst inough proue part common custome multitude doctrine turkes right way viij chapter viij sayth saintes saintes charitable liued answere abraha lyued charitable best yet dead answered hym appollo cephas whether world life death present thynges thynges come youres ye christes christ god fayth stedfast promise haue christes bloud neede pray father christes name shall send legion angel say ye put trust onely put remembraunce dutie man desireth neighbour pray remembring hym hys dutie desire brother helpe v neede false ye put trust ceremony holy deedes whosoeuer disguiseth hymselfe altereth hys coat common fashion ye euen coates yet saintes dortrine priest sayd masse gowne would ye rise hym slea hym false fayth ye haue garmetes honour garmentes god hys gowne profite vnto soules compell would yet naturally owne harte keepe law god yea violence compelling contrary see wil church proue hath great trust scripture sophistrie sword haue set vp landes keepe violence roome farre fro hauing lawes god written harte neither god lawe papistes neither god lawe man refraine fro wicked liuyng man refraine ope outward wicked liuing looke chronicle bloude hath cofle england attempt bring vnder law yea see busines ye realme hath keepe prelate within realme taking benefice lying rome yet scarsely brought passe pope hath stint euery byshoppricke euery great abbey therto oft voyde yer new admitted roome see bond vnto owne consent vnto al god hath forbidde see people vain glorious see walke iohn fleshly birth see farre fro image christ onely dye flocke ensample also yer would lose one towne vilage polling priuilege haue falsly gotten bryngyng selues good pasture wile shuttyng theyr papistes lose nothing belongeth flocke without would cast away hundred thousand one day begger realmes yea interdite bring straunge nation though turke co quere slea vp much innocent cradle see doctrine va tage onely therewith haue gotten haue finde scripture ye iewes comyng christ knew bookes confirmeth sayth holy ghost inspiration doe endeuour captiuate mine vnderstandyng teacheth beleue church concernyng god worde taught churche grauen men harte scripture well teacheth v beleue wordes except well knowen chast honest godly behauiour honour god word withall pope hath nothing vile whe mock bringeth forth text wydowe must wife one man answere iesting paule excludeth x husband one ij husbandes attonce laugheth though neuer sco fer bene guise would god mercy guise day sure hys wrath would great paule meaneth onely would haue diffamed woman chosen wydowe dishonouring worde god would paule let none minister feare occasion vnchastity therto none well knowen honest liuing good report much widow ten husband must foude common cost neede vncleanes reason secod husband good inough brother sister haue second husband shame among heathen shame amog christen husband dead wife free mary lord good reason husband right free priest therfore shame doctrine cogregation dishonour god amog heathen weake christen whe haue playne rule whiche rom loueth neighbour selfe kepeth lawes god let hym tell cause loue toward hys neighbour widow two lawfull husband may seruice vnto poore people may widow fifty seruice vnto poore paule whiche knytteth snare leadeth v blind teacheth v without reason geuing doctrine aunswereth feare occasion euill lest tempted tempt taken misdoyng doctrine christ euill spoken therto weake offended mocketh reason would haue euerye priest haue wife men ca liue chaste aunswere loued honor christ neighbour doth owne couetousnesse finde good argument paul maketh much sclenderly sophistrie hee disputeth thus youg widowes young widowes forbidde minister commo seruice dishonest ye congregation christ doctrine therfore shall young widow minister common seruice therof shal maried beare child serue husbades farre lesse rebuke doctrine christ cogregation woma amisse bishop priest mad thinke yt could priest line chaste neither foolish thinke many wome could liue chast fifty priestes xxiiij yet though thousand widowes fifty yeare old ix hundred xc ix could liue chast paul knoweth one wil let none minister common seruice amog occasion vnchastitie christes apostle considered infirmity might hynder doctrine christ therfore dyd best preuet occasios wherfore fishe better fleshe fleshe better fishe kingdame christ fish better flesh flesh better fish kyngdome christ euen virginitie wedlocke widowed none better saued nature please god soeuer may best serue brother euer best accordyng vnto tyme fashion world persecution good euery man liue chast namely preacher peace man may liue quietly abyde one place wise sure thyng cut occasios would make seme priestes wiues occasion heresy tyndall almany nay fell first heresy tooke wiues ye sell first pope holy doctrine tooke whore church byndeth man tyndall chastitie tyndall truth geueth licence soeuer wil kepe whore permitteth abuse men wiues suffereth sodomitrie doth onely forbid matrimonie sayth chastitie receaued generall custome three lye ce lawe made one lye good father dyd geue theyr aduise therto lye ratified receaued cosent christendome third lye well chose poete defender first attempted generall coucell resisted holy father yet theselues neuer maried saying men might knit ate weake brethre agaynst doctrine christ hys apostle neither could bee brought passe vntill pope got emperours sword hys grekes one halfe christendome suppose would neuer admit godly loue would neuer suffer cosent boud vnto burthen themselues could beare place affirmeth dyd agayne haue manifest storyes brought violence ot sword priestes germany copelled put away wiues finde whersoeuer pope raigneth came deceauyng kyng countrey sword co elled rest pope came late wale raigne ouer byshops priestes sword kyng england yet though clergie christendome graunted church made yet tenth part church lay people well churche priestes neither priestes world right make law wherin part lyeth without consent perteineth vnto comon people vnto priestes must endued wyth vertue honesty weakest priestes endued vertue honestie chastitie wife daughter seruaunt perteineth vnto euery particular man see experience defiled dayly vnchast chastitie spiritualitie wherfore parish one parish sene experience incoueniences came chastitie would haue curate except wife cut occasion paule sene proofe would haue young widowes minister saue tyraunt agaynst moreouer generall councels spiritualtie maner generall counsell sence pope god generall parlamentes temporalitie man dare say hys mynde frely liberally eare one flatterer looke captiuitie parlamentes vnder priuate cou sels parl ment kinges generall cou cels vnder pope cardinal maner one two three wilye fox haue subiection ye vsed generall e also parliamentes haue sene lord cardinall imagine ought lust haue conceaue theyr braynes go child tyme yeare ij iij iiij v vi vij tyme xx aboue castyng esing compassing byrth agaynst oportunitie openyng matter priuely vnder othe litle litle vnto certaine secretary whose part therin finde men actiuitie courage prepared sell soule body promotion matter meane tyme turmoyled tossed among themselues persuasion sutle reason forged blind right way beguile men wittes feare haue aduersaries able resist meanes sought bring vnto partie conuey way whe oportunitie come call counsel parlamet vnder contrary pretece masse holy ghost desire farre away possible song goodly sermon made blere men eye sodenly vnprouided matter opened suttle maner many beguiled suttle argumentes craftie persuasion hold hard agaynst practise vsed counsayles parlamentes called aside reasoned part handled fashion partly entised fayre promise partly feared cruell threatnyngs ouercome siluer syllogismes feare threatnyng driuen vnto silence found last obey falsehead tyranny rayle iest coutenaunce call opinatiue selfe mynded obstinate beare hand deuill cleaueth vnto owne witte though speake silllable god word asked whether wilbe wiser spiritualitie excommunicate make hereticke spiritualtie make heretickes resist theyr power true clergy chastitie cleare ye day manifest chronicle much prelate rome brewyng aboue hundred yeares wot long lenger yer could bryng passe yet vayne til got emperours sword proue expedient entent priestes may haue wyues bryng vnder pope prelate landes might old maner come wayte pope rome prepared whore inough sworne prelate euery land might conueniently wayte kyngs courtes minister commo wealth vnto pope pleasure profite clergie kept wiues could neuer haue come vnto plurality vnios totquottes lay man though neuer euill disposed could wife child haue leysure cotr e mischiefe runne countrey countrey learne falshead subtiltie spiritualtie without feare chastitie ergy pert neth tempo ie much spiritualtie god shame man keepe whore whersoeuer come thus ye see clergy chastitie pertayneth much vnto temporaltie vnto spiritualtie power among professe truth may bynde god lowseth saue onely loue neighbour necessitie requireth neyther power binde come may freely keepe breake thing hurtfull expediet neither bond loue necessitie requireth contrary law loue thy neighbour helpe thou wouldest holp must interpret man lawes sworne young vnwisely would liue chast world bound afterwarde burnt could ouercome passion ought mary must condition vow vowes shew cause thereto may vow chastitie selfe though sacrifice please god self idolatry heathen must therfore vowe neyghbour seruice case may require geue selfe quietly prayer studie possible long burne minde quiet may better keepe ye lawes god burne stand thorow chastitie ieopardy breake oth kept agaynst charitie necessitie hurt neighbour shame yt doctrine christ like maner forsworne flesh al world bound yet necessitie require saue life health ought breake againe though sworne chastitie comon wealth necessitie required contrary must breake one side euer burnt pope chastitie neuer gaue priest licence take wife keepe whore onely side vow vow thing selfe though sayd seruice sacrifice god delite deede young child haue apple deede shall haue higher roome heaue neighbour idolatry heathen whe ought bestow vow vppon hys neighbour bryng heauen enuie seeke thereby higher roome caring whether neighbour come thether finally burne vse naturall remedy god hath made tempt god thinges god haue brought thee straite haue therto take naturall remedy thee resiste crie vnto god helpe suffer signe yt thou louest god lawes loue god law sure thou art god childe elect mercy child onely writeth token sayth euery man hath onely eateth drinketh vppe alone geueth man parte wyth hym item man howseled till lay dying tynd shamelesse lye tyndall item men woman touch tyndall spare touch tynd perillous case pope hath oyled neuerthelesse christ hath annointed wyth hys spirite wyth hys bloud wot ye pope thinketh busie handeling woulde beleue bread cause strength faythes hath imagined little prety thinne manchetes shine thorow seeme lyke made paper fine parchement wheate floure smale question oxforde late dayes whether bread none affirming floure long lying water turned starch lost nature item sacramet worship worshipped tyndall sacrament tyndall christes body bloud christ calleth newe euerlasting testament hys bloud commaunded shoulde remembraunce hym hys bodye broken bloude shed sinnes paule commaundeth signified therby onely worshippyng sacrament ye geue worship ye plainly dishonour may beleue christes church beleue christes church doctrine preach christ true ye haue doctrine teach v reason lead v light follow item christe bound keepe lawe made man tynd say vntruely christe man bound obey tyranny tyndall agaynst hys fayth lawe god vntill god deliuer thereof christen man byndeth hym thing saue loue neighbour necessitie requireth lawe made longer profitable christen ruler ought breake dayes whe tyraunts haue gotten simple people vnder compell serue theyr lustes wyly tyranny without respect common wealth wyly tyranny truth rebuketh cause persecute least common people seing good feeling wicked shuld withdraw neckes fro vnrighteous yooke ye haue ensample herode scribe phariseis many item purgatory purgatory tyndall beleue christ thou tyndall shalt shortly finde purgatoryes inow ye make feele item soules lye sleepe soules sleepe tyndall till dome day tyndall ye putting heauen hell purgatory destroy ye argumentes wherwith christ paul proue resurrection god doth shall know come true faith soules departed rest god pleasure putteth resurrection warned looke euery houre heathen philosopher denying put soules euer lyue pope ioyneth spirituall doctrine christ fleshly doctrine philosopher together thing contrary agree spirite fleshe christen man fleshly mynded pope consenteth vnto heathen doctrine therefore corrupteth scripture stablish moses sayth deut secrete thinges pertaine deut vnto lord thynges opened pertaine vnto v written booke wherfore sir loued lawes god would iames aunswered mammon augustine answereth hym iames expoundeth himselfe saith first chapter god begatte v owne wyth worde truth worde truth promise mercy forgeuenesse sauiour iesus begat v gaue v life made v new creature thorow fast faith iames goeth rebuketh opinion iames eproueth sel te true liuely sayth false fayth thinke inough saued beleue one god christ borne virgine thousand thing man may beleue yet beleue christ saued sinne thorow iames speaketh another faith beginning appeareth ensample deuils haue faith saith yea deuilles haue faith repent euil beleue christ saued thorow ca loue god worke wil loue paule speaketh fayth christes bloude saued thereby worketh immediatly thorough loue benefite receaued iames beginning speaketh fayth bydeth trying saying trying faith worketh ca seth pacience faith deuilles bide trying woorke god loue like maner fayth woorke oportunitie serueth ca iustifie fayth repent thinke themselues without sinne except feele daunger christ hath deliuered hym loue worke therfore iames sayth right fayth woorke iustifie man paule saith faith onely iustifieth iames man iustified woorkes fayth onely great differece betwene paules onely iames onely paules onely vnderstand faith iustifieth harte god without helpe workes yea yer worke must receaue life thorow faith worke wi h yer worke iames onely thys wise vnderstand faith doth iustifie nothyng iustifieth workes iustifie saue fayth deedes iustifie also faith iustifieth hart god deedes worlde onely maketh seene ye may see scripture paul sayth rom iiij abraha rom haue woorkes hath whereof reioyce god abraha receaued promise deseruing ben abrahas prayse god thou mayst see text neither god shewed abraha mercy grace onely geuen hym dutie deseruyng abraham receaued mercy shewed hym frely fayth deseruynges seed promised thou mayst see genesis gospell iohn iohn christ testifieth abraham saw day reioyced ioy doubt wrought god prayse glory mercy mayst thou see iames sayth abraham offered sonne scripture fulfilled abraham beleued rekened righteousnesse thereby made god frend fulfilled god nay fulfilled god many yeares god frend many yeares euen first appointement made betwene god hym abraham receaued abraha beleued god promise therefore iustified promise mercy beleued trusted god went wrought fayth fulfilled v see hart iames saith wil shew thee faith workes aungell said abraha know thou dreadest god knew v spake whiche see nought abraham men saue workes workes ment iames verely workes mercy brother sister lacke rayment sustenaunce ye moued compassion feele disease fayth haue ye fayth sure hee seeth hys neighbour necessitie hath compassion hath fayth feeleth mercy christ feele mercyfull agayne thankefull looke workes spiritualitie onely iustified workes worlde also god haue christedome rule viij hundred yeares onely annointed head haue onely bene kyng emperour haue power hand haue bene doer onely leders shadowes haue name prince haue led whether would haue brethed braynes lysted haue wrought world peace vnitie euery man wellfare become alone well ease onely free onely libertie onely haue thyng onely nought therefore onely laye me backes beare nought selues good woorkes wrought fayth gaue theyr good landes finde poore deuoure also alone workes preach onely papistes preach workes profitable selues profitable wherbey raigne men cosciences god offer geue prayed deliuered purgatory redeme sinne worshyp ceremony shryuen forth come selfe sayth first fayth first iustifying geuen v without deseruyng god thanked would fayne would describe meaneth second iustifying know whe haue receaued mercy forgeuenesse christ frely go powre vpon neighbour dauid lost fayth hee dauid tyndall committed adultery tyndall therfore could continue sinnne repeted assoone fault told reconciled fayth onely dedes sayd haue mercy lord thy great mercy multitude thy mercy put away psal sinne agayne make heare ioy gladnesse bone whiche thou hast broken may reioyce let heare thy voyce sinne forgeuen safe reioyce afterward knowledgeth god deliteth sacrifice haue offended god must returne qui kly repentaunce call vpon god heare v christ sauiours sake sinnes troubled spirite broken hart whiche god requireth peace made prayeth boldly familiarly god would good sion ierusalem saith last god hath forgeuen v mercy hath done v good euill shall offer sacrifice thankes hym agayne dedes thankesgeuyng haue sinned go repentyng hart vnto christes bloud wash thorough fayth dedes thankes geuyng god helpe neighbour nede neighbour eche owe v much agayne nede testament forgeuenesse sinnes built vppon fayth christes bloud workes wil runne pope forgeuenesse poenae culpae merites doth pope christes poena culpa christ hath promised merites repent beleue geuen vnto pope sell absolutios ye oft absolue without ioynyng penauce must haue purpose good woorkes ye say codition set haue receaued god mercy must shewe mercy neyghbours ye mercy hee hath receaued receaue mercy popish repet hart therfore ca fele mercy fayth bryngeth therfore mercyfull neighbour doe woorkes sake faine sorow sinne euer continue morne mornyng laugh yer midday agayne imagine popish deedes make satisfaction god make idole finally good workes workes selues iustifie geue almes like iustifie selues manifest good taught god well loue god christ neighbour christes sake euen euill vayne glorie false fayth wickedly haue exaples phariseis man must good yer good purpose one purpose good others euill must good yer good purpose come loue law god consent therto haue written thyne hart professe thou art ready thyne accorde without compulsion righteous graunt loue may called righteousnesse god passiue lyfe quickenesse soule passiue loueth hys neighbour christ sake righteousand farre forth man loueth law god farre forth righteous much hee lacketh loue toward hys neighbour example christ much lacketh righteousnesse thyng maketh man loue law god doth make man righteous iustifieth effectiuely actually maketh hym alyue woorkeman cause efficient maketh man loue verely dedes folow spryng loue good neither preachyng law quickeneth hart gal iij causeth wrath rom iiij vttereth sinne onely rom iij therfore sayth paule righteousnes spryngeth deedes law hart iewes pope meane contrary deedes law spryng righteousnesse hart good father pronounceth law child shall go schole sayth nay killeth hart lustes hath power loue maketh hart aliue loue verely fayre promise loue kyndnesse shall haue gentle scholemaster shal play inough shall haue many gaye thynges forth workes procede loue nothyngeuen preachyng fayth doth worke loue soules make alyue draw harte god mercy haue christ doth make v loue onely onely bringeth spirite life soules therfore sayth paule iustified fayth grace without dedes yer dedes come fayth onely bringeth spirite lyfe deliuereth soules feare danation law euer maketh peace betwen god v oft variaunce betwene v finally whe peace made betwene god v forgeuen fayth christes bloud fayth christ maketh small workes acceptable begyn loue law neuer nearer except fayth went v supply lacke full loue haue promise litle haue take woorth accepted till come agayne frailtie hath ouerthrowen v feare damnation inuaded conscieces vtterly lost fayth bye helpe v vp agayne promised soeuer repent euill come right way agayne shalbe forgeuen christes sake whe fallen testament made workes come shal saue v therfore workes repentauce sacrametes neuer quiet cosciences deliuer v feare damnation last temptation tribulation aduersities perished dayly except fayth went v deliuer v haue promise god assiste v cloth v fede v fight v rid v handes enemyes thus righteous righteous lyueth aith liueth euer fayth euen fayth fayth soone deliuered one temptation set fight ouercome thorow fayth scripture sayth blessed man whose transgression forgeuen sinnes hid vnto lord reckoneth vnrighteousnes onely righteousnes ca sinne hath nought himselfe make amendes forgeuenesse sinne saith onely bringeth farforth vn ghteous faith christes bloud doth onely iustifie v faith onely iustifieth v actiuely el nothing partie farforth haue sinned sinne sinne shal sinne farforth must faith christes bloud iustifie v onely el nothing loue righteous farforth thou louest make righteous make peace beleue christes bloud repeting hart make righteous onely makyng peace satisfaction godwarde thus termes darcke expert exercised alway set meaning wyth cleare ensamples reporting selues vnto harte conscience men blasphemous wordes luther seme signifie iohn baptiste lady sinner tyndall iohn baptiste sayde christ mat neede baptised tyndall thee commest thou wherof iohn confesse nede washed purged christ holynes good deedes iohn saide beholde ye lambe god taketh away truely proue fleshe sinner send christ paul doth beginning ye romanes lawe coulde vnderstand spirituall requireth v woulde dispute imperfectnesse lady deedes dyd christ rebuke iohn ought rather haue vnperfectly passe potter hath craft neuer wel meteth chaunce maketh fashion pot misse thinke perfectest haue ensamples compelled say paul good would euill would would sweare booke lady bene let slip hard apposed present death eye would haue denyed somethinges knew true ye preserued grace though kept grace ye outwarde deede yet wickednes fleshe sinne grace knew meeke beleue christ haue forgeuen preserued bud forth iohn euangelist holy euer iohn baptist sayd iohn say haue sinne deceaue selues compareth fayth deedes together fayth shoulde workes vnder law stand better seruice right deedes yes deedes examined lawe therfore inough onely loue must wyth great loue christ fayth vnder law receaue good deede nede faith vnder lawe therfore neuer feeble shall receaue according truth promiser thing coulde aske god right beleue tyndall verely promiseth tyndall may bolde aske right dutie good obligation ferman sayd workes good inough god hath chose tyndall sure vntrue tyndall best good inough though god forgeueth euill hys mercy ye repentaunce hart endeth schole doctrine contrary vnto scripture god remitteth sinne hys chosen people hath chosen mercy towardnes blinde ond reasoning one saying god saw peter repent iudas woulde dispaire therefore chose peter god chose peter repent chose iudas repented much knowledged sinne brought money agayne blindnesse god wrought nothing iudas feare death goodnesse god wrought repentaunce meanes brought vp againe christes requeste iudas neuer good came christ loue doctrine couetousnesse euer beleue christ iudas nature birth iudas heyre wrath god whome deuill wrought blinded hart ignoraunce ignorannce blindnes grew grew age fell deeper deeper therein thereby iudas perished desperatio wrought wickednesse deuilles perished therin fro ignoraunce god purged peter mercy gaue light spirite gouerne towardnesse peter hys owne byrth mercy haue birth christes death proue god chuseth goodnes towardnes good towardnes haue endeuour altogether blinde caryed away deuill till deuill cast robbed towardnes adam made child wrath god adam nature made child sinne sinne naturally sinne nature though would well flesh yet sinneth naturally neither ceaseth sinne farforth kept vnder violence euen harte sinned naturally full lust consent vnto fleshe deuill possessing harte keeping light grace good towardnesse endeuour haue hate sinne long loue good towardnes haue vnto god hate ignoraunt therof desire witte seeth long sigh witte knoweth take thought losse wotteth good endeuour turkes child iewes child pope infantes haue taught falshead submitte rebellion reason vnto obediece faith credence worde god wherof ye see besides graunt reason rebelleth agaynst fayth co trary doctrine first booke shall compell witte beleue whiche much say carte must draw horse sonne beget father authoritie church greater god word wil teach wit lead foloweth naturally soeuer witte iudgeth good euill loueth hateth witte see leade straight foloweth witte blynde leade amisse foloweth cleane yt way witte leadeth loue god worde beleue hate iudge false vanitie might haue wiselier spoken maner wherfore serueth preachyng fayth wit haue power draw loue whiche wit iudgeth true good nought teach wit better shall alter turne good immediatly blindnesse cause ali euil light cause good fayth right hart consent vnto euill folow lustes flesh pope fayth doth conclusion hath halfe dose tymes boke more wittes captiuated may compell witte captiuate beleue lusteth verely like wittes captiuitie vauntage tangled holy father sophistrie doctrine owne feelyng profession hart popish haue yelded selues folow lustes flesh compel witte absteine fro looking ye truth lest vnquiet draw podell filthy voluptuousnesse prety example carte ouerladen goyng vp hill draweth horse backe tough mire maketh stand still carter deuill whiche driueth euer whistelleth vnto biddeth captiuate vnderstadyng vnto profitable doctrine shal haue persecution shal reigne kynges math xviij whe disciple asked shoulde greatest math kingdome heauen christ called young child vnto hym set middes among saying excepte ye turne backe become childre ye shall enter kingdome heauen younge child beare rule one ouer al felowship amonge sayde moreouer whosoeuer humbleth himselfe ensample childe greatest kingdome heauen concerning ambition worldly desire childishe thou couldest heaue thy selfe aboue thy brother bearing rule great christes kingdome describe ashion greatnesse kingdome sayd receaueth one childe name receaueth yt receaue childe christes name verely submitte meeke receiue child christes name humble thy selfe cast thy selfe vnder men consider men infirmity weakenesses helpe heale disease wyth worde truth liue purely see contrary ensample thee whatsoeuer thou teachest christ thou put stumblinge blocke make falle yet youg weake fayth thou absteine paule teacheth thes ab omni specie thes mala might seeme euill wherof man might surmise iste thou loue whatsoeuer gi god thee thou thinke foode sake geuen vnto thee truth infirmity thine thou fe e thine hart mourne al thy power thou helpe amende cease crye god neither day night thou let nothing founde thee man may rebuke whatsoeuer thou teachest e thou thou wolfe pope wolfe lambes skinne lambes skinne holy ather ye pope commeth vnto v name hypocrisie e curssed cham ham calling hymselfe seruus seruorum seruaunt seruauntes yet founde tyrannus tyra norum tyrauntes ye cruell receaue young child christes name receaue young child christes name beare rule kingdome christ thus ye see christes kingdome together spirituall bearing rule cleane cotrary vnto bearing rule temporally wherfore none beareth rule may haue temporall iurisdiction minister temporall office requireth violence compell withall p peter greater apostle authoritie geuen christ saye peter peter called chief apostle chiefe apostle verely appe called chief painter excellent cunninge aboue euen peter may called chiefe apostle actiuitie boldnes aboue peter auctoritie peter authoritie aboue rest apostle rule ouer brother felow apostle false contrary ye scripture christ forbad last euen passion diuers tune taught alway contrary haue rehearsed thou wilt say thou caust see good order kyngdome none better superior lawe authoritie compell inferior violece worlde truely see way rule violence man absteineth euil feare loue righteousnes written harte therefore opes kyngdome world pope kingdome world one sorte grace holines fatherhode lord byshop lord abbot lord pryor master able pope g e e badge doctour father bachelar mayster parson maister vicar last commeth simple syr iohn euery man raigneth ouer wyth might haue euery ruler prison iayler chaynes tormentes euen much fryer ob eruauntes obserue rule compell euery man violece aboue cruelnesse heathen tyrauntes commeth may neuer feare telling ta e schole rule ouer bodye violence compell whether harte obserue thinges owne making kingdome god contrary spirite bringeth thether maketh wil ing geueth lust vnto law minister kyngdome god must gouerne loue mekenes pacience god loue copelleth worke loue maketh euerty ma good comune vnto neighbour nede euery strog kyngdome loue compelleth take weake hand helpe hym take go vppon shoulder beare seruice vnto weaker beare rule kingdome peter excede peter vse speakyng diligece called scripture chief apostle apostle feruet seruice toward brother therefore e called scripture vse speakyng chiefest apostle dominion ouer truth thou mayst see also practise actes apostle resurrection peter bene preached sonnes sayde fought one another destroyed strength empyre fraunce tyme pope haue bene onely bloud shede aboue vij c peates aboue vij hundred yeares thou shalt reade pope haue led liues bloudshedding much thou consider story well thou shalt easely perceaue hath bene flayne cause farre aboue xl hudred thousand men besides hath bene prince christedome hath bene busied combred great part life matter landes variaunce betwene theselues dane came england vexed englishman dwelt spite harte euen came straunge nacions whose name scarce heard quarter vandales hunnes vandales hunnes gothes gothes ran thorowout christendome c thousand together subdued landes dwelt therin gre inhabitours thou mayst see douchland diuers nacions inclosed ye middes lande straunge tongue douchmen vnderstande rule continued well viij ix score two hundred yeares spiritualtie obe ed gat victory wicked soeuer ceason whosoeuer wan maystrye hym spiritualtie receaued crowned kyng claue whatsoeuer tyraunt robbed hys life part thereof must deale among hys death feare purgatory spiritualtie ceason preached pope mightely building abbeyes built abbayes recreation quyetnes shrining alway saintes shrining saintes purchased priuileges fought liberty disputed pope power howsoeuer liued l yeare whe liues forgotten resisted whatsoeuer mischief went hym noted chronicle cruell tyraunt ye whatsoeuer misfortune get fayned myracles gaue theselues vnto poetry shut vp scripture tyme christ speaketh math xxiiij false prophetes arise shew myracles wonder deceaue electe bene possible finally thys busie worlde kynges lumbardy gatte little might came vp agayne diuers tymes emperours though great might one beringarius kyng lumbardy began meddle beringarius holy father busines wherfore ye poge fled vnto ottho kyng ye saxon tyme gotten might brought italy beringarium ottho ottho ouercame beringarium made emperour labour thus came empyre first vnto douchlande ottho receaued empyre one pope iohn say thys pope iohn xij othe ottho promise sweare vnto lord iohn father oth emperour made pope sonne holy ghost wod crosse maketh liuing reliques saintes come rome god helpe exalte holy church rome gouernour vnto power neyther shalt thou lose lyfe member honour thou hast counsell consent setting worke moreouer wyll make rome constitution ordinaunce thing pertayneth vnto thee vnto romaine thy counsell euer dissimulation pope callyng possession peter possession landes saint peter commeth vnto hand deliuer thee vnto whosoeuer shall commit rule italy make hym sweare shall helpe thee defende landes saint peter vnto power gregory fift got last long gaped pope gregory fi made ordinaunce chusing ye emperour stablishe withall vi lordes almany iij election emperour apperteyneth lordes germany spiritualtie iij temporaltie kyng bohem vij odde man vmpere huse euer sende hym pope receaue othe crowned neuerthelesse pope keepe emperour far sendeth hym hys coronation home ofttymes much leuer come nearer meeke spryted man leuer liue solitarie alone haue holinesse seene p proper similitude describe holy father se holy father came vp marke example iuytree first springeth earth iuytree springeth crepeth along yt groud till finde great tree ioyneth selfe neath alow vnto body tree creepeth vp litle litle fayre softly begynnyng yet thynne small maner pope spring vp hys great auctoritie burthen perceaued semeth glorious garnishe tree wyntre beare tempestes weather meane season thrusteth rootes yt barck tree hold fast ceasseth clyme vp till top aboue sendeth hys braunches long braunches tree ouergroweth waxeth great heauy thicke sucketh moysture sore tree braunches choketh stif eth foule stinckyng iuye waxeth mighty stope tree becommeth sete nest vncleane byrdes blind oules whiche hauke darke dare come light euen byshop rome called pope begynnyng crope long vppon earth euery man trode vpon world assoone came christen emperour ioyned selfe vnto hys feete kissed crope vp litle beggyng nowe priuilege citie finde poore people necessary minister god word chusing pope bishoppes perteyned vnto emperour kinges hee entitled emperour chosing pope bishop promoted spiritualty vertue learning fauour great men comended flater get frendes defender almes congregation fode patrimony almes geuen vnto poore become peter patrimony poore necessary preacher called peter patrimony peter reutes peter landes peter right cast vayne feare heathenish superstitiousnesse harte man dare meddle soeuer came handes feare saint peter though ministred neuer euil thinke none almes geue much already yet geue peter somewhat nabucodonesser gaue god beel purchasse aduocate dani xiiij intercessor peter peter first knocke let thus flateryng fayning vayne superstition vnder name peter crept vp fastened pope first gat aboue bishop aboue emperour rootes hart emperour sword clame vp aboue felow byshops brought vnder feete subdued emperours sword euen sutiltie helpe sworne saythfull clame aboue emperour subdued hym also made oupe vnto feete kisse yea pope coelestinus crowned emperour henry fift holdyng ye crown lucifer betwene feete put crowne smote note deuilish nable pride feete agayne saying might make emperours put downe agayne made constitution e e pope lay man medle matter councels witte pope onely call councell emperour defed pope prouided allway councel one pope townes pope power greater emperours vnder pretence pope createth shauelyngs dignity condemnyng heresie hee called generall councell made one patriarcke cardinall legate primate archbyshop bishop another deane another arch deacon forth see pope played qualis pater talis filius good naturall child emperour dyd braunches member byshops play euery kyngdome dukedome lordshyp much heyres came vp hold landes take chief lordes emperour sworne pope euen euery kyng sworne byshops prelate realme chiefest parlamentes yea theyr money sworne come vp rule together thus pope father pope order compared christes hypocrite hath falsehode guile peruerted order worlde turned rootes tree vpward hath put downe kyngdome christ set vp kyngdome deuil whose vicare hath put downe minister christ hath set vp minister sathan disguised yet name garmentes lyke vnto aungels light minister righteousnes christes kyngdome world iohn xviij pope kyngdome world christ neither iudge diuider world luke xij christ pope compared together pope iudgeth deuideth world taketh empyre kyngdomes geueth lusteth christ sayth math v blessed poore spirite first step kyngdome christ humblenesse humilitie thou canst finde thyne hart seruice vnto suffer men treade thee pope sayth blessed proude hygh mynded clyme subdue vnder mayntaine right suffer man yesterday taken dongehill promoted day prince shall tomorow pope pleasure curse excommunicate interdite realme christ sayth blessed meke soft harmlesse doues pope blesseth set world together eares fight ea mafully sake may come haote bloudsheddyng byshopricke cardinall dyd thomas canterbury made byshop field complete harnesse horse backe speare bloudy hand christ hath neither hole fox nestes byrdes yet whereon lay head promised ought world vnto disciple toke disciple hym forsaken iuytree pope hath vnder rootes thoroughout christendome euery village hole fox nestes vncleane byrdes braunches promiseth vnto disciple promotion world christ bringeth man lowe pope lifteth vp hygh nearer vnto christ man commeth lower must descende poorer must waxe nearer vnto pope ye come hygher ye must clyme rich ye must gather whence soeuer ye get paye bulles purchase glorions name licence weare mitre crosse palle goodly ornamentes pope receaueth hys kyngdome deuill distributeth agayne shortly kyngdomes earth pope receaueth rich kyngdomes deuill glory christ refused math iiij dyd deuill waytyng great men pleasure corruptyng god word fashioning lustes pope receaued pope distributeth father kyng dome kyngdome world deuill become deuilles vicare tooke vp lyke maner christendome hygh first emperour thou wilt fall downe kysse feete sweare hold defend geue thee empyre kynges lyke maner sweare defende liberty hold crowneth eue temporall lordes highest vnto lowest officer maner subiectes enioy landes rente office goodes lyues must way whore god honour vnregarded log despise ordinaunces shall neste hys rente among hys prelate theeues murtherers shall haue dennes sanctuary stues studie sworne pope priestes sendeth vnto great men house preach godhed stuardes surueyers receauers counsellers maner mischiefe corrupt wife daughter mayde betray owne master oft needeth promote see helpe commeth yt vitayles spent wherfore remedy fight though vnequallie matched winne shall finde meat enough lose shall lose must lose hunger though fight concluded set vpon frenchman night king fraunce lordes supposing mone wold sooner haue fallen skie emperours hoste durst haue fought somwhat negligent emperour setteth vpon french king night went night mumming burbon set vpon emperours host many vnto secod brother shoulde haue bene prince england king time come sought wayes pluck v emperor ioine v vnto fraunce make fraunce strong enough match emperour keepe downe pope might raigne god lord iesus shield fierce wrath god vpon v pride arrogancie cardinall wolsey misshapen monster shoulde spring dunghill height dread god man layd part malepart onely defye vtterly maiestie mighty emperour whose authoritie christ apostle obeyed taught obey threatening damnation would also set little whole realme england hath bestowed great cost shed much bloud exalt maintaine proud churlish vnthankfull hypocrite care destroy vtterly satisfying vilanous lustes p putting downe cardinall wolsey concerning cardinal putting cardinall wolsey great traytor downe consider many thinges first neuer heard read man great traytor easely put death naturall disposition inclination man yt chief study yea felicitie inward ioy hath euer bene exercise aungels wit lord lincolne wone praise driuing dristes beguile men binde whole world wherefore none otherwise indge c token euident vnto whomsoeuer hath natural wit also nothing saue cast olde practise god wrapped owne wile wist way emperour preuailed al cardinal treason french child might come home learned also necromancie would iopardous yeare treason cardinall wolsey co mitted treason agaynst emperour wrought emperour yt mony borowed common least rising thought vndoe desteny policy went put downe himselfe vnder colour processe tragedy well declareth set vp roome minister forth fight god begun chiefest secretary one nothing inferiour vnto master lying faining bearing two face one hode whelpe goeth kinde syre chiefest stale wherewith cardinall caught kinges grace whome called vnto confirmation al entended persuade saying like grace learned man knoweth also lay man wherefore cardinall wolsey preferred chauncelour say otherwise parcialitie vswarde secretary yet must first deserue wyth writing martin agaynst obedience withall made reformation mortuary probate mortunries probate testamentes testamentes root yet left behind whence haue time weeded spring againe litle litle hope may stop light god worde abroad made whiche tydinges many beleue laude prayse thanke god glad syng daunce ioy euangelion gospell euangelio called newe testamet say ioyfull tydinges called new testament whe shall dye appointeth good dealt distributed death among whiche nameth bee heyres euen christ hys death commauded appointed euangelion gospell tydynges declared throughout world therewith geue vnto repent beleue goodes say lyfe wherewith hee swalowed deuoured vp death hys righteousnes wherewith banished sinne saluatio wherwith ouercame eternall damnation ca greater comfort happen sinner penitent promise gospell wretched man hatred betwen thee woman betwen thy seede sede selfe sede shall treade thy head vnder foote christ christ hath ouer throwen ye deuill hys power womas seede hath troden vnder foote deuils head say sinne death hell power without seede man anoyde sinne death hell euerlasting damnation agayne gene xxij god promised abraham saying thy seede shall generation earth blessed christ seede abraham sayth paule gala iij hath blessed world gospell christ remaineth curse fell adam soone sinned bo dage vnder damnation sinne death hell curse blesseth gospell world asmuch cryeth opely vnto knowledge sinnes repet saying soeuer beleueth sede abraham shalbe blessed shal deliuered sinne death hell shall hence forth continue righteous saued euer christ hym selfe sayth xj iohn beleueth shall neuer dye law requireth perfect loue low bottome grounde hart well thinges whiche suffer thinges sayth iohn place grace veritie geue v christ law hath passed vpo law hath condemned v christ graunteth v free pardon vengeaunce law new testament oft made mention law codemne beleue promise moreouer law gospell may neuer separate gospel promise serue troubled conscience brought desperation feele paynes hell death vnder law captiuitie bondage vnder law dedes must haue law condemne myne vnperfectnes neuer perfect yet damnable sinne compared law whiche requireth ground bottome myne hart must therefore haue alwayes law sight may meke law must euer sight make v humble spirited gospel also yes comfort v spirite giue god laude prayse ascribyng righteousnes selfe al vnrighteousnes sinne must also haue promise myne eye dispayre promise see mercy fauour good god vpon bloud hys sonne christ hath made satisfaction myne vnperfectnes fulfilled could may ye perceaue two maner people sore deceaued first two maner people deceaued iustifie theselues thse workes blinde opinion faith vtterly per ert liuely fayth whiche iustifie selues outward dedes abstayne outwardly fro law forbiddeth outwardly law commaundeth compare selues open sinner respect iustifie selues condemning open sinner set vayle moyses face see law requireth loue bottome hart loue onely fulfilling law dyd would condemne neighbour loue hydeth multitude sinnes sayth peter first epistle loue deepe bottome grounde myne hart condemne neither recken sinnes suffer weakenes infirmitie mother weakenes sonne vntill grow vp perfect man also deceaued feare god geue selues vnto maner vice ful consent full delectation hauyng respect law god vnder whose vengeaunce locked vp captiuitic say god mercyfull christ dyed v supposing dreaming imaginatio fayth greatly comended holy scripture nay faith rather folish blind opinion springing owne corrupt nature geue spirite god rather spirite deuill whose fayth dayes popish compare make equall vnto best trust confidence belefe repenting soule haue bloud sauiour iesus vnto owne confusion shame vtteryng true faith sayth apostle paule gift god geue sinner law hath passed vppon hath brought conscience vnto brim desperation sorowes hell haue right faith conset law righteous good iustifie god made hath right fayth deliteth law althogh weaknes fulfill law haue delectation law notwithstanding ca fulfill would weakenes abhorre soeuer law forbiddeth though wayes auoyde great sorrow fulfill god law spirite cryeth god night day strength helpe teares sayth paul expressed toung thinges belefe popish father magnifie strong faith hath none experience first say whiche iustifieth selfe outward iustifieth selfe reiecteth yt law priuises deedes consenteth law inward neither hath delectation therin ye would rather law iustifieth god hateth tyraunt neither careth promise owne strength sauiour selfe wise glorifieth god though seme outward second say sensuall person voluptuous swyne voluptuous person neither feareth god law neither thankefull promise mercy set foorth christ beleue right christen man consenteth law righteous iustifieth true christian god law affirmeth god righteous iust author law beleueth promise god iustifieth god iudgyng true beleuyng fulfill promise law condemneth selfe dedes geueth prayse god beleueth promise ascribeth truth god thus euery iustifieth god prayseth god nature fall adam child wrath heyres vengeaunce god byrth yea conceptio haue felowship damned deuils vnder power darkenes rule sathan yet mother wombes though shewe forth frutes sinne soone borne yet full naturall poyson whereof sinnefull deedes spryng sinne outwardes neuer young soone able woorke occasion geuen nature sinne nature serpent stynge serpent yet young yet vnbrought forth full poyson proper similitude afterward tyme come occasion geuen bryng foorth frutes therof adder tode snake hated man euill hath done poyson hurt hated god naturall poyson coceaued borne v outward euill euil venemous worme doth maketh serpent venemous worme doth euill poysoneth frute maketh tree euill euill tree therfore bryngeth foorth euill frute season frute euen euill dedes make vsfirst euill though ignorance blindnes euill workyng hardeneth v euill maketh v worse worse nature euill therefore thinke euill vnder vengeauce vnder law conuict eternal damnation law contrary knowledge sonne holy gospell gospell preached v openeth harte geueth v grace beleue putteth spirite christ v know father mercyfull consent law lone inwardly hart desire fulfill sorrow sinne frailtie neuer much sufficient till strength bee geuen v bloud christ hath made satisfaction rest bloud christ hath obteyned bloud iesus hath obtained al thinges v god thyngs v god christ satisfaction redemer contayned promise sundry sortes righteousnes righteousnes diuers blynd reaso imaguieth many maner righteousness righteousnes workes sayd hart way felt law spirituall fulfilled bottome hart iust ministration maner lawes obseruyng worldlye purpose owne profite loue vnto neighbour without respect morall vertues wherein philosopher put felicity blessednes whiche nothyng sight god respect lyfe come like maner iustifying ceremony whiche imagine owne selues counterfaite saying blynd reaso holy person dyd thus thus holy men therfore likewise shall please god haue none auswere god pleaseth consented law god ought found lust member cotrary lust desire mynde letted therefore cryed saying oh wretched man shall deliuer body death thankes bee god iesus christ righteousnes god value beleue promise god law hath confounded conscience temporall law ofttymes condenmeth thefe murtherer bringeth execution seeth nothyng present death commeth good tydinges charter fro kyng deliuereth hym likewise god law hath brought sinner knowledge himselfe hath confounded conscience opened vnto wrath vengeaunce god commeth good tydinges euangelion sheweth vnto promise god christ christ hath purchased pardon hath satisfied law peased wrath god poore sinner beleueth laudeth thaketh god christ breaketh exceedyng inward ioy gladnes hath escaped great wrath heauy vengeaunce fearefull practise euery thyng afore rehearsed fall adam hath made v adam fall brought v bondage deuill heyres vengeaunce wrath god heyres eternall damnatio hath brought v captiuitie bondage vnder deuill deuill lord ruler head gouernour prince yea god locked knit faster vnto deuill could hundred thousand chaines bynde man vnto post vnto deuils consent harte myndes might power stregth lust law deuill written well hart member runne headlong deuill full seale whole swyng power haue stone cast vp ayre cometh downe naturally owne selfe violence swyng owne wayght poyson deadly venemous hate hateth natural corruption myndes adam heyres playnly forth man hys enemy howe great malice mynde inwardly slea murther violence rage yea feruent lust commit aduoutrie fornication like vncleannes pleasure delectation inwardly serueth glotton belly diligence deceaue busily seke thinges world soeuer doe thinke imaginne abhominable sight god referre nothyng vnto honour god neither law written member harte neither power v folow god stone ascende vpward hys owne selfe beside slepe depe blindnes ca neither see feele misery thraldome wretchednes till moses come wake v publish law heare law truly preached ought loue honour god strength might low bottome hart hath created v heauen earth sake made v lord therof neighbour yea enemy selues inwardly grounde hart god hath made likenesse owne image sonnes well christ hath bought bloud made heyres euerlastyng lyfe well v ought soeuer god biddeth absteine soeuer god forbiddeth loue mekenes feruent burnyng lust center hart begynneth conscience rage law god sea neuer great tempest vnquiet possible naturall cosent law good god righteous maketh law much contrary vnto hys nature damneth ca neither sheweth fetch helpe preacheth mercy onely setteth variaunce god witnesseth paule rom iiij prouoketh hym styrreth hym rayle god blaspheme cruell tyraunt possible man regeneratio thinke wel god till borne agayne thinke god righteous make hym poyson nature either pleasure sinne man geue law impossible cosent witte reason beyng fast glued yea nayled chayned vnto deuill neither creature louse bondes saue bloud christ onely captiuitie bondage whence christ deliuered v redemed loused v bloud death pacience suffering rebuke wronges prayer fastynges mekenes fulfillyng vttermost point law peased wrath god brought fauour god v agayne obteined god loue v first father mercyfull father consider infirmity weakenes wil geue v spirite agayn taken away fall adam rule gouerne strength v breake bondes sathan wherein straite bounde christ thus wise preached promise rehearsed contained prophetes psalmes diuers place fiue bookes moses preachyng called gospell glad tydinges hart elect eue melt preachyng god mercy christes kyndnes harte elect chose begyn waxe soft melt bounteous mercy god kyndnes shewed christ euangelion preached spirite god entreth god hath ordeined appoynted vnto eternall lyfe openeth inward eye worketh belefe wofull conscience feele tast swete thyng bitter death christ mercyfull louing god christes purchasyng merites begin loue gayne consent law god good ought god righteous made desire fulfill law euen sicke man desireth whole hungred thirst righteousnes strength fulfill law perfectly omit leaue vndone seke god honour meekenesse euer condemnyng vnperfectnes deedes law christ standeth v double stede v serueth two maner wise first redemer deliuerer reconciler mediator intercessor aduocate christ e nothyng vndone might saluation atturney soliciter hope comfort shield protectio defender stregth health satisfaction saluation bloud death euer dyd christ self bloud shedyng dyd doth good seruice though selfe done god great myne hath husband wiues christ purchasing secondaryly ouercome loue kindnes seke god christen man nature haue christ exaple counterfeit saith christ example v goodnes christ selfe iohn haue geuen example eua gelist sayth wilbe great among shalbe seruaunt minister sonne man came minister ministred vnto paule sayth counterfeit christ peter sayth christ dyed left example folow hys steppe soeuer therefore fayth faith receiueth god thorough christes bloud must bestowe neighbour though enemyes hath receaued god christ bloud deseruyng must loue shed euery whit bestow neighbour vnto profite yea though enemyes fayth receaue god loue shed agayne must frely example christ without respect saue neighbour wealth onely neither looke reward earth yet heauen deseruyng merites deedes frier preach though know good deedes rewarded lyfe lyfe come pure loue must bestow selues haue able euen enemyes bryng god consideryng nothyng wealth christ dyd christ dyd hys christ dyd good deedes merite heaue ready frely sake deedes obteyne heauen therby bene madnes heaue ready heyre therof inheritaunce dyd frely sake consideryng nothyng wealth bryng fauour god v agayne v god naturall sonne father heyre doth father would heyre already byrth father gaue yer hee borne lother go without selfe hath wit pure loue doth doth aske doth thing doth aunswereth father bade father pleaseth father bond seruauntes worke hyre child loue father hath already doth christen man frely doth considereth nothyng god neighbour wealth onely liue chaste obteine heauen therby doe wrong bloud christ christes bloud hath obteined christes merites haue made heyre therof doore way thether wardes neither loke higher roume heaue shal haue liue wedlocke whore stewes repet pride lucifer frely wayte euangelion auoyde trouble world occasion might plucke serue brother euen one hand helpeth one member one feeleth others grief payne one payne soeuer done lest v whether good bad done christ soeuer done brother christen done neither doth brother payne greue lesse myne owne neither reioyse lesse wealth mine loue hym well asmuch selfe law comaundeth sayth paule let hym reioyseth reioyse lord say christ whiche lord ouer creature merites obteined heaue hygher place wherein might reioyse besides lord see ye nature law nature euangelion law byndeth gospel louseth men law key byndeth damneth men euangelion keye loseth agayne law goeth euangelion foloweth preacher preacheth law byndeth conscience preacheth gospell looseth agayn two salues meane law gospell vseth god preacher heale cure sinner law driueth force law disease maketh appeare sharpe salue freatyng corsey killeth dead flesh louseth draweth sore rootes corruption pulleth man trust confidence hath selfe owne workes merites deseruinges ceremony robbeth righteousnesse maketh poore killeth sendeth hym downe hell bryngeth vtter desperation prepareth ye way lord written iohn baptist possible christ come man long trusteth self worldly thyng hath righteousnesse rich holy workes commeth eua gelion gentle paster soupleth swageth woundes coscience bringeth health bringeth spirite god loseth bondes satha coupleth v god strong fayth feruent loue bondes strong deuill world creature lose poore vprising sinner feeleth ioy gospell thinketh impossible god forsake hym wretched sinner feeleth great mercy loue kyndnes god sure hym selfe possible god forsake withdraw hys mercy loue hym boldly cryeth paul saying shall separate v loue god loueth v withall say shall make beleue god loueth shall tribulation anguish persecution shal huger nakednes shal sword nay sure neither death lyfe neither aungell neither rule power neither present thynges thinges come neither hygh low neither creature able separate v loue god christ iesu lord tribulation christen man perceaueth god father loueth hym euen loued christ shed bloud crosse finally bond deuill wrought maner euill wickednes hell sake reward sinne heyre hell byrth bondage deuill dyd euill could none otherwise sinne nature euen since coupled god christes bloud well heauens sake yet reward wel doyng heyre heauen grace christes purchasyng haue spirite god good frely nature good tree bryngeth forth good frute euill tree euill frute frutes shal ye know tree ma dedes declare within make neither good bad though created new spirite doctrine christ waxe perfecter alwaye woorkyng accordyng doctrine blynd woorkes owne imagining must first euill yer doe euill serpent first poysoned yer poyson must also good yer good fire must first hoate yer heate thyng take example blynd deaffe cured gospell could see heare till christ geuen sight hearyng sicke could dedes whole man till christ geuen health man good soule till christ haue losed hym bondes sathan haue geue wherewith good yea first haue powred hym selfe good thing shedeth forth afterward whatsoeuer owne sinne whatsoeuer aboue christes gift purches doyng synne v selues goodnes christ working bought father dearely bloud yea bitter death gaue lyfe soeuer good thyng v geuen v frely without deseruyng merites christes bloudes sake desire folow yt god gift christes bloud hate deuils whereunto fast locked could loue also gift christes bloud vnto belongeth prayse honour good dedes vnto v deedes v three maner seruice first certifie v workes certifie v euerlastyng nheritaunce ill sinne v releue necessitie neighbour heyres euerlastyng life spirite god whiche earnest therof v harte consent vnto law god haue power mebers though imperfectly secondarily tame fleshe therewith kill sinne remayneth yet v waxe dayly perfecter perfecter spirite therewith kepe lustes choke word god sowen v quench giftes working spirite lose spirite agayne thirdly dutie vnto neighbour therewith helpe necessitie vnto co fort also draw vnto honoryng praysing god whosoeuer excelleth giftes grace belog brother much selues giftes grace let thinke geuen hym much hys brother seruice owne selfe much loue whiche god hath weake vnto vnto god geueth giftes withdraweth ought hath hys neighbour neede robbeth hys neighbour thefe proude giftes god thinketh hym selfe reason better feeble neighbour rather truth knowledgeth hym selfe seruaunt vnto hys poore neighbour reason hath lucifer spirite hym christes thynges know first law naturall right equitie haue one god put hope trust hym loue hart soule might power neither moue hart hand commaundemet hath first created v nought heaue earth sake afterward marred selfe sinne forgaue v created v agayne bloud beloued sonne haue name one god feare reuerence dishonour swearyng therby light trifle vanitie call recorde confirming wickednesse falshead ought dishonour god whiche breakyng hys lawes vnto hurt neighbour asmuch lord god double possessio creation redemption therfore ought sayd neither moue hart hand without commaudement right haue nedefull holy dayes come together learne holydayes necessary come together learne christes law haue v ruled also promise mercy whiche haue v trust vnto geue god thankes together mercy commit infirmity hym sauiour iesus reconsile selues vnto hym eche ought betweene brother brother requireth purpose lyke visite sicke nedy redresse peace vnitie holy dayes ordeined onely farforth kept holy fro maner workes may conueniently spared tyme till done lawfully worke right obey father mother master lord prince kyng ordinaunces world bodely ghostly god ruleth v ministreth frely benefites vnto v loue benefites receaue feare power haue ouer v punish v trespasse law good order farre yet worldly power ruler obeyed onely worldly ruler obayed far forth lawes impugne god lawes commaudements repugne commaundement god hoo wherefore must haue god commaundement euer harte hygher law interpret inferiour obey nothyng agaynst belefe one god agaynst fayth hope trust onely agaynst loue god wherby doe leaue vndone thyng sake nothyng man comaundement agaynst reuerence name god make despised lesse feared set obey nothyng hynderaunce knowledge blessed doctrine god whose seruaut holy day notwithstandyng though ruler god hath set ouer v commaunde though ruler appointed god oppresse v yet may auenge god roome v agaynst god v open wrong oppresse v cruel tyranny yet god rowme may auege selues processe order god law lawes made authoritie god law whiche also god law euer hygher power remittyng vengeaunce vnto god meane seaso suffer vntill houre come side know man ought loue neighbour equally must loue neighbour self fully well hym selfe neighbour neuer simple equally created god full redemed bloud sauiour iesu christ commaundement loue spring kill thy neighbour defile wife beare false witnesse agaynst hym finally onely thynges deede couete thyne harte house wife manseruaunt maydeseruaunt oxe asse soeuer lawes pertaynyng vnto neighboure fulfilled sight god saue loue loueth hys neighbour kepeth commaundemet defile thy neighbour wife though hee neuer touch neuer see thinke vpon commaundement though thy neighbour wife neuer fayre thou haue neuer great oportunitie geuen thee contet happly prouoke thee putiphers wife ioseph yet see thou loue thy neighbor well loue thou finde thine hart yt wickednes eue trusteth thing saue god onely sonne iesus christ kepeth co maundemet sight god hath trust creature whether heauen earth saue god sonne iesus ca see cause loue god hart c neither absteine dishonoryng name keepe holy day loue doctrine obey louing ly yt ruler world cause loue neighbour selfe absteine hurtyng hym may get profite hym saue selfe harmeles likewise law loue thy neighbour thy selfe may obey worldly power ought man comaundemet vnto hurt neighbour hath deserued though turke know cotrary law vnto nature danation haue law writte harte though neuer committe dedes meanes bee saued damnation repentauce toward law fayth christes bloud inward baptisme soules washyng dippyng bodyes yt water outward signe plungyng body vnder baptisme signifieth repent professe new life water signifieth repent professe fight sinne lustes kill euery day helpe god diligence folowyng doctrine christ leadyng spirite beleue washed naturall damnation borne wrath law fro infirmity weakenesses remayne v haue geuen consent vnto law yelded oure selfe scholers thereof imperfectnesse deedes done cold loue actuall sinne shall chaunce v enforce contrary euer fight thereagaynst hope sinne thus repentaunce fayth begyn baptisme first professing lawes god cotinue vnto liues end grow grow spirite perfecter greater repentauce stroger faith thus spirit doctrine god part repentauce fayth part beget v new christ euen make v grow waxe perfect saue v vnto ende neuer leaue v vntill perfecter greter repentante stronger fayth sinne put cleane purified full formed fashioned similitude lickenes perfectnes sauiour iesus whose gift finally know yt soeuer good thyng v yt gift grace therfore deseruyng though many thing geuen god diligence workyng lawes chastising bodyes praying beleuyng promise el geuen v yet working deserueth gift workes deserue yt giftes grace diligece marchaut seekyng good shyppe bringeth good safe lad though diligece doth helpe therto whe beleue god might tempt god true abyde promise helpe v performe alone strength past thynges say know haue scripture vnlocked opened thee thou wilt go read thou canst vnderstad thinges ignoraut haue scripture locked vp ye thou readest blinder thou art contrarietie thou findest tagled art thou principle scripture perfectly learned rest easie therin canst thou minde satisfy lust suffering euyll make satisfaction sinne past repent sory fatherly loue make father loue correcteth child v know selues feele mercy tame flesh keepe v sinning againe naturall father punisheth child delighteth tormenting take satisfactio sinne past first teacheth kindly suffreth forgeueth twise last seeth body wanton childe continue right way rage wild lustes beateth subdue fleshe negligent tame hys flesh prayer fasting good dedes doctrine christ wil surely scourge bring right way agayne keepe doctrine soules health perish taketh mercy v thinketh sinne past repent full haue corrupt v tast sicke maketh holesome well seasoned meate bitter soud faith shal easely attaine true sece scripture werish vnsauery neuertheles yet scripture abydeth pure selfe bright sounde faith thinke ye sophistry beleue ye minister secrete tradition without grounde truly see minister open scripture falsly ye bewyche wittes poetry beleue ye minister secret tradition profite wee see corrupt papist haue corrupted scripture abused sacramentes wee restore scripture vnto right vnderstandyng false gloses euen deliuer sacramentes ceremony vnto right vse abuse must scripture corrupt commeth would hypocrite say scripture maketh heretiques proue laye people ought read scripture false wicked frute roten tree therefore faythfull seruauntes christ faythfull minister dispesers doctrine true traslate themselues best maner yea let sow gloses many thinke make cleaue thereto put men translation way translation scripture sufficiet onely must well taught people may haue true sece howbeit called gospell say glad tydinges open preachyng christ epistle sent letter bill absent p begynneth first epistle iohn chapter begynnynge declare ioh wee vnto haue heard haue seene eye looked vppon handes haue handled worde lyfe lyfe appeared haue sene beare witnesse shewe vnto euerlastynge lyfe father appeared vnto v iohn sayth thyng iohn witnesseth christ god begynnyng euerlastyng lyfe father witnesseth christ god doth begynnyng gospel saying word thyng begynnyng thyng god thyng god thinges made whe sayth heard saw eye hand handled christ man hym testifieth christ man also doth begynning gospell saying word thyng made flesh became man thus haue playne ope wordes manifest article fayth sauiour christ god man article soeuer onely beleueth christ sonne god also man hath euerlasting life beleueth also beleueth sonne god hath euerlasting lyfe shall neuer come condemnation written iohn gaue power sonnes god beleued name iohn iij beleueth sonne hath euerlastyng life litle sayd chapter beleueth hym shall condened beleue wordes article yt eatyng christes flesh drinkyng bloud spoken iohn vj word speake spirite lyfe flesh profiteth meanyng ye fleshly eatyng body fleshly drinkyng beleue christ hys bloud therefore great difference betwene beleuing god christ god beleue god christ god man promise mercy hym first co mune good bad vnto deuils thereto called fayth beleue hystory secod proper vnto sonnes god lyfe written righteous liueth beleue christ god man put trust hope confidece fayth puttyng hys trust confidece whole hope goodnes mercy helpe god aduersities bodely ghostly temptation euen sinne hell depe euer fallen therin feeleth hys disease long health euen impossible man beleue christ bloud except moses haue hym first cure law haue moses robbed hym righteousnes codemned vnto euerlastyng death haue shewed hym vnder danation birth ada deedes appeare neuer holy yet damnable sinne ca referre nothyng vnto glory god seke selues theyr owne profite honour glory repentaunce toward law must go belefe repenteth cosenteth vnto life sinne hath part fayth iohn calleth christ euerlastyng life father hee signifieth christ lyfe epistle first also gospel saying christ life lyfe vntill receaue lyfe christ fayth dead dead saith iohn iij beleueth sonne see lyfe wrath god abydeth vppon wrath heyres byrth sayth paule ephe ij whiche nature child wrath wrath ignoraunt vntil law published walke quyetly lustes loue god wickedly content therwith mainteine v therin cotrary vnto godly righteous nature assoone lawe whose nature vtter sinne rom iij set man variaunce god preached first awake dreame see law codemneth v damnatio haue law contrary vnto nature grudge agaynst god therto young child agaynst elder first commaude count god cruell tyraut law codemneth v thyng loue loue fulfill christ preached christ god sake receiueth v mercy forgiueth v past hencefoorth rekeneth vnto v corrupt poysoned nature taketh v sonnes putteth v vnder grace mercy promiseth iudge v rigorousnes law nourture v mercy patiece father mercyful onely submit submit selues christ knowledge weakenes great mercy receaue v selues vnto doctrine learne kepe lawes yea therto consider mekenes soeuer chaunceth neuer taketh away hys mercy till cast yoke profession first runne away vtter defiaunce neuer come schole stubburne hard harte mollifie waxe soft confidece hope haue christ kindnes go god boldly vnto father receaue life say loue vnto god vnto law also whiche haue seene heard declare vnto ye may haue felowshyppe v felowshyppe may father sonne iesus christ thynges write vnto ioye may full bryng vnto felowshyp touch stone true doctrine preacher god christ beleue christ finall intent scripture giuen god vnto man onely thyng true preacher seke wherby ye shall euer know discerne true word god false counterfayted doctrine vayne tradition true preacher wylie hypocrite preache vnto sayth iohn yt euerlastyng lyfe haue heard hearyng receaued fayth sure draw v felowshyp ye haue damned deuils sinnefull lustes ignoraunce god seeke sayth paul ij cor xij loue modest charitable maner paules doctrine selues god therfore wold haue felowes equall v build vpon foundation layd apostle prophetes christ iesus make houshold god euer ye felowes brother coupled together one spirit one fayth one hope might haue felowship thereby god become sonnes heyres iesus christ beyng brother coheyres make ioy ful glad tydinges aungell sayd vnto shepheardes luke ij behold shew great ioye shalbe vnto people sauiour borne vnto day whiche christ lord tydinges bryng worde god onely receaued spirit mouth sonne true messenger preach selues christ paule preached christ hym selfe lord v seruauntes hys sake loue selues seke vnto v wile robbed ye haue exalte selues ouer separate selues fro make selues seuerall kyngdome free frake raygnyng ouer heathen tyrauntes holdyng bondage serue lucre lustes tanglyng conscience doctrine man whiche draweth god christ fearing bugge excommunication agaynste god word serued shakyng sword tydinges whiche haue heard hym declare vnto god lyght hym darknes say haue felowshyp hym yet walke darkenes lye truth walke light light haue felowshyp together worde lanterne vnto feete light pathes christe light lightneth men apostle called light world doctrine knowe truth light ye darkenes sayth paule ephes v light lord walke therfore child good workes agaynst first comaundement heare israell lord thy god one god god hebrew called el elohim plurall nu ber strength might co maundement heare israell harken voyce god mighty power helpe v thy power might thy sworde shield one none might helpe hurt saue one whiche together thyne thy commaundemet thou wilt heare bi voyce might world borowed hym lend might agaynst contrary promise keepe therfore commaundementes shall kepe thee thou haue broken haue lent power agaynst thee repent come agayne vnto thy profession returne agayne vnto mercy fetch power home agayne lent vexe thee thou forsookest hym brakest commaundementes feare creature false feare ye cause idolatrie moreouer baptised christ haue professed good euil auenge selues must good euill many v come vnto perfection prouoked temptation desire vengeaunce haue compassion mekely pray slay v wicked thyng popish imaginatio thinke saintes plague v superstitious honour whiche dishonour shame verely popish imagination eue describe saintes nature prelate meeke lowly till would loft play tormentours honour whatsoeuer commaunde earnestly whiche god selfe hath commaunded feare aboue god hym selfe like abhomination aduour e also choose fleshly mynde euery man seueral saint rather seuerall god aduocates attorney mediatours one timo ij intercessours call aduouryes whe might better call adulterer serue rather paynted post
