doctrine lyuyng autentike first god whiche alone hath power helpe hurt hath made appointment god hath promised geue v whatsoeuer aske christes name christes sake betwixt hym v christes bloud hath bound hymselfe giue v whatsoeuer aske hys name testifiyng therto name saued wilbe father vnto v saue v lyfe lyfe come take v vnder damnation law set v vnder grace mercy bee scholers onely learne law vnperfect dedes shal taken worth yea though tyme marre infirmitie yet turne agayne shal forgeuen v mercifully shalbe vnder damnation testament confirmed signes wonder wrought thorough holy ghost indented obligation layde apart make owne imaginatio betwene saint saint ca help v v merites image seruice false fayth seyng hath god woorde vnto alone ought cleaue also cleane contrary therto agayne saintes saued owne merites christes neither dedes dyd saint saued ne merites christes merites receaued vnder grace sufficiet selues fulfill law present time saue christes merites supply ye imperfectnes yt lackyng part thorough infirmity therefore saintes holy workes made satisfaction sinne dyd receaued vnder mercy euen made none deadly synnes vnder mercy seyng deedes vnperfect sinne annexed vnto reason flesh insufficient excuse theyr owne maisters merites haue store v seeing men confession merite obedient child world disobey father comaundementes fore good deedes cannot make disobedience sinne satisfaction childe presume confidence olde deedes must humble selues mercy almighty god think father wrong punishe hee must knowledge fault hath deserued punishmente desire forgeuenes vnto glory father mercifulnesse olde deedes though olde obedience great presumption sinned frailtye purpose euen holy euer paul holinesse sinne day thorough frailtie fleshe mine olde deedes ca satisfaction must know ledge sinne vnto father graunt haue deserued damnation meekly desire forgeuenes challenge obligation wherin god hath bound selfe vnto glory mercy god glory holy deedes deedes saue glory forgeue v freely without respect deedes glory hys mercye paules doctrine vnto romaine moreouer saintes heaue angel serue v none case aungels state christ testifyeth shall resurrection angel minister sent god seruice vnto electe shall saued heb god hath bound come right way dore christes bloud aske helpe send need hundred legion angel saintes god hath bound sende angel saintes angell saint hath promised send angell sainte therfore appoynt god shall send binde hath bound himselfe sende sainte tempt god thus chosing seuerall saintes choose saintes aduacates mere idolatry tempting god yet wee worse leaue yt way christ bloud go god throgh run saintes testament owne making eyther saue v themselues imageseruice compell god merites sake saue v goest thou vnto thy father thine owne selfe sinner say dare thou go right way thou hast sinne christ hath taken thy sinnes thee god hath rod hand looketh sowre merily lust beholde chearfull countenance offreth thee hande way stopped vp vnbeleefe therefore christ way life leadeth v saluation seek way life vnto euerlasting death looke law open eye therfore haue due repentaunce lust harken vnto gospell glad tydings christes bloud right way set v malice walke therin god let deuil play v iuggle eye confirme v blindnesse maner doth christ howe christ prayeth v pray v verily christ dayes mortall flesh suffred prayed shal saued obtayned heard petition graunted made satisfaction purged purchased forgeuenes eue sinne euer shall forgeuen praying v mediatour remembraunce v present sight god father fresh houre yea houre yet present past sight god christ christ kyng hath power selfe forgeue v receaue v vnto hym selfe king raigneth hath receaued power prayed himselfe whensoeuer elect cal ought name sedeth help eue yt power hath receaued yea ere aske sendeth spirit hart moue aske gift desire ought name thinke well preue teth v grace yea careth v ere care ourselues yet euill sendeth call v draweth v power harte cannot consent come angel stande behold testament elect shall receiued fellowshippe see grace christ shall poure vpon v reioyce blessed company heaue reioyse glad haue v might loye together prayse god infinite mercy glad long v loue ready houres whe shall call help christes name come helpe christ sendeth whe cal name ere call euen yet euill happely persecute truth ignoraunce paule angel wayte vpon v keepe deuils slay v time calling come angell shoulde appeare vnto thee wouldest thou say vnto thou prayedst helpe would aunswere christ hath sent helpe beleeue angel euer thee helpe thou desiredst pray thee obtayne woulde say christ hath prayed prayer heard whatsoeuer thou askest christ prayeth v hys prayer heard name woulde shewe thee god woulde thee would also haue thee thou beleeuest thou safe thou desiredst saue thee merites would aunswer merites christ onely lord merites saluation christ lord saluation wilte thou therfore saued merit wold aungell say pray god christes name thou shalt saued merites haue thy seruaunt immediatlye help thee vnto vttermost power keep thee bring thee vnto rewarde mertites thou wouldest promise worship imageseruice abhorred god imageseruice sticke vp candle image image appeared thee would aunswer spirite delighted candlelight would bid thee geue cadle thy neighbour lacked thou hadst many would aunswer thee thou wouldest put money boxe cloth image cloth gold put golden shoe vpon image feete thou saydest thou god hateth superstition wouldest build chappel name would aunswer dwelt house made stone wold bid thee goe church made already learne preacher purpose consenteth vnto life sinne infirmitie chauce great temptation hath ouercome therefore sinne veniall vnder mercy grace though murther theft adulterie vnder danation law father shall scourge hym cast hym away damne hym marke sinne saule dauid saule euer excused sinne could persecute god dauid confessed sinne great repentauce first warnyng whensoeuer forgot selfe worke righteousnes god hee loueth brother tydinges ye heard begynnyg loue one cain deuill slew brother wherefore slew deedes euill hys brother righteous maruell brother thoughe worlde hate law righteousnes loue one christ loued v hath law liuyng hart tyme bringeth forth frutes therof god deuill whose byrth property ye see described cain resisted god persecuted childre god belefe workes therof ye see cain brother abell shall euer continue betwene child god deuill vnto worldes ende wonder therefore thoughe worlde hate know translated death life loue brother loueth brother abydeth death hate theyr brother murtherers ye know murtherer hath eternall lyfe abydyng hym thou loue thy brother christ art ready suffer christ dyd thee thou art sure thereby thou art sonne god heyre life deliuered fro death damnation haue christen men signes know whether state grace side hath power loue brother may sure state death damnation let euery man looke vpo hart sure hateth brother hath slayne hym god murtherer murtherers shal obteine kingdome god gala caines brother deuils child heyres death euer vnder damnation compare regiment spiritualtie haue temperall sword handes aboue viij hundreth yeares vnto doctrine iohn iudge whether haue led v truely steppe christes doctrine hereby assured loue hee left lyfe v therfore ought leaue lyues brother hath substaunce worlde seith brother haue neede shutteth vp compassion fro dwelleth loue god hym felt loue christes death would sure set hart fire loue hym agayne brother sake neuer cease ay resisting member vntill could onely wel content brother prosperous state also vntill could secondarely owne confession say god heare graut ought seing vnworthy yea confirme similitude worldly wisedome put backe malapertnes fare worse rude felow shuld breake vp kyngs priuie chamber presse death sinne vnto death say thou shouldest pray vnrighteousnes sinne sinne death whatsoeuer sinne see yt world let v pray dispayre god god mercy sinne sinne yt death death whiche resistyng grace fightyng mercy open blasphemyng holy ghost affirmyng christ miracle doue beel sabub doctrine deuill thinke christen man perceaue otherwise pray paule prayed alexander copersmith ij timo last god would reward hym accordyng vnto workes go backe agayne know truth giue selues willingly sinne folow persecute doctrine truth profession maynteine falshead glorie vau tage remedylesse ye may see hebr vj x hope harnesse selues meditation thynges christ suffred v example saintes folowed thinke earnestly part lyue purely best come fast yet workes knowledge selues sinner vnsay nedly long one iote ketch hold keepe still captiuitie breake lose agayne repent penaunce chast theyr flesh come vnder yt deuils clawes know god whole world set mischief beleue say put trust christ see owne glorious state repentauce standyng owne conceites darkenes therfore say doctours man knowe whether hee state grace needeth care therfore therefore blynd leader blynd know sonne god come hath giuen v vnderstandyng power sonnes god beleue name sonne god loue righteousnes hate vnrighteousnes like thy father hast thou power loue law hast thou fayth christes bloud rom iij set vp mainteine law thorough fayth preachyng fayth ministreth spirit gala iij ij cor iij spirite lowseth bandes sathan geueth power loue law also sayth paul rom viij spirite raysed vp iesus dwell raysed vp iesus quicke mortall bodyes meanes spirite dwelling well wilt thou say must professe obiection aduersaries iustificatio fayth law worke ergo fayth alone saueth deceaued sophistrie withdraw thyne eares wordes consider thyng thyne hart fayth iustifieth thee bringeth remission compendious declaration iustification fayth sinnes setteth thee state grace workes getteth thee power worke yer thou couldest worke thou wilt go backe agayne continue grace come saluation glorious resurrection christ thou must worke ioyne workes thy fayth dede thou haue tyme leasure oft thou fallest set thee thy fayth agayn without helpe workes although thou art reconciled restored grace woorkes required yet reconcilyng grace benefite workes folow cleane contrary forgeuenes thy sinnes restoryng fauour deserue workes folow though whe kyng sentence similitude earthly kyng pardonyng condemned person death geuen vpo murtherer hath pardoned hym request frendes workes required hencefoorth kepe kynges lawes continue grace fauour standeth yet benefite lyfe procedeth deseruyng workes folow kynges goodnes fauour fredes yea benefite gift life deserue workes folow though father chastise child yet child lesse bounde obey father father pardoneth workes folow deserue fauour must woorkes folowed correction haue deserued fauour also father vnrighteous chastise soeuer thou art able please god thy duty though thou haddest neuer sinned thy dutie deseruyng mercy grace wet mercy benefite god thy father deseruing yt lord christ hath bought thee price bloud agayne sayth purposeth bestow good accepted fruites faith euident hee meaneth lyuyng fayth professeth law god mother good workes yea nurse therto ca illation whiche might make second part admitteth mediatour christe onely geue hys goodes bynde man fayned obseruaunce helpe hys soule whe whole kingdome christ cleane deliuered body soule dominion sathan scripture testifieth dye christ say held none pray saue christ bound pray one ought desire prayer man excludeth sayth petitioner prayer faythfull brother taking effect thankes therefore mu wholly bee attributed geuer wordes plainly cofesseth may ought pray may ought desire pray v meaneth may put trust confidence prayer though gaue selues desire v petition geue thankes ascribe merites geuen v name master christ deseruynges bloud christ lord hath deserued also obteined power geue desired al desire desired christes name geue merites bloud honour trust confidece thankes perteyne also haply say desire pray trust prayer verely euen desire neighbour helpe fro aboue man helpe ut god prepareth hys hart helpe neede yet trust christ hath commau ded v loue ech go desire helpe put trust god complaine god first say loe father go brother aske helpe thy name prepare hart agaynst come hee may pitie helpe thy sake c brother remember duty helpe receaued god geue god thankes moued hart brother gaue brother courage helpe wherwith hath holpe brother loue brother agayne say loe father went brother thy name hath holpe thy sake wherfore father thou mercyful nede hath ben thy sake nede loe brother dyd dutie holpe dutie praye hym agayne might haue put trust cofidence brother helpe may prayer sure god helpe promise sure brother wil helpe though dutie sure god heare soeuer aske christes name promise sure brother pray hath good hart god saintes heauen ca pray hard saintes earth pray heard neither moses samuell dauid noye elia elizeus esayas daniell prophetes prayed heard yet none wicked would put trust god accordyng doctrine preachyng partaker prayer end damnable praying saintes damnable poore trust rich richest vpon earth damnable also leaue couenaunt made christes bloud trust saint heaue heaue know elect trust christes bloud professe law god onely pray wicked idolater whiche haue trust couenaunt god serue god spirite whiche confirmed bloud exodus moyses offered halfe bloud god sprinkeled people halfe cofirme couenaunt bynde party neither couenaut made confirmed bloud rehearsed hebrues see bookes moses whose great mercyfull differece betwene old testament new went stode farre cofirmed bloud calues new gentle testament calleth agayne promiseth mercy amend better testamet confirmed better bloud make men see old couenauntes people sprinckled bloud calues without body bynd keepe law el boud iust damnatio breakyng sayd drinke euery one soules within may bee sprinkled washed thorough fayth bloud sonne god forgeuenes sinne partaker easie kynde testament vnder sinne thorough fragilitie shalbe warned louingly receiued mercy turne agayne amend marke dyd eate iesus tooke bread hee geuen thakes brake gaue saying cup new testament bloud ofte ye drinke remebrauce often ye shall eate bread drinke cup ye shall shewe lordes death vntill come mathew marke agree wordes lucas paul aboue declared vppon wordes luke oft repeatyng one thyng remembraunce cup new testament bloud oft ye drinke remembraunce agayne oft ye shall eate bread drinke cup oft ye must declare lordes death ofte repeatyng say ye may christ saying finde none standing vpo thinges necessary abiure rather suffer extremitie moreouer death come againe haue denyed thouh accepted god beleeue yet death denying euill spoken aduersaries glorious hipocrites say must needes dye denying helpeth might haue holpen would haue denyed fyue hundred tymes seing would helpe therefore pure pride mere malice togither speake mouthes conscience knoweth false geue selfe cast selfe yelde selfe commit selfe wholy onely louyng father shall power make strong strong shall feele obedience god payne present death spirit shall speake teach aunswere according promise shall set trueth wonderfully worke aboue hart imagine yea yet dead though hipocrites make haue sworne looke ma helpe bringeth god helpe death vna salus victis nullam sperare salutem looke man helpe bringeth helpe god seeme ouercome eye hipocrites yea shall make god cary thicke thinne truethes sake spite enemy trueth falleth heare till houre come conslancie stading pacience suffering houre come necessitie caryeth v hence though willing willing haue reward thanke feare threatning therfore neither ouercome sweete wordes twayne hipocrites shall assayle neither let perswasions worldly wisedome beare rule hart though frendes counsayle let bilney warning let visure beguile eye let body bylney saint endureth ende shall saued payne aboue perseueraunce end math question passe common capacitie hygh question auoyded expounde law truly open vayle moses condemne flesh proue sinner deedes bee iustified fayth sinne deedes vnder law mercy haue taken away beare recorde vnto feele yt doctrine preachyng law god mercy christ casteth miste two shadow hyde meane law god mercy christ resist withall power sacrament without significatio refuse put sacramets without signification refused signification receiue see may helpe though bee necessarie presence christes body tynball e beareth tyme sacrament medle litle appeare diuision amog v barnes whote agaynst saxon ore affirmatiue whether constant obstiuate omit god philippe melancton sayd french king antwerpe say saw come paris c l horse spake hym frenchman receiue worde god hee plant affirmatiue affir neth luther axos hold sacrament george ioye would haue put foorth treatise matter haue stopt hym yet doe get money wotte beleue wold make many reasos litle seruyng purpose mynde nothyng put forth till heare shal haue spede would haue right vse preached presence indifferet tyndall beareth wt tyme thyng till matter might reasoned peace laysure party required shew phrase scripture let talke beleue yt god euery hurteth worshyp within hart spirite verity eue beleue body christ euery though proued hurteth man worshippeth vbiquetie proued hym saue fayth hys gospell perceiue minde beit god shew otherwise free moueth gessed long ago god would send dasing head spiritualtie catched selues owne subtiltie trust come passe thinketh smel counsayle take litle profites time come must vnderstand pure hart loue truth aduenge eating whore flesh spoyle pope churche onely praye spoyle ther selues eate whore flesh suck marow bone wherfore cleaue fast rocke helpe god commit end thing hym god shall call may vse wisedome worldly farre perceiue glory god may come therof refuse euer among thrust worldly wisedome farre may serue god glorie may vsed scripture may bee mother toung learning set vp vniuersities ought required contrary glory god hys christ stand fast commit selfe god bee ouercome men persuasion happely shal say see way bryng truth brother iacob beloued hart lyueth haue good hope trust myne hart reioyseth soule comforteth selfe thousand part much learnyng giftes el haue wil crepe alow ground low wa kyng walke thinges conscience may feele imagination brayne feare boldnes open necessary thing pronounce define hyd secretes thynges neither helpe hinder whether vnitie seditious opinion much sure know yet thinges may abyde laysure wil deferre say till agree thinke text requireth sense vnderstandyng yea sure part good hold contrary yet thyng maketh matter laugh let passe referre thyng men sticke stifly stubburnely earnest necessary thynges trust ye persuaded eue call god vpright handlyng translation tyndall recorde ye day shall appeare lord iesus geue recknyng doings neuer altered one sillable god word agaynst coscience would day earth whether pleasure honour rich might geuen moreouer take god recorde conscience desire god selfe world without whiche keepe hys lawes finally gift could helpe hand ayde nede required promise would farre commit end god soule faynt though body wery god hath made euill fauoured world without grace sight spechles rude dull slow witted parte shalbe supply lacketh low hart maketh man hygh god remembryng lowlynes hart shall make hygh god euen mekenes wordes shal make authoritie glory age sinke harte men nature geueth age authoritie mekenes glory youth geueth meekenes glory youth honour aboundaunce loue maketh excede bablyng syr concernyng purgatory many thing demaunded may say erre spiritualtie hath le haue taught beleue preached thynges god word alledged thousad textes reason textes beleued taught finde lyers textes meane worke take paynes labour rather get meate shall neuer perish meate ye haue sought hetherto perisheth bellyes meate shall giue spirituall may perish abideth euer giuyng lyfe euerlastyng father hath consigned confirmed assured testimonie bee assured sauyng health earnest peny euerlastyng life iewes vnderstode iewes wer blynd ignorant vnderstode wordes christ christ meant biddyng woorke labour meate neuer perishe asked hym shal might worke workes god supposing spoken outward woorke required wherfore iesus au swered saying eue worke god beleue trust father hath sent lo may ye see true worke acceptable god worke god requireth v euen beleue christ also co sider agayn meate bad prepare seeke saying worke take paynes seeke meate c thou shalt see none meate belief christ wherfore cocludeth euerlastyng life sayd iewes vnto hym iewes desire sig e token whereby might beleue christ token doest thou whereby might know beleue thee somwhat might beleue thee thyng workest thou might know thee god thou knowest well inough father eate bread mana deserte written hee gaue bread aboue iesus aunswered verely verely say vnto moses gaue ye bread heaue psal though fell downe ayre yet heauely foode dyd feede belly bread god descended heauen father giueth refresheth soule aboundauntly geueth life vn world iewes vnderstode saying whiche nought elles declaryng gospell eatyng bread hee meant belefe gospell sayd syr giue v bread euermore iesus sayd vnto christ required iewes haue fayth trust hym bread life commeth shall hunger beleueth shal neuer thyrst iewes hard christ say bread descended heaue giue lyfe world desired haue bread giuen euer iesus perceiuing vnderstode sence gospel expou ded christ explaneth sheweth selfe iewes vnto liuely bread giueth life world saying bread life commeth say graffed ioyned faith shall neuer hunger beleueth satisfied fayth therefore stancheth hunger thyrst soule fayth therfore christ filleth hungry harte ca desire none fayth onely apprehe deth christ hys benefites eate drinke fayth say beleue flesh body haue bene broken bloud shed sinnes soules satisfied iustified ouer foloweth haue told ye looke vppon beleue ye offended sayd commeth shall neither hunger thyrst seyng selues beyng present yet hungry thyrstie christ rebuketh incredulitie lacke fayth iewes commeth ye haue sene bodily eye yet see beleue speake sight commyng sight fayth hath shall haue none desire shall seeke night loue would lay grief shal runne wandering seke dead stockes stone certified ayth hee shall cleaue coupled fayth vnto spouse liuely foode onely treasure soule neuer thyrst light fayth ye haue ye beleue trust wherfore ye vnderstand bread meate soules say faith hope cause blyndnes father draw come vnto christ say ouer hardly father hath drawne knowledge el ye receiued father giueth must come vnto cast commeth come downe fro heauen whiche ye attribute vnto vnto eche man verely man accordyng nature haue speciall proper much obediet father one christe came heaue earth fulfill father oft resisteth repugneth god doth mine neuer therfore come downe doe hath sent witte say father yt hath sent hath giue lee e none must rayse hym vp agayne last day playne sent seeth know sonne beleueth shall haue lyfe euerlalastyng shall styrre hym vp ye last day may ye see meate speaketh god sent sonne world might liue thorough liueth eate flesh drinke bloud eate flesh drinke bloud beleueth christes death remissio sinnes cateth fleshe drinketh bloud christ beleue body crucified bloud shed sinnes clea e vnto gracious fauour could cleane thus vnto except knew therfore added saying euery man seeth sonne say vnderstandeth wherfore sonne sent world beleueth shall haue euerlastyng lyfe appeared carnall cause ye iewes murmur iewes christ taken much vpon selfe saying iesus iosephes sonne whose father mother know well inough sayth come heauen iesus auswered saying murmour christ reproueth murmuryng iewes among selues heard ye told euen father giueth come vnbelefe wherof foloweth false vnderstanding wordes spiritually spoken compelleth tell one thyng twise therfore may come onely earnest peny pledge saluatio vnlesse father sent draw draweth vnto ioyneth vnto fayth shall styrre vp last day wonder ye take wordes straungely beleuyng hard r dels darke parable say nothyng el written owne prophetes esay ieremy saying esay ierem shall taught lord sith eue prophetes testifie knowledge giue father spoke playnly say father giueth commeth man may come except father draw yet haue manifestly hath heard father learned iohn commeth vnto onely anker saluation man hath sene father lest peradnenture ye mistake wordes heare learne though pertemed outward sens rather mynde inward illuminyng soule man euer saw father although worke secretly vpon hart euer hee willeth must heare learne man say seeth sent god sayd selfe seeth father therfore say vnto verely beleue hope christ haue euerlastyng life verely playnly yt beleueth trusteth hath life euerlasting haue ye yt summe doctrine eue gospel ye whole tale legacy message wherfore sent world vnderstandyng scripture cor vnderstode short sentence beleueth hath life euerlastyng knowne paule apostle preached especially paul yeare halfe amog corinthias determinyng neither presumyng haue knowe thyng preached selfe saith iesus christ crucified vnderstand point neuer haue thus blasphemed christ sufficiet scripture neither haue belyed euagelistes holy apostle say wrote thinges necessary saluation left thing necessitie beleued makyng god holy testamet insufficient vnperfite first reueled vnto father written oft sence moyses prophetes last written holy euangelistes apostle mocker turne iohn agayne let mocke still lye bread life saith christ denyeth father elder eate manna desert yet dead eateth bread say beleueth hath life euerlastyng liuely bread come heauen eate faith shal neuer eating bread christ onely beleue christes eath dye therfore noted diligently christ meaneth euery may see eating bread none thyng belefe self offred vp sinnes whiche faith onely iustifieth v whiche sentence declare playnly would haue noted diligently repeteth yet agayn saying yt liuely bread come fro heaue eateth bread shall liue euerlastingly put cleare doubt shall shew wordes matter wayes must sauiour redemer world giue life oft rehearsed therfore take good heede bread bread signifieth sheweth christes esh speake much shall giue myne owne flesh must lay forth pay life world manifest suffer death flesh redeptio geue v life euerlastyng thus may ye see christes fleshe christes flesh spirituall foode ou soules called bread spirituall foode meate soules whe soules fayth see god father haue spared onely deare beloued sonne haue deliuered suffer ignominious paynefull death restore v lyfe haue eaten flesh dronken bloud assured firmely fauour god satisfied certified saluation communication sayd bread whiche shall geue flesh whiche shall pay lyfe world yet carnall iewes neuer wiser obstinate wilfull blyndnes iewes vnbelief sturdy hatred would suffer spirituall sence mynde christes wordes enter theyr harte could see christes flesh broken crucified bodely eaten saluation spiritual meate soules bee fed certified mercy god forgiuenes sinnes thorough passion eatyng fleshe teeth malice iewes toward sauiour christ ignoraunt therfore fleshly fierce full indignatio striuyng one agaynst saying may felow geue v flesh eate stoke fast yet fleshe eye fleshly iewes wherfore maruell though abhorred bodely eatyng thereof although fleshly papistes beyng iewes carnall carnal papistes ceasse still offer hym hebr opinion yet abhorre neither ceasse dayly crucifie offer vp agayne euer offred paule testifieth euen sith christ came teache take away doubt breake strife might wordes otherwise declared hath expounde haue soluted question saying ment meaneth would haue bene conuayed conuersed iugglers sleighly conuaye woordes singyng loafe el thomisticall papistes thomistes schole doctours say bene inuisible dimensioned body vnder fourme bread transubstantiated like thomisticall mystery wyne transubstantiated hys bloud eate flesh drinke bloud owne carnall blessed death promised seede christ god determined decreed world made ergo christ must needes haue dyed expoude word oportet mynseth necessary contrary impossible except would make god lyer impossible righteousnes remission sinnes christes bloud new testament whereof mediatour ergo testament maker must nedes haue died wrest therfore word oportet though ye finde potest oportet corrupt copy vnto vnsauery sence let oportet signifie must behoueth hym dye tooke mortall nature ye decreed coucel himselfe saying oportet exaltari filium hominis c iohn behoueth sonne must dye euery one beleueth perish c may ye see also yt impossible god breake promise impossible god god may foud veritie found contrary deedes wordes saue hath damned damne hee hath saued wherefore thynges imagined more brayne possible god sayth christ power let lyfe take agayne therfore haue dyed necessitie woder scholemaister sayled cunnyng maketh selfe therin grau teth affirmeth true necessary decreed woorkes god forsight prouidence stadeth right wel free libertie would haue beleued christ talked hym soeuer hee said sayth last god would cell hee would make ech bodyes two meanyng young man body fiften place would beleue werable make wordes true body twayne neuer would much aske hym whether hee would glorifie first sure glorified vnglorified sayd able may ye see eruet fayth old man hath earnest mynde beleue christes woordes hee told pray christ neuer told said neuer would would ye hasty beleue told praye tell v spake hym beare ye recorde bryng false shrew selfe testify thyng yet doctrine must ye make v miracle confirme tale ere bound beleue yet admit argument god may make body many place ergo syr ye busie god almightye power busely deale withall god almighty power haue taken great burden vppon weake shoulder ye haue ouerladen selfe harnesse weapon young dauid likely preuayle agaynst sling stone god hath infatuated high subtill wisedome crafty conueyaunce spyed god hath sent church mete couer cup eue defender ye take vppon selfe shall let theyr whole cause fall flatte myer vnto shame vtter cofusion god therfore praysed euer amen sayth though semeth repugnaunt one body bee two place yet god seeth make stand together well inough man doth scoffe matter old eyen spectacle seeth farre god sight preuey councel knoweth belike secret reuelation god seeth one body many place includyng repugnaunce worde hath hee none scripture one body al place implyeth first repugnaunce matter ayth repugnaut reason sight reason world made nothyng virgin bryng forth child yet see written wordes faith god spake brought passe implyeth repugnaunce fayth reacheth receiueth stedfastly know yt voyce herd man whiche sayd place scripture body haue ben cotained vnder forme bread many place earth also abidyng yet still heauen verely would haue beleued soone firmely god blessed declared scripture therfore euen yet shew v one sentence truly taken part ca many contrary must giue place vnwritte verity authority antichristes sinagoge vnto yt scripture forsaken hee last shame inough copelled flee proued starke lye deuelry sayth hee ye wot well many good folke haue vsed matter many good fruitefull example god workes onely miracle writte scripture vnde versus one pray ye also done commo course nature earth done common trauc leth poetrie course nature miracle thynges made also man hand one face beholded diuers glass euery peece one glasse broken twenty c lorde ponti icall poete playeth part bicause saith see many face many glass therefore may one body many place though euery shadow similitude representing body bodely substauce aske hee seeth hys owne face many glass whether face appeare glass owne face hauing bodely substaunce skynne fleshe bone hath face hath mouth nose eyen c wherewith faceth v truth thus falsely lye face more similitude face glasse proueth face substaunce deede one body many place selfe beareth many face one hode accordyng purpose eue face many voyces sownes similitude multiplied ayre betwene glass obiect body philosopher proueth naturall reason bodyes christes body would make thee beleue bread many place bread broken eaten supper monisheth putteth v ayth must eate drinke christes body blo spiritually remembraunce death exciteth v thankes giuyng lande prayse benefite redemption thus wee haue christ present inward eye sight fayth eate leauing necessary point faith calleth last supper christ maudy sayth iohn speake nothyng writeth hym selfe sacramet see againe letter agaynst frith selfe bringeth iohn vj chap impugne frithes writyng haue made one vnwritten verity yet looke narowly hee shall espy self hath proued v scripture xxxvij leafe dialogue quoth quoth lady perpetuall virginitie expoundyng non cog osco id est non cognoscam whiche written vnwritten veritie hee numbereth litle among vnwritte vanity thus may ye see vpholder vnwritten verity old holy vpholder pope church hys woordes fight agaynst selfe confusion findyng v forth vnwritten written vanity verity say returne vnto exposition iohn iewes would vnderstand spirituall saying eating christes flesh drinkyng hys bloud oft playnely declared gaue strong stripe made blynd deserued secrete iudgementes god addyng vnto hys sayinges thus eateth flesh drinketh bloud abideth wordes spoken vnto vnbeleuers farther obstinatio vnto faithfull theyr better instruction gather contrary say eateth fleshe drinketh bloud abydeth ioyne foresayd sentence except abacuk ye eate flesh sonne drinke hys bloud ye haue lyfe let neuer fal fro thy minde christen reader faith lyfe fayth life righteous righteous christ lyuyng bread thou eatest say thou beleuest papistes take eatyng drinkyng bodely eate naturall body christ vnder forme bread drinke hys bloud vnder forme wyne must young child neuer came god borde departed laye men neuer drancke hys iohn bloud damned loue abyde god hee v loue foloweth faith order vnderstanding order succession tyme thou lookest vpon selfe giftes fruites principally faith wherby cleaue god goodnes mercy abide god god v declare wordes folowyng saying liuyng father fayth eate drinke christ abydeth v hym sent liue father euen eateth shall lyue bycause sake father sent whose thinges obey sonne euen soverely must eate beleue forme fashion exaple mortifying flesh chaunging liuing el eate vayne dissemble theyr belief come redeme yt world onely also chaunge theyr lyfe christen religion fayth lyfe correspondet therefore beleue shall trasforme life example doctrine man traditios bread yt came fro heaue effect selfe declareth eateth shall lyue euer yt eateth bodely bread lyueth euer ye may see father yt eate na yet dead therfore materiall bread bodely foode may geue life eternall wordes onely offende hated christ also hys disciple offended sayd text merueyled trifleth truth said hard saying may disciple yet stoke lesse christes visible fleshe barke wordes iewes doth beleuing haue spoken naturall body eaten teth offence christ seyng sayd doth iewes also disciple christe offended wordes offend ye say ye see sonne ascend thether offend eate flesh shal much offend eate body shalbe gone sight ascended heauen sittyng right hand father vntill come wet iudgement might christ haue instructed disciple truth eatyng flesh forme bread ben meaning left neuer perplexitie doubt sought wayes similitude familiar exaples teath playnly neuer spake hard parable perceiued eble ignoraunce anone helpte declared yea sometymes preuented askyng owne declaration thinke ye yes verely came teach v leaue v doubt ignoraunce especially chief pointe saluation stadeth belefe death sinnes wherefore put doubt concerning eatyng flesh drinkyng hys bloud giue euerlastyng lyfe tooke body eaten teeth hee sayd spirite giueth christ doth playnly shew spirituall eatyng fleshly eatyng body profiteth lyfe flesh profiteth nothyng eaten ye meane carnally spirituall meate heare speake spirite draweth harte men faith refresheth ghostly ye therefore carnall thinke speake flesh eaten bodely profiteth nothing long ye without vnderstadyng spirite tell giueth lyfe fleshe profiteth nothyng eate beleue shalbe crucified suffer redemption world profiteth ye thus beleue eate ye fleshe drinke bloud ye beleue suffer sinnes veritie hath spoken woordes flesh profiteth nothyng therefore false iewes disciple murmured disputed hys flesh eaten offeryng thereof sinnes christ ment therfore sure anker hold v agaynst obiections papistes eatyng christes body say forme bread christ sayd flesh profiteth eating christes flesh profited nothyng nothyng meaning eate bodely key solueth al argumentes openeth way shewe v false abhominable blasphemous lye vppon christes wordes vttereth sleigh iuggling ouer bread mainteine antichristes kyngdome therewith thus christ declared taught bodely eatyng materiall body eatyng spirite fayth added saying wordes wordes christe spirit life speake vnto spirite lyfe say matter haue spoken many wordes must spiritually vnderstand giue life euerlastyng wherfore cause ye vnderstad ye beleue lo conclusion sermon christ god man set flesh receiued fayth broken suffer sinnes could eate spiritually bycause beleued wherefore many disciple fell fro walked sayd twelue ye go away symon peter aunswered lord shal go thou hast wordes euerlastyng life beleue sure thou art christ sonne liuyng god manifest peter felowes vnderstode eatyng drinkyng christ perfitely taught stode belefe christ auswere testifieth matter stand vpon deepe miracle papistes fayne without word god comprehended vnder common sens eate hys body beyng vnder forme bread long depe thicke brode hanged vpon crosse beyng yet feble fayth confirmed holy ghost must nedes haue woundered stoned staggerde haue bene inquisitiue straunge christes disciple vnderstode consummate finished lead v seusible signes figure vnto veritie fro flesh vnto spirite take thou infallible assured saying christ neuer fall fro thy mynde last supper ye remebrauce luke also paul saying oft ye shal eate bread lo heretike cor calleth bread eue word pope cosecratio drinke cup praise declare geue thankes death lord vntill shall come agayne iudgement remeber thou also christ sayd carnall iewes takyng eatyng hys flesh drinkyng bloud carnally aunsweryng flesh profiteth meanyng eate bodely iohn spirite maketh lyfe set prophet abacukes sentece abacuk iust lyueth fayth christen reader put thee cleane doubt christes body present vnder forme bread papistes haue mocked v many day heauen euen rose asceded thou shalt christ declared disciple would leaue world go father heauen know told hys disciple almost twenty tymes betwene xiij xviij chap iohn would goe hence leaue world comfort agayne heauy bodely absence promised send hys holy ghost comforter defender teacher would present faithfull vnto worldes end hee sayd vnto hys disciple goe scripture many shewe christ touchyng natural body gone actes hence goe father leaue world shall world ye shall abyde still world father come thee poore men haue ye euer shall ye alwayes haue whe ascended vnto heaue behold hym saw cloude take hys body theyr syght fastnyng eye two men clothed white sayd vnto ye men galile wherefore stand ye thus lookyng vp heauen iesus taken vp heauen whiche shall come agayne euen ye haue sene going hence would flitte fro christ asce ded heauen hys litterall playne sense playne wordes sufficient trow christen man certifie hys conscience christ went way bodely ascendyng heauen whe told disciple oft bodely departyng maruelous heauy sad vnto christ sayd told iohn go hence harte full heauines beleued hym haue spoke bodely absence would neuer haue mourned goyng away vnderstode meane wordes sowned added haue sayd ye neuer heauy heauely euer ye take goyng hence yet tell truth expedient goe hence go hence comforter come vnto go hence shall christ playne wordes declareth bodely departure world send vnto agayne chap come father come world shall leaue world agayne go father mistery thinke ye manifest woordes speake darke parable dyd meane otherwise spake dyd vnderstand goyng hence ofte repeted tary still dyd meane forsakyng leauyng world inuisible beyng still world body surely meant faithfully playnly wordes sowned euen dyd hys disciple without maruelyng vnderstand aunswered saying lo speakest thou apertly neither speakest thou prouerbe darke prouerbe subtile ridle bene meant goyng hence haue aryed still forsakyng world abyde still world going hence father bodely ascention inuisible would intrepret plaine sentence thus go hence saye tary still forsake world goe father say inuisible yet abyde still world bodely concernyng godhead euer father place neuer spake woordes christ sayd death christ playnlye shewed vnto disciple must depart world father heauen hand vnto disciple agayne forsake world go father ye shall tary still world expound sakyng world tary still bodely inuisible lyke exposition interprete tarying still disciple tyme gone hence bodely visible christ dyd set contraryes one agaynst declare ech tary still dyd signifie disciple abyde world doth deede must needes goyng hence forsakyng world signifie bodely absence wordes playnly lowne christ meant vnderstoode plaine matter neede wordes thou therefore sure christen reader christes glorified body world heauen thether ascended body shal christes rified body heauen come euen went gloriously power great maiestie iudge world last day thou therfore assured neuer thus iuggled mocked hys dearely beloued disciple full heauynes bodely departyng meant papistes haue peruerted hys saying hys disciple would haue wondered straunge maner spech would haue expressed mynde playnly sith tyme hee full set leaue doubt comforte hys playne comfortable wordes christes scention witnessed many would haue ben inuisible still bodely present hee would neuer haue couered hym selfe cloude shewyng testifying also ij men bodely ascetion sightes may make hys bodely ascentio inuisible iugglyng cast papistes fayne fashionyng fayning christ body inuisible many place great yet litle place decerned sens glorified vnglorified passible impassible wote neare imagine make maker without woorde yea cleane agaynst wordes holy scripture surely imagination saying bryng fresh heresie great heretike marcian said marc christ tooke phantasticall body neither verely borne suffered rose ascended verely neither man heresie tertulian confuteth christ toke verely nature passible mortall body beare v saue without maner synne body suffered verely rose agayne death glorified body immortall c euery one v shall ryse generall iudgement appropried onely hys godhead euery bee circumscribed conteined one place papistes prophane voyde voyces body many place indifinitiue incircumscriptiue non per modum quati ne que localiter c includeth selfe contradiction paule warned timothe timo timo callyng opposition false named science theyr scholasticall diuinitie must make obiections agaynst euery truth neuer playne pro contra whiche science timo many professe sayth paul haue erred fayth contention battayle wordes profitable nothyng el subuert hearer care haue almighty testimony euerlastyng word god ready soyle theyr madde vnreasonable reason wype cleane away turne confession bycause hold fast paule shall loose theyr hold cor expoundyng lordes supper paule addeth immediatly vnto cup yt luke left foorth doe ye remembraunce doth paule repete ofte put supper lord commem ration memoriall christes death v minde thankes giuing supper comemoration memoriall christes death wherfore hee repeteth yet agayne vntill hee come say fro tyme death ascention vntill hee come agayne iudgement furthermore sayeth paule calleth sacramet bread consecration paule eateth bread calleth still bread drinke cuppe lord cup recite paules wordes saying ye may drinke cup lord cuppe deuill together ye deuill differte may bee partaker lordes borde deuils borde deuils borde hys cuppe body bloud earing drinkyng image idol dyd heathen worshyppe thankes theyr god thyng thou mayst gather paul meant lordes borde cuppe let v returne paule x chapter eate eate bread drinke cup vnworthely bread drinke cup vnworthely come vnto borde faith loue professed baptisme eate vnworthely thrust selues among congregation hauyng loue sacramet signe vnity teacheth signifieth maner people paule ye chapter rebuketh bendeth sermon agaynst contetious came together better woorse commyng together haue bene token fayth loue turned occasion matter disscution strife bycause euery man dyd eate paule sayth hys owne supper lordes supper wherein bread drinke common well poore riche rich disdayned euery eate supper supper rd poore would tarye rich went theyr way dronken full poore departed hungry dry whiche token equall distribution bread drinke rich contemned poore became sclau derous giltie body bloud christ witte poore congregation redemed christes body bloud thus came together appearyng haue loue whiche supper signified vttered selues contetious vnlouyng dealyng member christes body rather giltie hurtfull vnto souldier aduersaries part shoulde come among v lordes badge hauyng hart fayth loue captaine haue would espyed token take spye betrayer must firste examine stlues come table lord rather one v let man therefore sayth paule proue selfe well whether hath fayth christ loue god neighbour professed baptisme supper signified come among congregation eate bread drinke cup calleth still bread wyne neither body bloud eateth drinketh vnworthely eateth drinketh hys owne damnation bycause discerneth lordes body calleth still lordes body congregation redemed christes body dyd loke epistle reader also chapter folowyng fetching analogie similitude naturall body although diuers member one excelling one inferiour vyler cotemptible yet may body want must couer reuerently hold honour agayn body though diuers member diuers office yet discorde among euery member bee neuer low vyle yet doth minister serue together hold vp helpe whole body consideratio coparisons eloquently plenteously liuely doth paule set forth xij chap ca desire bryng v consideration discretion body christ congregation without whiche consideration discretion thrust selues come thankfully charitably vnto yt lordes borde eate drinke damnation signe recognisance faynedly hypocrite eate drinke owne iudgement cause many sicke among many slepe dead semeth plage haue bencast vppon corinthian abuse eatyng lordes supper law prophetes threatened v plague pestilence famine sword sinnes iudged soules diligently examined owne liuyng repented haue ben iudged say punished yt lord punished corrected lord lest condemned world wherfore brother ye come together eate tary one cause dissention wherfore paule rebuketh might obiect tell paul syr come thether hungry may tary long wherunto paul aunswereth dyd saying haue ye house eate drinke ye contemne cogregation god shame haue none paule calleth poore church god calleth poore church god afterward called body lord last sayth hugry let eate somewhat home delay hunger may better tary pore lest ye come together vnto condemnation thynges place papistes alledge proue vnwritten ritie shall dispose set order come thynges concerning supper frame among whiche ye read whole epistle easie see necessary truthes saluation truthes paule preached written neither thinges lent fast assumption lady halowyng bowes belle ash halowyng vestimentes crepyng crosse vnwritten vanity lysteth lest tryful truth haue ye pure sense christ wordes body say signifieth representeth body takyng est significat hym selfe vttered dialogue put forth william barlowes name recityng opinion oecolampadius zwinglius saying body much say signifieth body saith oecolampadius alledgeth hym belyeth decolamp dius zuingitus tertulian chrisostome austen falsely sometyme addyng wordes sometyme takyng away theyr senteces saying playne false hee belyeth man departed first incomparable learnyng verye spirituall iudgement would suffer hym ignoraunt vnderstandyng old holy doctours dare say vnder stode well couscience faythfulnes would suffer hym falsely peruert belyeth peruerteth christ paule holy scripture thus dealt doctours sayinges luther agaynst cotende matter would haue left vntold hym christe reader put thee loke epistle reader doubt haue doctours wordes latine englishe first heare tertulian thou must first vnderstad hereticke called marcion saying christ tooke hym body man imagiued phantasticall body put lysted haue ben borne verely virgine mary yet haue suffered verely death c agaynst thus writeth tertulian hys fourth booke professus ita que se concupiscentia concupisse tertulian edere pascha vt suum acceptum panem distributum discipulis corpus suuni illum fecit hoc est corpus meum dicendo id est figura corporis mei figura autem non fuisset nisi veritatis esset corpus caeteru vacuum re quod est phantasma figuram capere non posset whiche wordes thus english spoken christ whiche acknowledgyng hym selfe feruent desire longed eate passeouer bread taken distributyng disciple made body saying wor e tertulian body say figure body figure bene none except body voyde thyng phantasie receaue figure playne body old holy doctour much say figure signe representeth signifieth body also thus sayeth austen lex dicit non esse manducandu sanguinem quod anima sit sanguis quod lex dicit sanguis auste cap xij dim nt est anima esse positum dicimus sicut alia multa pene omnia scripturarum illarum sacramenta signis figuris plenum futurae predicationis quae iam per dominum nostrum iesum christum declarata est c possum etiam interpretari praeceptum illud signo esse positum non enim dubitauit dominus dicere hoc est corpus meum quum signum daret corporis sui sic est enim sanguis anima quomodo petra erat christus nec tamen quum haec diceret ait petra significabat christum sed ait petra erat christus quae rursus ne carnaliter acciperetur spiritualem illam vocat id est spiritualiter intelligi docet whiche woordes thus english law sayeth bloud gene leui deut eate life bloud precepte lawe bycause bloud lyfe affirme set like many almost innumerable sacramentes scripture full signes body yet sayd wordes sayd stone signified christ sayd stone christ whiche lest taken carnally hee calleth spirituall say teacheth bee vnderstand spiritually more litteral sense materiall meate shall ye heare chrisostome hom operiti imperfect nihil sensibile tradidit christus licet dederit panem vinum non quod panis vinum non sint sensibilia sed quod illis mentem haerere noluit nam suum corpus cryme payne also repugnaut vnto scripture hath relesed v payne may robbe god honour well sinne entent bee vnkynde despoyle great honour without authoritie scripture imagine hath deliuered v payne well compelled aunswere nay rather greate pleasure vnto forgeue could make satisfaction vnto hys iustice repentaunce reioyseth punishyng v addeth rastell rastell libertie alway execute iustice mercy pleasure auswere hath pleasure agaynst scripture frith therein hath fully opened pleasure pleasure forgeue god forgeueth christes ake otherwise freely beleue sonne christ iesu condemne beleue rastell meane fashion graunt hym vnderstad god taketh hys pleasure libertie ministryng mercy iustice hee may condemne hath geuen payment full satisfaction sinne seemeth e meane seing hee denyeth first part argument agayne saue hym beleued say rastell runeth ryotte taketh hys rastell groundeth hym vppon lye imagination pleasure god hath power agaynst hym selfe hys scripture looke hath promised performe purgatory christes merites vtterly setteth aside purgatory vayne haue purged v neede purgation made perfite thorough hym neede lyfe bee purged hee haue satisfied v seeke satisfaction leaue fountaine liuing water seeke refreshing polluted pooles specially sith headspryng ready hand must make satisfaction vnto god sinnes would know christ died thinke ye meane purge v onely death christ bloud shed vayne doubt way vnto father christes bloud whether purgatory sacrifice thou canst imagine death necessary ala vnkindnesse deiect precious bloud christ set gracious fauour naught meanes may satisfie sinnes neede redemer yet auour may call right duety neede christes bloud mercy fauor may blasphemous vnto christes bloud free redemption christ able fully euer saue come vnto god hym seyng hee euer lyueth make intercession christ hable fully saue commeth god v hebr v j able fully euer saue v runne hym seeke purgatory make intercession v lyke cruell stepfather towardes v rather meanes hee seeketh health flye hym offereth hym selfe louyngly v dar put trust hym whiche enemyes vouchsafed dye v reconcile v vnto father rom maketh comyngo almany rom bryng example confutyng thinketh wynne fielde shew similitude nothing lyke dede imagine lyke doth cofute maketh stronger example owe thee c li true debt humbly desire thee forgeue discharge rastell pardon thou make cleare release therof bounde make must suppose humble request forgeuenesse discharge pardon payment satisfaction c li therfore vpo first haue agreed el ca example serue nothyng make lyke imagine humble desire forgeuenes payment satisfactio c li hath made rod arse shall neuer able auoyde let v see aunswere case haue put rastell sayth rastell desire forgeuenesse c li yet libertie gentlenes whether forgeue thee whole c li el part therof well hitte master iohn pay c li frith good curraunt money yet libertie gentlenesse whether would forgeue part whole therof truly would loth one debtours e hard creditours like maior haue studyed cautell law neuer heard owed c li gaue payment satisfaction therof bee cleane discharged whether ye would yea nay neither neede thanke liberalitie gentlenes case request minor desire forgeuenes must payment satisfactio c li el nothyng lyke argument may put similitude purse til place tyme shal better agree wherfore must needes co clude desire forgeuenes coclusio standing sayd desire forgeuenes rastels similitude clearely co founded payment satisfaction c li el sayd nothyng lyke cleane discharged neede neither thanke liberalitie gentlenesse obiect recompense losse tyme damage hurt hinderaunce haue none paymet c li forth applyed vnto god remission sinnes losse doynges god neither better worse tyme damage hurt hinderauce towardes god neither hurt hynder hym although vnto father v repentaunce whiche take sufficient counterpese one cryme christ damned leaue rastell turke gingemin naturall philosophy proued foolishnes hetherto hath proued purgatory neither hath hee accordyng workes body whether good bad cor cor true purgatory whiche shall profite hym dissolued body receaue accordyng ye workes body rather accordyng paynes suffered purgatory text true must folow thyne executours dealyng offeryng masse penny c helpe thee myte text possible purgatory vpon text would fayne dispute poynt sophistry whiche would gladly haue dissolued thinke selues learned accordyng workes body shall receaue accordyng workes body two co tradictories true wil proue firste proposition paules two contradictory may true cor man deny true secod may easely proued true shall receaue accordyng workes body case depart world cleane purged fayth word god neither rebellious member subdued death imagine spottes remnauntes sinne remaine worthy lye paynes purgatorye space sixe yeare graunted sure deny also put case man lyeng purgatory space moneth haue frend offereth hym peny vnto dominikes boxe hath power assoone tinging hard ye boxe soone soule free heauen frende bye pardon hym may absolue poena culpa commeth one effect man deliuered maner doth receaue accordyng workes body workes body yet lye purgatory fiue yeares doth deliuered purgatory ergo may conclude receaueth accordyng workes body two contradictory true el deliueraunce purgatory whiche destroyeth pardon massepence suffragies dead would haue soluted beit adnumber argument vnlearned people write booke well perceaue sophisme haue writte stop chatteryng mouthes sophisters cast bone gnaw vpon paule sayth whiche tymes past straungers enemyes myndes set euil workes hath recociled body hys fleshe thorough death make holy man complayne without aulte owne sight ye continue grounded stablished fayth moued away hope gospell collos paule affirmeth reco ciled god ye death christ therefore neede booke purgatory reconciled death ye made holy without faulte sight haue expounded bee without fault ixt argument looke ye yet purgatory ye childish insensible imagine ye must yet go purgatory ith ye already without faulte ight playne ase god th purgatory although one righteousnes punishe man nothyng grouded stablished fayth hys ight without faulte sinnes imputed vnto forgeuen christes bloud wherfore necessitie must conclude faythfull shall euer come euery man departeth world either faithfull vnfaithful faithful commeth ye foresaid argumet proueth vnfaythfull commeth neuer purgatory ready damned iohn iij marke last iohn neither aythfull vnfaithfull e say purgatory enter vayne nothyng made vaine wherfore must conclude purgatory paule sayth spared owne sonne deliuered v shal geue v thynges also shall lay thyng charge god chosen rom viij forsooth lord god rom prelate lay sore vnto charge would haue broyle purgatory lord protectour thou iustifiest v w god hast freely geuen v thynge rom viij paule sayth law spirite wherein lyfe christ iesu hath deliuered lawe sinne death rom viij seyng r deliuered n de v seke deliueraunce specially ith make paynefull yng ye maner deliuered hau ceth taken prisoner agayne vnder sinne must purged fresh fire purgatory pray god geue v grace christ hath purged ou sinnes may purged fro blynd ignoraunce thorough hys spirite knowledge may perceaue iesus christ purgeth sinnes hath deliuered v thorough bloudshedyng geue hym prayse whiche hath deserued vnkind vnto hym paule sayth ye condenatio christ iesu rom continue firme rom stable christ vnto end shall saued math needeth math purgatory yea purgatory purgatory doe christ sufficient faith vayne sufficient purgatory vayne paule sayth iustified law christ dead vayne lawe beyng good god hath commau ded v world must nedes haue conuersation men therfore hath god appointed hee thou shalt doe profite thy neighbour tamyng thy flesh paule testifieth ephes worke made ephe christ iesu good woorkes whiche woorkes god hath prepared walke workes god would haue v doe vnfaythfull might see godly vertuous conuersation faythfull thereby compelled glorifie father whiche heauen math v math profitable thy neighbour also testimonie vnto thee may know thou art right sonne thy heaue ly father christe vnto thy neighbour euen heauenly father gaue christ vnto v profit haue ther onely profite likewise shouldest thy good workes hauing respect comodities thou shalt haue euer attendyng charitie wealth profite thy neighbour thou wilt yet obiect see great profite shall haue aunswere aunswere obiection wouldest haue first christ geuen thee freely hast thou thinges thy wisedome righteousnes halowyng redemption cor art thou made cor inheritour god felowheyre christ rom viij freely rom geuen must thou thy workes must worke single eye single eye hauyng neither respect vnto ioyes heaue neither yet paynes hell onely profite thy neighbour god commaundeth thee let lone residue well agreeth farre east weast euen farre hath set sinnes v psal citj psal psalme ye prophet exhorteth soule prayse lord saying prayse lord soule whiche forgeueth thee thyne iniquity healeth thy disease true forgeue debtour yet cast prison debt thinke euery man would say maner god hath forgeue v sinnes therfore wil punish v purgatory pleasure whether hee would forgeue fauour compassion forgaue hath forgeuen hee doth vnrighteously punish debtour albeit man repente forgeuyng afterward sue debt yet god neuer repet selfe mercyable gift rom xi rom therefore neuer torment v trespass yet remember ezech deuill sinne ada committed rom rom v sayth deliuered pitte water forsooth euen much say hee deliuered hell eternall damnation thou wilt obiectio aunswere therunto happely say hee deliuered hell eternall damnation prisoner say yt shalbe saued neuer came aunswere without doubt haue gone thether haue bene daned perpetually except christ death deliuered losed therefore sayth scripture christ deliuereth v hell saueth deliuereth v come el surely enter euer also common maner speach among v man go prison debt matter one frendes come yt meane season pacified aduersaries payeth debt may well say hath deliuered man prison although hee came haue gone thether likewise say hath deliuered frend galowes meane ready hanged deliuerauce late meane deliuered hee hanged furthermore might question master bee bold aske whether christ haue redemed loosed deliuered bloud testament thinke would aunswere yea aske whence hath deliuered sure ignoraunt say christe hath deliuered purgatory euen hath deliuered eternall death damnation hath christe deliuered v pytte wherin water say fro hell euerlastyng damnation yt hell ready although bound vnder sinne ready cast therein enter hell pure vnderstandyng texte might dispute wt true plaine exposition prophet zachary hell limbus patrum wilbe short possible deferre yt vntil occasio yt may reason hym somewhat large place also old testament putteth purgatory quyte question sayth playner place whiche booke machebees make mention machabeus deuoute remembraunce prayour asmose sacrifice done soules good holy iudas machabeus gathered money among people buy sacrifice withall offered vp soules dead battaile shift finde surely shamelesse shift sore spo fayne take talkyng shote anker alway finde storme great see shyppe goeth wracke first vse set false glosse vnto text helpe fall shameles boldnes let deny scripture place whiche hee reciteth frith written macha say mach truth yt booke sufficiet authoritie make article fayth neither admitted cano hebrues obiecteth church hath allowed holy doctours hierome austine aunswere hieromes mynde opened vnto v epistle wrote yt prouerbes salomo wordes sicut iudith tobie machabeorum libros legit quidem co ecclesia sed inter canonicas scripturas non recipit sic haec duo volumina legat ad aedificationem plebis non ad authoritatem ecclesiasticorum dogmatum confirmandum lyke church bokes machabees canon yt hebrues doth read bookes iudith tobias machabees receaueth amog canonicall scripture euen let read twoo bookes meaneth booke sapience ecclesiasticus vnto edifieng people confirme doctrine church therby nothyng lyke austen dissent hierome one tyme yea hierome lyued austen therfore church could admit bookes either austen tyme tyme hierome haue knowne may gather austen allow bookes el say churche hath allowed may vnderstad haue allowed receaued canonicall scripture make hierome lyar thus must vnderstad haue receaued read edifying ye people confirme doctrine church article fayth thereby according hieromes expositio may see shote anker called strog stormes waues moue deny booke receaued church read shew hierome entent receaued read proue article faith therby onely order maner liuyng therafter poyntes repugnaunt vnto canonicall scripture yet pleasure let slyppe shote anker take sea furious wyndes frothy waues wil neuer strike sayle strong shyp well ballaunced case booke machabees good authority esay yet proue fury paynefull purgatorye therby speaketh one word neither fire payne speaketh sacrifice offred dead yt might losed fro sinnes resurrectio yt ded may wel sinne yet need brydeled poore rich aboundaunce raygneth sinne howbeit haue shewed sufficiently agaynst rastell feare sinne feare purgatorye shall neuer come damned hell abstaine sinne feare pure loue cleane finisheth sinne one man sinne whiche adam hath condemned many men one man grace christ hath vanquished sinne holpen many one man sinne able condemne v without workes much god grace power saue v without workes sinne thorough adam planted v grace thorough christ planted v sinne hath dominion ouer men adam grace preuaileth ouer v christ death thorough sinne planted v life grace plated v death almose could lese reward good wil although opinio vntrue purgatory side beleueth none therfore prayeth none opinio false purgatory deede hee leseth much good getteth hym also much harme hee feareth much lesse sinne lye log purgatory sauing heresie shall keepe hym thence sende hym downe deepe hell auswere take frith harme beleued purgatory opinio wrong could proued scripture supposed sinne transgresse agaynst law god sayth deut xij commaunde thee onely vnto lord neither adde thyng diminish iiij chap booke ye shall adde vnto woorde speake vnto neither shall ye take thyng agayne v chapter ye shall decline neither left doyng good owne sight neither yet vnto right hand doyng manifestly forbyd though say doe onely whiche commaunde thee sayth hee lese rewarde hys good although opinion vntrue aunswere yes chosen holynesse paule conde neth collos surely shall rather imputed vnto hym synne good worke better beleue scripture aloweth make fayth sayd done fayth say vtterly reproued god side beleueth sith proued scripture ca catch harme although opinion false rather much good prayse god good men feareth swerue fro word god leuer leue thyng true case purgatory set forth scripture shall sure sinne beleue article yt fayth thyng false deede surely sinne transgresse agaynst god holy woorde great perill beleue thyng article fayth whiche opened spoken scripture beleue although true yet ryght law condemne may see beleue article fayth purgatory sith proued scripture may condemne man make hym lye euer paynes hell shoulde litle lenger lye paynes purgatory one shal sure catch harme beleueth purgatory sauyng sayth master hys heresie shall keepe hym thence sende downe depe hell supposed yt could frith proued scripture standing suppositio calleth heresie anheresie stiffe holde opinion repugnant vnto scripture heresie purgatory bee proued scripture maketh supposition ca contrary opinio repugnaunt scripture thus suppositio doth euill cal heresie sayth sore iudge opinio shall sende hym deepe hell verely steppeth farre god iudgement conclude determine cruelly specially argument supposeth proued bee proued scripture whereby ye condemne hym deepe holdeth contrary forsooth fierce iudge god geue eye see finallye ye pitie man payne neuer knewe ye payne comparable whose fire passeth fire purgatory meruellous hot fire farre heate fire euer burned vppon earth hotest passeth fayned fire paynted wall verely among poetrie frith reason graunt hym yea fire water comparison ensure hath alone melted gold beholde force fire purgatory siluer spiritualty profite poore men purse gold smithes fire within england neither yet therewith ragyng heate aswaged melteth castels harde stone landes tenementes innumerable sectes religion monkes frier chanons nunnes priestes regulare seculare fire multiplication alcumye haue obtayned whole rich pleasure euen swete england must graunt hym fire hote may wel perceaue slender foudation hote purgatory hath confutatio may easely see hath grounde authority scripture notwithstandyng foundation religion cloysters yea goodes nowe spiritualtie witty worke men whiche buylde much slender foundation howbeit haue made toppeheuye surely lyke haue fall thus hath fully aunswered say purgatory master full aunswere hys scripture whiche farre wrested theyr place also hys owne apparent reason howbeit hys mastershyppe fully pacified let hym groundly open hys mynde bryng purpose thinketh make shall god grace shortly make hym aunswere quyet mynde p thus endeth second booke p third booke aunswereth vnto lord rochester declareth mynde old doctours addresse thirde part shallbe aunswere vnto lord rochester reason argumentes scripture doctoures dissouled seconde part wyll clene confute god grace thirde booke howbeit cheefest byshop rochester disciple scripture hath perused hath maner nothing writte lord rochester sauing maketh selye soules pull helpe matter withall lord rochester rochester first patrone purgatory first patrone defender thys phantasie eue tooke worke lord rochester euen plucked rastell hys booke more lord rochester confirme hys sentence rekoneth vp doctor heape iohn william thomas omnes concerning doctor eyther none byshop rochester owne wordes el seldome mention made also among grecian euen vnto day purgatory beleued let read commentary olde grecian suppose shal finde eyther worde spoken el lordes wordes wonder obliuiousnes come vppon hym cleaueth vnto doctor whome affirmed frith eyther make mention el seldome notwythstanding declare somewhat doctor may better know theyr meaning speake doctor departed body purgatory maketh austen wholy v thinke ye austen dissenteth companion hierome hys owne master ambrose saint ambrose nay verely howbeit alleage theyr owne wordes iudge saint ambrose dissenteth austine doth stablysh hys sentence fully possible writeth second chapter hys booke called de bono mortis maner bringing word dauid psal aduena ego sum terra peregrinus sicut omnes patres dicit remitte mihi vt refrigerer priusquam abeam c straunger pilgrime earth father haue bene therfore pilgrime hasted vnto common countrey saintes requiring filthines receaued bodely mansion sinnes might forgeuen departed thys lyfe hath receaued forgeuenesse hys sinnes shall shall surely come vnto euerlasting life euerlasting lyfe forgeuenes sinnes therfore sayth forgeue may cooled depart may euidently perceaue ambrose knew purgatory forgeuenesse thys lyfe plainly affirmeth yt receaueth forgeuenesse hys sinnes thys life shall neuer come heauen vehement affirmation dubleth hys wordes saying hath receyued forgeuenesse hys sinnes shall shall surely meaneth shall neuer come heauen hath remission saint hieromes minde may sone saint hierome eccle gathered hys exposition ix chapter ecclesiastes vpon thys text dead haue part thys world worke done vnder sunne addeth suffrage prayer good dedes done dead vayne sainte hierome dead adde nothing vnto haue taken life neither good sinne exposition fully excluded kaye knowledge word god cleane shut vp scripture haue done nowe dayes also called kaye dauid whych shutteth man openeth openeth apoc man shutteth apoc two effectes worketh shutteth openeth hath nomination kayes yet sayd indeede one worde god thys kay kayes call wyll sith know meaneth christ deliuered vnto peter vnto hys apostle like shall easely perceaue marke geuen mat math onely promised yet geuen christ sayd geue thee kayes geue thee risen death performed hys promise gaue kayes indifferentlye thou mayst see ioh luke cap iohn luke christ gaue kayes peter rest bindest thou woorde god thou preachest mercy christ vnto repent open shut binde lose doost thou loose word god therfore preacheth woorde god neyther binde lose though call selfe pope contrarywise preacheth worde bindeth looseth well peter paule although called sir iohn countrey consequently say pope ca deliuer soule purgatory one vaine lie except proue goeth downe vnto pope deliuer soule purgatory earth rochester sayth third place hel earth thirde place hell therfore passeth bondes stretch hand purgatory text serue notwithstanding lorde content geue thys power onely hath farre waded pope power hath graunted full auctoritie deliuer men hell damned already sayth whosoeuer hath committed capitall crime rochester hath therby deserued damnation rochester place far beside himselfe yet may pope deliuer hym crime also fro payne due vnto affirmeth thre time xxj article feare forgetting vpon poynte litle reason frith lord wil make end pope may deliuer cryme hath committed also payne due vnto affirme may authoritie deliuer xx hundred thousand yea world sure shewe reason may deliuer let deliuer playne declaration ye pope tyranny euery man poynte death crime fro payne shall neuer man neither enter hell yet purgatory best dede charitablest euer hee dyd yea ought could although cost hym owne lyfe soule thereto moses exod rom paule geue exaple yet ieoperdy neither ca say wretched cruell tyraunt euer lyued euen sonne perdition woorthy bee damned hundred thousand helles haue receaued pope proude shamelesse tyranous antichrist power god hee may saue men yet wil suffer many damned report vnto selues hee worthy haue man would solute reason say may meete hym theyr paynes god iustice may satisfied say euasion nothyng worth neyther yet ca imagine way wherby may haue apparece escape lord sayth hym selfe pope must pacifie god iustice euery soule hee deliuereth purgatory therefore blasphemous pope deuils vicar hath imagined pope hath hys hand merites christes passio may apply pleasure also sayth merites christes passion sufficient redeme sinnes world sith merites part sufficiet satisfie ye iustice god redeme whole world also pope hath hand distribute pleasure lacketh euen pope distribution vnto saluatio world may pacifie god wrath satisfie hys iustice sayth lord applying merites lacke good workes pope wil god iustice may bee fully satisfied whole worlde saued hee may iustly easely saue whole world charitie also mouyng vnto yet apply merites pope sonne perdition worthy payne imagined rochester doctrine true frutefully faulte onely sonne perdition worthy payne imagined reason improued much stablished thinke ineuitable beholde pray whether lord rochester hath brought holy father auauncyng hys power high euen yt deepest pit hell lord sayd true impossible hym auoyde chaunceth vnto hym euen doth customably pryde raigneth whe hyghest fall downe headlong vnto vtter confusion ruine man feele himselfe greeued yet fully satisfied matter let write hys minde god grace shall make hym aunswere speede pray christen reader woord god may encrease amen p booke agaynst rastell named subsedye bulwarke first booke made iohn frithe prysoner tower neadeth christe reader thinke thou hast ouerread diligentlye pondered thine inward sens treatise iohn frith wherein confuteth reason rastel rochester made maintenance vpholding bitter paynes purgatory commende vnto thee thys briefe worke folowing named subsedy subsedy defence bulwarke defence bulwarke much le nedeth dehorte thee vayne childish feare forefather haue place purgatory theyr good woorkes day remayne vppon earth founded theyr thence deliueraunce testifie forasmuch thou art christen man reioysest christ dare boldlye affirme thee thou takest neyther pleasure ioy place like person much ioy made yt finding purgatory although small purpose triumphed late much ioy clapping handes sent tidinges partes purgatorye founde agayne read booke named institution christen man worde purgatory yet haue heard hetherto selfe person haue shewed token gladnes god woorde translated english seeme reioyce haue sely soules purged punishmentes departed haue purged worde god wil think haue vttered theyr harte concerning purgatory theyr tongue euen say theyr stomakes holy father pope whome may iustly call bishop rome seeing christ deuided peter paule head peter church may call head paules church london byshop london hath recouered agayne england old authority yea neuer yet lost finde theyr church cope rope bel beades lyke holinesse themselues long gownes shauen crownes finger annointed holy oyle idlenes say holy reliques declare byshop rome clarkly worde purgatory proueth place soules departure theyr body suffer paine punishmentes doth preaty pageant purgatory signifie prognosticate tragedye play hereafter word god shall blow scatter face earth darke cloudes mistes men inuentions shall scoure away yt rust fleshly vnderstanding scripture thing likewise hath done ought may found booke wherwith may resist thinges may picked fruite commonly hath come counsel conuocations synodes since apostle time excepted causeth somewhat feare wey good bad hath sprong perchaunce thinke lay people estate may well iustly say farewell one wyth maruayll haue bene child one father haue bene counsel haue bene sheepe haue gone sheepes clothing oft time greater part ouercommeth better thing gathered experience reading causeth oftentimes wishe would counted sinceere true minister gospell eyther might would cleane abstayne counselles haue part el would geue place fruites infidelitie meane man inuentions carnall interpretation fayth christ neuer begatte paule gaue peter hys colleague left table gentile went iewes facte peter iudgement paule might conueniently haue approued seeing peter entent would offed weake brother iewes wyth hys eating true sincere minister christ gospell may winke many thinges vsed dayes among disciple gospell much lesse may approue fashion theyr liuing confirme auctoritye defended one heresie yet shouldest thou haue three one iudgement opinion rochester men high dignitie thys worlde one byshop chauncelor noble realme england auncient yeares great wit singular erudition haue alledged vnperfeitly woude myne owne dartes euen one playeth tennes tossing balle agayne doe verye well admitte similitude notwithstanding know right well inough man playing tennes tosse balle agayne iohn frith semeth could pla well ten e must tosse take smite ouer agayne game great ieoberdy besides hee must take heede neither smite short line yet vnder losse bene better let goe finally sometyme man smiteth ouer thynketh yet vngracious post standeth way maketh ball rebounde backe againe ouer corde loseth game wil anger man assartayne ye haue tossed neuer ball ye offende one pointes maner sure many rastell maruell yong dare attempt dispute thys matter agaynst three person wordes frith sure many much maruell yong smal learning dare dispute matter c rastell leaueth wordes small learning put bewrayed himselfe thincke man mad say sayeth himselfe yong small learning shoulde prayse boaste hym selfe also immediatly wordes note modesty iohn frith hys first allegation say thys false contrary damne also shall reuoke mine hart c finally exhorted read booke aduertising speaketh wordes rather spoken wordes might well see entended boast selfe haue written left eue first page calleth wherin reporteth boast selfe notwithstanding one thing doth rastell sore vexe recite epistle paule wherby saith would haue men beleue spirite god thinke though young see vision espye truth haue made thys maner thou grauntest thy self yong small learnyng doost thou thinke shall read regard thy booke specially sith written auncient great wit dignity two pointes aunswer preuenting theyr learning bringeth therfore may despise youth first read doctrine bring therafter iudge proue enspyred haue spirite god timothie onely proue god may enspyre youth tymothe therefore ye ought first read condemne know enspyred vntill haue read theyr workes seene theyr factes thus may see wordes define youth enspired although may exhort thess man despise prophesies proue approue good make matter playne shall bring example paule hebrues hebr exhorteth hospitalitie men vnwares haue receaued angel harbour therefore vnmindfull paule exhorteth hospitalitie shewing meanes men haue receaued angel house argument paule affirmeth without spot blame wrinkle thereto say nay euen outwarde circumcision made iewes elect people child saluation doth outwarde baptisme make v faythfull member christ child god inwardly circumcised euen washed inwardly concupiscens thys worlde member christ paule affirmeth purged bloud agayne may know rastell knoweth none faith may stand maner sinne faith speak worketh charitie wherof paule speaketh gal haue thys fayth borne god sinne gallat iohn haue faith hope looke daily deliuerance thraldome body sinne meane season purify themselues iohn iohn pure man say
