list indeede neede make frende rastell helpe purgatory better hell shall neuer come heauen except repent walke innocently luke world christ little flocke haue euer done walke otherwyse none though weare miter little flocke smaller number belong christ greater purged rastels multitude neyther hell purgatory ordeyned euen hope continueth still sin ordayned heauen hell ordained faythfull folowers christ proue euen worde paule rastel rehearsed rom rom damnation christ iesu liue flesh rastell hath smitten ball quite vnder corde hath rastel taken owne trappe alleged shall condemne damnation somewhat slow perceauing matter shall reduce sillogismus manner damnation vnto maior christ iesu liue flesh spirite euery hell danation ergo hell christ iesu minor liue flesh spirite first figure made relarent profite thinke poore comos take babblyng onely satisfie mynde pleasure notwithstandyng one thyng must rastel falsyfieth scripture put remembraunce haue falsly translated text text hath coditional although contented take handes see could proue text sayth thus da nation christ iesu walke flesh sprite paul doth certifie christ iesu walke flesh cor galath spirite may gather paule walke spirit christ iesu say none christes although rastell call christen men therfore deare brethre looke man deceiue hym selfe christ yt minister sinnes deliuered fro sinne rom iohn phil pet christ must walke new conuersation life el still darknes remember haue precious treasure frayle britell earthy vessel let v therfore feare trembling worke health make stable vocation electio retayne rom truth knowledge god sinne vnrighteousnes shall shortly perceiue wrath god vppon v infinite delusion ende v shalbe woorse begynnyng awake therfore vnderstad health may see howe concludeth establyshe thys error hell seeing mine argument hell christ iesu paule rom viij doe conclude hel dampnation chryst iesu hys faythfull follower thinketh well folowe hell hell man hys seconde chapter also beginnyng third saythe deny hell suche feare god co maundements come hys probation nothyng sayd whych paul confyrmeth damp ton chryst iesu walke flesh sprite whych thorow chryste wythoute spotte wrynkle blame though rastel appeare hymselfe conclude lyke sage philosopher yet answer co cludeth lyke ignorante sophyster may see foloweth paule fryth say hel contrarywise foloweth heaue good euil hell good euill heauen rastelles chrysten men whych contynue styll synne ergo heauen deuil theyr father yet heauen chryste hys electe haue declared chrystes elect synners synners nowe bycause shoulde mistake tertes iohn whych alleaged wyll shew commyt synne whych dyd also fufficiently touch answer agaynst rastels dialoge euen two leaues fro ende yet wyll touche agayne bycause shall thyncke woulde leade ignorance darknesse two partes faythfull two partes man outwarde man inward man man whych rebell eche agaynste contynuall stryfe haue diuers name serypture one called inward man heart mynde wyll spryte called outward man rebellyous membres bodye synne fleshe faythfull man keepe contynuall warre allbeit one subdued taken prysonner yet neuer consenteth hys ennemy leaue neyther make peace wyth hym wyll laboure wyll call thynketh wyll helpe hym deliuered hys ennemie warreth vppon hym freshe tyme faithfull man brought knowledge god beleeueth chryst hath mynde renued spryte god consenteth lawe god good ryghteous holy beginneth loue lawe hath desire fulfill lawe god despyse hys heauenly father looke howe much loueth lawe countyng ryghtwise holye euen muche doth hate synne whych howe inward resisteth assaultes outward man lawe forbiddeth abhoreth hys heart inward man albeit outwarde man rebellious membres time beseege take hym captyue vnder synne yet doth inward man consent thys synne good lawe naught whych forbyddeth neyther dothe heart delighte thys synne neyther delyght suche synne bycause spirite god testyfieth vnto hym abhomynable syghte god fyghteth inwarde man agaynste outwarde wyth faythe prayer almose deedes fastyng laboureth faithful man feareth god displeasure subdue membres lamenting hath bene ouercome bycause feareth displease god hys father desyreth bloud hys sonne christe forgeue whych past hys diligence taketh tamyng hys membres recompece towards god sinne paste subdue fleshe yt synne thys rebellion paule rom saying dyd good thing rom whych would euill whych hated fulfil yt good lawe god hys hart inwarde man desyred dyd euill touchyng hys fleshe outwarde man whych hated synned hys outwarde man howe thys true committeth synne deuill god committeth synne paule god yes verely committeth synne wyth membres outwarde man yet sinned saythe doe thyng hate may comit sinne yet sinne doe synne dwelleth euen lykewyse faythfull folowers christ commit synne hate fortune entangled wyth synne doe paule saith synne dwelleth god hathe left exercise left yt philistians exercise nurtoure child israell remnauntes sinneremaineth oure outward membres exercise inward resisting sinne sinne fortune anye time looke aloft begin raigne sendeth crosse aduersitie sicknesse helpe suppresse thus shall long liue deade oure member rebell needeth neyther purgatorie anye crosse outwarde man turned vanitie inwarde iohn euer pure thorow beleeuing worde god neuer consented sinne needeth nother purgatorie world world come subduing outward man therfore lyfe shall neuer haue purgatorie marke well say reade againe shall reade shall vnderstande hathe eares let hym heare seconde erroure rastell layeth charge wold bring people belefe repentance man helpeth remission sinne prouing second error rastel taketh great paynes rastell almoste besydes hym selfe saith would make men frith beleeue forceth whether sinne brother rastel verely allege iohn rastelwold faine canel cannot tell paule erechiell hieremie quenche hotte fire purgatorie allege aucthorities proue good woorks whervnto answer nothing purpose prouyng good workes doth neither make purgatorie coulde haue alleaged textes entended selfe proue shoulde doe good woorkes neuer knewe christen man denie touchyng matter nothyng purpose well mighte haue improued bicause bryng textes proue father heaue god proue whych neuer manne doubted notwithstanding rastel indifferent eye spake sufficiently good woorkes argument hys dialoge let men read place iudge rastel taketh matter greeuously attempt allege howe iohn paul send v christ rastell adde know take away sinne christe adde worde therfore thinketh cleane destroy frith meane put away sinne christe repentance whereunto aunswere added thys woorde naught authoritie iohn saith walke lighte lyght haue felowship eche bloud iesu christe hys sonne purifyeth v fro sinne wherupon say v lyght hys bloud sufficient christen men whych continue still sinne walke darkenesse theyr father deuill muste meanes suche dwell lyght christ hys bloud onlye sufficiet founde else shall neuer enter kingdome heauen bicause short let rastell note fynde two manner repentance one without faith two maner repentance suche repentaunce iudas rastels christen men continue still sinne haue latter ende dothe rather purchace halter remission sinnes repentance foloweth iustification remissio sinnes florishing frute faith true repe tance florishing frute faith faith perceiue fauor kindnesse louing father hath shewed v sonne chryst iesu hathe reconcyled v vnto hymselfe bloude hys sonne begin loue hate body sinne lamet sory membres fraile fulfil lawe god mourning bewayling infirmitie causeth v abstaine bothe meat drinke worldly pleasure pure fasting pure fasting talke vnderstande thys repentaunce commeth purge sinnes comitted taketh occasyon sinnes committed knowe poyson remained oure sleshe seeketh meanes make v hate body sinne subdue wyth manner work god hathe appoynted entente time come displease god moste merciful father gentlenesse often pardoneth forgeueth v haue touched maner repentaunce finde scripture helpeth shoulde sinne rastell dreameth wot expresse vttermost meane repentace liuely declared example repentaunce marke example man build house dothe cost muche labor money haue layde sure foundation tempest commeth hys house dothe fall sory repente hathe foolishly bestowed money labor wtstanding thys great sorow repentance set vp house againe whych fallen taketh occasion ruine house teache owner witte againste time buildeth againe may make sure foundation euen though thou repent neuer much get remission sinnes past muste pardoned onely faithe christes bloude neuerthelesse dothe teache thee witte learne thee tame thy body subdue cast lowe foudacion time thou mayste better resiste assaultes deuill worlde fleshe doth frith teach repentaunce let worlde take chrystes sheepe doe heare voyce p third errour rastell layeth would make men beleue need penaunce satisfaction sinnes every childe may aunswer thys euer read perceaue wrote repentaunce take repentaunce sorow mourning followeth crime euen call penaunce good workes ensue repentaunce good woorks folow mortifie member good workes mortify membres exercise v god commaundementes sinne get remission sinne past call repentaunce yet neyther destroy sorowing sinne good workes falsly reporteth v teach ought done fruites fayth mortifie member profitable neighbour testinony vnto v good workes fruites fayth child heauenly father example say neither sunne moone iustiue v purchase remission sinnes yet woulde rastell say deny destroy sunne moone say without haue light without touching solution penaunce taking largest signification good workes taking paynes satisfaction sinnes must tell againe two manner satisfaction one god neighbour god two maner satisfaction world make satisfaction one crime insomuch euery grasse ground holy euer paule peter shoulde pray vnto god theyr life long one crime yet could make satisfaction onely bloud christ hath made ful satisfaction vnto god crime heb el hebr none remedye wee perish satisfaction neighbour haue offended satisfactio neighbour bound pacifie two agree lawes realme determine betweene v defamed bound pacifie hym restore hym hys good name againe haue murdered man lawes realme must dye pacifie neighbour common wealth yet sure rastell childish thincke thys ciuyle satisfaction verye satisfaction pacifieth god wrath breaking law thou murther man dye hundred time yet except thou haue satisfaction christes bloud thou shalt damned thereto spake teporall paine instituted god intent satisfye god wrath therby plaine booke rastell could see p fourth errour layeth agaynst would perswade people good work ar nothing auailable come fourthe errour rastell vntruly reporteth would persuade people good woorkes done man thys worlde nothing auayleable vnto doth hurt hindraunce vnto man though neuer none say iustifie god therfore thinketh men would vnderstand wisely doth argue thing auayleable must desire put hys spectacle looke agayne vppon booke shall finde woordes peraduenture good workes done thou wilt aunswere vnto shall good deedes aunswere yes thou wilt aunswere wherefore aunswere thou must god hath commaunded aunswere thou art lyuing thys worlde men hast conuersation therfore hath god appoynted thee thou shalt profite thy neighbour taming thy flesh paule testifieth ephe worke christ iesu ephes vnto good woorkes woorkes god hath prepared shoulde walke woorkes god would haue v vnfaithfull might see godly vertuous conuersation faythfull therby compelled glorifie father heauen math profitable vnto thy neighbour good workes profitable neighbour also testimony child god also testimony vnto thee man may know thou art right sonne thy heaue ly father christ vnto thy neighbour teacheth ought woorkes without hauyng respect eyther heauen hell attending charitie wealth neighbour c wonder rastell ashamed say would make beleue auaylable therfore good reader note wordes first say must god hath commauded auaylable keepe commaundements god secondaryly say profite neyghbour auaylable thirdly say tame flesh auailable fourthly say glory god auailable fiftly say testimony doth may know yt yt sonne god auaylable belyke rastell cou teth nothing auailable iustifieth god say sonne auaylable iustifieth fire auaylable eye bycause iustifieth c rastell sayth make wonder worke yt scripture alledgeth certaine textes yt ought good workes neuer denyed thereupon would conclude woorkes saue iustifie playeth ball lustly ouer corde god would stode post right way hytte full made ball reboud ouer agayne backward alledgyng purpose paule sayth ephe hath cleane lost game ephe wordes grace saued fayth iustified grace fayth whiche selues gift god gift god woorkes man glorifie hym selfe workes created god christ iesu whiche god hath prepared walke would haue latter ende text serue hys purpose whiche teacheth good workes neuer denyed hee bryngeth thyng whiche cleane confuteth opinio opinion place hath laboured proue saued good workes marke alledgeth paule grace saued fayth gift god workes man glorifie selfe paule saith plainly saluatio workes hath rastell cast rastell hath ouerthrowe hath built set vp built may likened shrewde cowe whiche hath geuen large messe milke turneth downe hele thus haue aunswered much rastels treatise could get whiche may come handes shall diligence disclose hys disceite god geue leaue keepe court hym shall wynne litle except conuey balles craftly yet truth say play euen hand maner man bound post well bestow play libertie may haue bookes necessary neither yet penne inke ne paper onely secretly continuall feare lefetenaut keeper lest espy thyng therfore litle meruell though woorke vnperfite soeuer heare ihon frith streightly kept keyes ryng doore strayte much coueyed way notable thyng bene mynde cleane lost therfore besech thee good reader count thyng borne season many cause haue perfeite forme shape pardon rudenes imperfection p finis iohn frithes iudgement vpon master william tracyes testament p iohn frith christian reader nothyng world firme stable godly may vndermined frowardlye wrested specially voyd charitie euident william tracyes testamet last left agaynst many men long continuaunce haue blasphemously barked whether godly zeale dasing brayne let iudge dare boldly professe godly sayinges vngodly led thyng iustly ascribe vnto ignoraunce vnto rancour vnto fury almost sayd conferred thing vnto rule charitie enuyeth whiche puffed vp whiche styrred vengeaunce thinketh none euill suffereth thing beleueth thyngs trusteth thing beareth thyngs would heddely haue codened thynges whiche might haue bene full deuoutly expounded howbeit haue onely attepted thyng haue proceeded vnto madnes haue taken vppon stryue dead folkes common iest euery ma mouth maker testament departed buryed tooke vp hys body burnt thing declared furye although felt fire therfore hubly require redoubted prince withall noble present assembly euen thyngs right depende iudgement euen would discret aduise cure disease ponderyng thynges equall ballaunce shall enormous facte looked vppon worthy correction condition common wealth shalbe quyet marke therefore thynges cruelly condemne master tracie name god amen william tracie todyngton countie gloceter esquier make testamet last hereafter foloweth c rest whiche testament shall fynde woorkes william tyndall fol iohn frith maruell somwhat improue mynde intoxicate nothyng note blacke coale yet may established testimony scripture fayth sure persuasion mynde god hys goodnesse towardes v wheras sure persuasion mynde doubtyng mistrust douteth like floude sea tossed wyndes caried violence let man thinke shal obtaine thing god ia therfore austen sayth doubt shalbe holy seede furthermore wheras looketh grace merites christ obtaine remission sinnes surely faythful saying worthy comended euen peter professed actes xv hee sayth vnto hym prophetes beare witnes name many beleue hym shall receiue remissio sinnes moreouer trusteth christ haue resurrectio body soule haue cause blame hym thus doth paule argue christ risen shall also ryse christ risen shall rise christ risen soule lest hell therfore shall also rise christ shall bryng hym immortall body soule cor therfore doth righteously godly deduce resurrectio christes father hath geue v thinges el gather woordes hee recount soule mortall whiche thyng iudgement suttelly gathered either truly charitably seyng neuer christen man euer thought paganes godly zeale brotherly loue whiche caused surmise good man would dreame thyng pray say soule doth verely rise christ rising filth sinne doth enter body new conuersation life whiche shall leade together without possibilitie sinnyng say also god certaine phrase scripture ariseth openeth vnto v hys power presence may say thing soule meane season semeth lye secret shal expresse vnto v christ power presence takyng agayne naturall body ye condemne thynges man receiue venome wordes except hee haue spyderous nature turne hony combe perilous poyson therfore let v looke residue master tracie touching wealth soule c frith heere onely cleaueth god hys mercye surely persuaded according testimony peter euer beleeueth hym thorowe hys name shall receyue remissyon synnes act paule also affirmeth euer trusteth shall cofounded ro denye thys moste true vnderstande fayth formed wyth hope charitie yt apostle calleth faith worketh charitie gal sith thing may expounded purely forsoothe vttereth owne enuie woulde otherwise wrest mynde maker thys testament touchyng addition particle wtout mannes worke woorkes seemeth respect vnto thys saying peter whych declareth none name vnder heauen geuen vnto men whych shoulde saued act besides paule committeth power sanctifying christ heb sayth bothe sanctifyeth say christe sanctified say faithfull one god surely labored precel eche loue charitie condempne innocent shoulde rather measure hys wordes rule charitie muche thyng first sight appeare wycked yet shoulde take best sense iudging wickedly oure brother referring secreate iudgemente vnto christe whych disceyued thoughe disceiued pretence charitie yet therein may reioyse therfore would lothe condempne innocent lette v passe thing see foloweth master tracie ground beleefe one god c frith looke sowerly good brother rather giue hym great thankes syth hathe opened vnto suche proper distinction whiche may escape scholasticall snare ma deserueth name mid dealer god became man make men god ca right called mid dealer betweene god man god man therefore sithe haue suche mid dealer poyntes hath proued infirmitie sauing sinne exalted aboue heauens sitteth right hande god hath thyngs obtayned nexte power vnto whose emperie thing depende lette v come wyth sure confidence vnto throne grace heb calleth peticioners whyche receyue grace able empresse power therof man dothe god distribute wyth hys finger say spirite god thorowe christe maruell angrye hathe done great pleasure howe doe ascribe condemnation rather vnto canonistes vnto deuines godly deuines wold neuer dote farre condemne proper saying peraduenture myght moue theyr pacience distribute portion hys goodes entent anye man say doe weale hys soule sore afraide youre market afraid ye haue salues inoughe souple sore ye knowe bounde vnder payne dampnation distribute goodes fashion holy father shreud cause co tinuing long penurie scant lefte theyr departing halfe pennie thou wilt peraduenture say shall suffer greenous paine purgatorie yet may queched lesse cost labor pope pardon ready hand bothe crime paine remytted verily plentie place canne scantly beleeue liueth anye man worth halfe peny sure pardones store thys man innumerable notwithstanding distribution necessitie vnto dampned profiteth nothing dampned sure saluation ye hot thys man hys goodes owne power shall giue reckoning vnto god vnto heere maye see howe light iudgement haue condempned thing nowe let v ponder residue master tracie touching burying body c frith hath offeded rehearseth nothing woords austine improue thinges reproue austine himselfe finde meanes allow austen charitably expound woordes admit fauour vnto brother especially seeing charitie requireth besides man deny thinges true although austines auctoritie reputation thinges great value god christ euill prouided martyres whose body commonly cast consumed fire wild beastes notwithstanding would afrayde say thing worse burning theyr body tearing peeces therefore charitable towards brother ponder woordes rather saint austines somewhat iustly tracie touching distribution temporall good purpose c frith man doubteth fayth roote tree quickning power good fruites spring therfore necessary fayth present el looke good workes vayne without fayth impossible please god heb insomuch austine called woorkes done fayth swift running way moreouer merite cannot properly ascribed vnto workes doth euangelist teach v saying whe ye haue done thing commaunded say vnprofitable seruaunts haue done duety luke saying doth maner feare v putting confidence workes glorious pride hygh minde excluded merite harke austine sayth death lorde merite without merite long mercifull lorde fayleth c death lorde profite except receaue fayth therfore rekoneth right wel faith christ merite meane fayth worketh charitie say fayth formed hope charitie dead historicall fayth deuils haue tremble iam furthermore austine iudgeth merite expresseth woordes marke psalme proud head receiue crowne sayth redeemed thy life corruption crowneth thee sayth psalme hereuppon woulde man say crowneth thee merites graunt vertue hath done haue deserued freely geuen geue care rather pleasure thine owne saying euery man lyer heare god sayth crowneth thee compassion mercy mercy crowneth thee compassion crowneth thee thou wast worthye shoulde call thee whome iustifie called thee whome shoulde glorifie iustifieth thee remnantes saued election grace fauour rom grace woorkes grace grace rom vnto hym worketh rewarde imputed grace duety rom apostle sayth grace duety crowneth thee compassion mercy thy merites haue proceeded god sayth vnto thee boult thy good merites thou shalte finde giftes righteousnesse god meaning righteousnesse whereby himselfe right wise righteousnes wherewith iustifieth whome maketh rightwise wicked austines wordes finallye let moue addeth good woorke maketh good man rather good man maketh woorke good man eyther good euyll euill good euill according christes testimonye rotten tree beareth good fruite math agayne sayeth howe say well seeing selues euill math good shall also bring foorth good fruite season howbeit fruite maketh man good except man first good bring foorth good fruite tree knowne fruite therfore fayth quickening roote must euer goe whyche wicked maketh v ryghtwise good thing workes coulde neuer bring passe thys fountayne spryng good woorkes iustifie v saye declare v verye rightwise god verely iustified roote fayth searcheth hart therefore iust iudge doth inwardly iustifie condemne geuing sentence according fayth men must looke woorkes theyr sight cannot enter hart therfore first geue iudgement woorkes many time deceaued vnder cloke hypocrisie may see nothyng good man may expounde well albeit child world wile deceiue selues enteryng presumptuously god iudgement seeke doubt none go ye therfore let charitie guide god charitie though lawyer hart would breake yet must needes iudge christe man saith nothyng scripture confirmeth verely iudgement cause came season eue vngraciously vnto canonistes cleane ignoraut scripture therfore condemne thinges read law wherfore renounce sentence appeale vnto deuines soone knowe voyce theyr shepheard gladly admitte thynges allowed scripture whereunto accustomed p finis p letter iohn frith wrote vnto faythfull folowers christes gospell whyles prisoner tower london worde god anno xxxij p grace peace god father sauiour christe iesu loue lord vnfaynedly amen bee expressed dearely beloued lord ioy comfort myhart perceiue woorde god hath wrought continually worketh among finde iohn smal number walkyng yt wayes lord accordyng gaue v iohn commaundement willyng loue ech loued v haue experience fayth testifie rom without simulation ye loue word toung onely worke veritie iohn triall faythfull hart aduenture onely ayde succour meanes whiche without daunger may admitted vnto v also personally visite poore oppressed see nothyng lackyng vnto haue ghostly comfort bodely sustenaunce notwith stadyng strayte inhibition terrible manacyng worldly ruler euen ready abyde extreme ieoperdies tyrauts imagine euidence haue prepared selues crosse christ accordyng vnto councell wise man sayth sonne thou shalt enter way lord prepare thy selfe vnto tribulation euidence ye haue cast accomptes haue wherewith finish tower ye haue begon builde doubt luke whiche hath begon worke shall glory acco plish phil eue vnto commyng lord shal giue vnto euery man accordyng deedes albeit god secret iudgementes rom time keepe rod ensue steppe yet let surely reken vppon doubt whiche deuoutly lyue christ must suffer ti persecution lord loueth heb correcteth scourgeth euery child receaueth child father chastiseth ye vnder correction partaker ye bastardes child neuertheles may suppose louyng father reioiseth bloud punishment doth singular profite may partaker holynes remnaunt sinne whiche frayltie mebers rebell agaynst spirite causing workes go vnparfectly forwardes may somedel suppressed lest subdue v reigne ouer v haue sufficiently declared epistle booke whiche intreateth purgatory remit desire instructed matter thynges god geuen speculation hath pleased hym put vre practise vpon euer thought yet doe thinke walke god word would cost life one tyme albeit kynges grace take fauour suffer bloudy edomites haue pleasure vpon yet thinke escaped god hath onely differred season intent woorke somewhat hath appointed vse vnto glory beseche faythfull follower lord arme selues supposition markyng selues signe crosse crosse superstitious multitude doth rather crosse token euer readye willingly receaue crosse shall please god lay vpon day cometh counte cleare wonne geuyng thankes lord hath kept commeth shall nothing dismay new thing eue ye haue continually looked cor doubt god faythfull shall suffer tempted aboue ye able beare shall euer send occasion ye shall stand stedfast either shall blind eye enemy diminish theyr tyrannous power el hath suffred theyr best dragon hath cast whole floudde water shall cause euen earth open hir mouth swalow vp apoc faith full careful ease v time vexation heauy v shall send ioseph ye shall come egypt yea shal prouide ye shall haue hundred father one hudred mother one hundred house one thys lyfe haue proued experience marke life euerlasting ioy wyth christ sauiour withstandyng sith stedfastnes commeth selues austen sayth neuer man weake frayle greatest offender euer lyued euery man hys owne nature frayle committe great enormity except kept spirite power god beseche brother lord iesu christe loue hys rom spirite pray may vessel laude prayse tyme soeuer pleaseth hym call vpon v ephe father glory giue v spirite wisedome vnderstandyng knowledge lighten eye mynde may know hys wayes praysing lord eternally please brother write vnto v doubtes peraduenture may founde bookes acceptable vnto v trust vnfrutefull endeuour selfe satisfie poyntes god grace committe gouerned defended euer amen iohn frith prisoner iesu christ tymes abydyng pleasure treatise made sayd iohn frith while prisoner tower london anno xxxij called myrrour glasse know thy selfe desired faith full frende much bound might lawfully haue commaunded would make litle treatise might somewhat instructed knowe himselfe geue god thanckes benefites hath aboundantly poured vpon thing tooke vpon gladly partly fulfill right wise request trust shall great profite christes flocke partly declare thinke selfe herein may men see haue receaued god ought bestow talent co mitted vnto note well cause say wise man salomon vaiuersa vanitas omnis homo viuens euery eccle liuing nothing vanitie also prophet dauid confirmeth psal saying men liuing pondered one ballance vanitie hanged ballaunce agaynst eccle quite way downe heauier example man prayse foole thinke note witte good profounde person deede foole eue uth doth prayse commende rich honour beautie strength vaine transitorie thing dreame vanishe lyke flower fielde man shoulde haue moste neede foloweth well hymselfe vayne thyngs whych vanitie possyble thou shuldest haue al thing hundreth yeare continually wythout trouble aduersitie neuer man yet vaine dreame compared vnto euerlasting lyfe whych prepared christes electe faythfull follower flesh hay hys glory lyke flower hay witheredesay flower fallen god worde endure euer heb let wyse man reioyse wisedom neither ye strong man hys strengthe ryche hys rich reioyseth let hym reioyse lord whome honor praise without end amen first chapter goodnesse commeth god c ourselues philosopher god enspired ro truthe knowledged ch poynte wisdome direction mannes lyfe know hym selfe whych sentence scrypture establysheth clerely man may dissent truthe salomon saythe feare prouer lord beginning wisedome nowe feare lorde knoweth himselfe scripture teacheth perceiue rom imperfection nature subiect vnto corruption voide stablenesse perceiue rom math vnstablenesse flesh prone synne rebellyous rightwysenesse dwelleth goodnesse perceiue poyson old serpent hell synne whych lyeth hidde wythin vnto whych prepared paine intollerable shall haue none occasion feare god rather aduaunce selfe equall yth god esay daniell actes lucifer nabuchodonozor herode haue done sore chastened theyr follye hast thou vain man wherof thou maiste reioyse scrypture testifieth euery good persecte gifte commeth aboue father lyght wyth whome rom transmutation whether outward giftes inward pertaining eyther body soule good come aboue father lyght thou behold math proportion thy body stature beauty thou shalt easily perceiue cometh god euen word christe whych exhorteth v carefull none v math thoughe neuer carefull adde one stature eyther make one white heare blacke touching wisedome eloquence long lyfe victory glory scripture testifieth come god oure selues iames saythe iames lacke wisedom let hym aske god giueth abundantly euident salomon whych god desired wisedome iudge betweene kinge good euill lorde made hym aunswere asked thing long lyfe ryches destruction hys ennemyes rather wisedom discerne iudgement behold haue geuen vnto thee heart full wisedome vnderstanding muche none thee hathe bene like vnto thee neyther yet thee shall like vnto thee besides haue giuen thee rich glory furthermore moste gloryous giftes concerning oure soules come god euen meere mercye fauoure whych sheweth v christ christ predestination election vocatio iustification albeit wyth hys painted more miste poetrie craftye conueyance doe cast miste eye might wander oute right way endeuoring hym selfe instructe god hathe predestinate chosen v beginnyng worlde knewe good workes yet set vpon cadel shall shine bright clerely dispel mist vaine poetrie shall plainely perceiue hym daunsing naked nette whiche notwithstanding thinketh daunsing net thinketh hym selfe inuisible iohn himselfe go inuisible although scripture inoughe bothe tit rom proue true yet wil let passe alleage austine candell speake whiche shall disclose hys iuggling vtter hys ignorance austine saythe man affirme god dyd chuse v sawe good workes christ sayeth sayeth ye haue chosen haue chose sayeth chosen v sawe shoulde doe good woorkes shoulde also haue seene firste haue chosen hym contrary woordes christ minde euangeliste heere may see howe euidently austine confuteth more poetrie openeth hys serpentine deceite finally paule saythe ephes ephe saued thorowe grace commeth oure selues gifte god commeth workes least man boste word might ashamed heare lucian neither regarding god man austine addeth thus much vnto non erit gratia vllo modo nisi fuerit gratuita omni modo say ca wise grace fauoure except alwayes free therfore may conclude neyther workes going work comming free fauor god thys sure yt whome soeuer chuseth saueth mercy whome repelleth secrete vnsearchable iudgement condemneth chuseth one repelleth enquire saythe austine thou wilte erre muche paule coulde attaine rom knowledge therof cried oute depth rich wisedome knowledge god howe vnsearchable hys iudgementes incomprehensible way leuer loude lye farre erre let god alone hys secretes acknowledge hys ignorance thing shorte paule saythe hast thou thou hast receiued thou hast receiued whye dost thou auaunce thy selfe though thou hadst receiued may conclude goodnesse commeth god sinne mischeefe oure owne poysoned nature muche may say prophet daniel tibi domine gloria nobis autem confusio faciei lord glory vnto thee vnto v shame cofusion reioyseth may cor reioyse lord second chapiter intent god geueth v giftes rather charge carefull burthen pleasure reioyce like many member oure body euery member cor hathe offyce appoynted vnto hym must doe hys owne wealth sauegard preseruation whole body muche moste honest member must serue vilest necessitie hande woulde serue lowe belly bothe perishe together euen hathe god appoynted giftes distributed world vnto v whych shoulde one body euery nation hathe neede euery occupation neede euery man neede hys neighboure plain denyed neuerthelesse specially touche matter woulde haue rooted might endeuoure youre selues fulfill towards eche god haue opened eye thy mynde haue geuen thee spirituall wisedome thorough knowledge word boast thy selfe rather feare tremble chargeable office committed vnto thee whiche thou fulfill lyke cost thee thy life one tyme much trouble persecution thou fulfill shal office thy damnation cor paule sayth wo preach prophet ezechiel ezech god saith say vnto wicked shall dye death thou shew hym wicked shall dye iniquitie shal require bloud thy hand peraduenture diuines would expounde textes onely vpon sent haue cure soules wherunto answere euery man whiche hath light god worde reuelated vnto hym sent soeuer seeth necessitie hath cure neighbour soule example god haue geuen sight perceiue blynde man goyng way ready lacke sight fall pytte wherein lyke perish bounde god commaundement guide hym till hee past ieopardy el perish might haue deliuered hym bloud shalbe required hand lykewise perceiue neighbour lyke perish lacke christes doctrine boud instruct hym knowledge god hath geuen mee el hys bloud shalbe required hand paraduenture say ready one appoynted obiection watch pitte therefore man fall shall make good therfore discharged neede take thought wherunto aunswere would glad solution notwithstandyng perceaue watchman sleepe runne yt ale house make good cheare gone countrey whorehunting thorough necligence espy neighbour daunger pitte neuerthelesse bounde leade hym thinke god hath sent tyme saue soule fro perishyng law god nature byndeth therto chargeth loue neighbour selfe doe vnto hym would done thinke case would haue hys neighbour helpe hym therfore math bound helpe neighbour lyke ieopardy euen thus art thou bound geue good counsell hym lacketh distribute soeuer talent thou hast receiued god vnto profite thy neighbour moreouer besides ye auoyde solution yet desire note text selfe alleged doth condemne vayne obiection wordes ezech iij say vnto wicked shall dye death thou shewe wicked shall die iniquitie shall require bloud thy hande marke pray prophet saith obiect shewe wicked iniquitie doth shall perish wicked hym selfe saued bicause faut told take charge teach contrarywise ye wicked shall perishe iniquitie saith god prophet ezechiel bloud shall required hand haue instructed truthe god haue geuen thee faythe rom christes bloude proude feare sith god hathe spared naturall braunches meane pet iewes hys elect people sith spared angel sinned hath cast hell reserued vnto iudgement sithe spared olde worlde ouerwhelmed water deliueryng noe preacher righteousnes take heede lest also spare thee truth fayth present sinne imputed faith thy power gift god therfore thou cor vnkynde endeuour thy selfe walke innocently bryng forth fruites fayth feared thyne vnkyndnesse god math take thee hyer vyneyard whiche shall restore fruite due seaso shall thyne end worse thy begynnyng let v therfore feare tremblyng seeke health make stable vocation electio math math phil pet mortifiyng member man sinne exercising selues christes preceptes may child father heauen felow heyers sauiour brother christ iesu god haue geuen thee rich math thou mayst thincke hath committed vnto thee thine owne vse hath made thee stuard ouer destribute profite commontie indeede thou art verye owner god owner whiche sayth prophet agge golde mine siluer agge mine hath committed ceason thy hande see whether thou wilt faythfull distributing thys wicked mammon according luke commaundementes thou mayst well note parable riche man whych clothed silke fared delicately worlde buryed hell wheruppon gregory noteth damned despoiled man distribute yt processe text doth also well declare wherefore must geue accompts geue v haue litle cause glory rather feare tremble count happy least committed god accomptes must made deluded although world may blinded god haue geuen thee thy perfite limmes member gette occupation woorke wyth thyne owne handes thy member whole perfite may minister theyr necessitie lacke theyr member acceptable sight god contrarye detestable thou withdraw thy member ayding thy neighboures thou shalt god recounted theefe murtherer therfore affirme holy hypocrite idle bellyed monkes chanons priestes whether regulare seculare laboure preache god woorde theeues also murtherers maintaine strong member idlenesse ought labour profite theyr neyghboures theyr perfite member might minister vnto necessitie lacke theyr member eye must minister fruite sight vnto feete handes member lacke el ieoperdie perishe euery pit eye giltie destrution withdrawing office may establish wordes paule sayth ephes dyd steale let hym steale rather laboure wyth hys owne handes may haue distribute lacke doctoures well expounde certaine person walked inordinately would worke themselues though sturdye lubber liued men charitie thing apostle calleth theft exhorteth woorke theyr hand may helpe themselues person feele selues greeued giltie content allow exposition alledge text wise man shall onely allow sentence also bite better sayth panis egentium vita pauperis eccl est qui autem defraudat eum homo sanguinis est say bread needy life poore defraudeth murtherer text holdeth nose hard grindstone clean disfigureth theyr face proueth byshops abbotes spirituall possessionaries double theues murtherers concerning body besides murdering soule lacke god worde neyther preache suffer doe purely persecute put vnto cruell death firste theeues murtherers distribute appoynted faythfull forefather entent haue bene ministred vnto poore seemed vertuous bestow vpon hawkes houndes horse c vpon gorgious apparell delicate fare glad yt poore whe may get scrappes may haue much pigge sow scant fether goose may dispend foure v thousand markes yeare would thinke much gaue xx noble vnto poore notwythstanding owner vnder god together minister lyuyng deduct apostle sayth hauing theyr foode clothes couer ought therewith content tim thus defraude poor theyr bread theeues bread theyr life aforesayd text testifieth defraudeth hym onely theefe also murtherer thinke bestow well bestowe buildyng haue goodnesse sith goodnesse commeth hym muste agayne thanckefull vnto keepe hys commaundements el may feare least take hys gift v shall receiue greater dampnation thou haue receiued knowledge hys woord geue hym thanks faithful minister thereof else shall deliuer thee vnto thyne owne fantasticall imagination cast thee headlong heape heresy shall bring thee vtter destruction geue thee faith hys worde geue thanks bring forth fruites therof due season el take away thee sende thee finall desperation geue thee rich geue hym thankes distribute according god commaundement else shall take thee loue thee either theeues water death thy cattell blasting thy fruites scourge cause thee loue hym wolde esai ierem alienate thine heart say wil loue thee make thee put thine whole trust transitorie thing ier hate thee sende thee great prosperitie encrease plenteously geue thee thy heauen thys worlde vnto thine euerlasting dampnation lyfe come therefore feare take good heede while thou hast leasure thou aske honoure praise thankes answere honor praise thankes nothing el fulfilling hys commaudementes thou aske commaundementes touching bestowing thy goodes answer comaundemets thou bestowe woorkes mercye shall laye thy charge daye iudgement shal aske whether haue fedde hungrie geuen drinke thirstie whether haue builded abbayes chauntries shall aske whether haue harbored harborlesse clothed naked whether haue gilded image geuen cope church shall aske whether haue visited sicke gone prisoner whether haue gone pilgrimage walsingham canterburye thys affirme vnto thee thou builde thousand cloister giue many cope chalice church visitest pilgrimage worlde espiest seest poore man whome thou mightest help perishing lack one grote thing whereon thou hast bestowed muche money shall able helpe thee therefore take good heede say ye warned god haue geuen thee thy perfite limmes member geue thankes vse tamyng thy body profite thy neighbour el god loue thee send thee mayne mischief take thee thy negligence none vsing extremely imputed vnto thee hate thee shal keepe whole sounde thee none vsing may thy greater damnation therfore beware feare geuing thankes according hys adam fall v vnfaythfull angrie enuious couetous slouthfull proud vngodly suche v wherewith oure nature venemed ought withall diligence cutte mortifie may daily pacient liberall mercifull according onely fayth thou baptised thousad time water haue fayth auayleth thee towardes god doth goose ducketh selfe vnder water therefore thou wilt obtaine profite baptisme thou must haue fayth thou must bee surely persuaded thou art newly borne agayne water onely water holy ghost iohn iij thou art become ye iohn child god thy sinnes imputed thee forgeue ye bloud passion christ according vnto promise god great cause sacramet baptisme shold bee great reuerence price much reuerence commauded god done beside outward signe witnesse vnto cogregation inuisible promise geuen grace vnto euery priuate man doth congregation receiue hym openly couted one first receiued faith grace promise putteth v also remembrauce aduertising kyndnesse god promise baptisme may learne dye mortifie rebellyng member otherwise gyueth grace nether hath secret vertue haue sufficiently proued therfore sore blame vnaduisedly condemneth infates iudgyng brother god hand yea peraduenture baptised christes bloud god election vnknowen man endeuour selfe ouerthrow vtterly put second errour whiche hath long raigned seduced many strongly sticke vnto weake ceremony concerning ceremony baptisme yea must behaue selues wisely charitie teacheth v seekyng profite many may saued must co sider sundry sortes haue conuersation withall diuersly affected haue conuersation men world part know god young weake peruerse stiffenecked obdurate vnto young ceremony although noysome vnto fayth contrary word god yet hard finde good expedient ceremony sortes guide vnto knowledge god milke leade young tenderly perfite knowledge god second sort weake vnto thynges behoueth v haue respect beare infirmity charitie sake actes xv dyd paule circumcise timothe yea sake hee actes leuer captiue libertie neuer eate flesh drinke wyne offende one thyrde kynd men perfite meane perfit cleane without sinne hauyng remnauntes old ada assailyng none onely christ call perfection man perfite haue perfit knowledge vse thynges whiche know soeuer entreth belly deff eth man know math thynges pure vnto pure tit whiche know tit eate nothyng better eate nothyng worse cor cor free betwene god consciece may vse thinges howbeit weake conscience eyther breaking auncient custome neglecting ceremony offended cor yet bounde cocernyng neighbour whiche weake hath knowledge yea bound vnder payne sinne abstaine wou dyng coscience sinneth god woundeth man consciece cor fourth kynde selfe willed obstinate put confidence indifferent thynges thinke needefull vnto saluation obstinate put trust thinges needefull saluation must resisted ought resist face yeld inche vnto paule geueth v example would theyr pleasure circumcise titus vtterly resisted theyr obdurate ignoraunce thou make diuisio thou shalt know behaue thy selfe towardes men meete shewe thee whiche ceremony baptisme ceremony baptisme easly expressed thou know substaunce apostle ministred may haue better expressed actes viij philip baptised eunuch actes chamberlaine queene cadace eunuch knowledge iesus sonne god signe fayth desired baptisme phillip philip apostle vsed many outward ceremony baptisme papistes doe next water came washed hym name father sonne holy ghost man deny baptisme full good yet neither fonte holy water candle creame oyle salt godfather godmother popatrie wherfore may coclude thinges ceremonyes say exterior thynges whiche make baptisme neither better worse myte thus say haue ceremony want iudgemet disanulled noysome fayth feare offending weake onely thou mayest know vse indifferent put confidece hurte vnquiet conscience thorowe negligence otherwise thinge vndone shoulde occasion plucke v christe institute meane bring v vnto therfore seniours minister minister must circumspect v abuse ceremony congregation ought instructe flockes take thinges indifferent neyther saue damne whether done vndone perceyue people cleaue sore ought seeke tyme conuenient abrogate alter ceremony elles escape wrath god seeke health ceremony fallen grace treade vnder theyr te bloude christ vnto condemnation theyr bloude shal required hades better haue instructed concerning abrogation alteration ceremony haue godly ensample sabaoth sabaoth instituted comau ded god kept chyldren exod deut israel notwithstanding signe ceremony signifie vnto god sanctified spirit themselues wyth theyr holy workes also ceremony shadowes ceased whe exod christ came might done left vndone indifferetly sabaoth abrogated feare superstition forefather beginning church abrogate thys sabaoth entent might haue ensample christe libertie might know neyther keepyng saboth day necessary according paule ye obserue dayes gallat tymes monethes afrayde haue laboured vayne towardes howbeit necessary day reserued people might come together heare worde god ordayned stede ye sabbaoth saterday next day folowing sonday although myght haue kept sabaoth kept sonday saterday wyth iewes thyng indifferent yet much better ouerset day perpetuall memory free bounde day may lawful workes pleasure god profite neighbour maner supersticious saterday ye much madder iewes haue word god theyr saterdaye sithe seuenth daye commaunded keepe seueth day solempne haue word god v rather agaynst v keepe seuenth day ye iewes first commaunded god lawe paule byddeth man iudge v concernyng holy day meates exteryour thyngs yea coll wise obserue countyng holy dayes institute people come together heare god worde receyue sacramentes geue god thankes done may returne vnto house businesse aswell day thinketh man sinneth worketh holy daye weake ignoraunt ought better instruct leaue holde obstinate perseuer hys sentence god deuill maketh sinne god leaueth free accordyng thys ensample would ceremony altered haue sayd people seeke health vilany christes bloude concerning godfather godmother promise theyr godchild shall mortifie roote sinne springeth body subdue theyr lustes vnder lawe god promise also instructe bryng vp theyr godchild fayth christ office pertayneth vnto theyr parentes comaunded god teach child parentes exod deut either alone least ye chiefest godfather dayes father may suffered know thing themselues shoulde instruct child keepe scripture word god beare hand heresie ala long wyll lacke vnderstanding perceyue yet would keepe darcknes shoulde espye theyr priuy practise sleightly conueyaunce mad blessed worde made euill good make good euyll thynke thys holsome medicine healeth infirmity chauged nature poyson ye simple childishe surmise godly doctrine discloseth hipocrisie confoundeth heresy make erre fall heresy pray god geue eye see eares heare open harte may perceyue pleasure surely ignorauncie shall excuse ezechiell ezech speakyng person god sayth vnto ye curate thou sonne haue made thee ouersear vnto ye house israel thou shalt heare worde mouth shalt shewe say vnto wicked thou shalt surely die thou shew hym exhort turn fro wicked way may lyue shall dye wickednes require bloude thy hande yea righteous turn righteousnes iniquitie shall die although thou shewe hym shall die hys sin wyll require bloude thy hand take hede curate vnto charge let man excuse himselfe thorough ignoraunce finis antithesis wherin compared together christes actes pope gathered iohn frith annexed vnto reuelation antichrist translated p antithesis haue annexed christen reader vnto end reuelatio little treatise maner epitome minister iustice whose ende shalbe accordyng workes christen men marke flye away serue christ owne bellyes sweete preachynges flattering wordes deceaue harte innocetes euen iannes iambres timb exod withstode moses euen resiste truth men corrupt myndes lewed concernyng fayth shall preuayle lenger madnesse shalbe vttered vnto thus people blynded fallyng vnbelefe deceaued thorough sleghty forth fruite approueth ye tree good although seeme dead vnto v tree fayth mother good workes euer worketh charitie seeth occasion pope byshops say fruite maketh tree good cleane contrary scripture sacrament body bloud christ article fayth necessary beleued vnder payne damnation declared christ naturall body euen myne sauyng sinne could bee two place myne ca thirdly shewed necessarie wordes vnderstand sound might phrase scripture innumerable shewed certaine phrase maner speakynges well vsed english toung finally recited maner might receiue according christes institutio fearyng froward alteration priest vse contrary first forme institution sufficiently published occasio moued iohn frith write sacrament mynde hee desired entitle sume wordes write hym seemed ouerlong well reteined memorie albeit loth take matter hand yet fulfill instant intercession tooke vpon touche terrible tragedie wrote treatise whiche beside paynfull imprisonmet like purchase cruell death ready glad receiue spirite inward man although fleshe frayle soeuer shall please god lay vpon notwithsta dyng say truth wrote intet haue ben published would haue touched matter earnestly haue written well spirituall eating drinking necessitie dyd carnall necessarie treatise made expedient men albeit sufficient tooke hand instruct knew spirituall necessarie eatyng spirituall eatyng sacrament fayth drinkyng body bloud receiued teth bellye eares faith onely neded instructio outward eating whiche thing therfore onely declared comon abroad many me mouthes much whiche late hath busied hym selfe medle matter zeale define hath sore labored confute thinke ashamed part cause doth diligently suppresse woorke whiche printed selfe saw worke print lord winchester house vpon stephen day last past neither neither fredes could make might attaine copie onely one written copie whiche seemed drawen great hast notwithstandyng well iudge cause bee boke kept secret right sure neuer touched foundation treatise builded vpon therefore sith foundation standeth sure inuincible el thinke verely would sore haue laboured haue vndermined thereupon builde litle also declare ordinauce slender breake downe although set vppon woorse foundation p foundation litle treatise article fayth necessary beleued vnder payne damnation sacrament naturall body christ thyng proued maner firste must acknowledge sacrament naturall body christ article fayth necessary beleued vpon payne damnation article fayth saue v bound beleue vnder paine eternal damnation beleue hys naturall body flesh bloud naturally bread wine saue seyng many beleue receiue damnation presence bread saue presence hart faith bloud hath washed sinnes pacified yt father wrath toward agayne doe beleue bodely presence bread wyne shall damne absence hart thorough vnbelefe would obiect obiection though truth absece bread could damne v yet bounde beleue god word beleueth much lyeth maketh god lyer therfore obstinate mynde beleue hys word may occasion damnation may answere solution beleue god worde knowledge true dissent whether true sence take sence ye take say agayne though ye haue appeareth vnto euident wordes christ therefore consiste barke letter yet compelled conferring scripture together within letter searche mynde sauiour spake wordes say thirdly obstinate mynde defendeth cause obstinately obstinate defendyng cause worthy reprehention whether true false euer reprehended satisfie coscieces co pelled place scripture reason doctours iudge euen ought iudge partie defende sentence obstinacie ye reason foundation iohn frithes first treatise vppon sacrament scripture cause take ought nether partie dispise eche seeketh glory god true vndersta ding scripture foundation first treatise hath left vnshake great argumet true el hys pregnant wit could haue passed cleane ouer would haue assayled sophisticall cauillation hys painted poetrie might haue coulered lest might make ye ignoraunt appearance truth hath done agaynst residue first treatise neuerthelesse true shall proued first none article fayth necessary beleued vnder payne damnation may thus bee confirmed article fayth beleue naturall body christ fayth shall saue v whiche saued olde father christes incarnation bounde vnder payne damnation beleeue pointe therefore shall followe bounde therto vnder payne damnation firste part myne argument proued agustine ad durdamu dare boldly say almost c place thinke propositio doth ofte inculcate fayth saued v saued father second part manifest fayth saueth v saued father needeth probation coulde beleue ye thyng neuer saide done without word could haue fayth vppon truth two party must conclusion nedes folow notwithstanding dyd eate christes bodye dranke hys bloud spiritually although ad hym present teeth ye spirituall eating fayth body bloud saued well soone forefather adam transgressed adam god precept fallen vnder condemnation mercyfull father hys gracious fauour gaue hym promise health comfort whereby many beleued saued thrauldome transgression worde promise shal put enmitie betwene thee woman betwene thy seede seede seede shall gene treade thee head thou shalt treade hele thys promise knowledge christe become seede sonne woman shoulde destroye deuill power deliuer faythfull sinnes sayde deuyll treade hele vnderstoode right well deuyll finde meanes wyles wicked minister put christ death knew god true would fulfill hys promise vnto hartely longed seede eate body drinke bloud knowledging father eate body christ dronke bloud wyth infinite thankes christ sinnes take perfect thinges shoulde chaunce hym playnely reuelated vnto albeit dead many hu dred yeares actually fulfilled reuelated vnto ye world fayth saued yet neuer eate fleshe teeth neuer beleued bread shoulde bodye wyne hys bloud therfore sith also saued without fayth ye fayth shall saue v saued hym thinke shall also saued spirituall eating drinkyng christ shall saue v eate spiritually dyd although wee neuer beleue bread body furthermore mercifull moses whiche brought child israell egypt wildernes obtayned god prayer manna heaue feede people also water stone refreshe comfort manna water euen manna israelite sacramet v thyng vnto bread wyne v saint austen sayeth quicun que manna christum intellexerunt eundem quem no cibum spiritualem manducauerunt august de vtilitate poenicentiaequicunque autem de mana solam saturitatemque sinerunt manducabant mortui sunt sic etiam eunde potu petra enim erat christus say many manna vnderstoode christ eate spirituall meate doe many fought onely fill belly manna father vnfaythfull eate dead likewise drinke stone christ may gather austen manna vnto ye bread v likewise water wyne v whiche anone shall appeare playnly aug super ioan tract austen sayth manducauit moses manna maducauit aaron manducauit phinees manducauerunt ibi multi qui deo placuerut mortui non sunt quare quia visibilem cibum spiritualiter intellexerunt spiritualiter esurierunt spiritualiter gustauerunt vt spiritualiter satiarentur omnes eandem escam spiritualem manducauerunt omnes eudem potum spiritualem biberunt spiritualem vti que eandem nam corporalem alteram quia illi manna no aliud spiritualem vero eandem quam no vt omnes eundem potum spiritualem biberunt aliud illi aliud no sed specie visibili quod tamen hoc idem significaret virtute spirituali quomodo eundem potum bibebant inquit apostolusa goodly saying augustine de spirituali sequenti petra petra autem erat christus say moses also dyd eate manna aaron phinees dyd eate many dyd eate whiche pleased god dead wherefore vnderstode visible meate spiritually spiritually hungred tasted spiritually might spiritually replenished dyd eate ye spirituall meate dranke spirituall drinke euen spirituall meate albeit bodely meate dyd eate manna eate thyng dyd eate spirituall dyd drinke spirituall drinke drake one thyng outward apparence neuerthelesse dyd signifie thyng spiritually dranke drinke sayth apostle dranke ye spirituall stone folowyng stone christ thereunto beda added wordesbeda suter cor videte autem fide manente signa variata say beholde signes altered yet fayth abydeth one place may playnly perceiue onely article necessary beleued vnder payne damnation seyng old father neuer beleued yet dyd eate christ fayth manna expresly manna lesse frute manna ceassed eate sacramet fayth spiritually eate body christ cand albeit manna sacrament v eate euen spirituall meate yet neuer mad beleue manna chaunged christes owne naturall body vnderstode spiritually outward man dyd eate materiall manna comforted body dyd inward man thorough fayth eate body christ beleuyng manna came heauen comforted bodyes sauiour christ promised god ye father come downe heauen strength soules euerlastyng life redeming sinne death resurrection cause accompt sacramet christes naturall body grosse imaginatioand likewise eate christ fayth come sacrament expressely ye sacrament lesse fruite haue receaued sacramet neede make naturall body manna might much better vnderstand spiritually outwarde man doth eate materiall breade comforteth bodie doth inwarde man fayth eate bodye christe beleuyng bread broken christes bodye broken crosse sinnes whiche comforteth soules vnto life euerlasting ye fayth saue without beleuyng manna altered bodie euen doth thys fayth saue v although beleue substaunce bread turned hys naturall bodye fayth shall saue v saued bound beleue vpo payne da natio father beleuedand bound beleue vnder payne damnation bound beleue beleued god father almighty maker heauen earth beleue christe sonne god beleue shoulde take nature vyrgingene beleued suffer death deliueraunce psal esay acte thyng signified sacrifice besides testified euery prophet verely one excuse beleue pointes contayned scripture although vndoubted verity yet may saued without case neuer heard heare vnderstand comprehed feare vnderstad yet reason texte misconstrue bohemes must beleue matter haue eyen see austen sayth old father differ touchyng ye bodely meate dyd eate manna bread albeit varyed ye outward appearaunce yet neuerthelesse spiritually dyd signifie one thyng manna bread signifie christ eate one spiritual meate say eate thing signifieth representeth vnto v one spirituall meate soules whiche christ beda doth playnly call mana bread signes saying behold signes altered yet ye fayth abideth one signes signifie thing selfe signifie ye signe thyng differeth fro thyng selfe doth signifie represent alepole ale selfe doth signifie represent thou wilt obiecte agaynst faith sufficient needeth institutio sacrament aunswere sacramentes instituted three cause first assigned austen sayth maner aug contra faustum lib cap nullum autem nomen religionis seu verum seu falsum contemnitur sine qua perfici potest pieta say men ioyned kynde religion whether true false except knit felowship visible token sacramentes power sacramentes efficacie expressed thre cause ye sacramentes institutedand therfore maketh despise abhorred wickednes despise thyng without whiche godlynes brought passe thus appeareth necessitie first cause first necessity congregation seuered multitude men must needes haue signe toke sacrament common badge may knowe eche difference betwene signe badge sacrament sacrament signifieth holy thyng signe badge doth signifie wordly thing austen saythaugust ad marcellinu signes referred holye thynges called sacramentes second cause institution sacramentesthe second cause institution may meane bryng v vnto fayth imprint deeper v doth name doth nothing offede v though call heresie thousand tymes paule testifieth phariseis priestes counted actes church hys tyme dyd call therefore foreceth though ruling rowmes vse name young say hath lately made diuers thynges yet runne hoker moker close amog brother commeth copy abroad aunswere surely frith spynne thinke hateth idle wherfore thynges able doe shalbe diliget long god lendeth lyfe ye thinke busie may rid sooner euen sheepe butcher ioh frith feared death handes ready bound looketh euen grace butcher whe shall shed bloud euen bounde byshops pleasure euer lookyng day death much playne worde sent chauncelour lo sayd cost best bloud body whiche would gladly shed morow might open kyngs grace eyen verely maruell thing runne hoker moker hyd sith mought haue store copyes concernyng thyng whiche desired haue ben kept secret lacke copye thynges would haue published hereof ye may sure care frith wisheth workes seene though byshops england looke euer wrote rather would glad ye dyd sparkle grace breastes trust bee occasion somewhat kyndle may consider know selues whiche first poynt wisedome would god mercy sayth sith nothing refrayne studie deuising compassyng euill vngracious writyng would could keepe secretly neuer man see farre corrupted neuer would cured caker possible hym hath eyen seeth hys brother whiche frith lacketh sight ieoperdie perishing perillous pit hee must come hym guide hym till seeth brother peril ieoperdy must warn therof past ieoperdye lest wise come yet call crye vnto hym cause hym chose better way except hart bee cankered contagion hatered reioyse neighbour destruction eue possible v whiche haue receiued knowledge god word must cry cal leaue perillous pathes owne foolish phantasy doe onely lord co maundeth deut neither addyng thyng diminishyng therfore vntill see meanes founde whiche reasonable reformation may one partio sufficient note earnest zeale frith instruction poore commos insure neither cease speake worde god boyleth body like feruet fire needes haue issue breaketh occasion geue hath bene offered offered shall offered graunt word god meane ye text scripture may go abroad english toung nation haue tounges brother offer made clergie io frith william tyndall haue done promise write wil graunt condition haue breath shew wordes scripture doth many lest saue lacke paule sayth contagion heresie creepeth lyke canker canker corrupteth body turneth whole party deadly sicknes doth heresy creepe forth among good simple soules till last almost past remedy true saying maketh frith well agaynst owne purpose deede dayes also paul prophesied shold folow tyme actes saying take ye heede selues flocke ouer whiche holy ghost hath put ouerseers feede congregation god whiche purchased owne bloud prop esie paule latter timesfor know wel departyng shall enter greuous wolues among shall spare flocke euen selues shall arise men speaking peruerse thing draw disciple therfore watch c canker began spread congregatio dyd full sore noy body much within iiij c yeare many sectes scattered euery cost notwithstandyng faythfull father diligently subdued sworde god word siluesterbut surely since siluester receiued possession hath canker creept ye church hath almost left neuer sounde member cistercensis writeth booke day hee receiued reuenues voyce heard ye ayre cry ouer court whiche sayd day venime shed ye church godwhen corruption entred ye church tyme byshop gredy take cure honour profite onely carefull charge bishoprickes wer gredely sought ye primitiue church charge lordship lyke cost lyfe one tyme therefore man would take bare loue zeale god flocke could content shed bloud made honorable profitable worst learnyng lyuyng laboured vertuous wold entangle selues vayne pride world weare three crownes goldmath vyne vntill luke drink new kingdome father furthermore nature doth teach bread nature sayth bread sacrament wine continue nature bread mouleth kept long yea wormes breede poore mouse runne away desire meate dinner euident inough remayneth bread also wine reserued would waxe sower wyne waxe sowre kept log confesse selues therefore housell laye people one kinde onely wine continue reserued haue ready hand whe nede surely remayned bread could mould waxe full wormes eue remained wine could waxe sower therefore false doctrine prelate long haue published finally remayneth bread might proued doctor proue bread remayneth sacrament authoritie many doctor call bread wine christ apostle though sophisters would wrast saying expound phantasie yet shall alleage one doctor also pope rome maketh plaine v shall compelled shame hold tongue pope gelasius writeth thys maner certe sacramenta gelasius pope contra eutych nestorium quae sumimus corporis sanguinis christi diuine re sunt propterea per illa celebrantur say surely sacramentes body bloud christ godly thing therfore made partaker godly nature yet doth cease saying gelasius pope substance nature bread wine continue propertie owne nature surely image similitude body bloud christ celebrated acte mystery thys sure olde doctrine auoyde therefore scripture nature father conclude remaineth substaunce nature bread wine ye say affyrme hys sonne christ hys faythfull minister thys world sure many mite ye yearely poundes although sure hys learning iudgement scripture worthy bee promoted bishop england receaued letter hym written since christmas wherein among matter writeth thus call god recorde agaynst day shall appeare lorde iesus geue reckoning doings neuer altered one tyndall declareth innocency sillable god worde agaynst conscience would doe thys day earth whether honour pleasure rich might geuen moreouer take god recorde conscience desire god selfe thys world without keepe hys lawes c iudge christe reader whether word spoken faythfull clere innocent hart hys behauiour sure man ca reproue hym sinne howbeit innocent god beholdeth hart zwingliusfinally zwinglius man learning grauitie beside eloquence thinke man mastership meane vengeaunce god declared hym euill person slaine may say nay shew euident example contrary sometyme god geueth victorye agaynst haue righteous cause euident booke iudges iudic child israell gathered together punishe ye shamefull sodomitrie tribe beniamin number thousand israelite thousand fighting men came silo asked god theyr captaine agaynst beniamin note child israell fought god commaundement righteous cause yet twise ouerthrowenand thousand slue israelite thousand one day fledde child israell vnto lord silo made great lamentation hym euen vntill night asked hym counsell saying shall go fight agaynst tribe beniamin brother god sayd vnto yes goe vp sight agaynst went next day fought agaynst slaine agayne israelite thousand men came backe agayne vnto house god sat wept lord fasted day vntill euen asked hym agayn whether fight agaynst theyr brother god sayd vnto yes morrow deliuer handes next day ye tribe beniamin vtterly destroyed sauyng men hid selues wildernes euident child israell loste victorye twise yet notwithstanding iust cause fought god commaundement besides iudas machabeus slaine righteous cause manifest first booke machabees1 macha therfore euident argument vengeance god slaine battell righteous cause therefore thinketh thys man malaparte bluntly enter god iudgement geue sentence matter called counsell thus haue sufficiently touched hys preface pointes ye afterward touched largely haue willingly passed shall touch earnestly hereafter let v see heproueth p y great wonder see vppon light sleight occasios falle vnto abhominable heresy denieth ca say nay sauiour sayd selfe fleshe verely meate bloud verely drinke denieth also christ selfe last supper takyng bread blessed handes blessed sayd vnto disciple take eate body shalbe geuen likewise gaue chalice blessyng consecracion sayd vnto chalice bloud new testament shalbe shed many ye remembrance p great wonder see frith ignoraunt proctour playne textes scripture iudgmet might wel perceiue christ spake wordes flesh verely meate bloud verely drinke spake nothing ye sacramet institute vntill last supper wordes spoke ye iewes long ment ye carnall eatyng drynking bodye bloud spirituall eating done fayth tothe bellye wherof austyn christe spake carnall eating spirituall catyng sayth sayth vppon gospell iohn preparest thou tothe bellye beleue thou hast eaten ye christes word must vnderstaded spiritually calleth hys fleshe meat meate eating disgetting bodye doth strengthen corruptible mebres likewise doth christes fleshe beleuing taketh sinne vpon selfe suffered death deliuer v strengthen immortall soule likewise drinke dronken doth comfort quicken frayle nature likewise doth christes bloud drinkyng bowelles soule beleuing remembring shed sinnes comfort quicken soule vnto euerlasting lyfe eating drinking ye speaketh place papistes doe falsly alledge text may perceaue text following sayth eateth body drinketh bloud dwelleth possible vnderstad sacrament false say ye surrexit tot anni transierunt quare nemo tam ineptus est vt no loquentes arguat esse mentitos quia istos dy secundum illorum quibus haec gest sunt similitudinem nuncupamus vt dicatur ipse dy qui non sit ipse sed reuolutione temporum similis eius dicatur illo die fieri propter sacramenti celebrationem quod illo die sed iam olim factu est nonne semel immolatus est christus scipso tamen sacramento solum per annuas pascha solennitates sed omni die pro populis immolatur nec vti que mentitur qui interrogatus responderit eu immolari si enim sacramenta quadam similitudine earu reru quaru sunt sacramenta non haberent omnino sacrameta non essent ex hac autem similitudine pleru que etiam ipsaru reru nomina accipiunt sicut ergo secundu quendam modu sacrum mentu corporis christi corpus christi est sacramentum sanguinis christi sanguis christi est sacramentum fidei side est nihilest autem aliud credere q fidem habere ac per hoc eum respodetur paruulus credere qui fidei dum habet effectum respondetur fidem habere propter fidei sacramentum et conuertere se ad deum propter conuersionis sacramentum quia ipsa responsio pertinet ad celebrationem sacramenti sicut de ipso baptismo apostolus body day day dyed onely remembrauce thereof sacrament naturall body onely remembraunce body breakyng bloud sheddyng likewise next easter day shalbe called day resurrection day christ dyd rise remembraunce euen sacrament called body body deede onely reme brauce furthermore eue priest doth offer hym say crucifie hym masse eue sacrament body masse doth onely represent hys frith writeth masse according comon opinio time passion doth sacrament represent body yet though masse doth represent crucifying may truly say crucified euen though sacramet signifie represent body yet may truly say body verely sayth sacramentes haue certaine similitude thinges wherof sacrament similitude part take name thynges blessed god whiche hath clearely discussed matter faythfull father notwithstandyng hee doth yet expresse playnly saying certaine maner sacramet christes body christes body behold deare certaine maner sacrament christes bodye christes body brother sayth certaine maner sacrament christes body may soone know neuer ment naturall body deede onely token memoriall keepe memorie death body norishe fayth besides similitude alledgeth baptisme doth wholy expound matter sayth hee ye apostle sayth peraduenture thou wilt say sene appearaunce bloud hath similitude euen thou hast taken similitude death euen thou drinkest similitude precious bloud may see ye conferring two sacramentes ambrose iudged sayth euen thou hast taken similitude death sacramet baptisme doost thou drink similitude precious bloud sacrament altar yet austen sayd apostle sayth signifie burning sayth buried likewise lord sacrament figure christes body iesu christ cauleth plainly figure christes body thing auoyde therfore geue prayse vnto god let truth sprede plainely testified holy father let v see hierome sayth hierome writyng vpon ecclesiaste sayth thys maner caro domini hieroni super eccle cap verus cibus est sanguis eius verus potus est hoc solum habemus praesenti saeculo bonu si vescamur carne eius cruore que potemur non solum mysterio sed tiam scripturarum lectione verus enim cibus potus qui ex verbo dei sumitur scientia scripturarum est say flesh lord meate hys bloud drinke onely pleasure thys place doth signifie contrary antithesis doth euidently expresse ye say speaketh nothing sacrament would ye sticke still saying thys playne speaketh naturall body therefore hee speake ye sacrament
