nature condicion qualitye naturall body one certaine place heauen many place thus much proued austen thys truth onely proued austen authoritie also ye noble clerke fulgentius writeth maner vnus idem que homo fulgentius localis ex homine qui est deus immensus ex patre vnus idem que secundum bumanam substatiam absens coelo cum esset terra derelinquens terram cum ascendisset coelum secundum inam vero immensam que substantiam nec coelu dimittens cum de coelo descendit nec terram deserens cum ad coelum ascendit quod ipsius domini certissimo sermone potest cognosci qui vt localem ostenderet suam humanitatem dicit discipulis suis ascendo ad patrem meum patrem vestrum deum meum deum vestrum de lazaro quo que cum dixisset lazarus mortuus est adiunxit dicens gaudeo propter vos vt credatis quonia non era ibi immensitatem vero suae di initatis ostendens discipulis dicit ecce ego vobiscum sum vsque ad consummationem culi quomodo autem ascendit coelum nisi quia localis verus est homo aut quomodo adest fidelibus suis nisi quia ide immensus verus deus est say one man locall say conteined one place touchyng manhode also god vnmeasurable father one man touchyng substaunce manhode absent heauen hee earth forsakyng earth ascended heauen touchyng godly vnmeasurable substaunce neither forsoke heauen whe descended heaue forsoke earth asceded vnto heauen may knowen sure word lord shew humanitie locall say contained one place onely dyd say vnto disciple asced vnto father father god god lazarus also hee sayd lazarus dead hee said glad sake may beleue agayne shewyng vnmeasurablenesse godhead christ ascended heauen locall man sayd vnto disciple behold vnto worldes ende dyd ascende heauen locall man present vnto faythfull vnmeasurable god may conclude authority doctour also christes body onely one place saith christ touchyng manhood locall say conteined one place onely hee proueth scripture euen christes owne woordes true conscience doth testifie euer men shall iudge must needes folow naturall body sacrament authoritie sure man auoyde playne natural reasos worthy reasonyng first body christ vnglorified could ij place owne naturall body examine coparison betwen ij bodyes christ wold tell would eche bodyes fiftene place would beleue hym would neuer aske hym whether would first glorifie sure glorified vnglorified sayd hee able matter impossible god truth christ sayd saying met doubt frith able deede grossely ment ye shall neuer proue deede meant hys owne body naturall haue continued sacrament meate soule fayth body eatyng may well eaten faith although remayne heauen present mouthes say ment wold neuer haue geue v scripture dyd say grosse imagination may stad processe scripture whiche receiued shall appeare certaine textes first sauiour sayth ye flesh profiteth nothyng waight flesh profiteth nothing woordes doth compell v vnderstad matter spiritually short sentence lesse plucked backe fro carnall eatyng nichodemus dreame carnall regeneratio christ sayd vnto hym soeuer yt flesh flesh playne conclusion christ sayd flesh profiteth nothyng hee ment euen hys fleshe christ profiteth much eaten fayth flesh could profite vnderstode hym eate teeth albeit doth much profite bee slayne redemption eaten thorough fayth whiche thyng may although natural flesh ye sacrament may well beleue hym though heauen earth sacrament myne eye christ spake woordes owne body playne austen wordes writyng vppon place therefore sayth august tract super must vnderstand spiritually addeth thou vnderstand spiritually spirite lyfe though thou vnderstad carnally yet neuertheles spirite lyfe vnto thee spirite lyfe vnderstandest spiritually thing haue spoken also athanasius sayth spiritus est qui viuificat caro prodest quic que verba athanasius lib qui dix verb quae ego locutus sum spiritus sunt vita nam hoc loco vtrumque de seipso dicit carnem spiritum spiritu ab eo quod est secundum carnem distinxit vt non solum visibile sed etiam inuisibile quod ipso erat credentes discant quod ea quae dicit sunt carnalia sed spiritualia quod enim comedetibus suffecisset corpus vt totius mundi alimonia fiat sed ea propter meminit ascensus filij hominis coelum vt illos corporali cogitatione auelleret posthac discant carnem dictam cibum coelestem superne venietem spiritualem alimoniam qua ipse det na quae locutus sum inquit vobis spiritus sunt vita say spirite quickeneth fleshe profiteth nothyng wordes whiche speake vnto spirite lyfe place also hee meaneth owne fleshe owne spirite deuided spirite flesh might know fayth onely ye visible part also ye visible part ye hym also wordes spake carnall spirituall body shold haue suffised haue ben meate yt world eue therfore dyd make mention ascension sonne man heaue might withdraw fro bodley imagination might hereafter learne flesh called heauenly meate co meth aboue spiritual meate whiche hee would geue sayth christ wordes haue spoke vnto spirite lyfe may see christ spake owne fleshe ment playnly dyd nothyng profite infidelles dyd vnderstad hym el geueth life receiued faythfull mysterie bartram sayth l ram mysterie body bloud spiritual operation geueth bread wyne sacrament called mystery lyfe without whiche operation mystery nothyng profite surely sayth hee may feede body soule feede besides scripture sayth entreth ye mouth doth defile man christ sayth cast forth draught reason foloweth doth sanctifie make man holy sacrament entreth mouth therfore doth folow selfe doth sactifie make holy text folow two inconueniences sacrament naturall body christ first folow body sacrament body christ natural body note inconueniences must folow christ sanctifie faythfull entreth yt mouth agayne folow body christ cast draught whiche thyng abominable wherefore must needes folow sacrament hys naturall body furthermore christ would suffer deuoute woman loue sought hym hys sepulture touch hys naturall body lacked poynt fayth dyd count hym equall hys father much shall follow wicked may eate body christ wicked haue fayth loue towardes hym shall suffered eate hys fleshe theyr teeth swallowe vncleane bodyes much touch hym yet notwithstandyng receaue eate sacrament wherupon follow sacrament hys naturall body deede eate hys body thyng may counted blasphemye agaynst god moreouer christ sayth eateth fleshe drinketh bloud dwelleth hym wicked eate sacramet yet dwell christ know right well wicked doe eate sacrament yet neither dwell christ christ wherefore must followe sacrament fleshe christ surely excuse blasphemye directly contrary christes wordes auoyde textes christ speaketh vnto hys disciple saying yet little iohn depart hym sent agayne expedient iohn depart excepte departe comforter shall come vnto agayn sayth forsake world go iohn math mark iohn father short saith poore men ye shall euer haue shall euer haue know right well hys godhead place touchyng hys godhead hee forsooke world ascended vnto father wherfore must nedes follow forsooke touching hys fleshe manhode thereto agreeth exposition austen fulgentius alleaged yea al old faithful father haue forsaken world touching presence hys naturall fleshe manhode doctor define ment hys naturall fleshe shoulde present monk adam may say doth right way simply receaue thyng may put texte scripture warneth v wise serpentes text following sufficient biddeth v simple doues doth mastership graunt necessary allegorye whe paul sayth christ stone whe christ sayth doore scripture sayth hee twaine syth god sayth able make therfore reason shall nede none allegorye scripture simple foolish may counted faythfull shall neede faythfull father expoud text shall merite beleue letter thys denye god coulde haue done intended spake wordes ye scripture standyng doth thinke doe example thinke god bloud hys sonne christ myght haue saued men faythfull vnfaythfull intended pleased hym scripture god may thing yet canot denye hys truth neither restore virginitie c iohn standyng say hee doe impossible hym might make hys sonne lyer sayth beleueth damned againe beleueth shall see life wrath god abydeth vpon hym euen impossible stand processe scripture wherin god hath declared vnfaythfull shoulde saued although god might haue done first would likewise impossible scripture standing naturall body christ shoulde present naturall body christ present teeth sacrament teeth sacrament fayth needeth haue hym present bread may wel eate drinke fayth say beleue hym though present sacrament hanging crosse say naturall reason worth reasoning alledge moe see say first argumets proue christes naturall body sacramet body bloud euery sacrament signe holy thyng sacrament altar sacrament faythfull confesse ergo must follow sacrament altar signe holy thyng signe holy thyng holy thyng selfe doth signifie represent shoulde feare call bread figure say sacrament holy body lord sauiour besides woulde know necessitie profite hys fleshe must present sacrament presence hys fleshe profite v doth remebrance hys body thys remembraunce may well done sacramet though hys bodye present therefore ith god nature make nought vayne followeth cosequently yt naturall flesh onely memoriall therof furthermore end finall cause thyng euer better thynges prouided end house better lyme stone timber prouided house ende finall cause sacrament remembraunce christes body thereupon must followe sacrament hys naturall bodye remembraunce christes body better hys body selfe thyng abhorred faythfull men fondnes fayne soule otherwise eate angel heauen meate ioy delectation haue god glory euen doth soule vpon earth eate fayth body christ heauen deliteth reioyceth while ioyfull eatyng christ fayth vnderstandeth fayth christ hath taken sinnes vpon pacified father wrath neyther necessarie cause flesh present man may well loue reioyce thing present though present hym manner moreouer bread christes body euen ye breaking ye bread death body breaking bread maundy death christes body onely representatio al minde fayth doth spirituallye behold death euen likewise naturall bread body lord sacrament signe memoriall representation albeit monision therof ye mynde fayth doth spiritually behold body surely therof man faythfull sprite god worketh hart sweetely communion finally lawfull eate drinke bloud onely man also brute beaste apostels selues moued ye rule charitie institute abstayne bloud somewhat sau ring infirmitie iewes apostle orde e absteine fro bloud meaning natural bloud apostels taught ye sacrament fleshe bloud eaten dronke teeth mouth faythfull vnfaythfull could haue bene greater occasion haue excluded iewes christes fayth euen thinke apostle would haue bene scrupulous haue dronke bloud seing playne agaynst moses lawe vnderstand hym grossely ye peter cloth sent actes downe heauen manner beastes forbidden ye law commaunded slay eate aunswered god wyne sacrament naturall bloud forbid neuer eate vncleane thing meaning therby neuer eate thing forbidden law wherof must needes follow either neuer recei ed sacramet whiche playne false elles hee spiritually vnderstode wordes christes maundie ye falslye fayne plainely forbidden law eate drinke maner bloud know obiection one reason haue count insoluble e godes slender shew solution many example may dissolued despiseth kinges seale letter offendeth agaynst owne person yet letter seale owne person violently plucketh downe grace armes breaketh broade seale furious minde violence committeth treason owne person yet armes pull downe violently kynges armes treason agaynst hys owne person yet armes kinges person broad seale owne person clippeth king coyne committeth treason ye kynges person common wealth yet mony neither grace person common wealth therfore argumet weake slender euen man doth offende prince person dispising armes seale letter doth man offend agaynst christes body bloud abusing sacrament body bloud although present ye kinges person present armes seale letter besides paule saith euery man prayeth prophecieth couered hed shameth hed hed christ shall therfore imagin christ naturallye euery man hed argument cocludeth soth prety phantasie finally austen negligent hearyng word god great offece sayth doth lesse sinne negligently heareth ye worde god doth whiche vnworthely receiueth ye sacrament christes body bloud true reason worth rishe christes naturall body ye word preached men knowe yet sinneth lesse negligently heareth doth vnworthely receiueth sacrament thus see insoluble argument easely dissolued p must yong man consider againe selfe confesseth cause selfe sayth christ saying meane haue ment impossible god bring meaning say christes body might two place therfore proue thing impossible god doe el confesseth god onely sayd also met dede yet ouer christ neuer sayd yet doubtted nothing ut able doe el could doe sophistication cocluding confesse impossible god haue ment impossible god bring meaning deare bretheren quarelyng brabler babelyng sufficiently discused ready ment impossible god bring ment meant hee may doe hee touching reason repugnaunce sayth many thynges may seme repugnaunt thinges god seeth make stad together well inough addeth blynd reason repugnauce induce many men great errour concernyng sight litle eye say though eye discry see whole countrey yet whole coutrey eye countrey knowen ye sight eye though countrey death christ hys bodye breakyng bloude shedyng christes deathe beyng many place neither man el iustly assigne maior first proposition thus vnderstand doth co clusion folowe directly ye cause must nedes graunt cause proued false scripture must needes graunt thyng whiche foloweth cause must needes false purpose proued concluded example astronomer say naturall astronomer say naturall course sunne west east course sunne fro weast east aske cause see hym dayly take cotrary course east weast agaynst hys nature aunswere hyghest sphere whose course east weast swift mouyng doth violently drawe inferior sphere hym cause alleage man assigne sith ca proue sense false scripture austen scripture sayth ye sphere fastened hebr viij chap austen expoundyng text improueth astronomer whiche affirme moueth sith say cause proued false scripture must needes graut thyng whiche foloweth cause must needes false may conclude naturall course sunne fro weast east astronomer say contrary conclusio agaynst astronomer east west lykewise sith cause christes body many place conclude shewe reason many place wonne might conclude therupon could many place though possible god make body two place able tell wherby shewe reason far conclude shewed frith immediatly though bare cause reason soeuer papistes say must stand reason say church erre teach contrary thynges yet good inough whe see make scripture agree doctrine say theyr doctrine true inough man vnderstand scripture processe scripture wherin god hath declared vnfaythfull shoulde bee saued although ye first god might haue done would likewise impossible scripture standing naturall body christ shoulde bee present teeth sacrament fayth needeth haue hym present bread may well eate drink fayth say beleefe hym though continue still heauen though present sacrament hangyng crosse yet hys mastership hath left one thyng vnproued euen pith hys purpose though hee proued hee hath god hys almightynes saith god may thyngs doth proue hath done myght make christes body many place place sacrament yet forgotte proue god hath done therfore albeit dyd graunt hym myght yet thereof doth followe hath done deede god may many thynges doth therefore hys argumet doth proue hys purpose thinke god hath done well pleased put hym payne proue anone ye shall see hym intangled brier shall witte become yet thys young man goeth proue poynt scripture except graut point true sayth el make angell lyer sayd also el make though christes body ascension goe vp cloud heauen earth onely hid self cloud playeth bo peepe taried beneath still end forgetteth selfe foule young sophister would dare say haue bene full sore ashamed haue ouerseene selfe oxford peruise ye wotte well thing sayth must therfore proue body christ euery place meane god could make textes bringeth proofe say place two thinges disputed betwene one frith whether god make body two thinges disputed betwen frith christ many place sacrament thereto hys mastership sayth ye god almightye may thing say nay affirme god called almightie may thing may say make hys sonne lyer hys scripture false yet abydeth almightye thyng thys whether haue done albeit graunt hym possible yet neuer nere except ca proue hath done deede el thinke god hath done sayd god doe many thinges doth ye controuersie thys doubt resolued angell scripture graunteth hym selfe proueth place thereof olloweth god hath done although possible hys mastership poynt graut neuer possible yet scripture proue deede neuer neare hys purpose much thys eue sayd possible stand processe scripture haue receaued hys mastership hath graunted hym selfe may sure would haue done hee coulde otherwyse auoyde may see sore haue ouerseene selfe god forbid man prone ready beleue yong man greate matter sayth beginning bring men concord quietnes conscience bringeth men worst kinde quietnes may deuised telleth v doth fraunces christ bad disciple goe preach creature yet would thinke yt sinned therein referre hym vnto god iudgment yet wene euery woman hath wit say deceiued sure olde holy doctours beleued christes perill damnation beleue thus selfe graunteth may graunteth hee may also without perill damnation beleue selfe lieth hee sayth truth beleefe impossible beleuing thys poynt self damnable damnable frith thinke christ stone vine litterall sense sayth beleue ought preach fish goe christen ye belle insure worse mischiefe ensued thys beleefe selfe would neuer haue spoken agaynst followeth vppon damnable idolatry beleefe thys body fall downe worship thinking please god damnably sinne agaynst hym thys say cause earnestly write agaynst martin luther sayth yt natural body christ present ye sacramet wold haue worshipped auoyde idolatry committed part germanes thinke naturall body present sacrament take woordes fleshly martine taught none worshyp martine forbyddeth hys wordes workes blessed god auoyde vndoubted damnation great ieoperdy way none though deede yet doe sinne worshyp commaunded worshyp sacrament commit damnable idolatry p consecration sacrament nowe quietnes euery ma conscience young man biddeth euery bold whether blessed sacrament consecrate vnconsecrate though especially speaketh wyne yet speaketh byddeth v care take vnblessed priest hee sayth deceiue v take v profit christes institution whether hee alter woordes leaue vnsayd wonderful doctrine young man wotte well priest hurt v ouersight malice fault vpon owne partie perfection lacketh priestes part great mercy god trust owne goodnes supplyeth therfore holy chrisostome sayth man take harme selfe see thyng disordered owne selfe priest christes institution broken wittyngly receiue vnblessed vnconsecrated care whether christes institutio kept obserued rekon good without make selues partaker fault leese profit sacramet receiue damnation priestes fault owne thought turke wold frith haue wrested man woordes vnfaythfully hee leaueth pith matter wordes shew meanes ye shall euer receiue accordyng christes institution although priest would withdraw first ye neede haue respect vnto priest wordes ministreth meane may receaue ye sacrament according christes institution though minister negligent ye remember intet christ dyd institute sacrament know put v remembraunce hys body breakyng bloud shedding might geue hym thankes bee sure fayth accordyng promise sure bread eatyng say ye remember thyng intent onely priest speaketh wordes priest leaue wordes part therof hurt haue ready effect final purpose ye speake agayne wholy alter yet ca deceiue ye sure lyer though see priest bryng wyne consecrated yet neuer sticke surely shall certifie conscience outward worthy receauer sacrament may consecrate selfe sens though consecrate thou consecrate thy selfe say thou know ment therby geue hym thankes though hee made thousand blessynges ouer say euer cosecrated hys hart beleueth though priest consecrate contrarywise consecrate neuer much thy consecration bye helpeth thee rishe except thou know meant therby beleue geuyng thankes hys body breakyng bloudshedyng profite thee say see thyng disordered priest christes institution broken wyttingly receiue make selues partaker cryme aunswer reformation thereof laye handes sayd frith truth sith written priuate person may reforme matter reformation therof resteth onely ye hand prince parlament ye erroure consisteth misordering matter one priest rather doctrine sauing god hath lightened priuate person say doctrine soner occasion insurrection labour eshew quieting christes doctrine therefore sith waye wood sauing vpright auoyde perylous path ye see christes institution broken one kinde left vnto laye people ye pertaker thereof beit beleife taketh better bare bread wine maketh litell matter consecrated sauing better consecrated euer noyous receiueth hauing conscience combred execrable heresie well appeareth putteth difference betwene body lord blessed sacrament comon bread eateth dinner rather estemeth lesse one yet thinke begyn lack priest blesse selfe hee careth sayth whether blessed reacon bread frith wine shew declaring minde paule vppon sacrament conclusion boke meane season say belyeth blessinges consecracion profit right consecratio hym receaueth sacrament fayth christes death except consecrate selfe fayth christes bloud geuing prayse thankes inestimable goodnes enemy recociled vnto father death consecration must set haue profit death ye sacrament representeth vnto selfe thus consecrate shal sure ye fruite death say agayne ye priestes doe vse consecrate helpeth poore comens rishe consecracion stand preaching vnto death christ hath deliuered egipt sinne ye fiery fornace pharao deuill wagging finger popish consecration latine worth rish ouer saying vj vij wordes latten helpeth nothing beleue ye meanes wordes know sayth touching common bread eate dynner whether haue priest blesse hart finger hartly geue god thankes haue hundreth priestes blesse yet excused therby except blesse selfe profiteth vnblessed blesse elfe care byshops proctour tell blessyng meaneth priest prate long vnderstand profiteth meaneth euident wordes folowyng say remembrance mee likewyse cuppe finally concludyng paule sayth often ye shall eate bread drinke cuppe sacrament ordained feede soules bodyes place felowshyp ye shall spirituall huger eate fayth body bread representeth breaking disstributing commeth mery hart geuing god harty thankes deliueraunce sinne doe much eate hart yt death body doe bread mouth sith corinthyans onlye seeke belly flesh forgat god honour prayse instituted thakes geuen remembrance body breaking v eate god dishonour neighboures hinderaunce owne condemnation lacke fayth giltye christes body fayth chiefely haue eaten soules health therefore followeth let man therfore examyne selfe let eate bread drinke cuppe proue examine man owne selfethis prouing examinyng man selfe first thinke selfe lust desire cometh vnto maundy eate bread whether sure child god faith christ whether coscience beare witnesse christes body broken whether lust yt hath prayse god thanke hym faythfull hart middes bretheren driue hym thether warde el whether yt meates sake keepe custome better away eateth drinketh vnworthely eateth drinketh owne damnation becaufe maketh differece lordes body sayd regardeth purpose instituted putteth difference betwene eating eating eating doth onely serue bellye eating instituted ordayned serue soule inward man therfore abuseth flesh eateth drinketh owne damnation commeth vnworthelye maundye sacrament christes body eaten ye body lord eaten carnally teeth bellye spiritually hart faith vpon followeth text allegeth wresteth purpose cause many weake sicke among many sleepe yf truely iudged selues haue beene indged iudged lorde chastened bee damned wich world wherfore bretheren whe ye come togither eate tary one yf man hunger let eate home ye come togither vnto condemnation cause lacke good examinyng selues meaning paules formet wordes touched many weake sicke fayth many sleepe haue lost fayth christes bloud lacke remembraunce body breaking bloud shedding yea onely many weake sicke euen striken bodelye disease abusing ye sacrament body eating bread teeth body hart minde peraduenture slayne stroke god truely iudged examined selues intent came thither instituted haue beene iudged chastened lorde lorde doth chasten bring v vnto repentaunce mortifie rebellious mebers may remember hym ye may shortly perceyue mynde paule epitome short rehearsall booke shewing poyntes frith dissenteth prelate short three poyntes frith dissenteth epitome whole booke fro prelate taketh vpon hym proctor prelate beleeue sacrament remaineth bread opinio prelate turned naturall body christ fleshe bloud bone frith sayth article crede therefore let opinio frith beleeue thinketh remayneth bread still proueth three maner wayes first ye scripture paule whiche calleth bread saying cor bread breake fellowship body christ though bee many yet one body one bread many partaker one bread againe sayth often ye eate thys bread drinke thys cup shall cor shew lordes death vntil come also luke calleth bread saying actes continued fellowship apostle actes breaking bread prayer also christ called cup fruite math marke luke vyne saying shall hence forward drinke fruite vyne vntill drinke new kingdome father furthermore nature doth teache nature teacheth bread wyne sacrament bread wine co tinue nature bread mouldeth kept long yea wormes breede poore mouse runne away eate euidence inough remayneth bread also wine reserued would waxe sower confesse selues therefore housell lay people one kinde onely wine continue reserued haue ready hand neede surely remayned bread could mould waxe full wormes euen remayned wine could waxe sower therefore false doctrine prelate log haue taught published finally ye remayneth bread might proued authoritie olde doctours proue bread sacramet many doctor call bread wine euen christ hys apostle though sophisters would wrest saying expoud owne phantasie yet shall alleage one doctor pope maketh playne v shall neuer bee able auoyde pope gelasius writeth thys maner certe sacramenta quae sumimus gelasius concilio ro corporis sanguinis christi diuinae re sunt propter quod per eadem diuinae efficimur similitude body bloud celebrated acte mysteryes thys sure man auoyde wrest men shall soone espye hys folly therefore may conclude remayneth substaunce nature bread wine second poynt wherin frith dissenteth prelate proctor prelate beleeue hys fleshe present teeth fayth prelate eate sacrament wicked eate hys body frith sayth article opinio iohn frith creede therefore hee reckoneth hee ieoperdy though hee beleeue hee thinketh fleshe present vnto teeth receaue sacrament hys flesh onely one place yt hee proueth yt authoritie austen ad dardanum also authoritie fulgentius ad thrasuuandum lib euerlasting life wicked hath euerlasting life ergo wicked eate body agayne scripture sayth hee eateth christes fleshe drinketh hys bloud abydeth christ christ hym yt wicked abyde christ christ ergo wicked eate hys fleshe drinke hys bloud thys may also bee confirmed august serm de sacrum fe passch good authoritie austen sayth hee abydeth christ christ abydeth without doubt hee eateth hys fleshe first bringing vp sayd rob barnes childe vniuersitie cambridge made nouice ye house ye fryer augustine beyng apt vnto learning profite helpe frendes remoued thece vniuersitie louayne brabant remained certayne yeares greatly profited study tongue proceeded doctour diuinitie thence returned agayne england vniuersitie cabridge made prior maister house augustine wherein first brought vp tyme knowledge good letter scarcely entred vniuersitie thynges full rudenes barbarietie sauing fewe priuye secrete whereupon barnes hauing feeling better learning red better actours bega house reade terence cicero plautus industry paynes labour helpe thomas parnell scholer brought louayne reading copia verborum et rorum caused house shortly florishe doct barnes bolisher barbarisme founder learning light trueth good letter made great parte ye house learned drowned barbarous rudenes cambridge felde colman burley couerdale diuers vniuersitie soiourned learning sake foundation layde read openly paules epistle put n dorbell yet questionary onely would haue christ taught holy word turned vnsauery problemes fruitles disputation better matter holy scripture thereby short space made diuers good deuynes order disputation kept house obserued likewise vniuersitie abroad dispute man common schooles first man aunswered barnes scripture stafford forme bacheler diuinitie disputation merueilous sight great blynde doctours ioyfull godly spirited thus barnes reading disputation preachyng became famous mightie scripture preaching euer agaynst byshops hipocrites yet see inward outwarde idolatry taught maintayned reges regnant kynges theyr maiesties raigne stand mee sayd cardinall loe maister doctours learned wise man tolde mee kneeled downe sayd desire grace bee good vnto hym hee reformable sayd stand vp sake honestie vniuersitie aunswered thake grace good sticke ye holy scripture god booke according simple talent god hath lent sayd cardinall aunswere well woulde aduise thee thou shalt haue thy learning tried vttermost thou shalt haue lawe barnes requyred hym might haue iustice equitie foorthwyth haue gone tower gardiner foxe became suertyes night morning came agayne yorke place gardiner foxe article subscribed willingly committe fleete warden fleete commaunded man shoulde speak hym saterday folowing agayne brought chapt house westminster remayned almost whole day late eu ning cauled father death passion onely worke man deserue thing god onely passion touching iustification knowledge best worke euer vnpure vnperfect withall cast abroad handes desired god forgeue trespasces although perchauce said know nothing yet doe confesse thoughtes cogitation innumerable wherefore said beseech lorde enter iudgmet according saying prophet dauid non intres iuditium cum seruo tuo domine place si iniquitates obseruaueris domine quis sustinebit lord thou straightly marke inniquitie able abide thy iudgment wherefore trust good worke euer onely ye death christ doe doubt inherite ye kingdome heauen take speake good workes bee done verely doe shall neuer come kingdome god must doe commauded v god shewe set forth profession deserue merite onely death christ beleeue holy church copany doe professe christ haue suffered confessed name sayntes doe la de prayse god heauen mannes tongue expresse alwayes haue spoken reuerently saintes praysed asmuch scripture willed doe lady say shee vergyn immaculate vndefiled shee purest virgin euer god created vessell god elected whome iesus christ borne shriefe somwhat stayeing hastening make ende turned people desired men forgeue said euell tyme vnaduisedly wherby offended man geuen occasion euell would forgeue amende euell tooke beare witnes detested abhorred euill opinion doctrine word god dyed fayth iesus christ doubted saued grace peace god father sauiour iesus christ noble excellent grace euer amen complaynt doctour barnes made k henry viij agaynst lordly byshops prelate englad huble wise coplaineth vnto grace continuall oratour robert barnes intollerable iniuries wronges oppression wherwith certaine byshops realme vexe haue vexed contrary vnto worde god ownelawes doctor onely also true preacher professor condemning heretickes whiche thing able proue scripture god yet shall would please grace indifferently according office wherein god hath set heare small well great sustaine poore orator agaynst violence strength god take recorde right sory make thys complaint vnto grace could coniecture meane cause redresse intollerable oppression wherewith dayly oppresse poore true subiectes sore violently without doubt grace see shortly remedy god must needes punishe doe beleeue euer hee suffer long great tyranny worde violent oppression true christen doe vse name christ hys holy church verely wee doe read memoryes father haue left v euer people vnder great tyranny poore subiectes bee vnto farre come soeuer hee bee hye lowe poore riche wise foolishe tyrannous gouerment byshops england speaketh agaynst vicious liuing hee either made traytor vnto grace hereticke agaynst holy church though king god may excellent grace perfectlye know call remembraunce good men haue doe maruelous court byshops court man founde innocent haue wherein neuer man accused heresie hee learned learned found gilty maruelous court ye neuer hath innocentes court within realme may say thys againe speak god law right conscience agaynst thys damnable tyranny little stick make heretick helpe colour maintaine oppression adde treason grace though hee bee neuer true subiect vnlikly make resistaunce thinke euill vnto grace please grace let v consider ende vncharitable vnrighteous accusation byshops yea rather ye diuell inuented first bee men ye preach dispute put forth writing soeuer agaynst clergye thoughe neuer wicked yet finde fault therewith thing towching though bee neuer blasphemous god ye bloud christ holy worde moued therewt example thereof playne yt needeth proufe grace may see blasphemous rubrikes allow yt bloud christ shamefull abhominable pardos tollerate admyt disputation doe mayntaine proue yt pope god man hauing wordes pope neyther god man whether ye pope vi cap quo ver papa dist xl ca si papa sinne man condemne pope though hee bring innumerable soules hell occasion agayne let v consider speake agaynst cloked ipocrisie neuer litle thing yt longeth abhominations shoulde disclosed shall euydently whosoeuer speake agaynst preache agaynst abuse abhominations st nedes bee caught moste shamefully cruelly hadled tormented perceaue scripture place maistership excuse world saue hee must eyther open shame cruell death playne cruelnes serueth ende saye yf man wyll take preache verety true gospel maister christ purely wherby winning deminyshed wherwith mayntayne honour dignity worldly promotion delicious lyuing gorgious apparel suptuous pallaces lordship breifly thing vse pastime pleasure bee manifest ye get thinges false fayned holynes deceyuing robbing people goodes also ye dyspendyng bee abhomynable contrary ordynance worde god rather come passe leuer power potentae maye hinder gayne profites clergy gather stregth togither oppresse vyolece many wil hold wt learning bee hee king duke lorde baron knight man woma childe practise euident see goe make insurrection yt mayntayning world ly pompe pride true preacher hee entendeth mayntayne yt false preacher persecuter true preacher sufferer nothing bring light glorious heauenly word god hath beene darkened kept vnder suffering persecution nature worde persecuting maketh stryuyng yf bee bee true preacher god fighting worlde suffereth child worlde enioye worldly thinges withstandyng ashamed thus falsly laye preacher charge would make grace mayntayne maliciousnes vnder pretence treason myght execute tyranny hart hee would bee traytour mayntaine traytour agaynst excellent noble grace thinke yea know surely man doe without great displeasure eternall god paule comaundeth straightly vnto christian bee obedient thinges manner let euery man submyt rom himselfe auctoryte higher power whosoeuer resisteth power resisteth yt ordinaunce god resist shall receiue selues damnation also peter confirmeth saying submit selues vnto manner pet ordinaunce yt lord sake whether vnto king vnto chiefe head eyther vnto duke vnto sent hym punishment euell doer prayse ye doe well wherfore scripture common toung teach obediece ruler mouer sedition euery man scripture would god iudge euery man doctrine question preacher therof eyther would could make cause bee made insurrection prince seeyng selfe scripture straytely commaundeth subiectes bee obedient vnto prince paule witnesseth saying warne sayth hee submit selues prynces power obey officer ca preach gospell christ ye cause insurrection exhort men thys doctrine cause insurrection disobedience prince let v goe consider preacher onely haue preached word god marke euer occasion disobedience rebellion agaynst prince first call mind ye old prophet prophet euer styrred vp people agaynst prince single eye iudge eyther priuely apertly sturred vp people agaynst prince looke christ hee submitted hym self ye hye power payde christ submitted himselfe higher power hee tribute hee free caused peter likewyse pay suffered hee pacience punishmentes prince yea death cruell although hym open wrong could finde gilty cause looke also apostle taught wrote doctrine apostle obeyed prince christ liuing followed hys steppe euer sturred occasion people agaynst prince yea themselues obeyed prince although part tyrauntes infidel consider likewyse doctor purely sincerely hath hadled true preacher teach obedience prince worde god either preaching writing euer theyr meanes insurrection disobedience rise among people agaynst prince shall rather finde haue ready lay downe owne heades suffer pacience whatsoeuer tyranny power woulde minister vnto geuing people example doe conclude neither scripture neither practise preacher thereof teacheth affyrmeth ye people may disobey prince ordinauces contrarywyse teacheth obedience bee done vnto playne byshops rather papistes doe falsely accuse true preacher subiectes thyng woulde appeare euery man sight violence word god kept vnder ye doctrine doe preach teach none concerning thys matter god take recorde bookes writinges euer wrote made onely allow fauour whiche furthereth thys doctrine christ thys sure myne aduersaries rather aduersaryes christes doctrine must beare mee witnesse wee haue breefly touched doctrine true preacher preach people worde writing practise let v somewhat touch ye doctrine practise pope papisticall bishop let euery man seeke ye heretickes traytors prince first preacher onely worde god preacheth teacheth men obey prince ordinaunces according wordes peter lib titulo de matori obedientiae cap solite pope papisticall bishop contrary vnto minde facte saint peter expoundeth peter wordes saying peter meaned hym selfe successor pope falsifyath scripture hys subiectes false interpretatio excludeth selfe hys fro obedience prince yet content craftely drawing subiectes obedience prince sayth also ye wordes peter spoken comaundement counsell crafte prince espye hys falsehode conscience goe reproue papistes teach disobedience prince false preacher maintainer hym lightly withdraweth ye harte common prince affirming comaundement god bee counsell least wyse authoritie bee sufficient dispence ye comaundementes god thus people ignoraunt lacke ye word god iudge euery doctrine delude wittes man perceaueth crafte loue hee hath god hys commaundementes exhorteth people iudge doctrine papistes worde god anone lay heresie vnto hys charge laying god doctrine papist lawe saying man may iudge pope also may geeue sentence aboue hys iudgement hee shall dist xl c si papa q ca cuncta q cap ideo permit iudge men vpon earth item seate rome geeueth strength might lawes subiecte none item subiectes may bee disobedient lordes lib de sen iudic hee may depose kinges item hee hath authoritie breake othes bondes obligation q cap alius made betweene man hye lowe degree item pope hath power interprete declare lay forth q capit quotiens holy scripture hys suffer man expound contrary hys pleasure item pope god vpon de coc preb ca ad apostolatus verb continetur dist cap si papa earth ouer heauenly earthly ghostly worldly hee hys owne man may say hym doost thou item though pope euill hee lead innumerable great heapes hell yet shall man reproue therefore p sytten conscience men shamelesse doings papistes like abhominable doctrine excluded fro ye scripture vnlawfull thing haue mother tonge lest espye disceatfulnes past shame without feare god man spared put executio abhominable doctrine insomuch deposed openly prince emperours yea assoyled subiectes obedience commaundement god regarded wordes better appeare men shall recite practises auteticke crownycles af owne lawe p zacharias depose king quest alius item fraunce onely iniquitie also vnprofitable greate power set shamefull arroga cie tyranny pope eede pipinum emperours father assoyle fraunce othe alleagyaunce made nto olde king thing holy church rome doth oftimes hir auctorite c p would god grace earnestly would looke lawe least suffer geeue worde god ye handes subiectes compare obedience men preache practice fayne would know hath deposed king syth christes passion sauig onelye bee kinges felowes yea cotroulers sauing subtile crafte antychrist warne men heretykes cast antichrist traytours meane season men stand lokeing fhr traytours commeth hee playeth parte open traytour sauing onely hee coloureth name calleth himselfe true byshop ready accuse treaso might escape hymselfe hee sure hee wil neuer accuse none speake auctorite prince man doe beginne open mouth declare hee hath temporall power rageth hee cryeth treason treason let v returne lawe see proue god word standeth true subiection resonable pope pope take vpon deposition kinges god lawe subiectes shall depose king example master christ apostle scripture haue helpe dare bee bolde depose king ordayned god yea holy worde hauing example scripture aboue god blessed worde say king wicked man aunswere crownicles geue contrary witnesse ye good man ryght simple hee simple therefore pipinus ye rule vnder thought self better worthy rule king wrote byshop chaplayne vnto pope desireth hym geue sentece whether better worthy bee king paynes labour hee labour could doe nothing pope make pipinum frend trusting meanes haue helpe hym agaynst emperour hee beene variance gaue setece deposed made hym monke falshod bee perceiued fained ye king beene moke afore called samuell proue good cronicles let noble grace consider right onely depose suche king also make moke thus haue done wt noble kinges doubt worse attempt doe vnto grace displease least doe vttermoste let hole rable tell grace true preacher christes gospell dyd deede officer hath neede bee afrayde christes gospell yet preacher thereof preuye traytours man bee wary let v graunt ye kyng wicked man scripture commaundeth v obey ought depose king though wicked wicked prince geueth v none auctoritye depose owne glose testifyeth vpon text subdeti estote wicked herode yet iohn suffered death vnder hym wyckedder pilate yet christ put hym downe crucified vnder hym breeflye ye prince good apostle dayes yet deposed none god worde owne learnynge practise maister christe holy apostels openly agaynst moreouer owne glose sayth pet deposed vnsufficient hee wanton lecherous weemen lordes bee afrayde vengeauce god least take litle shame worlde vnto haue long tyme great tyranny defended lawes bee openly agaynst god ordinaunce agaynst god word agaynst common ordinaunce cosent world haue done great iniury noble prince intollerable subduyng noble bloud oppression true subiectes destruction common wealthes finally euerlastyng damnation many christened soule tell fayth doe beleeue liuyng god mighty punish enemy beleeue say vnto deuise auoyde hys vengeaunce bee openly contrary hys woorde aunswere thinke make hym thinke hee suffer worde heard let godly word bee despised thinke bee sufficient say bee lawes holy churche thinke hee bee thus taught tyme plucke hym downe set vp nay lordes hee childe shall finde childes game thus trifle playe hys holy word hys blessed ordinauce yea despising maker heauen earth say ye ye able learnyng defende matter neither afore god yet afore noble christ apostle ouerthrowers pope doctrine prince afore man learnyng bee true prince whiche way soeuer turne master christ blessed apostle bee agaynst openly accuse bee cotrary worde theyr deede aunswere aunswere hold peace speake helpe litle crye old maner heresie heresie traytour traytour crye agaynst selues thynges christ apostle doe accuse doe thinke ordinaunce god shal depose kyng bycause hee lyueth aduoultry lecherous man thinke lawfull cause doe preach opely doe lay kynges charge suffer bee kynges lyue aduoultry doe put lawes executio say bee lawes holy church therby may depose prince wil put execution much better bee bishop priest kyng duke may lyue whoredome vngracious lyuyng yea destruction many men soules yet hardy reproue law doth openly commaunde wordes pope doe draw dist ul si papa hym innumerable people heape deuill hell punished euer yet shal mortall man presume reproue hys sinnes hee must iudge men may bee iudged man c lykewise haue de hereticis cu ex iniuncto et sieut law decretals lay may reproue priest c thinke lawes bee deuill tell deuil wil reproue yea also depose prince neither bee deposed yet reproued mortall man thinke selues god ye depose kynges fornication would handle kyng dauid kyng salomon would depose bycause aduoutry dauid salomon nathan doe prophet nathan durst doe briefly ye bee content kyng shall depose fornication shall shortly bee rydde part let v come herode herode kept brother wife would depose hym therefore doe iohn durst doe hee durst doe reproue hys vice dare depose hym let v go forth law authoritie ye pope set pipinum rowme rather let kyngdome choose king master christ sayd hys kyngdome world bee aboue kinges world onely depose also set new pleasure moreouer authoritie pope dispence realme othe law sayth holy church rome wont doe pray hath learned wont hath geuen authoritie pope dispece ye othe obedience subiectes make prince shee discharge v obedience owe prince law god standeth also yt law nature yea doe turkes infidel faythfully obey prince prince power god depose power dipece lawe peter learneth actuum yt bound obeye god lawe man litle regarde peter saying wherfore say owne q regu officium lawe whose wordes bee must keepe vnto prince power fayth reuerence c lordes fidem oportet come despensation othe say non oportet bound obedient prince despence v ca dispence v othe seing god lawe may men see teacher haue beene also bee toward god holy apostle towarde noble prince ye thing may bee clearely knowne shall resyte practyse chronicle make mention time edward iij pope vrban dyd depose perse king spaine hee vicious liuer set hys stede one henry bastarde thinke standeth thys facte christes doctrine byshops captaynes rebelles prince v preach gospell hath gone doe prince villanye doe deede laye blame v doe remember dayes henry iiij captayne church called richard scroupe archbishop yorke dyd gather hoste men waged battell hys kyng god defender hys ruler gaue king victorye caused ye traytor bee beheaded forefather deuilishe crafte made people beleeue false chronicle euery stroke geeue bishop necke kyng receaued god neck king afterward stricken sicknes made hys subiectes beleeue ye god punishmet hee killed byshop thus content fayned hys death hee dyd miracle thys toe much bee traytors king also faine god bee displeased king punishing treason finally make hym saint also god done miracle defending hys treason possible inuent pestilent doctrine thys god ruler despised hereby open treason maintained thinke god shewe miracle fortifie thynges doubt prouerbe true lippes lectuse saintes miracle many thinges bee sayd passe ouer sure doe remember obediently kynge iohn cruelly handled clergy droue king iohn kingdome originall strife iiij bishop england variaunce kinges grace hee required dymie pyed mo kes england maintaine hys warre agaynst irishe men would geeue hym none wherfore ye king sped well ireland hee reuenged ye monkes tooke euery place certayne yt thing forefather maintainer deuilishe doctrine wrote vnto god yt pope caused first excommunicate kyng afterward interdicte land gaue french kinges sonne maintayned father naturall king compelled flee wale tarye till ye time hee content make agreement holy idoll pope coditions ye agreement hee first geeue xl marke iiij byshops make restitution pyed monkes agayne also geeue pandolphus pope legate great summe money finally hee bee bound geeue yearely pope rome certayne great summe money hee hys successor shoulde receaue land pope holde see ferme vnto thys father set hades seales binding selues tompell kynge iohn poysoned king keepe thys contracte yet content afterward found meanes good kyng poysoned traytorous monke swinested say hee would make halfepeny loafe worth xx shillinges hee liued yeare whiche abhominable hypocrisie word holy monke moued went confessed hym selfe abbot would poyson king thys one deuill good holy traytor absolued holy murtherer deede done thys holy murtherer founded v mass euer blessed obedience holy church would cry would yaulpe wee ennemy true man theefe handled gentleman dogge fashion call v poore men traytors meane season bring king kingdome seruitude bondage treason bee treason bring honourable kinge hys lande bondage compell hym receiue naturall free kingdome vyllayne lymme ye deuell bee said thought defend matter haue onely done wrong kinge vnto yongest childe ye lyeth cradell ye meanes bonde thinke sufficient say deede first child father haue alwayes alowed acte hath beene blased blowen preached cryed bookes full matter many true man bloud hath beene shed speaking agaynst thys yet neuer none ye euer preach damnable facte full consent full agreement worde deede wrytyng haue alowed treason therfore take auctors well forefather would speake dampnable institute mass willing traytor murtherer neuer learninge could allow remedy hee dye agaynst king maintayning treason must needes bee saynt mass blessinges myracles wil helpe bee commaundement geue list pore men must bee accused insurrection treason must bere al blame must bee driuen ye realme must bee burned god knoweth people vnder heauen abhorreth earnester hart resisteth diligenly doth preach agaynst disobedience doe yea dare say boldely let bookes bee serched written year shall declare auctorite prince true obedience towarde hym one litle bookes shall doe bee condemned heresy helpe v may preach may wryte may doe maye sweare prince also assoyle men obedience towardes prince may compell prince bee sworne yet child obedience good christen men ye dye doctrine remedy must bee saintes rather fayle ye shall doe myracles proue tell holy saynt legend story germaine one ye pope saintes cronicles maketh mencyon hys name ye call germayne chaunced ye tyme king vortiger came england place king lay desired hym company lodging king hee kept como inne would receiue hym hee departed angerly went kinges neteherdes house desired lodginge meate drinke hym companye neteherde contet lodge hee sayd hee meate hym sauyng yong calfe stode suckyng damme crybbe byshop commaunded calfe bee slayne bee drest brought worthy miracle pope saintes afore hym hee company eate vp commaunded bone calfe bee gathered togither put calues skinne agayne bee layde cribbe damme ye calfe starte vp aliue agayne next day byshop went king vortiger reprooued merueilous straightly hee would lodge hym sayde hee vnworthey bee kyng deposed saint cowheard set vp kyngdome kyng therefore deposed hym made neteherde kyng hys stede neteherde ye cronicles maketh mension came afterward many king writen one called petrus de netalibus writeth liues saintes thinke man binde mee proue thing lye yet must bee preached taught church must bee writte holy saint liues hee must bee saynt hee deposed king set neteherde shamefull abhominable thinges doe prayse alowe meane season condemne v heretickes traytours chaunce moued abhomynablenes doctrine geue one euyll worde world rekoneth v vncharitable parte take god recorde afore whome shall bee saued damned though haue done mee shamefull wronge intollerable violece yet owne person neuer displeased angry agaynst horrible deuyll ye dwelleth causer auctor mayntayner abhominable doctrine god blessed worde agaynst hym say quarell agaynst hym doe striue truth let men take wordes abhominable thinke shamfully depose emperour hee sworne keepe peace ye church rome oth hee brake sayth ye pope second hee done sacrilege takyng gallyes laden holy spiritual prelate would haue gone ye councell gathered agaynst emperour lugdune third ye emperour accused certaine article heresye bee set fourth hee payed annuall pencyon kingdome sicill sicill pope calleth spirituall patrimony peter space ix yeares thinges dyd hee depose ye emperour pryuate hym hys dignity assoyleth hys subiectes othe obedience commaundeth euery man obey hym men ye eyther gaue hym councell helpe fauour bee excommunicate cursed facte deede doctrine learning bee promoted doctours vnto learnyng sworne bookes bee read openly vnyuersities marke v twayne bee traytours eyther doe depose emperours king trifle yea also make note difference betweene papistes protestantes lawe thereof swere vnto compell swere vnto el speake agaynst say ye doe wronge god blessed ordynaunce noble potentate fyrste ye ought bee vnder vnder doe repreue god worde vnlawfull factes depose though bee infydelles heretickes haue none authoritye ye see howe master christ hys blessed apostle vse selues towarde vnbeleeuyng prince neither deposed yet caused bee sworne vnto matter depose emperour bicause hee layeth handes carnall cardinall paule peter holy college yet laying handes deposed hee keepe peace sufficiet cause depose hym owne law testifieth otherwise holy church xxxiij q q inter haec god hath sworde spirituall sword whiche doth kill quicken lykewise xxiij q viij conuenter place blessed ambrose sayth willyngly neuer forsake bee copelled may resist may sorow may weepe may wayle agaynst weapon agaynst souldiers agaynst gothans teares weapon thynges bee defence priest otherwise ought may resist c blessed ambrose durst depose emperour neither laying hand yet heresie neither defendyng liberty holy church ambrose simple foole knew liberty church ment yet holy spirituall fleshe cardinal worth therfore hee could nothing weepe wayle hee beene halfe wise read certaine bishop salisbury hee done hauty mynde loftie courage byshop matter tyme kyng richard second chauced baker london beare horsebread basket came seruaunt byshop salisbury tooke violence loafe fro hym baker asked hee dyd hee made hym none aunswere brake head pore felow cryed helpe violence whereby people moued strete come keepe kinges peace byshops seruaunt compelled flye house neuerthelesse people moued great violence caused constable come take hym bryng prison anone maior shriues came pacified multitude departed byshops seruaunt hurt notwithstandyng byshop pacience bishop soone turned wrath salisbury archbyshop yorke moued citie makyng asaute bishop house made coplaynt kynges grace hee put maior shriues set knight called syr edward rule yt citie done horseloafe shall say pacience spiritual men doe open violence breake kynges peace robbe men goodes yea kynges chamber also kynges hygh strete great disdayne iustice rebuke kyng great dispeasure subiectes yet packe matter bee white sonnes men must suffer beleeue none otherwise haue witched worlde men could neither heare see bee shamefull fact tell shamefull becommed great deale better haue may cause insurrection treason ye master master best conueyers iugglers true englishe hart would thinke kynges request godly lawfull learnyng able defende contrary standeth fidelity owe toward prince yea truth owe father mother brother sisterne coutrey men doth othe made prince bynde v yet agree bookes must rather bee fulfilled contrary doctrine men must bee codened heretickes speaketh agaynst beleeue mortall enemy reken bee haue wel deserued bee could set matter spytte vse selfe charitable toward matter beene haynously violently hadled would haue geuen one ill woorde let man require vnto abhominable detestable deuill hath brought wicked shamefull learnyng maners put cappe make low curtesie geue fayre wordes say god geue good morow syr deuill fare glad welfare prosperity lordship doth rule graciously men prayseth doubte god shall prosper say let man require bee taken mortall enemy whersoeuer doe finde hym whether hee bee lord byshop sauing peraduenture spye hym dwelling byshoppe wyll hadle rough wordes weaknes certayne men would founde place vncharitable recited name innocent bloud haue shed time speaking vnlawfull doctrine ala fault coulde ye sinde good mayster bylney ye haue cast away violently dare master bylney say one among knew hym must commende prayse vertuous lyuinge though founde litle faulte thinke hee aliue faulte ala would cast away cruelly good man true god kyng returne agayne purpose shewe example haue learned taught set king kingdomes togither ye eares maintenance dignity doctrine pope vrban vj chose yeare lord iohan fros croni suis sedition violence romaine would haue cardinall fraunce woulde pope shoulde bee resident rome vrban say deuising mayntaine secte part agaynst aduersary called clement whose side ye kyng frauce helde sent kyng england ed well content frenche kyng certayne bulles contaynyng cleane remission poena culpa would wage battayle kyng fraunce clementes side kyng lord pope clemet pope vrbane vrbane clement eche defiyng cursing shoulde bee willinger take battayle hee sent commaundement byshops rayse spiritualtie taxe pay souldiours wyth moreouer duke lancaster tytle kyngdome castell helde clementes side therefore ye pope graunted part money also bee deliuered hym hee would wage battayle agaynst ye kyng castell promysing hym also hee would styrre kyng portyngale also varyaunce sayde kyng castelll warre agaynst sayd kyng mayntaynyng warre hee would graut yt kyng portyngale demy spiritualty thorow realme much gathered portyngale story maketh mension london diocese gathered tune golde whole realme england gathered xxv c frankes whiche make englishe money cc lxxvij vij c lxxvij money gathered ye spiritualitie diligence therefore pope ordayned henry spenser byshop norwych bee chiefe captayne warre euer pope coulde brynge matter passe sent ye king lordes byshoppes xxx bulles last thys foresayd byshop norwyche sent foorth greate number men wage church duke lankester likewise agaynst kyng castell theyr oth geuen fight agaynst man countrey helde pope vrban chronicle saith pope vrban would haue made peace betwene frech king last thinke pope styrres vp procurer warre destruction people countreys pretie practise set men together eares make beleeue woulde make peace fyrst must haue cleane remission fight tha wee shall bee curssed blacke potte wee make peace pope hath hys purpose goodly packyng spirituall men goodly obedience taught toward prince bee men soules well fed wyth thys doctrine bee good father thus watcheth nyght daye yt cure charge haue men soules marke charitable liberall holy father bee distributing christes merites euery man fighteth cause shall haue cleane remission pena culpa must needes bee childe saluation let christ say doe hee holye church hath determined man shoulde doubt bee xxx bulles graunted vnder leade church rome dist xix si ro enim vero nul ifas ca sic omnes erre spirituall lawe sayth sea rome doth approue must needes bee allowed reproueth must bee strength likewise place must decree sea rome bee accepted though spoken godly voyce peter hymselfe agaynst thinges dare speake would fayne bee taken christen man yet muste bee bolde speake one worde truth deuill himselfe hath blowen presumptuous voyces yet must set life soule wordes bee xxx bulles leade confirme matter weightye thynge kyng iohn naturall prince shoulde haue pyed moke defece realme small summe money neuer bull gette yet one byshop englad preach side cc pound gathered one lent greate deale maintainauce ye pope holy flesh marueilous subiectio suffer cause neuer great vnto right naturall lege lord ye doe beleeue kynges grace day desire ye spirituality halfe summe dare say ready spiritualtie helpe pope wold neuer graut good shoulde bee found one fidelitie truth hart men ought haue beare toward naturall prince toward natiue countrey toward father mother toward wiues childre yea toward liues god infinite goodnesse hath geuen v noble prince maintaynyng defence thynges toward hym haue litle none affection vnto idole rome ready geue body goodes geue better content merueilous poueryshyng realme sende many thousandes receiue nothyng agayne deceitfull bulles sheepes skynnes litle peece leade yea worst make men beleeue saluation dyd hange dare say boldly poore men bee conde ned heretickes also traytours kyng realme england stad good condition men beene bounde still conscience profite england hath gospell obey wretched idole durst haue kept ye innumerable summe money within realme ye yearely sucked adder godly learnyng instructed conscience let liberaries bee sought englad shall one booke writte iiij c yeares admitted church rome spiritualtie founde doth teach obedience fidelitie toward prince deliuereth realme bondage wicked sathan pope el able satisfie quiete man conscience within realme yet dare say hee englad ca reproue learnyng doctrine master christ el holy apostle yea haue studyed deuised might bryng mighty prince noble realme vnder ye feete deuill could bee nothyng handled secretly within realme either pleasaunt profitable pope know byshops england sworne reuelate matter may bee wel proued shamefull trayterous byshops made pope church rome lord pope successours lawfully entryng popedome shall consent counsell deede hee shoulde lose either lyfe lymme hee bee taken euill trap councell shall bee shewed vnto called onles bee lawfully let pope legate shall honorablye entreate goyng commyng necessity shall helpe shall visite yearely either myne owne proper person el sure messenger sea rome onles bee dispensed helpe god holy euangelist hath beene wonderous packing vsed hath cost many thousand men liues ere spiritualitie brought passe bee sworne pope owe none obedience man onely matter hath beene wonderous craftely conueyed beginnyng bishop sworne straitely vnto pope doe read tyme isidorus decretis gregoris mi noris c nomine gregory thyrd yeare lord vij c lix othe sweare keepe fayth holy church abide vnity consent man pleasure contrary promise also seeke profites church rome byshops lyue agaynst olde statute holy father haue conuersation rather forbidde coulde el trewly shewe pope othe cotinued pope chaungeth bishop oth ofte maketh profite great many yeares tyll mortall hatred sprang betwene emperour pope confirming byshops many byshops confirmed pope sweare othe haue first written othe gregory maketh mention sufficient byshops bounde betray prince reuelate counselles pope thing ye pope must needes know el hee coulde bring passe purpose say coulde bee lord ouer worlde cause emperours kynges fetch confirmation kneele downe kisse feete hee broght passe hee proceeded farther firste kynges hee brought wt violence vnder pope foote byshops bee sworne maintaine adding thinges byshops othe maintayning worldly honour dignitie shall afterward appeare first wee wyll examine othe standeth god worde true obedience prince pray tell scripture el example mayster christ holy apostle haue take doctrine learne swere saint peter el church rome el pope neede sweare saint peter ye ca neither doe hym good fidelitie yet hurt falshode othes taken hee othe made vnto might bee sure true helpe succour hym sweareth agaynst men could hurte hym saint peter hath none enymies though hee yet hee afearde neyther helpe hym deliuer hym hee neede verytie good peter must stand fore frunt make men afrayde make men beleeue frendes god knoweth neyther fauour person lrarnyng lyuyng peter person nette necke thinke would bid hym walke beggar called heretik doe sweare folowe hys lyuing preach teach doctrine maketh nothing purpose therefore swerre onely peter name wherein wyll bee faythfull peter mayntane worldly honour dignity rich know well hee sayth hee hath forsaken thinges christes sake thinges thinke hee require none othe wherfore needes bee faythfull sworne vnto peter muste bee mayntayning defending spirituall thynges preaching christes gospell purely sincerely mynystring truelye institution master christ ye blessed sacramentes holy church vertuous lyuyng geuing example holy church christe bee othe truely periured worthy weare paper doe reken selues hye honorable goe aboute simple thinges bee therfore haue applyed selues holy workes byshops greater matter christening belle halowing church blessing candels consecrating holy oyle halowing chalesies vestementes aulters geuing dayes pardon receiueth blessing streate visyte holy saintes like greate matter partayneth nothing othe wherefore doe recken ye true forme othe haue byshops ye bee periured abiured call god agaynst peter prince foloweth holy church rome needeth good doe ye holy church rome profyte sweare request holy scripture shoulde sweare thinke compell othe bee true must shee needes sue periurie breake othe marke ye church rome set othe better person pope wherefore must needes followe ye pope vnder ye church lesse church hed church except make hym third person neither pertayneth peter yet holy churche thyng selfe law sayth neither god prohe vi ca quoni verbo papa man middle betweene much say learnyng deuill hym selfe meaneth sweare onely holy churche rome bee traytours holy feede norish bee true owne church haue taken cure charge peter commaundeth see pe feede christes flocke among haue taken name lyuyng dignitie called byshop winchester london lyncolne fed bee forgotten sorte liueth agaynst god agaynst blessed worde agaynst liuyng holy aposties agaynst coditios holy mother ye church could say whoredome oppression sodomytrie murther pope pride summa summarum maner mischief toung ca tell hart thinke say men would reken vncharitable vehement neuerthelesse worlde knoweth doe recken selfe vertue oth boude men vnto deede liueth vngracious maner yet bee faithfull true vnto agaynst men yea dare say conscience true description leudnes byshops rome codemned mischief would neuer haue desired assistence el haue thought necessary haue required othe veritie bee naught haue neede mayntainers mischief also suspect bee true except made othe yea scarsly onles deede tyme place conuenient doe betray prince ye cause othe profite hath kyng bee reported practise euer came othe foloweth lord commeth pope name lord pope would gladly learne pope hath got dignitie lord thyng litle regarded lordes byshops bryng worldly dignitie yea say trifle mocke men speaking agaynst truth durst much time past would burne litle trifle best lord england dare say hath cost many man lyfe euer brought pope lordshyp blessed peter whose successour pope boasteth selfe bee knew nothing lordshyp bee sayth vnto hys felowes pet shall exercise lordshyp ouer congregation likewise paule durst take vppon cor commaunde lord collection bee made poore men mekely desire without lordshyp also place let cor man iudge v minister christ blessed paule rekeneth selfe minister seruaunt yet ye day hath beene good lord pope master christ came teach peter paule learned disciple math vse selues lordes seruauntes marke occasion hee bee two newe disciple brought vnto old beyng yet perfite thought scorne two sit aboue ye one right hand left master christ reproueth proude stomacke straitely saying ye prince ruler infidel hath power ouer subiectes shal ye hee bee greatest amog shal bee least master christ learneth none hypocrisie shold bee called lest name bee greatest deede hee doctrine shalbee expressed deedes lord pope calleth selfe woordes seruaunt seruauntes deede hee wil bee lord ouer lord seruus seruorum yea lordes byshops bee sworne hym vnto lord wil reken selues periured burne take pope seruaunt marueilous hypocrisie pope monstrous hipocrite bee called seruaunt seruauntes yet desire bee taken lord kyng ouer kynges yea vnto bee byshops sworne wil bee obedient prince conscience rypped finde sit kyng losell pope poore men must bee co demned reprouyng verely lord haue sworne hym agaynst prince true subiectes howe standeth othe toward prince bee sworne pope onely lorde also contrary yea worlde greatest mortall ennemy prince hath dare say good minde clement pope bare vnto kyng henry viij wretched clemet could drowne noble prince one worde shoulde bee longe vndone sine clementia common sayinge went hamburgh caytyfe hath al onely excomunicated noble prince also geuen away kingdome facte must defende sworne ye pope yea dare say conuenient occasion would declare fidelitie doe iudge factes haue done kinges tymes past whensoeuer power might bring passe ye haue conceiued agaynst prince thinke iudge mysse el doe wrong let bee put proofe shall see heape holy factes ye bring chronicle bookes bee lauded praysed hyely haue faythfully stucke vnto da nable idole rome yea dare say beene heresie within two yeares haue written sayd thus much agaynst lymme deuyll prince side ye worlde testefye wherefore thinke put tryall othe howe doth stand allegyance toward prince bee sworne pope owne lawe sayth lege man make none lib de senten et iudicata ca pastoralis verbo homo que othe fydelytye none man owne kinge moreouer doe remeber othe made vnto prince wherein doe renounce clause wordes sentence made vnto pope may bee hurtfull preiudiciall highnes agreeth ij othes may set togither well ca know way excuse byshops periurie auoyde periury truth kinges grace councell considering othe made pope bee periudiciall regall power causeth othe afterwarde made vnto reuoke thinges haue afore sworne ye pope declare grace counsell reckon othe made ye pope bee therfore maketh reuoke name naming othe also pope may clearely perceiue prince doth suspect byshops assoyled oth towarde prince neuer othe made pope othe making deede pope meaning none betray ye king realme therfore soone variance betweene ye king yt pope first assoyled allegyance dew vnto king absolucion blasen blowen preached taught throughout world dores postes must bee decked paper bulles discharge helpe prince could neuer bee discharged hereticall trayterous othe made vnto pope agaynst prince neither peter paule helpe key ye open locke lord god haue beene blynded thus trayterously handle naturall prince caterpiller come bee lorde hath brought kinges vnder hys feete speake god willyng peculiar treatyse foloweth successours lawfully regularly entryng lawe reade owne di qui episcepus ex consilio cartha bookes law thinketh bee byshops made wherein finde among good thinges hee shoulde bee chaste lyuyng meeke gentle speake mercyful wel learned yt new olde testamet ye shoulde forbyd maryage blame eating fleshe also beleeue maner synnes well actuall original bee clerely forgeue baptysme many thing pope holines indewed many hee aloweth owne bookes deedes wil testelie wherfore recken othe doth meane law yet ye lawe blessed paule writeth recken vertue timo tit othe haue beene bound one pope yeares must folowe haue lawes blessed paule speaketh councell charthaginence chose pope farre men recken common experience practice bee primis hee shall bee able lawfull pope bee pope must bee vegeable tyraut neuer keepeing peace wayes warryng defence yee call peter patrimonye suffer prince dwell rest hym snatch possession vnholy church rome set prince together eares tyll bee weary take ye matter hande neuer make ende tyll partyes hath geuen possessios holy fatherhed assoyle soules hath bene slayne packyng hee pope wickednes described large dare moste boldelye least shame depose prince without cause hee best able bee pope trayne craft subtyltye bring vnder hym byshop spirituall person inuent newe clausein othe hee bee alowed afore moreouer hee ye keepeth fewest woman hath wote hee holyest apte bee head church hee ye tyranously burne preaching ye gospel hee hym selfe take labour therein item burne priestes ye mary wiues hee hym selfe liue myschefe whordome yea abhominablenes man may honestye speake knowe meane man say hath good testimony afore spirituality hee lawfull man office furthermore hee whore clement pope sonne curtisan sonne holy father finde meanes men forswere selfe hee lawfully borne holy clement dyd fitte father child finally hee ye geue mony bye ye greatest part cardinales hys syde hee best worthy bee called pope sit peter stoole bee vnknowen ye thomas woulcy holy piller church woulde haue beene pope whe clement chosen offer resonable peny clement dasshed hym consayte li hee offered hee iudged best worthy entered lawfully regularly vnto bishop bee sworne obedient haue head bee member coulde el kingdome stand pope shoulde bee chosen paules rule ye vayne trompery ye clergie clearly ouerthrowne one bee chosen rule blessed paule el lyuynge newe heretykes bee simple poore care dignityes neuer swere fyght would rather mary wyfe owne take men alwayes studying preaching god worde seeking onely honour god profyt neighbour bee subiect obedient thinges desiring none exception prince man say shoulde bee vnlawfull eligible hee able destroy ye whole kingdome ye papistes worthy receiue othe lordes ye byshops gladly periured ma sake able destroy ye whole church rome vnto byshops haue beene sworne foloweth othe shall consent counsell deede shoulde lose eyther lyfe member shoulde bee taken trapped euill meane neede sweare thus vnto charitie deth men thinke well one another pope doth order charitie binde thus vse selfe towarde men say neither hurt harme neither intrappe betraye men must bee betrayde crafte subtiltie vndone mayntenaunce thys one wretched person truth neuer man spake popet destroyde betrayde popet hath blasphemed betrayde potestates yet neuer hym sworne hym keepe othe bee right wrong last othe hath beene newely made added thys clause man lay violent bandes vpon wyse wrong shoulde bee done vnto maner colour part newly brought since fleshe pope much holy tyme past hath beene fleshe pope hath beene holy man might touch harlottes christen men must patiently suffer iniuries wroges head forsweare point mayntaine himselfe power men neare apostle liuing christen men well iudge foloweth othe counsell shal bee shewed vnto mee either theyr letter messenger shal open man hurte damage let prince beware whan pope sendeth couselles vnto meaning betraye worlde knoweth pope doth litle regarde beggar worlde doth handle emperours kyngs duke doth handle must let destroye pope counsell may shewe man kyng sworne pope say othe made vnto prince wherein sweare shall faithfull true beare vnto aboue creature loue fauour lyue dye hym open vnto maner counselles may bee hurtful vnto grace well knowne pope hath pope doth practise counsailes honourable state prince done dayly doth handle cou selles bee prince honour conseruation yet may neyther tell prince let sworn pope sworne prince tell thyng opened vnto prince pope handeled counsell agaynst prince thing take recorde noble grace whether say true false yet must bee accused treason sworne pope true kyng foloweth shall helpe defend mayntaine papistry rome men sauing myne order new othe oure dayes made added regalles saint peter bee contained prince must needes defend ye bee sworne pope forsworn prince othe prince defend wit reason men must forsake one practise hath beene alwayes forsake prince sticke pope othe made prince haue article manifestly gospell luk homo quis constituit iudice contrary paule iam omnino delictum est c myne aduersaries vncharitably layde two article mee though condempned lawemaker lawe execution thereof whan onely spake agaynst lawfull christen man demaunde debt order law lawfull vexe sue vncharitably necessitie make payment rather shall perish dye prison whiche thyng agaynst charitie neuer poore vnlike pay debte two person spake none neuer mine intent forbid suing lawe doe know well maiestratus god ergo must needes followe lawes hauing probable reason nature made conserue common wherfore must needes followe wee may lawfully vse men may misuse cunning beautie may also misuse excellent gift lawes lawes bee euill wee vse intent ordayned man doubteth vsing god creature must bee epykya meane measure order man may therby destroy neighbour order charitie guide ruler vsing creature men make rumour whole countrey trifle el sue neighbour able meanes paye hys debte vtterly vndoe
