poore husband wherby moued send frend name called ihon drake well knowe cambridge vnto spake maner countreyman sory heare vncharitable demeanour hath beene wt mee poore woman weepyng waylyng cry howe haue vndone poore husband miserable child haue one bitte bread towardes foode neither shee able labour wherefore marueile sore wil bee extreme vnto poore men god visited pouertie proue charity mercy haue christes hand whiche extreme vnto poore neighbour hee hath bought precious bloud vnto hee made aunswere maner thyng pertained hym vnto church wherfore euill counsell doctours law hee sayd doctours law say must sue therefore vnder payne deadly sinne wrong learne many wordes hym betweene concernyng maner next day preached reason selfe stoode afore ye church brought remembraunce case hee commoned bicause clearely couerted hym therfore recited case parable man knew meant hee thyng moued god knoweth speake suters whiche thinke case christen man alow therefore say myne article lawyer vtterly sinne among sayth paule cor bicause goe law one rather suffer wrog rather suffer ye selues bee robbed also master sayth man sue lawe math take thy coate thee let haue thy cloke also may say wordes wherfore written doe condemne suing case holy ghost bee learned master christ paule speaketh agaynst suters man denye text cleare suyng bee vnlawfull bee vnlawfull speake poore man wife child destroyed charitable wayes taken poore man whereby hee might make restitution learning saith summum ius summa iniuria est wherefore bee iudged christen men ought case geeue frende counsell sue whether bee worthy bee condemned spiritualtie forbiddeth priestes sue causa sanguinis et tamen non dapnat leges athanasius hereticke counsell frende brother rather suffer wrong vndoe whole housholde naughtie leude kettel let v see holy doctours hath written ouer place scripture doth erpounde first athanasius text saint paule bryng vtterly sinne among say condemnation ignomynie doe exercise iudicials among wherefore doe rather suffer wrong also saint hierome sinne vnto hiere ad cor doe comau demet christ haue iudgementes among ought alwayes keepe peace yea though losse temporall good wherefore doe rather suffer wronge ye ought commaundement doctours wyll destroy iudicialles onely vncharitable sutes gospell example lorde patiently suffer doe contrary onely suffer doe wrong vnto doe wronge c marke hierome calleth precepte commaundement counsell also calleth sinne doe comaundement likewise haymo saith offence sinne haymo ad cor haue iudicials accusation engendreth strife strife engendreth discorde discorde engendreth hatred least paraduenture woulde say sinne require mine owne therefore sayth apostle truely sinne vnto doe comaundement luke lord sayth taketh away thy good aske againe wherefore doe rather suffer losse ye might fulfill commaundement lord c marke hee calleth commaundement god sinne aske owne contention haue sayde mine article holy scripture also holy doctours say came doctour bee counsell ye condemne heresie lawe knew sayde lawe condemned thys epinio declared scripture bee counsel denyed sayd knew lawe sodainely doctour steuen byshop winchester shewed mee lawe whose wordes bee illud euangelij si quis abstulerit c quest ita non est precipientis sed exhortantis let euery christen man iudge whether wordes theyr lawe bee sufficient auctoritie refell holy wordes scripture came doctour wolma hee brought texte thy brother doe offende thee tell church sayd hee tell church aunswered place made purpose aleaging saint augustine mee speaketh crymes bee reprooued congregation correction temporall sworde also foloweth hee heare ye church coute hym heathe publican vttermost payne christ assigneth ye payne temporall lawe aunswere hee sore moued sayd abide burnt sharp sentence greate man hee apppelles ioly wyse felowe sayd vnderstoode myne answere well contet mee shomaker ne sutor vltra crepidam neuertheles let hym burne many yet playne haue spoken neuer worde holy scripture holy doctours say sentence wordes wherefore see condemne article heresye yea dare saye recken none heresy condene mee article wyll neuer beleeue yet neuer beleeue one man may sixte article lawe god byshop cyties yea whole coutrey contrarye paule sayth haue left thee behynde set tit euery citye byshop finde one place scripture ye bee called episcopi shal finde diuers place bee called persoiteri p brought afore lorde cardinall galary cardinall doctour barnes reasoned togither hee reade myne article tyll hee came hee stopped sayde touched hym therefore hee asked thought wronge one byshop shoulde haue many cityes vnderneath hym vnto answered could therefore heretick farther goe paules texte set euery cytye byshop asked hee mee thought vnright seeing ordinaunce church one byshop haue many city aunswered ye knew none ordinaunce ye church concerning thinge paules sayinge onelye neuertheles see contrary custome practise world know originall thereof sayde hee ye sigmetu apostle tyme dyuers city myle vj myle long ouer set one byshop subbards also likewise byshop hath one citye cathedrall churche country subbards vnto thought farre fetched durst denye greate auctorite holy father greate fayned sut thynge shoulde bee heretick deuine dare say holynes could neuer proue scripture yet auctorite doctours yet practise apostle yet must bee true piller church hath spoken let v see ye doctours say myne article athanasius doth athanasius declare text apostle haue left thee behinde c hee woulde commit vnto one bythop whole ylde hee inioyne euery cytye shoulde haue proper pastor supposing ye meanes shoulde diligently ouer see people also ye labour bee easye beare c also chrisostome chrisostome texte hee would ye whole countrey shoulde bee permitted vnto one man hee enioyned vnto euery cure ye meanes hee knew labour shoulde bee eaysye subiectes bee diligece gouerned teacher distract ye gouerning many church cure charge one church onely c mee thinketh bee plaine wordes able moue man speak asmuche graunte may haue city yet make none heresy lord cardinall graunted agaynst hym bee god poore man must bee heretike remedy haue able say nay scripture yet god hymselfe bee proued scripture vij article man churche shoulde haue greate temporall possession say great possession could kepe many seruantes many dogges many horse maintayne great pompe pride liue deliciously heresye fynde heresye speake horse houndes abhominable lyuing doubtles say myght haue possession onely spake superfluousnes abuse ye world wondereth mischiefe worlde vsed ye clerely openly knowen doe abuse goodes church yet must bee co demned heretyke speaking ala doe thinke god suffer violence doe vse agaynst poore men stad ye daunger proue godly maiesty shall iudge matter beetweene mee dare trust hym sure viij article law god haue iurisdiction seculer yet chalege power haue doe put vse must say iewes sayde may kill man article dyd byte bee content office byshop bee also kynges howe standeth god lawe othe haue declared noble prince doubt hee put tryall haue many yeres condemned officicers bee byshops hangman god amende many poore man deliuered hym temporall power put death knew nothing cause hee would ye yee shoulde put hym death selfe answered yee might kyll man yt alwayes hangman say bee successours ix article christ apostle see folow none iudas beare purse haue money great possession sure c would speake agaynst dare one losse promotion article ouercome witnes world may well condemne heresie true pater noster iudas solde ter sell often hee commeth handes would yee coulde proue mee lyer folowed apostle sauing iudas onely yea woulde yee certayne pointes good iudas beene better medled mee matter compelled speake many thinges would shame worlde neuer haue spoken haue take make best greatest pharisie x article church sure pricke wordes hee knoweth bee true though hee say contrary doe well know article speake doctour rydle tyme graunted maister doctour butte house byshoppes cleane order therefore say know ordynary byshops prelate xj article doe followe false prophet balaam woulde curse people prouision god compelled blesse say teach liue well though theselues liue mischeuously ass ride vpo common people haue liues abhominaiton haynous heresie speaketh holy father bee almost holy balaams asse speake worde god good purpose doe neuer graunt offende caulling ordinary byshops shoulde haue called inordinate butcher compared balaam owne lawe quest secuti sunt cap no si q secuti sunt cap no si liuing worlde knoweth coulde tell many holy pointes deceiue simple bee ye false maisters saint peter speaketh pet bee fountaines without water geue good doctrine people heresie copare lawes baall looke whether interpretation worde doe agree wyth nature without hope money graunt conclusion false pardon worlde knoweth handlyng pope pardon hath beene best marchaundise england dare say best marchaundise worlde handle maruaylous blindnes great presumption cruelly handle mee article middell haue punished mee speaking agaynste must needes hereticke dare say one among shameles ye dare come forth day proue article heresie agaynst mee doubtles long liue restored name fame againe haue violently taken away mee bee vnto deuill pestilence require nothing good name fame haue right ought charitie restore mee though neuer required thinke haue punished mee inough speaking foolishe worde twayne wilte thou know benediction xiiij article worth rather geeue thee benediction one halfepeny sore heresie ryde thorowe streetes townes blessing man stone neuer geeue halfepenye man childe nowe come pardon wherby xv article say haue power sende hundreth soules heauen may doe without respect may likewise sende hell foloweth text quodcunque ligaueris euer thou byndest sore heresye say may rule matter iudgment marueylous texte quodcunque ligaueris bindeth hell loseth heauen openeth men purse cofers earth deposeth prince interditeth landes looseth man coote yea often tymes loseth man wife yea horse carte done texte quodcunque ligaueris merueilous text hath greate power know bible abhominable heare howe xvj article preach teach may absolue poena culpa sure impossible vnderstand make looke owne scholasticall doctours learneth boldlye keyes church hath none auctorite ouer sinne yet ouer eternall payne onely hath auctorite chaunge euerlasting payne vnto temporall payne pope may chauge take away pleasure amog temporall paynes reken purgatory ye greattest ouer yt pope hath full power owne doctrine looke alexander de hale alexander dun bonauenture iiij sent dun bonauenture booke sentence condemne mee must fyrist condemne owne doctrine cause forbid v shoulde discusse xvij article greate power would make fooles holde v ignoraunce owne scholemen say pope power greate man may discusse also lawe co maundeth bee hardy pope may bee conptrolled man aske ye pope lord doe put case lye yet farre heresie yet lordes say shall bee heretyke say haue say yea thou beest content yu shalt bee burnt mary thank hartely lord pro bona vestra informacione haue lawe moste abhominable contrarye god lawe xviij article charitie excommunicate people tymes yeare say men raise rent house must vnderstand beelong church beelong vnto ye church thou maist raise euery moneth ons man shall curse thee also curse bee buried parishe church ye must bee vnderstaded bee rich men bee poore may bee buried amog frier byshop bath sayd ther maner curse men ye world knoweth contrary ouer red article booke generall curse belongeth saynt benet church cambrige marke myne owne hand yet byshop ashamed denye muste bee heretyke remedye holy father hath determined haue myters glystering xix article precious stone haue gloues catching colde ye middest ceremony haue rynges ouches ceremony many ye manner nothing el church iewyshe maners wyll make heresy speake danable pompous myters thinke ornamentes bee condemned euen among heathen men say among christean men man may speake agaynst pompe prelate dare say neuer god among heathen men euer delighted ornamentes yet serue god heauen poore brother christ hath redeemed precious bloud dyeth prison openly streate hangeth selfe necessitie yet wil bestow hym much one precious stone tell one byshop euer brake myter helping poore man neuer man necessitye england ye world may see bee thinges bee sensible inough myters tell xx article whence come except take iewes byshops take ye iewes let also take theyr sacrifice oblation offer calues lambes dyd haue nothing doe wee bee christen men iewes pray tell mee byshops myters co meth iewes yee finde one pricke holy scripture myters mayster institute byshops paule setteth office also ornamet yet speaketh neuer worde myters dare boldelye bee co tent truely doe yee wronge myters horne ca xxi article tell signifye except horne false prophet whome spoken king horne shalt yu blowe afore thee syria dyd hee mocke ringes ornamentes saw exposition agree thyng man bee lesse learned bee speake great many wherefore thought vaine exposition therfore compared two horne myter meaneth two horne false prophet bicause know false prophet sayde vnto kyng hee shoulde two horne blow afore syria yet hee lyed kyng first slayne likewise say vnto kynges folowe cousell mayntaine authoritie bee ruled shal ouercome enemy sinne death hell yet saluo ordine vestro lye haue word god wherefore must false prophetes haue copared similitude myters two horne false prophetes bee false proue yet make none hereticke must make men heretickes haue compared forkes myters new old testamentes true apostle haue made greater lye haue done neuer able proue proue saying true ye stad scripture el wil taken hereticke haue baculum pastoralem xxij article take sheepe like shepheardes hooke intricate manifold crooked turneth alwayes may bee called mase hath neither begynnyng endyng like knocke swine woules head take sheepe haue also pyllers pollaxes notwithstandyng sayd thus much say sermon agaynst onely damned sermon gorgious pompe pride exteriour ornament sayd well say well well sayd sure wordes made hereticke wordes beene therein myne londo intelligence barnes become called tunstall departyng prison sayd vnto substa ciall man dead dare say conscience recken hereticke would haue killed selfe voice wet yet would hee haue done gladly charitie sayd hee amsterdame neuer beene life god knoweth yet countrey x yeares certaine men speake sayd hee hee fained certaine wordes say added thereunto lorde cardinall would haue agayne cost great gracious prince haue shewed grace article myne aduersaries vncharitablie hath layd agaynst whiche though greate many wordes sayinges yet neuerthelesse left thing make declaration probation wordes also mollifying temperatyng thinges seemed bee somewhat hardly spoke agaynst byshops whiche thinges longe recite vnto noble grace god iudge also conscience wordes deedes maner liuyng conuersation neuer intende speake agaynst byshops el man liuing conuersation agaynst blessed word god holy doctrine christes churche truth great clerke church auncient learned father cry vpo pryde lewde lyuyng byshops god cccc yeares wrote thyng hee complained vehemently agaynst liuing spiritualtie let bookes bee brought foorth proue whether saying truth ala pituous case yea also agaynst law conscience poore man shalbee thus violently cast away speaking agaynst vice beene damned almightie god hys holy creature yea byshops selues worlde must graunt doe liue euill yea rather worse speake oh lord god loue vertue shamefastnes christen men ought haue iustice shalbee thus shamefully cast awaye speakyng thynge euery christen man bounde speake doe lyue beyng preacher verity must bee condemned speakyng agaynst gracious mightie prince god hath set grace honour dignitie god ordinaunce ought defende men oppressed wrongfully wherefore humbly meekely lowlynes reuerence beseech grace minister vnto gracious iustice let bee heard indifferently whether iustifie cause learnyng iustifie grace minister iustice earnest petition made doctour barnes refuse maner payne shal bee due trasgressio wherfore one agayne meekenes lowlynes way charitie christes name sweete bloud sake hee hath shed grace yea also ye vertue auctoritie heaue ly god hath deliuered doe require desire grace audience iustice paretes bee naturall subiectes borne great many v hath dyed grace quarell yet none v ready doe grace seruice bodyes bloud shall become trewe subiectes doe noble prince wherfore thyrdely name name al rebuked meekenes reuerence beeseche grace gracious audience fauorable iustice thing trust grace denye yet take displeasure poore subiect thus requiring haue none prince lorde seeke vnto earth vnto grace onelye come charitable ende myne aduersaries wherefore compelled extreme violence thus complayne vnto grace name fame estemacion thinges belong honest poore man world take wrogfully mee hereby haue dyd myne aduersaries gather article knew offered selfe preach agayne sonday folowing declare selfe meanyng clearely doctour rydley doctour preston chaplens kynsmen yt byshop london foud meanes yt vicechaucelour doct batnes inhibited preachyng inhibet preach could neuer know reasonable cause alonely hee sayde shoulde bee profyt holde peace content tyll last foresayd doctours one master tyrell gathered writyng certayne article presented vicechauncelour sent mee asked mee sayd article aunswered none myne certayne wordes sentence spoke left yt make declaratio wherefore sayd none myne would bee reported audience hee sayde take hede denied brouht wytnes agaynst must nedes dye aunswered witnes shoulde bee false neuer spake sayde hee could proue negatiue aunswered woulde proue yt witnes false euer hee hee sayd whether popish law tyrannous true false must suffer witnes come agaynst mee lawe sayd yt piteous case lawe might condemne christ hee sayd yt shoulde remember mee matter daungerous haynous lawe might haue counsell aunswered sayd well let god helpe knoweth thing vniuersite scholes doores shut fast man wt parte alone aduersaries parte doctour rydly doctour watson doctour preston doctour law whose name haue forgotten also one master fooke mayster tyrel appoynted amonge bee presenter article nowe vicechauncelour hee coulde haue mee co munication beetweene v bee asked mee would doe answered hee goe way set hym downe heare complaint would make aunswere god put mynde hee required mee instantly cast selfe away hee went set hym downe called soone came stoode forth tyrell presented roule certayne article hee doctour barnes accused contention sedition heresie sayd gathered sermon yt sayde hee contentious sedicious sklaunderous hereticall hee thus spoken sayd hym good tyrell wyll present article heresye word spake yt vicechauncelour mee good mayster doctour let passe wyll bee content submyt selfe sayd euer haue spoken god word exposition holy doctours bee content bee reformed submyt selfe doctour rydlye doctour watson content except adde vnto offended lawes church stopped sayde large knewe ment lawes church doctour lawe wherefore iudged sufficient mee bee reported god worde exposicion holy doctours facultie vicechauncellour rekened sufficiet mee could agree great space thing wherefore sayd woulde agree maner lawes yt gaynst god worde agustine hierome yet none foure doctours rest yt day poynt handeled tyme whole body yt vniuersitie gathered togither knocked schoole doores said would heare examination seeing matter manifest persos take auctorite onely determine cause vicechauncelour sent bedell doore requiring bee content moued knocked sorer rose vicechauncelour went hym selfe dore gaue good faire word hee coulde conclusion woulde departe except might heare matter iudged sayd apertained learning body vniuersitie yt vicechauncelour came backe agayne vnto bodye vniuersitie stirred vp v sayde wee must geue ouer matter vniuersitie rumour departed wee sunder within two three dayes cauled clare hall yt vicechauncelours chamber also foresayde doctours gathered agaynst mee entreate mee good wordes bee cotent bee ordered master vicechauncelours councell require master vicechauncelour woulde indifferently heare mee myne aduersaries togither sayde thing agaynst learning woulde bee ordered master vicechaucelours comaudement sayd done profyt mayster vicechaucelour sit iudgmet sayd frends woulde bee lothe matter shoulde bee heard iudgemet came witnes mee sure would lost aunswered witnes soeuer come proue article layde mee would proue false preached openly many learned men sermon doubted would testify truth partyes aunswere yee may note course yt pope lawe made mee thre witness came agaynst mee would three twenty helpe mee yt course lawe sayde pitious case yt man shall bee reported indifferently audience seing vniuersite false witness wherefore woulde abide dau ger let myne aduersaries doe vttermost shall thus dye must bee content sayd better master christ many wordes vsed many daungerous wayes shewed mee haue withdrawen mee purpose stad fast required mee goe backe cha ber communed togither secretly alone yt last sent vnto mee vicechauncelour intreated mee sore bee content ordinaunce co science hee could perceiue frendes intended saue name fame could doe lawe daungerous onles would followe counsell asked vicechaucelour would doe truely said article falsely vncharitably layde vnto mee hee aunswered bee ieoperdy subtile craftie popishe chauncelour ye matter therfore bee conteted graunt vnto yt would agree wise wherfore desired hym depart agayne vnto would come make resonable aunswer came making protestation first right worshipful maisters trust bee frend haue protestation much charity cast mee away onles perceiue great faute obstinacy mee trust shall fynde neuer intende speake yet boe agaynst christ holy doctrine notwithstanding seing yt lawe daungerous vicechauncelour haue tolde mee therfore rather put selfe vnto charitie stande yt daunger lawe purpose two article layd vnto mee thus aunswer article doe stande neuer mine neuer barnes answere article alleaged intended speake bee written neuertheles doe graunt yt bee many word also great many seteces ye speake wherfore doe submit self vnto desiring charitably deale wt mee take wordes yt worst sence made mee bee sworne stande ye vicechauncelours determination stopped great ye last graunted abide determinatio agaynst learning charitie vpon vicechauncelour assoyled mee said ab excomunicacione iuris note crafti willy fox standing vnknowen vnto mee notary make instrament agreementes know yt dealt mee frendes priuate person instrument made notary afterward prese ted vnto court witnes mee brought beefore byshops thus talking yt vicechauncelours chamber vniuersitie gathered togither ye bodye yt vniuersitie sent vp certayne maysters bachelours diuinity yt vicechauncelour requiring myght bee admytted examination mee muth heard mee preach aunswere made agayne suche matter hand deale mee frendlye deuise ende moste profite reason congregation compelled departe sonder tyme rested ye matter still space moneth tyme doctour watson doctour preston agreement vicechauncelour wente wrote reuocation made euery article selfe making reuocation graunt yt article layde mee addyng also note false euilishe practise popishe cleargie euery article beecause men vnderstode mee therefore reuoke article fyrst article sayde mynde hierome yt dayes lyke vertue added ye certaine men take mee ye would haue holy dayes therefore must reuoke article heresye item spoken myns article agaynst gorgious pompe pride spirituall ornamentes ad e yt certayne men dyd take sayinge would haue halowed chalice vestimentes yet ornameutes yt church therefore must reuoke article heresy euery one article coulde expounde word euell sentence el malice make mischeuous sedicious saying layd mee would haue reuoke though beene saying meaning neuer article either hereticall sedicious contentious blasphemous el pij auribus offensinus moreouer yt place good frende wrote reuocation priuely fast mee hee wright doctour preston man yet aliue nowe thing wrytyng cauled chambre eyght tenne yt best learned men yt god helpe true preacher styrreth vp good men cambryge bee yet aliue farre know sauing master george stafforde master bylney asked counsell thought best doe seing reuocation vncharitably made thinges falsly layde vnto charge myne article yet could bee charitably taken also concluded neither right conscience agree reuocation wherfore afterward vicechauncelour called agayne afore doctour rydley doctour watson doctour preston master tyrell deliuered mee reuocation chambre rede openly yt sonday folowing edwardes church saye neyther lesse therin cruell mercylesse papistes written yea also promyse afterward called forth hygher power spirituall bee content suffer payne punyshment hee shoulde lay vnto mee would agree wise determination consent condicions neyther agreeable learning yet standing charitie certayne article condemned heresie true iohns gospell charity would bee blamed thing neuer spake thought alonely malicious person dyd take sayinges false meaninges wherefore greate tragedy among sayde periured yt reason sworne abide determination yt vicechauncelour parte rekened oth bound mee reason vncharitably made promyse doe yea ye vicechauncelour hym selfe thought extreme ye many word ye cogregation dissolued make aunswere within eyght dayes would meane season master tyrell ride london founde ye meanes reason hee could obtayne mynd vniuersitie sayd would appaele vicechauncelour ye whole body vniuersitie cardinal sent downe doctour capon sergeant armes called gybso arest mee vniuersitie barnes arested sergeaunt armes appere grace counsell brought vp london ye twesday afore shroue sondaye wedensday night brought afore cardinall hys gallery westmynster take red article quietly tyl came hee stopped asked mee byshop might haue city one aunswered yt byshop instituted instructe teach cytie therfore hee might haue much vnderneth hee able preach teach mee thought paule agree commaudyng timothe set euery cytie byshop wherefore knew none order sayde hee paules dayes citie myles long beside subburbes whole cytye one byshop likewise byshop one cathedrall see resedue countrey subburbes vnto sayde nothyng hee woulde heare mee returned read forth ye article till came xxij article hee founde pyllers cardinall greatly delighted estemed cross pollaxes pollaxes hee stopped great disputation mee haue written afore article ye last wee came farre sayde article vncharitably gathered sermonde hee sayd defamed heresie answered sayde trust good knoweth suspect mee hee sayde doe knowe rumour bee brought afore v heresie aunswered rumour scattered mine aduersaries malice occasion haue geue sayd beleeue bee true purge selfe answered wyll bee bounde brynge vnto grace xx honest men well learned good name fame shall depose mee worthy infamy hee sayde bring mee vi x doctours diuinitie wil sweare neyther giltie yet worthy bee suspected aunswered possible bryng many doctours mee seeing two sermonde belonged byshops wherefore supposed woulde testifie wyth mee woulde brynge many honest men shoulde bee required shoulde bee well learned better testifie wyth mee sayde woulde helpe must bee peeres ye forme law sayd ye impossible sayd hee must bee burned answered trusted nothyng el haue grace fauour hys hand hee sayde hee sworne mayntayne lawes church therfore hee must follow ye forme lawe wherefore shoulde take deliberation selfe whether woulde stande course lawe el submit selfe grace submitted selfe vicechauncelour thereby circunuented therefore thought would bee hasty submitting self therefore aunswered woulde submit selfe grace thing coulde proued agaynst mee spoken contrary learning sayd submission woulde graunt much communication hee concluded wyth mee sayd foole coulde perceiue good hee vnto mee wherefore seeing woulde bee reported deedes therefore hee signed xv xvi doctoures sayde hee shoulde ye nexte day heare mee nexte day thurseday festigam sonday brought chapterhouse westminster maner examinatio westminster sate ye byshop bathe principall iudge byshop saint asse abbot westminster abbot burye doctour quarton doctour allen doctour stephen secretary many moe knew sayd byshop bathe syr defamed heresie denyed hee sayde yee doe see multitude people gathered heare examination whiche must rise fame sayde knewe cause gathering knewe neuer man brought man wyth mee sauing childe xiij yeares sayde hee dyd neuer heare man accused heresie sayde men may say pleasure let matter mee long faultles sayde hee wee doe beleeue faultles yet must purge selfe declare innocency answered content woulde bee reported men euer knew mee heard mee well sayde hee wel said sayde hee bee certayne article deliuered vnto v agaynst say desire know myne accuser nay sayde ye may note crafty iugglyng papistes hee wee proceede forme lawe wherefore say article aunswered vncharitably gathered agaynst mee wherefore deliuer certayne article court subscribed mine owne hande soone woulde nowe come daunger wist must needes purge selfe request el reuoke thinges laide mee though beene myne el must needes dye theyr lawe thyng neyther knew suspected thys innocet sooner trapped condemned among papistes hath beene cause maner men whatsoeuer came afore neuer good innocent must needes bee heretykes good vnto seldome deedes hath declared come purpose enquired diuers question mee nothing perteyning vnto mine article whether man might sweare whether lord cardinall myne ordinarye iudge wyth lyke captious interogations last came first article inquyred mee dayes alyke sayde mynde hierome dayes equall asked mee wee shoulde keepe holy dayes sayde yes matter wee great disputation till last lord rochester came hee asked mee commaundement sabatum sanctifices ceremoniall morall precepte answered ceremoniall alleaging mee augustine tha epist c xix sayd hee learned alwayes asked mee question assoyled neyther woulde coulde abiecte thyng agaynst mee commauded alwayes stand parte layde heades togither till inuented captious question called agayne myne answere geuen comaunded backe agayn thus continued three dayes space notary wrote reuocation article tyme myne aunswere heard thyrde day noone iij ye clocke greate long rolle offered vnto read word word stode commaundement geuen ye byshop bath speake one word afore people lesse written rolle hee would handle well inough required first see writte rolle would graut vnto aunswere made would read written well good stand ieoperdy desired know condemned article heresie sayd yea asked sayd would tell writte aunswered ala lordes ye truth iudgement haue spoken nothyng standeth augustine hierome doctours holye churche wherfore shall chaunce thus bee codened bee taught wherein tell preach tyme come byshop bathe aunswered shoulde take care preachyng hee would prouide alonly aunswere would read rolle desired doctour barnes forbydden preachyng would first pointe finger wold speake article condemned heresie would bee bounde proue true augustine el hierome would bee take hereticke said byshop bathe augustine hierome stad determination church vnto sayd church determined augustine hierome church may first see doe shall please sat still wone looking bishop bath commaunded departe aside tooke counsell togithers last called agayne sayd syr ye shall haue man shall read vnto afore well said content one notary lay assigned vnto departed litle aside hee began read yeare lord day moneth one doct barnes conuented byshops westminster certeine article gathered sermonde hee preached cambridge whiche bee sclaunderous bee erronious bee contentious bee seditious bee foolishe bee hereticall hee came worde hereticall asked hym hereticall hee answered mee agayne yee haue heard lordes sayth make whiche article condemned heresie would bee taught handle forme law byshop bath auswered sayd chose whether would read ye rolle el bee burned ye one doe sayd iesus haue mercy wil surely read lest deliuered againe doctours cryed vppon one shoulde remember selfe cast selfe awaye manner read rolle said small thing neuer worse see lord cardinall bee good gracious vnto would speake supposed deede would haue required grace deseruyng haue read rolle afore ye face world seeme haue victory agaynst thing greatly regarde deede knowen beene mischieuous poyson tyranny cruelnes founde afterward would neuer haue read haue dyed god bryngeth thinges passe pleasure vpon opinion reason theyr good wordes pituous spake vnto mee graunted reade roolle woulde haue read byshoppe bathe sayd late great neuertheles ye last hee deliuered mee roole reade ye people stoode called heare ye iij dayes man suffered heare one worde spake commaundement geuen mee red adding nothing saying one word might make myne excuse supposing haue founde byshoppes better commaunded subscribe make crosse note crossing tossing papistes vse commaunded goe kneele downe byshop bathe require absolution hym hee woulde assoyle mee except woulde first sweare woulde fulfill penaunce hee shoulde enioyne mee sweare yet suspectinge e men cromme charitie within sworne enioyned hee mee returne nyght agayne pryson nexte day fastingam sonday doe open penaunce paules worlde shoulde thynke marueylous haynous heretyke cardinall came next day ye pompe pride hee could make paules church bring mee poore soule consayte moreouer determined matter substancially byshop rochester must preach day glori u assembly papistes sermon agaynst lutherians though couicted one truth afore god farre thinges man could bee sauing tyrat persecutour god worde gorgyous fasing myters crostaues abbotts prior done blinde people outface mee god amend thinges amysse beene well content haue suffered thinges might haue come charitable end must returne agayne prison remayne tyll lord cardinal farther pleasure pleasure abide fyrst last yeares three quarter yet could neuer bee poynt sent vnto byshop london certayne worshipfull men cardinall put matter hym cyty lodon whose name bee mayster lambert hath beene maior raynold hath beene shreue palmer petyt iones pernell desyred men way charitie goe byshop london desire bee good gracious vnto mee offended would bee glad make amends asmuch hee reasonably require mee desiring hym shew hee would charitie require doe bee bound vnto hym ye would keepe dyd aunswer ye hym bee men aliue part tell amongst maister petit sayd vnto byshop ala lorde petuous case man come daunger lawe remedy helpe hym yes sayd byshop sayd maister petyt yong man hath good frendes would bee right lothe haue cast away wherefore bee remedy deuise wil bee bound byshop astonyed sayde last hee would speake lorde cardinal mee offered goe bee bounde mee hee sayde neede neuertheles hee spake vnto departed god saue speaking whe came home one durst geue mee much bread meat hee durst geue dog yet speake one word mee immediatelye byshop founde ye meanes sent northapton remayne perpetuall prison thus gracious prince haue handled poore oratour beseche highnes bee good gracious vnto mee iudge bee charitable dealyng thus codemne mee heretyke shew mee poynt wherefore euen violent tyrannye compeil mee doe confesse el bee put death bee yet ye come forth proue article heresye refuse suffer payne grace shall iudge worthy thus lord iesus christe preserue noble grace euermore amen onely fayth iustifieth shall finde paule stifly strongly newe workes euer hee agaynst iewes theyr olde workes hee condemne work law instituted mouth god best workes euer thinke workes haue inuented shalbe alowed briefely marke argument righteousnes cometh law christ dead vayne hee woulde say lawe helpe iustifie opinion iewes christ alonely iustifier hee iustifier alonely bee dead vayne paule proue consequent maner eyther christ doth thys thyng alone el hee dead vayne hee haue helper thys must needes bee meaning hys argument take argument paule likewise dispute agaynst newe woorkes newe woorkes doe helpe iustifie christ deade vayne christ dead vayne ergo new workes doe helpe iustify first part paules second graunt therfore third must edes folow let v see paule proueth preposition example olde lawe though hee disputed alonely agaynst work ould lawe holy excellent patriarch abraham maner workes coulde iustifye fayth onely thynke yt paule doth speake workes ould rom lawe nay doubtles could abraha doe yt work lawe lawe geue yeares wherefore paule constrayneth galat conclude maner good workes though bee soe good abraham workes helpe iustificacion note also paules argument abraha instified many yeares yt lawe geuen ergo saith hee lawe doth iustifie like wise dispute agaynst newe workes men sufficiently perfectly iustifyed alonely fayth afore new workes geuen preached ergo workes yt new lawe doth iustifie necessitie anticedent proue thus abraham isaac iacob iohn baptist holy prophetes perfectly iustified afore new workes take new workes spoken ergo men sufficiently iustified alonely fayth saint paules argument conclude must mine also wherefore say standeth holy paule stifly strongly mee sayth bee freely alonely iustified fayth without maner work let v see ambrose sayth text iustified freely nothing ambro ad rom nothing deseruing alonely fayth iustified gift god c ye men working nothing nothing deseruyng iustified fayth onely yea freely wonte cry sola sola sola onely onely onely iustifieth iustified without workes lawe lorde aske hee done looke workes accepte onely cofessing christ foloweth wherfore man iustied fayth vnto concerning iustification workes ye law helpe nothing c say origine sayth men bee iustified though doe good workes workes doe help nothing iustification fayth onelye bee plaine word graunt wordes aske haue also sola sola sola ye neede cry sola also origine bringeth ope example theefe man deny haue lesse good work theefe neither good god man yt ye worlde may see new opinion seeing scripture also holy doctours doth teach also paule chapter bringeth gentyle rom knoweth nothing god hath done good work co trary blasphemed god name hath alwayes lyued idolatrye beene vtter enemy vnto al goodnes hee bringeth also iewe full good workes law hath also great zeale vnto god workes yea paule beareth hym witnes briefelye hee bringeth iewe man complaine full good workes yea take best iewes togither madnes paule speake damnable rom iewes open wretch damned iudgment lawe good workes yet paule doth exclude repelleth clearely iustifycation good zeale good workes concludeth playne wordes gentyl full damnable wordes neither zeale loue vnto goodnes iustified fayth onely bee paules wordes rom say gentils folowed righteousnes haue obtayned righteousnes meane ye righteousnes cometh faith sraell foloweth lawe righteousnes could attayne vnto righteousnes wherefore hee sought fayth workes lawe bee playne wordes gentile folowed righteousnes minde therunto iustified freely fayth sola fides fayth moreouer iew neuer attayne saluation faith christ reprooued zeale loue studye good workes merueylous thing yes verely merueilous shall neuer vnderstand without beleeue peraduenture shall bee sayd good woorks iewes dyd profite faith faith would haue holpen iustificatio make answere trouth good workes profyte iewes lacke fayth false workes haue holpen iustification fayth paule proueth clerely good workes helpe nothynge iustification euell workes let iustification yt commeth fayth hee proued example gentyll good workes damnable workes yet iustified fayth moreouer iewe yt zeale god manner good workes wt thing world ca deuise yea also paule speaketh iewes yt christened could helpe wherfore maner work whether bee fayth faith helpe iustifye neuerthelesse workes hath glory reward glory prayse iustificacion belongeth christ onely also paule proueth playnely wordes workes haue place rom iustification worketh rewarde geuen fauour duetye hym worketh beleueth hym iustifieth fayth accompted righteousnes wicked man fayth couted righteousnes thinke wordes bee opely agaynst workes sayth hee yt iustification imputed vnto yt worketh alonly beleeueth hym ye iustifieth ye wicked pray good work doth wicked marke also hee sayth righteousnes imputed vnto ergo deserued deserued imputed fauour must bee geuen duety thinke sola fides onely fayth know bee workes fayth doe iustifie paule excludeth workes clearely ergo fayth alone remaineth peraduenture say ye workes fayth doe iustifie neuerthelesse meekenes lowlynes auoyding boast goodnes wil geue yt glory fayth vnto yt principal thyng without workes helpe notwithstading workes bee good helpe iustification thoughe meekenes know damnable hipocrisie yea god intollerable men ca proue scripture workes worthy glorye iustification open lyeng fayth geue yet say hee worthy workes bee worthy parte fayth bee worthy alone confesse openly gene workes prayse faith prayse say one thyng mouth thinke hart god searcheth priuities harte hath required meekenes praye workes helpe iustification lesse bee neyther done yet thought iustified wicked thinketh nothing good work meeke lye deserue none aunswere wherefore let v heare holy doctours say texte hym worketh c saint ambrose sayth maner ambrosi decreed god ye lawe grace god require vnto saluation alonely fayth thyng hee prooueth example prophet saying blessed man god doth impute iustification without workes hee sayth bee remitted sinnes bee couered maner workes required alonely beleeue c bee wordes playne god hath decreed hee shall require nothyng iustification fayth hee blessed god imputeth iustification without manner work without maner obseruations also sinnes bee couered sola fides iustificat maner work penaucered alonely beleeue haue sola fides tantum fides say ambrose speaketh alonely workes law maner work maner obseruations yea also penaunce peradueture wetherall bee sayd great doctour sayd ambrose dyd vnderstad young child newly baptised fayth saue alonely without workes thinke likely aunswere great doctour diuinitie great dun man great preacher paule ambrose wel auoyded clerkely made aunswere epistle written paule romanes men child also wordes scripture speake man childe ambrose sayth blessed man aunswere hee litle moued sware blessed god let ambrose augustine say hee would neuer beleeue workes dyd helpe iustificatio lordly word prelate pyller christes churche medlyng mad men yet peraduenture say take peece doctour much maketh purpose notwithstandyng hee sayth otherwise place doe bryng yet doctour thus auoyded ca deny saying vppon place scripture doth agree scripture el hee doth expounde scripture euill wherfore must aunswere saying doctour place place layd agaynst ye place whereby place must bee expounded dare deny place deny place authoritie bee holy doctours clearely gone neuertheles holy scripture standeth openly agaynst deny haue cause suspect wherefore take heede doe yet peraduenture ye say vnderstand ambrose holy doctours lord rochester sayd howe vnderstode tertullian hee none euasion saue honour inough say must proue must iudge betweene haue translated great many sayinges english let men iudge whether vnderstand go ye latin let v see sense ca take lordes remember god alyue whose cause defende afore dare well say already confounded conscience wherfore doubt terrible vengeaunce han geth ouer repet whe cometh cometh sharpely ye able defend thing ca proue opely holy scripture say conscience murmour grudge neuer bee satisfied me dreames yet tyranny thinke lawes inuentios bee sufficient rule christen men liue saue conscience therby thinke cause sufficiently proued haue compelled poore men violece graut may destroy scripture receiue alonely tyranny lordes matter righted iudgemet master christ blessed worde afore whose strayte iudgement shall bee iudged straytly grace honour dignitie pompe pride briefly harte doe nowe reioyse shall lye dust shall bee called strayte rekening light game childes playe marke well lieth necke nedeth loose many wordes halfe full grace say bee good workes recken better moue againe purpose paule proueth iustification faith onely wordes man iustified gallat workes law faith iesus christ doe beleeue iesus christ may bee iustified fayth christ workes law marke hee sayth man iustified workes law peter howe thinke doth paule exclude workes bringeth alonely faith yea workes law whiche best workes world hee beleeueth bee iustified onely fayth iesus christ workes proueth hee abacuc wordes prophet righteous man lyueth fayth righteous man liueth faith call liuing fayth hee liue part workes lyueth hee fayth partly workes paules probation vnperfite let v see doctours athanasius galat doe expounde texte doth hee plainly shewe sayth alonely hath vertue righteous man lyueth fayth workes iustifie bringeth abacuk saying faith law shal righteous lyue hee addeth well afore god afore man peraduenture shalbe reckened righteous sticke lawe afore god c haue sola onely also holy iustification afore god iudgemet men iudgementes wherfore glory much ca good workes alonely iustifie also bee valure damnable sinne bee fayth farre helping iustification thys aug prolo psal doth augustine witnesse wordes workes bee done afore fayth though seeme vnto men laudable yet vayne doe iudge great strength swift running way wherfore let man cout good workes fayth faith good work intention maketh good worke fayth doth guide thee intetion c augustine condemneth good workes without fayth sinne good workes afore fayth sayth bee nothing worth vain thinges way thynges helpe iustification marke also good intention wherupon boast doe many good workes helpe hee blynde knoweth doe though stand well owne conceite fayth guide thinges afore fayth blindnes soone fayth commeth hee doth iustifie also maketh work good afore sinne let v see saint barnarde sayth good workes doe abhorre sayth hee whatsoeuer thyng mee except paradueture barnar super ser lxvq myne god hath made hys grace hath hee iustified mee freely hath hee deliuered mee bondage sinne thou hast chose sayth christ haue chosen thee found merites thee might moue chose thee preuented thy merites wherefore thus faith haue maryed thee vnto woorkes law haue maryed also iustice iustice lawe iustice fayth remayneth thou doest iudge ryght iudgment betweene thee mee geue thou iudgment wherein haue maried thee open thy merites dyd come betweene pleasure c barnarde doth despise hys good workes taketh hym onely grace stycke partly good workes onelye grace barnarde good workes stycke marke barnarde god child freely grace bee workes doe helpe lesse hee christened man hee workes new law workes newe law call thinke yes yet hee sayth ye merites goodnes freely chosen wherfore hee prouoked iudge righteously betweene god hath preueted goodnes owne hys owne pleasure hee finde goodnes preuenteth goodnes haue clearely good workes ye law morall good woorkes fayne doe nothing helpe iustificatio afore god bee preueted iustification also well proued saint augustine sayinge wherfore thinges considered declared aug despiri lit c xij strength hath pleased god geue v doe gather man bee iustified preceptes good liuing lawe workes ye law fayth letter spirite merites workes free grace man bee iustified ye lawe workes law faith christes bloud c merites workes free grace call free grace without al thing sauyng gra e call workes workes helpe nothing workes helpe would hee say workes workes onelye part workes part faith hee excludeth workes fully onely agayne thing purchaseth v remission sinnes doth also purchase iustificatio iustificatio nothing remission sin fayth purchaseth v remissio ergo faith ar iustified nowe fayth doth purchase remission sinnes well proued article fayth credo remissionem peccatorum beleeue remission sinnes haue remission fayth fayth deceiueth mee doe beleeue onely woulde haue remission sinnes needeth beleeue remission sinnes may deserue workes also mayster christ declareth openly ye manner work euer bee iustifye afore god bee wordes whe luke haue done thinges bee commaunded yet saye wee vnprofitable seruauntes bee vnprofitable bee iustified bee iustified haue done thinges bee iustified doe maner nothing specially thinges bee commaunded wherefore playne ye workes helpe v iustification whe haue done thing yet vnprofitable let v proue open example put case lordes vnto speake noble prince would call say lordes hath pleased v cal vnto spiritual dignitie byshops make counsell lordes realme also parlamet wold know hath deserued reckeneth hym selfe worthy deseruing le dignity say aunswere kynges grace one amonge dare bolde say kinges grace hath geuen vnto hym freely hee hath done king faythfull seruice boud geue vnto yea deseruinge one proude say thinke ye king grace woulde laye charge hee done halfe duetie rather bound doe ten tymes much yet kinges grace boud geue hym bysshopricke hee done duetye good workes faythfull seruice bee able deserue byshopryke kinges grace bee able workes deserue heauen iustification good workes deserue remission sinne king kynges haue aunswered kinges grace come dispute god iustification workes yet shall bee farre vnlike wherfore conclud scripture doctours fayth haue christ iesus blessed bloude doth onely sufficiently iustifie v beefore god without helpe workes though ye scripture bee thing el holle probacion article alonely perfect commedation prayse christ blessed merites hee hath deserued v yet passe ouer bryng moe place ye cotet scripture wyll bee satisfied yet content geue al onely glory god though brought newe testament yea christ hym selfe could satisfie hee yet though heauen earth creature therin nothyng el probation article would helpe wherefore let infidel passe leue iudgement god alonely certifieng one thyng infallible day shall come shall repent yea sorer either write thinke beleeue lest pricke holy article vnto purpose true way iustification maner iustification first commeth god loue christe iesus alonely mere mercy geueth v freely gift fayth wherby doe beleeue god holy word sticke fast vnto promise god beleeue though heauen earth perish come nought yet god shall bee founde true promise faythes sake bee elect child god fayth men fides historica dreame beleeue one god beleeue hee eternall beleeue also hee made worlde naught yea beleeue gospell true thing god speaketh must bee true fulfilled thynges say fayth wee bee iustified deuils infidel haue fayth also wee may attayne thynges strength reason fayth shall iustifie v must bee maner strength must come heauen strength reason must also make mee beleeue fides iustificans god maker heauen earth alonely father also father yea thorow fauour christ hath purchased mee whiche fauour neither heauen earth tribulation persecution death hell deuide mee sticke rom fast hee alonely father also mercifull father yea vnto mee mercifull mercifull hee impute sinnes vnto mee though bee neuer great long hang blessed bloud christ iesus sinne malice frailtie pleasure hee also lyberall father yea vnto mee liberall alonely promise mee thynges also geeue whether bee necessary body ye soule hee also alonely lyberall myghty performe thynges hee promyseth vnto mee briefely fayth maketh mee hang clearely god blessed promyses made christ sweete precious bloud feare death affliction persecution tribulation despise thynges alonely despise also myne lyfe christes sake finally fleshely beast maketh frutes fayth mee spirituall man damnable child maketh mee heauenly sonne seruaunt deuill maketh mee free god deliuered lawe sinne death deuill myserie might hurt mee lordes fayth doth iustifie wee preach geuen heauen harte spirite god therfore bee idle thing must needes maner thing ye bee honour god also profite neighbour much tymes necessary must needes worke well also bryng forth good workes may bee profite helping man workes bee done iustifie man iust man must needes doe vnto profite alonely men profites euen maister christ suffered hunger thyrste persecution tooke great labour preaching worde yea also suffered death thinges say hee profite himselfe merites profite likewise doth iust man workes good tree tyme yeare bryngeth exaple fayth bryngeth forth good workes forth good apple make hym good hee good afore yet apple profite vnto men notwithstanding ye good nature hym muste needes bring forth likewise iust man must needes doe good workes bee iustified alonely serue brother hee hath neede concerning iustification wherfore haue true cause iustification fayth alonely also true way maner doynge good workes man hanged king grace mercy doth freely deliuer gallowes geueth pardon theefe thus deliuered keepe hym selfe true man doe workes belong true man doe falleth agayne stelyng kyng pardoned hym freely reckeneth kyng mercyfull hee hag theeues deliuer mercy without deseruing thinke wil ye king bee mercifull vnto theefe hee cometh againe ye gallowes nay truely hee deliuered cause keepe hym selfe true man commeth lord rochester hee sayth fayth doth begyn iustification v workes doe performe make perfite recite owne wordes per fidem initiari dicitur iusticia solum non ti autem consummari nam consummata sticia non aliter quam ex operibus natis lucem editis acquir potest opera consummate iustificant fides primum choat c christened man would thinke byshop would byshop rochester vayne distinction thus trifle play god holy word god worde playne man auoyde fayth iustifieth alonely commeth lord rochester litle ayne distinction inuented owne brayne without authoritie scripture clearely auoyde scripture whole disputation paule lord say conscience doe recken auoyde vengeauce god sith thus trifle despise god holy word thinke vayne distinctio bee alowed afore iesus christ whose glorye wee doe cotede striue afore doe handle matter doe thinke verely owne conscience doth sore accuse thus blasphemyng holy worde god wherefore lord christes sake remember bee aged shall long tary vayne distinctios haue inuented pleasure men great peruertyng god holy word shall bee euerlastyng damnation lest wayes feare ye terrible vengeauce god remeber shame ye world thinke men bee mad vnlearned bee deceiued triflyng distinction seyng worde god playne agaynst doth paule say ephe iustification alonely fayth workes auoyde non ex operibus workes workes doe make iustification perfite saint paules wordes true also paule sayth bee childre god fayth bee childre also heyres imperfection finde childre heyres christe desire haue fayth onely say fayth doth begyn iustification beside know well paule cosequent owne logike work doe iustifie ergo wee neede doe despise bee valure take like consequent say kinges grace doth iustifie ergo despise ergo hee longer kyng also sunne moone doe iustifie ergo destroy damnable lye must paul needes suffer whe hee proued fayth onely iustifie came ouerthwarte father sayd ergo thou destroyest law thou teachest iustifieth god forbid sayth paule doe learne rom waye fulfill law faith whereby law alonely fulfilled without whiche workes law bee sinne doe likewise teach true way wherby good workes must done first man faith bee iustified iust man must needes doe place conuenient good work therefore hee cauleth deade fayth hee bryngeth also naked brother fayth bryngeth forth fruite fayth iustifieth yet fruite doth iustifie wich hath neede clothing vnto men yt boasted fayth hath compassion necessitie wherefore hee concludeth ye haue true fayth therefore hee sayth vnto shew vnto mee thy fayth without workes shall shew vnto thee workes fayth heare playne iames would fayth dead fayth valure ye hath workes workes shoulde declare shew outwarde fayth workes bee outward declaration testimonie ye inwarde iustification receiued fayth ye workes may take away synne el bee satisfaction part synne belongeth onely christ blessed iohn iohn sayth also paule hee hath appered al put sinne flight offering vp hym selfe iames meaning hebr declared foloweth thou seest sayth hee fayth wrought abraham deedes ye deedes fayth made perfect marke fayth wrought hys deedes fayth lyuyng fayth brought forth wrought ye high worke oblation also fayth perfect deedes fayth declared great testimonye afore worlde ye lyuyng perfect right shapen faith abraham yt inward fayth declared afore god fayth iustifieth god good wordes declare iustification yt worlde outward workes lawe lawe commaundeth true fayth christ iesus ende ye lawe fulfilling law saint paule sayth beleeue wherefore men bee hearer onely lawe till tyme haue fayth christ iesus imputed vnto iustice workes lawe bee cause iustification alonely outward testimonie witnes lawe fulfilled inwardly conscience afore god fulfilled hath accusation christ hath made satisfactio bee partaker fayth lawe must bee content admitte men bee fulfillers doer ye law shall say dreame bee augustine wordes doer lawe shall bee iustified must bee august de spiri lit vnderstaded wee may know ca none otherwise bee doer lawe excepte bee first iustified iustification belongeth vnto doer iustification doth preceede maner doinges c heare iustificatio first geuen men might bee able doe workes lawe also exposition glose haue meruayle studie better also haue scripture glosa cornelius getile great almes prayd vnto god alwayes vnto whome aungell spake maner thy prayer thy almes come vp remembraunce presence god actes texte coulde hee know god deuoutly fayth ergo hee iustified afore god fayth man iustified god bee idle must doc good ye world knew iustificatio therfore yt holy ghost doth declare hys inward iustificatio whe hee saith hee deuoute feared god also doth shew openly fruit iustification hee sayth hee almes moreouer haue holy ghost fell afore baptised water declareth openly iustified afore god well declared also owne lawe whose wordes bee cornelius ceturio yet heathe made cleane ye gifte ij quest non omnes episcopo holy ghost haue playnely yt hee iustified yt gifte yt holy ghost afore good work hee heathe scripture yee haue haue faith yt may traspose moutaines haue charitie nothyng gather fayth wythout charitie iustifie aunswere gather paule open hee speaketh thyng whereby men may bee iustified alonely hee teacheth bee iustified must worke charitie also plaine hee speaketh fayth doth iustifie inwardly faith doth worke outwardely caulled gifte holy ghost yt gifte tounges gift prophesies gifte healing gifte interpretation ope chapiter afore fayth geuen iustifie alonely doe myracles wonder signes therefore sayth paule fayth coulde moue mountaynes also open certayne men shall say vnto christ beholde wee haue done myracles cast deuils math thy name yet hee shall say truely know fayth gifte god iustifieth gifte science prophesies sometyme church sometyme neuer necessitie bee faith wee speake doth beeleeue promise god sticketh fast bloud christ hath none vertue iustifie must needes iustifie wheresoeuer hee hee sticketh fast god worde hee looketh myracles thys fayth neuer church lyfe church fayth mayster christe iohn prayde myght neuer fayle therefore paule describeth fayth hee caulleth fayth worketh charitie iustifieth charitie sayth playnely neyther circumcision yet vncircumcision gala valure christ iesu fayth doth hee playnely exclude iustification hyghest worke lawe circumcision setteth fayth alone gyfte fayth doth myracles gift fayth worketh charitie yee shall thinke thys bee dreame bryng athanasius sayinge whose wordes bee two maner saythes one iustifieng atha ad rom spoken thy fayth hath saued thee cauled gyft god whereby myracles bee done written haue fayth grayne mustard seede c haue playne fayth doth iustifie onelye perfectly maner work fayth geue god freely soules fayth iustifieth v geue v freely god vnto fayth iustification onely promised onely imputed rekened god neuertheles fayth tyme place conuenient strength hee must needes worke charitye bee iustified thereby afore iustified possible hee coulde haue charitie owne schoole men infidell ca haue charitie ye iustified hee free seruaunt vnto god loue ye hee hath vnto loue seeketh god owne profit owne aduau tage hee wicked seeketh alonely wyll god profite men worketh neyther loue heauen yet feare hell hee knoweth well heauen wyth ioyes thereof prepared begynnyng world hym hys father must needes folow contrariwyse infidell wicked man doth worke hys wicked deedes hee woulde haue hell euerlasting dampnation hys rewarde hee woulde rather contrary notwithstandyng hell euerlasting dampnation must needes follow wicked deedes finally righteous man free seruaunt god worketh hyerelyng possible heauen yet woulde hee doe lesse good respecte maker worlde lord rewardes also argument thys fayth worke workes doth iustifie ergo fayth doth iustifie aunswere truth doe meane fayth owne dignitie hys owne perfection doth iustifie v scripture doth say fayth alonely iustifieth thyng alonely whereby doe hange christe faith alonely partaker ye merites mercy purchased christes bloude fayth goodnes amen church bee therof whereby men may know name holy church haue long tyme vsurped presumptuouslye pope hys churche agreeth maners holy churche darkenes light wt shame greatest enemyes holy church could haue earth agree wt maners holy church darknes light god yt deuyll holy church hard man christ onely would heare manner men sauing christ neuer heare except weare profit glory holy church ruled world would rule world holy church would bee holy christ onely would bee holy owne helpe holy church allwayes despised persecuted world would bee honored yt pope persecutor holy church world persecuters men holy church inwardly decked spiritual vertues would bee outwardly shinyng spirituall araye holy church would bee chaste spryte would mouthes vow chastite spend liues whore dome holy church dyd allwayes shew meekenes worlde would bee proude yt hart could deuise breifely whatsoeuer thing ye farre pope doth differ churche true holy church agreable church neuer crumme allonely violence vsurped name holy church man crowne long goune white smock ouer gowne remedy hee must nedes bee church yea holy church self ye barber made bul crowne taylor iack nape log gowne brought asse forth foule greate abuse pope takyng vpo hym hee ye holy church white rochet might dout ye holy church euerye man must fall downe receyue clene remission poena oulpa toties quoties came successours peter paule haue despensatio christes bloud merites holy saint ye suffrage holy church distribute key bearer heaue hell denye truth ope neede probation wee see dayly eye man compare christ yt ye head nothing yea hee may recke peter paule starke fooles ryght mad men liued despectuous lyfe neede make many wordes tell name speake doubt galde horse beewray hym selfe shortly deuyll would come owne person disguised tell impossible hee could bee contrary christ hys apostels men call selues ye holy church yea take away name church set steede name deuyll know byshop fro deuyll workes nay trewly difference betweene byshop deuill bee one yet bee heades christes church yea holy church selfe yee wicked wherefore blessed spouse christ may bee knowen thee open abhominable whore harlotes therefore god grace set holy church men shall know worde ecclesia ye new testament olde taken ofte tymes whole congregatio whole multitude yt people good bad booke numeri haue brought nume congregation church god wildernes also place king king turned face blessed whole congregation church israell church israell stoode likewise new testamet saint paule corinthian haue set cor vnto tymothy shall learne wayes ye bee christ iesu doe learne euery congregation also place doe despise cor congregation god shame haue place many moe open greke word ecclesia taken whole congregation good bad wherfore ye church greatly speake church iewes sarasens murtherers theeues baudes harlot though know holy church paule speaketh ephe men loue wiues christ hath loued church hath geue selfe hee might sanctifie clense fountaine water worde life make selfe glorious holy churche truely defined church without spot wrincle thyng might bee holy without blame haue true churche christ pure cleane without spotte wherby shee pure cleane owne merites owne might exteriour araye gold siluer yet precious stone neither myters crosestaues pillers pollaxes wherby christ onely hath geuen selfe intet hee would make cleane therefore sayth paule hee gaue selfe hee might sanctifie true holy church sanctified made holy christ hee might clense make selfe glorious church also place washed sanctified iustified name iesus christ spirite god see lordes church washed christ cor holy spirite blessynges spirituall ornamentes spirituall holy water thynges cannot helpe holy church holy spirite outwarde hypocrisie also clensed christes blessed bloud outward disguisinges doth augustine wel proue saying christ church made fayre first filthie sinnes afterward pardon grace augustinus de verbis domini ser made fayre c augustine sayth yt christ hath made church fayre grace pardon pardon grace church stadeth christes election christ haue washed chosen bee none church though ride thousand spiritual horse haue spirituall toke earth ye sonne god haue deliuered iohn truely deliuered ye make power holynes shall alwayes finde good ale wyne hangeth greene signe spirituall signes token make churche god folow assigne churche shall bee nay nay lord bee beleeue ye christ faithful beleuers christes merites yt ryght holy church god hath washed sinnes sticke fast vnto merites promise made hym onely bee church truely gospell could haue lyuyng lordly possession doe nothing worlde excercise tyranny would preach gospell make lawes statute destroy holy gospell chri de anathemate god chrisostome speaketh well beholde see men haue trew sence holy scripture yea vnderstand nothing thereof passe ouer many thing ashamed call mad trifler wrangler bee know say thynge speake onely bee mighty bold make lawes curse codemne thing yt know nothing c bee workes say wordes spoken maketh statute lawes curseth condemneth lay thinges auoyde long shall bee layd agaynst tyll bring one gylty think bee long yet haue great possession bee also greate lordes nothing therefore al al onely play part byshop christmas game player doth king popet springeth byshops compared popets stage player vp downe cryeth peepe peepe goeth way doe make coutenauce great holines great perfectio ye world testify doe indeede ouer bound gospell men bee ye world thereby haue honour rich lordly possession gospell men would regard doe coblers piklocke open locke say haue keyes heauen el thinke may seeke clegge keyes fynde one open locke finis p free man fall adam hys naturall strength doe nothyng sinne beefore god article wee dispute man may doe comon influence geuen hym god ouer inferior worldelye thinges power hee hath eating drinking sleeping speaking buying sellyng naturall thinges bee geeuen god indifferently men good bad wee search strength thinges haue freewill none man naturall power without spirit god doe thinges bee acceptable god vnto fulfilling god beleeue god loue god commaundemets loue iustice selfe take god father recken bee mercifull vnto feare god louingly thinges doe call good workes thing wee search knowe hee doe nothyng cause free wil maister christ prooueth wordes hee iohn abideth mee bringeth forth much fruite without mee ca ye doe nothing man abide mee hee cast braunch shall burne open freewill without grace doe nothing doe speake eating drinking though bee grace nothing fruitfull meritorious worthy thanke acceptable frutes freewill freewill without god grace doe nothyng good god hee hath christ hym cast first fruite freewill wythereth hee second fruite wythering helpeth hym nothing goodnesse hee must wither let doe best hee gathered cast fire thirde fruit bee fire doe nothing burne hee lye thing indifferent hee must needes burne hee ca come yt fier owne stregth let hym intende much hee intention bona intentio helpe hym yet hym might freewil hee left alone nothyng el firste bee cast seconde wyther decayeth hee thyrdly cast fire wors wors finally hee burneth worst hee past helpe strength freewill hath bryng selfe vtter destruction dun men bryng bonum conatum longe bryngyng freewill brought fire hee neither saue selfe fro burning yet helpe selfe lord rochester aunswereth certaine place freewill doe good meritorious sed tame non omnino facit nihil say nihil hee doe good yt meritorious worthy thake god pray doth hee nihil disputation goodnes hee doe wtout hee euill tree bryng forth good frute denye freewill without grace euill tree ergo frute must needes bee euil hee may well bryng forth frute shall bee good freewils power declared wordes hee pray lawfull also men bound search know thys wyll consideration manifested vnto v wyll doth declare euery man bounde doe euery man bounde flie thys wyll offered vnto euery man thynges bee saluation god haue man damned hee letteth worde bee preached indifferently men nowe hee wyll knowe wyll must goe maister christ whome paule sayth treasure wisedome science hee shew v much necessarye v knowe much father heauen woulde wee shoulde know texte speaketh god incarnated sent speake doe preach bee familiar v doe myracles yea also suffer death saluation sayth hee woulde haue gathered howe christ willed saue iewe thy child say dyd preach labour wyth diligence conuerte thee myracles afore thee yea wepte wailed thy sake thynges thinges myght bee thy conuersion beloged god incarnate doe thing profite woulde hym faulte nothyng vndone belonged hym doe hee wyllyng yet profite ierusalem woulde woulde theyr power wyll consent wyll consent nay truely iohn saythe iohn coulde beleeue hee blinded eye hardened harte shoulde see theyr eye vnderstand harte must needes alonely wherin th libertie freewill consisteth consent coulde otherwyse doe consent yet neyther constrayned compelled wrunge wyth violence freely woulde conset yet libertie freewill bee agaynst christe bee wyth hym libertie freewill standeth may wil thing also contrary therof standeth magist sen ij thyng hee wyll wyll owne wyll therto constrayned wylleth freely wythout compulsion yet hee choose wil choose bu wyll wyll necessitie immutable necessitie compulsion coaction nowe open place maketh power none entente freewyll consent vnto christ wyll contrary wyl vnto hym handes chaunge blynded harte hardened therefore naturall stregth coulde none otherwyse doe vary christ would destred otherwise swarue hym delyte wherefore blynded wherefore hardened must inquire inscrutable wyll pleased hym leaue may ee inquisi ue god sec etes cause therof sure hee ca tel hee woulde sure rightteously done inough mee commeth blynde fleshlye reason murmureth thys asketh wee codemned doth god punishe v seeing wee wyll otherwyse also hee blyndeth v hee maketh hart harde wee amende v lieth power wythout nowe complayneth hee v layeth hee charge nothynge done hys wee bee instrumentes hys wee doe well geeueth hee v strength doe better thou dampnable reason satisfie thee reckonest nothyng bee well done thou dooste done wyth thy counsell thynkest thou thou art good perfecte thyne owne nature thee wel righteously made thou wilte aunswere yea thou wi condemne thy selfe thing thine aunswere mee hath made thee well geuen thee thy righteousnes thys goodnes thou hast thou must needes say god cause thou art well righteous good made seeyng thou deseruest nothyng yea thynges bee done well righteously thou canst complayne amede yet deuise way amende doest thou murmur agaynst god seeyng thynges done without thy knowledge also without thy deseruing doest thou inquire cause hym murmurest thou hee hath made thee good rightfull seeyng thou haddest nothyng deserued wilt thou graunt god dyd thyng best doest thou lykewise thynges furthermore thou must needes graunt god thy maker nothyng god doth ca bee amended gouernour thyngs wise righteous mercyfull wise nothyng hee doth bee amended righteous bee suspition hym vnrighteousnes mercyfull ee hee ca doe nothyng without mercy howe thinkest thou wilt thou graunt thynges thy maker thou must needes graunt compare vnto rule thy note wicked sinnefull state man blindnes within thee thy induratio thee thy peruers toward goodnes cause hast thou complayne thou hast graunted hee doth thynges righteously ergo thou hast wrong hee doth thing mercyfully ergo thou art thy blyndnes thy hardnes better intreated thou hast deserued moreouer thou beleuest god righteous god wise god mercyful fayth thynges doe appeare bee prooued exteriour cause hold thee fast fayth thy fleshely reason bee as iled whe god saueth men damneth many thou knowest cause yet must thou beleeue hee mercyful righteous fayth doth come exterior cause mere gift god fayth could bee prooued exteriour cause neede beleeue thou beleeue hee mercyfull good righteous vnto thee wherefore murmurest thou yet wouldest thou know wherfore hee durateth thee blyndeth thee geueth thee grace amende vnto thy brother hath better deserued thou hast yea hee hath likewise euill deserued thou hast yet hee geueth hym grace taketh away hardnes geueth goodnes indifferently done thou thinkest first say thee thou hast cause complayne thou hast god disposeth hys mercy pleaseth hym wrong thou hast thyng thyne nothyng taken fro thee belogeth thee doest thou complayne right yea yet sayest thou hee geueth one mercy geueth none aunswere thee mercy owne lawfull geue hee thy eye euil hee good take thyne goe thy way math bee wil shew wrath make power knowne ouer vessel wrath ordeined rom damnation declare rich glory vnto vessel mercy hee prepared elected vnto glory hast thou therewith doe cause hast thou therof coplayne god bee well righteous thou sayest thou beleeuest wherefore leaue thy murmuryng god hath delight damnation thy disputation agaynst god recken hee nature mercyfull hath delite pleasure thy damnatio beleeue thou stedfastly hee shewe hys mercy vnto one man worlde thou shalt bee one man though aungell would make thee beleeue world bee damned yet sticke thou fast mercy iustice iustifieth thee beleeue sweete bloud blessed sonne bee shedde vayne must needes iustifie sinner many sticke fast vnto though bee comfortable wholesome doctrine neuer blynded neuer hardned shed alonely thou canst thus satisfie thy selfe doest thou wel thou art doubtles ieoperdie thou wilt bee content wilt dispute inquire cause god inscrutable stand looke see victordome thou shalt get doubt repet thee hee conclude thee maner may doe haue auswered intricable doubt schoole men wrapped whiche would know cause predestination reprobatio dun beeyng sc st wrapped betweene carnall reason inuincible scripture paule tell whether hee may graunt god alonely cause election el merites man precedyng afore hee concludeth ye opinion may bee defended bonauenture blyndly bonauenture concludeth may bee cause preceding grace deserue vnfrutefull question gender nothing contetion haue spent liues thinges bee geuen vnto peculiar name subtile seraphicall irrefrigable doctours agaynst set paule whiche tooke god saw know god sawe hee sawe yet know cause iacobs election iacob elected esau reiected child bee vnborne haue done neyther good bad yet one chosen refused paule knoweth none cause god discuse say ye haue done god woulde haue geuen hym grace wherefore gyauntes subdue heauen earth leaue searching cause bee content god doubt god righteous lawfull cause merites bee doubt paule toke great labour rom matter dyd see farre man deseruing doe yet hee concluded wordes scripture shew mercy god mercy ye cause onely saluation shew mercy haue co passion haue compassion lyeth man cunnyng mercy god hee sayth haue mercy hym see shall doe good shew mercy wil hee saith haue compassion hym shall deserue de congruo haue copassion doth augustine well proue word disputatio vain august super ioannem tract lxxxviij doe defend ye presece god agaynst grace god therfore say chosen afore ye making world ye god knew afore bee good beecause hee make v good hee sayth haue chosen mee sayth hee dyd therefore chose v beecause hee knew wee bee good must hee also knowe beefore wee fyrst haue chosen hym c playne election god hee sawe afore doe well onely cause election mere mercy cause well election therefore paule sayth workes callynge goe subtill dun men carnall reason search cause secrete dyd beleeue hee good righteous mercyfull great comfort electio stoode onely hys sure bee righteously done mercifully haue god mercyfull fayth therfore must nedes mystrust god fall inuent cause election strength one say beecause god righteousnes mercy choose v sure shall bee elected fyrst ma good intent saue hym selfe inuent election commeth deseruyng also dreame certayne workes shall thereunto bee appoynted v doe pleasure election reprobacion shall stande hand let god doe pleaseth beecause bee certayne open place scripture geue onely cause god onely election also reprobation therefore men sore troubled tell remedy onely studye may wring wrest open scripture fortifiing errour satisfyinge carnall reason shal make obstinate malice god doth indurate say hee doth chastice synner sheweth softnes easynes sufferaunce hym hee mercifull hee doth call sinner repentaunce affiction scourging induration exposition nothing el suffer euyll softnes goodnes haue mercy nothing el correcte scourge punyshe men synnes exposition induration origine per arcon glos rom hier super esaiam hierome common glose scripture exposition playne taketh away inconuenieces exposition god auctor euell clarkely exposition briefly must needes bee true expositio wherfore weare better erre hierome oulde schoolemen say true newe heretykes call reproue oulde errours haue well defended bee newe men matter cause well proued must holy ghost chang wordes hee hath new schoolemaysters wheare hee wont say haue hardened pharos hart must hee say pharao hath hardened hym selfe softnes easines haue done yet pray woulde satisfie weake conscience stickes faste worde god reckeneth holy ghost knoweth well hee shal speake wil speake nothing without great cause hee speaketh shall bee well spoken amende thynke sufficient say poore man hierome schoole men say holde thou thy peace bee thou content exposition serch thou doth become thee know hee wyll laye charge thyng opely writin scripture wordes moyses paule bee playne therfore must aunswere shall bee lawful necessary hym know minde holy scripture expositio hierome hee brought captiuitie babylon hardeneth hee worlde hee suffereth great softnes mercy also exposition hee mercifull israell hee sent babylo dyd hee chasten affliction prouoked repentaunce likewise inferiour thinges suffereth nothing bee vnmoued notwithsta ding hee moueth thynges owne naturall course likewise god infinite thyngs subiect god power letteth nothyng bee exemted hym b thynges bee subiecte vnto action nothing done principall motion hee worketh maner thynges bee eyther good bad chaunging nature mouinge alonely worke nature god worketh good euill worketh euil god vseth instrumentes yet doth hee nothynge euill euill done alonely thorowe euill man god working hym euill instrument take example man doth sawe blocke euil sawe nothyng apte cut wel yet must needes cut mouing man though bee neuer euill man mouing doth chaunge nature sawe neuerthelesse action ye man good cunningly done cutting sawe nature likewise god moueth euyll instrumentes working common influence geuen creature suffereth bee idle chaungeth nature wherfore operation fruite god actio good conuenient corrupted nature yet faulte god mouinge haue howe god workes thynges men good bad let v bee expounded wroonge vnto carnall purpose el make heresie thinke father heauen great tender loue hee man soule sent hys onely sonne redeeme also geeue lawe liue owne mouth shall thus suffer loste playne inough neede exposition doctour auctority wherfore answere hym also chrisostome gen ho byshop well bee codemneth sentence openly saying beeseeche notable saying chrisostome oftentimes come woulde wee shoulde take byshops holy father bee openly agaynst scripture centrary holy doctours neuer doe liue neuer looke see antichristes take till see almighty god conuerte also doctour saith bee
