excuse religious haue wife child house care ye excuse wherewith scripture meete bee knowen state sortes people doe pestilence corrupt thinges doe recken studye holy scripture beelongeth alonely vnto religious men bee much necessary vnto vnto c may see damnable institution harte men chrisostomes dayes howe woulde reade scripture see hee condemneth calleth pestilece bring agayne lousie statute owne mee man woulde call v hetikes neither regarde christes holy worde holy doctours yet thinge ye agaynst let v see owne lawe saith christ paul di si iuxta sayth bee power wisdome god bee ignoraunt scripture much bee ignoraunt christ c haue playnely take away scripture lay men much take away christ fro doubt doe intede hart doe thing god knoweth workes doe declare god shall aduenge full straitly ouer also place set meditation thy iustifications sinod c omnes et forgette thy wordes thing exceeding good christen men obserue keepe c counsell owne hath admitted christen readyng scripture allowed counsell men shall study scripture condemne neither scripture god practise christe men exposition doctours owne law yet statute counsel hold agaynst bee marueilous giantes shal behaue selfe handle possible ouercome wil admitte nothyng yet leue first declare manifestly ye bee cotrary christ holy doctours hierome reprooueth sore wordes paula eustochium bee thyng prohe epist ad ephes li life doth preserue wise doth persuade abide good oppression thraldomes world doe recke specially meditation study holy scripture seeyng doe differre creature specially bee reasonable speake reason maner wordes co teined godly scripture whereby may learne knowe god also cause wherefore bee created wherfore doe sore marueile bee certein men geue selues slouthfulnes sluggishnes learne thing benefites may receaue readyng scripture bee good recken men worthy bee reprooued haue good mynde c marke written two woman learned also hee reckeneth nothyng better study holy scripture hee also marueileth certaine neither study scripture selues yet let study well knowe wordes pricke men ye bee slouthfull geuen voluptuousnes selues study scripture yet suffer study doe study deceiue simple poore brother maintaine abhominable liuing wrostyng wryngyng profite commeth none study worlde knoweth may preach haue damnably condemned christes blessed word el violence made poore brother heretickes come gorgious estate pompe pride face christ simple brother outward danable pride afore face great arrogancy pride tyranny papistes world lordes leue fasing brasing lord whose cause defend agaynst length bee faced remeber holy ghost prayeth saying iudge lord psal may fall cogitation expell lord haue prouoked thee doubte holy spirite preuaile agaynst though god suffer season yet hath hee till day defended selfe godly wordes agaynst proude crakyngs world thinke hee wil take fall hand nay nay hee shall first thrust headlonge world shall take example beleeue word haue codemned doth thus learne wherfore doe reuoke condemnation new testament ordeine christen men may read holy scripture shal haue greatest shame euer men world neuer able defend meanes power ye earth power earth wil withstand hee shall rather bryng dust raise vp stone newe ruler wormes meate stinking car doctour barnes vehement rion nourishmet hell fire dare thus presume god omnipotent whether flie auoyde daunger heauen earth water fire sunne moone starres saintes angel man child bee holde accursed though deuill laugh season remember ende god geue hys grace lose labour let mee assoyle carnall papistes first reason prooue lay men ought read scripture reason bring fyrst euyll men doe take occasion heresy scripture wherfore best haue aunswere lykewise good men doe take occasion goodnes ergo people ought haue condemne thinges men doe take occasion euill must fyrst put eye take occasio see many idle thinges must also destroy handes feete tongue al haue doe mysuse often must also destroy hart whereby haue alonely occasion euil doe thinke euil deede must also destroy fayre wome take sore occasion euyll must also burne goodes destroy rich men take occasion theeues euill men take occasion euill euery good thyng bee proud must also destroy wynes men take occasio bee droke must destroy meates geeue occasio gluttony yea muste destroye mercy god euell men take boldenes myschief briefly good thing euell take occasion euill yea christ hym selfe saint paule saith vnto cor iewes offence vnto gentyls occasion folyshnes yet al may destroy christ hee must remayne stil likewise gospell though euell men neuer bee good receiue occasion euyll yet ther bee many thousandes ye receaue saluation beecause spider gathereth poyso ye good herbes reason therfore destroy al good herbes reasos three bee certayne math setences scripture doe belog euery man know reason papistes christ sayth vnto geue know misteries kingdome heauen vnto geuen aunswere meane say vnto geuen meane apostle onely successor may reade holy scripture bee successor ye apostle lord rochester auctorytie meane christe people haue spirite god christ ment bee excluded haue sprite god ye effect doth declare therfore may read scripture marke also mayster saith vnto geuen sayth geuen shoulde haue men proue vnderstanding scripture geuen ye text maister christ speaketh heare sprituall right vnderstanding holy scripture gift god onely hee speaketh studying reading holy scripture haue place meant saying geuen true vnderstyng interpretation scripture many dyd followe heare preaching yet vnderstoode therefore text maketh directly work doe declare bee hearer reader worde god vnderstanding geuen wyllmy lord rochester saye haue vnderstanding holy doctor though scripture themselues owne nature bee plainest best bee knowen yet bee ye holy doctor playnest vnto v wherefore hee vnderstand scripture must fyrst learne vnderstand doctours shal bring hym true vnderstanding holy scripture el hee must erre aunswere lorde doe wryte safe conscyence thinke discharge conscience beefore dreadfull face christ triflyng distynction quedam sunt notiora nobis et quedam notiora naturae pray wil proue god wise would beegin proue wisedome would proue god scripture must bee first knowen therby may iudge opinion doctours whether say right ly doctours yt bee perfectly knowe except scripture bee fyrst knowen owne dyuynitie denye wherefore proue haue verytie must proue beecause haue sence holy scripture sece holy doctours doubtles haue great meruell lord rochester neyther ashamed yet afrayde vengeance god thus triflyth wt holy scripture besides christ saith place haue shewed secretnes preach tope house also paule sayth gospell ti tim declared openly preachyng place god haue brought life immortalitie vnto light thorough gospell also maister calleth light world nowe iohn math set hee saith light vnder bushell rather openly may bee lightned wherfore lord similitude far vnlike lord woorthy bee despised doubtles may bee wel thought foolishe similitude made stokesley byshop london sore exigent compelled prooue thynge auld reason would haue looked simple reason earnest matter wise man great doctour worshipfull father bishop london yea called salomon notwithstanding haltyng similitude dyd hee neuer learne prouerbes salomon beene better similitude king proclamatio proclaimed yt men might know also keepe man bound keepe till bee proclaimed likewise gospel geuen bee proclaimed euery man bound keepe wherfore must needes bee proclaimed euery man vnto lorde beseeche god may bee one spoke geue know misteryes god amen p men teporall power comitted god kinges duke earles lordes baron iudges maiors shriues minister vnder bee haue onely teporall swordthe description temporall power wherby must order al ye como wealth world ly thinges logyng thereunto ye disposition worldly goodes shal bee right owner probation men testamentes ordering payment customes settyng maner taskes forfaites correction transgression wherby comon wealth priuate person disquieted wronged correction theeues murderer harlotes baudes sclanderers wrangler extortioner brybers vserers false buyer seller thynges whereunto beelongeth outwarde orderyng corporall payne thys power kyng chiefe full ruler bee minister seruauntes paule doth declare aying let euery soule bee subiect obedient vnto hye power c also peter bee subiect vnto rom pet kyng vnto chiefe heade eyther vnto ruler vnto sent kyng punishmet euill doer vnto power must wee bee obedient thynges pertaine rom ministration present life commo wealth alonely paule sayth auoyding punishment also dischargyng conscience ye wyll god power commaunde anything tyranny right law alwayes prouided repugne agaynst gospell destroye fayth charitie must needes suffer paule sayth charitie suffereth thyng also cor maister christ man strike math thee one cheeke turne hym hee doth exercise tyranny ouer worldly good present thynges ouer thy corporall bodye christen men doe alonely regarde dispise neuertheles hee commaunde thee thyng agaynst ryght doe thee wronge example cast thee prison wrongfully thou canst reasonable quyet meanes without seditio insurrectio man wrongfully imprisoned tyraunt maye quyet maner make escape breakyng commo peace saue thy selfe auoyde hys tyranny thou mayst doe wyth good conscience thou prison thou couldest auoyde without sedition thou mayst lawfully doe thy coscience free doyng thou dooste sinne offende lawe god paule sayth thou mayste bee cor free vse wise bee ryght wrong mayst thou make resistaunce wyth sworde wyth hand obey except thou canst auoyde haue shewed thee cause haue made offe ce common weale ought breake prison bee ryght lawfull profitable comon wealth thou must obey thou mayst flye wtout sinne men haue fled tyranny wrong thys power wee haue openly diuers place scripture elezy fled tyranny kyng siria also helyas kyng king fled tyranny kyng achas also peter fled prison actes idem paule citie damascum iconium open actes apostle agaynst power though thou haue wrong mayst thou make corporall resistaunce alonely auoyde flying el keepe ye thing commaunded thee bee ryght profite co mon wealth thou must fulfill also abyde wil bee inquired mee case please kinges grace condemne newe testament englishe commaunde none subiectes shall haue vnder displeasure whether bee bounde obey thys comaundement auswere doe beeleeue noble prince hath forbidden christen bee done kyng forbyd v readyng scripture men may haue christes testamet whether bee latyne englishe french douche greeke hebrue christes veritie one tonges grace knoweth vnreasonable man eyther counsell forbid grace hee shoulde know reade testament noble prince hys father alouely geeue promised worldly good soone bee geeuen bee ready decay perishe say bee vnreasonable vnright much vnreasonable take awaye v father heauens testament whose legacy promise doe farre excell legacy noble prince father god doth excell man shoulde make many reason prooue vnto hys grace thyng bee lawfull father heauen hath sent v fro cometh nothyng goodnes yea sent man angell saint onely sonne god god diligently declared hym worlde vnto pharesies alone vnto maner people houre death also thereof tooke death yet content sent glorious apostle declare learne thys godly worde thorough worlde beecause ministration thys worde required greater strength naturall man therefore also gaue hee eternall sprite establishe confirme make strong thinges might bee nothing desired declaration setting worde coulde finde hart true subiecte regardeth honour noble prince saluation soule eyther thinke grace would condene el mooue hym condemne thyng cometh heauen yea fro father heanen sent learned eternall sonne hath sealed wyth hys precious bloude also commaunded glorious apostle preach confirmed wyth many myracles also geeue confirming writing glorious consolatour holy ghost open father heauen send godly worde small diligence though hee cared whether shoulde remayne earth hath hee declared holy worde wyth pro heaue earth hell know worde men shoulde haue hee woulde defende bee enemy vnto woulde ouerpresse wherfore let bee cappitall enemy vnto grace hart deede susspect grace moue vnto doubtles neuer doe dare boldely say deuill hell enemy vnto grace body soule moue hym vnto thing alonely condemne god worde thing doth grace know well therefore doubte hee hath also auoyde daunger thereof neuerthelesse may please god take great vegeauce abhominable sinnes hys grace dayes hee may sende v tyraunt shall alonely forbid newe testament also thynges may bee honour god yea paraduenture vnder co llour god name men shall recken none hee god frende bee great scourge intollerable plague father heauen hys infinite mercy defende v terrible vengeaunce greatest plague come earth paule doth declare rom romaynes god veritie condemned god name bee blynde perceaue bee geeue peruerse sece plague neuer cometh toke euerlasting reprobatio merciful redeemer christ iesus defede v fro ame come wee rning conscience onely concerning ordering worldly thinges therefore mynistreth temporall payne ouer body onely therwith cotent wherfore wil speake power men call spirituall fyrst noted power none auctoritie spirituall power worldly onely ministration word god spirituall regiment preaching gouerning soule mynistration ye spirit hauing nothing doe erterior iustice righteousnes worlde therfore hath power spirituall power hath auctoritie make lawes rule worlde right law make statute lawes order worlde onely faithfully truely preach minister word god ther instructing conscience man nothing worde god make lawe statute must bee consydered two maner wayes fyrst whether bee openly derectly agaynst word god ye destructio ye faith statute whereby haue condemned new testament also forbydden assoyled statute say lyke men boud obey neither charite faith hurt geueth place charitie yet auoyding sclaunder worde god may bee auoyded yet geeue place vnto sclauder shoulde neuer bee preached must circumcise titus galat false brother woulde haue compelled hym thereunto thynge necessitie vnto paule gaue romthe cocernyng bee brought subiectio paul note thing selues indifferent yet comaunded bee fish thereunto bee bounde conscience vnder payne deadly sinne may obey word god beecause euill eate fishe tyme conuenient thou art disposed good bycause thyng bynde conscience make thynge necessitie lesse holynesse angel haue set thereunto mandamus remandamus exco municamus sub pena excommunicationis maioris minoris precipimus interdicimus sub indignatione dei omnipotentis apostoloru petri pauli lyfe bee subiect vnto power vnto men doe minister worldly thing honour concerning part wherby beleeue god bee cauled vnto hys kingdome ought bee subiect vnto peruert thing v hath pleased god geue v eternall lyfe c playne conscience christ bee made free nothyng bynd v vnto sinne word onely clearely open power heauen earth commaunde thyng god worde destruction minishing may obey case vnder payne damnation god veritie indifferent bee lefte bee lefte agayne man commaunde thyng bee done may bee done time place conuenient hee wll binde thing indifferent co maunded bee done necessitie obeyed destroyeth ou freedome christ v vnto indifferent thinges vnto thing necessitie shall wee doe beecause euill doe damnable bee done thyng necessitie neuerthelesse thynges bee commaunded byshops burden thinges indifferent shall wee keepe tyme place conuenient may serue brother edifie hym doe good may bee vnto hym meanes come verity neuerthelesse tyme place conuenient shall offende brother ingender sclaunder disquietnes common wealth may freely without charge conscience without maner sinne breake byshops commau dement burden tyraunt layde v neither helpeth increasing god honour edifiyng brethre selues keepe speaketh master christ binde greeuous vntollerable burden lay men neckes themselues set litle inger example eate fleshe fryday math forbidden byshoppes compell thee vnto thyng necessary without thou canst bee saued shalt thou doe vnder payne sinne haue thee keepe thyng congruence thyng may bee exterior meane mortifie bodie outwarde shyne holynes vnto compell thee outwarde paynes thyng shalte thou doe thy charitie beecause thou wilt breake outwarde order make disquietnesse thinges neyther make thee good yet condemne thee beefore god paule sayth wee eate neither cor wee better wee eate wee worse alwayes prouided indifferent thynges thou neyther set confidence holynesse yet offende thy weake brother charitie therein though thou bee free thy selfe thyng also indifferet thee yet charitie freely makest thou thy selfe seruaunt paule saith free thynges yet dyd make selfe seruaunte might winne many men note hee alwayes speaketh weake brother obstinate indurate person agaynst whome thou shalt alwayes withstand defende thy libertye hee dyd hee thy weake brother hath good minde cor beeleeueth worde god neuerchelesse hee hath gifte perceaue yet libertie vse indifferent thynges freely wyth thankes therfore fayth charitie must bee thy guide thynges folowing thou canst erre finis men bounde receiue holy communion vnder kyndes vnder payne deadly sinne men stucke ope scripture god ye practise christes holy church ye exposition olde doctours beecome christen men doe beene needefull mee haue taken paynes labour cause yet haue layd charge thinges antichrist doth onely hee doth workes antechrist antichrist seeyng doe open deedes antechrist must bee contet may also geue name world may openly know antechrist doth raine world yea vnder name christ heare set forth act whe co pared christes wordes doe doubt trew christen men iudge bee deuyll deede though childre world doe iudge otherwyse doe say acte councell constance dyd make agaynst holy glorious sacrament eternall god iesus christ one kynde blessed sacrament condemned vnlawfull lay men receiue euery man may know councell costace forbad sacramet bee receaued lay people kyndes auctoritie dyd thing moue condemne blessed gloryous ordinance lord iesus christ wryte owne wordes custome auoyding certayne sclaunders perrils resonably brought notwithstading wordes councell determination antechrist beeginning church sacrament receiued christen men vnder kindes afterward receiued al onely vnder ye kind bread wherefore seeing custome church holy father reasonably brought long obserued must bee taken lawe yt shall bee lawfull reprooue without auctorytie church chauge ma pleasure wherfore say sacrilege vnlawfull obserue cosuetude law must bee iudged erronius doe pertinaciter defende contrary premissis must bee restrayned heretikes greuously punished byshops official bee inquisitores hereticae prauitatis bee kyngdomes prouinces men doe attempt presume thyng agaynst thys decree shall men proceede agaynst holy lawfull decree bee inuented agaynst heretickes fauters fauoure catholicall fayth c wyll exhorte christen men ye glorious name mightie lord iesus christ redeemer shall bee iudge wyll indifferently heare article discussed blessed worde maister christ iesus whiche alonely god also god himselfe hee dyd done counsel whole trinitie alonely whole counsell counselles heauen earth must bee ordered counsell contrary whether bee sainte angel soeuer doth alter worde god set vp theyr owne inuentions deuill man must bee accursed iudged bee deuil though bee neuer mighty neuer well learned neuer many multitude power learning yet multitude neither heauen earth ieoperdies sclau ders may iudge christ hys holy worde may geeue place vnto wherfore prooue open scripture mayster christ also practise holy church counsell false damnable let christen men iudge v must bee heard beeleeued eyther counsell hauyng scripture yea contrary scripture el haue ope worde god vse practise holy apostle holy church christ god doubteth ye holy counsell though fiue thousades byshops therin must proue theselues bee god worde god theyr workes doe bee contrary christ hys blessed worde moreouer christ true vnder condition bycause men doe low hym though worlde agaynst hym yet hee neuerthelesse true cousell true alonely vnder condition bycause doth agree christes holy worde selfe hath veritie deuill varye christ dreadfull trone god shall ye counsell bee iudged christes holy worde christ shal bee iudged decree counsailes deuill varye fro christe counsell hee shall bee counsel iudge christes worde condemne cousell shal approoue shall prayse shall defende temporall sworde god word iudge councels councels iudges god word multitude byshops interdiction excommunication cursing helpe wherefore let euery true christe man looke matter indifferently trifling wyth god holy worde god remayne euer holy word must bee fulfilled wil fulfill bee shal cast v deepe pit hell make stone stede shall keepe worde light thyng lyeth saluation damnation body soule fro bee deliuered glorious wordes concilium conciliu patres patres episcopi episcopi may bee minister deuill yea though aungels therfore one agayne doe monish exhorte glorious name lyuing god ye sweet bloud christ iesus true christe men take heede doe agaynste christes holy word whiche eternal god mercyfull redemerand shall bee also mighty glorious iudge let v examine wordes note councell hath graunted councell first councell graunteth begynning church christen men houseled vnder kyndes nowe would knowe councell church receiued maner christ holy apostle doubtles shee dyd authoritye councell chaunge institution christ holy apostle also vse practise holy church first churche god shee keepe christes institution shee fulfill christes word ye holy apostle learne shall councell constance first condemne christ blessed word learnyng christes holy apostle also long vse practise christes blessed church without scripture without authoritie without speciall reuelation fro god alonely auoydyng certeine peril yea content alonely codemne thinges vnder paine heresie codemne sore codemnation christes open woorde thyng whiche graunt church dyd vse begynnyng furthermore councell sayth councell doth shamefully bee lye father scripture holy father church dyd bryng custome housell laye men vnder one kinde ashamed woordes doth conscience prike thus openly lye yea christ holy church christes worde openly agaynste graunt vse church also otherwise holy father may see say child kyngdome lye doubtlesse bryng foorth holy father make shall alonely bee taken abhominable en lyers also shameful detestable sclaunderers holy church also holy father wonder antichrist must declare selfe openly bee agaynst christ yet hee neuer without antichrist doth tymes declare hym selfe bee agaynste christ excuse shaddow holynes hee may blynd poore people excuse hee councell codemne christes worde might auoyde certaine sclauders perrils beecause body without bloud bee lawfull cause condemne christes open word yea vnder payne heresie new maner law make new doctrine made antichrist hee obeye statute made agaynst god word hee boude obey perill vsing neede many wordes prooue councell bee soeuer contrary christ deuill deuill bee deuill contrary christ hath excuse alonely auoyde perrils ca tell deuill sure antichrist shall neuer bee without carnall excuse hee deny christ bee god man hee shall haue stronger carnall reason councell hath matter must bee iudged carnal reason god worde aboue creature wherefore let v goe scripture sure ancore ouercome antichrist carnall reason first maister christ hee dyd institute blessed sacrament vse woordes take eate body c likewise takyng math marke luke challice hee gaue thankes gaue vnto saying drinke bloud newe testament shall bee shed many remission sinnes bee playne wordes drinke hee sayth excepteth man furthermore christes institution sacrament body bloud hee knewe might bee ieoperdies receiuyng yet hee sayth drinke bloud shall bee shed remission sinnes shed lay men sinnes shal drinke maister lord sayth drinke therof shall miserable seruaunt withstand commaundemet yea commaunde playne contrary say drinke therof commeth lord rochester perceiueth councel connict consenteth whole church begynnyng receiue sacrament vnder kyndes yet forbiddeth thyng sayth rochester glose vpon christes wordes mainteine errour christe spake wordes drinke alonely apostle men apostle therfore must alonely drinke therof aunswere lord thing alonely lawfull vnto apostle discharge primatiue churche whiche men christ ministred sacrament vnto yea selfe men minister vnder kyndes whole congregation accordyng commaundement drinke dout vnderstoode christes well commaundement way communication let v graut apostle onely sayd discharge owne priestes deadly sinne receiue vnder kindes yet bee neither apostle successours learnyng bishop alonely bee successours priestes doe written priestes aunswere whomsoeuer writte maketh matter wordes bee plaine diuision one misterye bee done without great sacrilege word bee spoken person shall receaue deuiding sacrament whosoeuer reason body without bloude yet hee calleth superstition let v see glose saith texte superfluously sayth hee receaued vnder kindes kynde bread referred vnto fleshe kynde wyne vnto bloude wyne sacrament bloude seate soule therfore receiued vnder kindes signifie christ receiue body soule partaking thereof doth profite bodye soule wherefore receiued alonely vnder one kynde gloser agaynst counsell reason deuotion contrary god mere blyndnes impietie good consideration good intent finally ten tymes better reason counsell yet saul good reason wyth good deuotion good purpose fatte beastes repelled behold thy kyng cometh zacharie math thee sittyng asse fole saying reason alonely simple also foolishe say kyng shal come riding asse yea borowed asse therof make much doe though wer notable thyng would mocke kyng hee dyd ryde notwithstandyng bee wordes god yea also fulfilled deede maister christ owne proper person moreouer reason madde token sauiour luke world christ iesus borne say shal finde young child wrapped cloutes layd cribbe purpose prooue sauiour yt world borne reason mocke wil reason bee persuaded token yt sayinges doinges christ bee iudged naturall reason messias prophetes patriarkes haue promised many hudred yeares afore borne yet token came heaue yea ministration aungels shepheardes dyd beleeue yt word briefly reason bee article fayth christ remission sin yt lyfe come reason mocketh thynges yet bee true bycause alonely yt word god speaketh wherfore noble excellet prince looke word god blynde reason saue honour therof shal saue grace neede furthermore doe exhorte require honour yea doe comaunde vertue christ iesus blessed word duke earles lordes maner estate hygh lowe bee christen men bee saued vertue iesus christes blessed bloud doe see ordinauce iohn god heauen obserued vttermost power soeuer bee houseled receiue blessed sacramet vnder kyndes lest desire hart curate desire may bee discharged afore immortall god heauen whiche bee mocked auoyded damnable reaso soeuer thyng bee agaynst holy word god glorious ordinauce collour soeuer ordeined agaynst ordinaunce christ occursed euer bryng holynes let bee cursed reckened deuill doth cyprian learne v saying thyng soeuer bee ordeined man madnes ordinaunce god violated whoredome deuil sacrilege wherfore fly fro contagiousnesse men auoyde woordes canker pestilence c woordes bee playne maner men estate dignitie honour soeuer bee collour holynes soeuer bryng wherfore present writyng doe counsel exhorte true christen men take heede doe word god playne matter desire playner childes game trifle god worde god bee trifled yet mocked nowe helpe poore men bee vnlearned assoyle certeine damnable reason first geue blynd reason papistes vnder kynde wyne lest shoulde negligence either priest receiuer fall droppe grounde aunswere christ dyd know chaunce might come deny except say hee god would greatly sticke doe might haue maintenaunce yet notwithstanding dyd hee institute kindes aunswere moreouer doe reaso owne priestes abstayne fro wine seeing perill may also chauce cautelles yt masse doe graunt also bee reasonable cause shal keepe christes ordinaunce beecause auoyding perilles may take away whole sacrament auoyde perilles receauing ye kinde bread ieopardous least remayne crumme receauers teeth reaso good sacramet kindes taken away furthermore auoyde perilles may geeue thys sacrament man tell deadly sinne know harte sore perell greatly ieoperdye geue pure body christ iesus foule soule papistes finde faulte gnattes swallowe caniels yt drop bloud negligence fall ground falleth drop yt whole body foular place ground also may bee auoyded good diligence wisedome priest sacrament shall alwayes bee receiued pure conscience dilygence priest make thinke whole sacrament christes blessed ordinaunce clearely taken away auoyding ieoperdies perells thus trifle christes holy word yea yt great holy counsel reason lorde rochester bringeth bee worthy solution hee doth mocke scorne trifle god word hee bringeth yt myracle yt fiue loues mentio made wyne therefore lay men must bee houseled one kinde madnes meane men yt neyther feare god yet bee ashamed man purpose christ dyd myrackle fyue loues iohn mencion made wyne sacrament bread fygnifyed one part sacrament sygnifyed fyshes thing fonde argumentes made byshop roche estr must needes signifye part also lay men touch breade moreouer place christ geueth onely wine therefore sacrament must bee receiued kinde wine al onely lay men bee goodly argumentes yea bishop madnes aunswere god worde lawfull priestes hath gift chastitie marry wiues cause moued hym write thing haue seene heard diuerse countryes haue beene intolerable persecutio agaynst priestes compelled weakenes nature mary wyues intent might god law man law vse honest couersation world thyng say haue beene sore persecuted cast countrey drowned burned beheaded finally cruelnes could bee excogitated men thought litle wherfore recken selfe debtour seruaunt vnto thynges wherein may profite specially thynges apperteine instructio conscience hath taken vpo cause shew litle small learnyng charitably desiryng bee thing yet thyng let selues bee taught instructed god word set themselues obstinately agaynste verity god blessed word lord easely beare suffer vnwilled ignoraunce peruerse malice froward resistyng veritie hee suffer thereunto hee mortall extreme enemy wherefore let men consider article doth stand god word ith christes holy doctrine resiste set themselues agaynst doe resiste god man able performe certaine men bee two sort men peruerse froward obstinate mynde doth set selues agaynst article moe wise admit either reason learnyng still remaine theyr old errour haue conceiued braynes whiche neither grounded god holy word yet holy conuersation lyuyng blessed vertuous vnto men write nothyng bycause trouble bycause would bee loth bee torne dog teeth elles cast pearles beefore swyne sorte bee math doth admit article reason bee ignoraunt scripture know groude therof alonely led old custome haue brought vp yet neuerthelesse obstinate enemyes vnto veritie would gladly geue place learnyng reason doe search sober meekenes ye truth thing glad embrace soone layde vnto men writyng labour spent doe charitably beseeche fauourably indifferently iudge writyng doe bynde selfe prooue thing god grace christ holy worde sayinges holy doctours authoritie authe ticall story example practise holy vertuous men doe bee contented bee beleeued thyng performe thinke reasonable men geeue credence mee finally la shew reason authority wherby pope hath bounde hys priestes keepe hee calleth pure chastitie conclusion poore learnyng assoyle scripture reason prooue thyng ca haue place vnto performyng whiche iesus infinite mercy graunt holy spirite amen first cometh blessed saint paule church god hath alwayes reuerence hee approueth doctrine mine saying let euery man auoyding fornication cor haue wife euery woman haue husband marke blessed paule comaundeth daunger fornication euery man auyoding vicious lyuyng take wife man excepted text euery man specially lyue sole vnto streight commaundement marry none remedy ordeined god auoyde fornication mariage yea ten remedy mariage yet must mariage bee lawfull bee vsed yea great deale seeyng specially appoynted god remedy case remedyes fastyng watchyng labouryng chastising priestes bounde mary auoyding vicious liuing chastising theyr body seyng god ordinaunce ther unto appointed man body though bee lawfull laudable good yet bee appropriately onely appoynted god bee remedy agaynst fornication blessed paule doth appoynt mariage bee wherefore bee lawfull priestes fast watch auoyde fornication must needes bee lawful marry wiues bee daunger fornication mariage case alonely commaunded god appointed god especiall singular medecine disease marke also occasion paul write text corinthian certeine men amog reckened holines perfectio certeine doth priestes christen lyue sole without wiues text declareth good man touch woman doth blessed paule aunswere holy hypocrisie maner auoyde fornication sayth hee notwithstandyng holynesse let euery man mary wyfe blessed saynt paule thought vnlawfull marry christen man would hee haue sayde let euery man marry marke also agaynst perfection christen man marry hee rather boude marry hee haue gifte chastitie farthermore note paule neither biddeth thought holynes bee vnmaryed fast labour weare heere alonely marry shoulde say god hath ordayned approoued lawful laudable remedy sicknes doctrine shall heare god vse comforte creature remedy thankes geeuing god hath appointed therewith bee co tent recken selues wyser god helpyng curyng disease nothing bee vnlawfull god doth allowe prooue vsing god creature ordinaunces tyme place requisite man bee blamed beefore god refusing god remedy whe bee necessary let man thinke hee shall auoyde god daunger example hee wyll eate drinke hee hungry thirsty excogitateth remedie owne brayne long hee bringeth himselfe vtter destruction let man doubte case god hee murtherer homicide thinke learning contrary wherefore woulde well remember themselues thys case thinke ca inuent thyng pleasaunt vnto god hee doe hym selfe pleasure best knowen vnto himselfe cause iudge lawfull euery priest hath gift chastitie vse remedy god hath ordayned also sanctified blessed paule saith mariage honorable bedde vndefiled fornicatours aduoulterers god shal iudge marke paule caulleth honorable cleane thyng presumption hebr therefore v recken dishonour vncleannesse priestes vse maryage god sayth hee shall iudge whorekeepers aduoulterers bee maryed wherefore yet agayne ye doctrine paule exhorte priestes liue chaste receiue god remedie thankes paules doctrine cor hee sayth woulde men selfe euery hath proper gift god one maner say vnto vnmaryed men wydowes good abide doe abstaine let mary better mary sufficient god auoyde paule light vayne solution burne deuise clearer text purpose thys saint paule woulde euery man gifte chastitie much men hath one gift therefore sayth paule must euery man vse himselfe gift hee hath gifte chastitie paule wyll plainely hee shall mary hee sayth hee shal chastice himselfe wyth labour wyth payne remedye weakenes though woulde bee contente parte gladly men shoulde prooue maner lawfull remedy helpe lyue sole continue wyll wise shall refuse maryage thyng vnlawfull filthy rather vse prooue least wise haue done remedy haue inuented seeing god hath iustituted thyng hee iudgeth lawfull principall remedy note paule sayth better mary burne paules meanynge man hath gifte extincte burnyng ardent desire nature hee must mary rather bee subiecte vnto concupiscence paule sayth rather mary keepe whore hys wee shoulde bee farre whoredome wee suffer selues much burne whiche preceedeth whoredome lesse deede whoredome yet paule wylling v auoyde lesse thing commaundeth v mary much auoyde open whoredome abhominable detestable vncleannes vsed shamelesse worlde doe reprooue priestes whoredom lawful case mariage lawfull diuerse case ergo mariage must rather bee alowed whoredome doth lyue sole rather thereto exhorte detestate men rather suffer allow priestes liue whoredome abhominable fornication vse lawfull remedy god hath ordayned sanctified wee haue mention storye euer priest burned keepyng whore mariage haue seene doe see dayly cruelly violently men doth persecute though god blessed ordinaunce rather bee extincted abhorred thyng ye god nature reprooueth one man england hath great loue reuerence holy state matrimony hee keepe maryed priest hys house priestes lyue vnlawfully agaynst god law man law agaynst honesty morall vertue bee euery man house company ruler cousellers controller ala pitie shall say affectios men harte thus winke say alow abhominable thynges yea selfe men shall bee extreme cruell vnto poore simple priest good hart towardes god ordinaunce maryeth lawfull wife priest say shall neither haue meate drinke yet office charitye sort shalbee exalted set vp honour kept reuerence estimatio bycause say bee good cleane felowes loueth peece flesh well blasphemous woordes haue heard diuerse tymes many men sit laugh haue great reioysing sore god holy ordinaunce morall vertue goodnes extincted men harte lord god thy mercy world able co tinewe thus abhominably shamefully iudgeth thy halowed sanctified workes oh lord haue thou mercy pitie v sweete bloud thy sonne christ iesus loke synnes oh lord god able abyde thy syght lord thine infinite mercy send downe thy spirit ye hart thy people may bee taught better iudge thy heauenly godly institution amen purpose article haue written bee something harde obscure sauing onely men bee learned article mee thinke playne meruayle doubt doubtles needeth learned iudge onely ciuell morall good man write agaynst priestes ca doe lyue chast rather exhorte continue indued reason equitie surely mine aduersaries doth earnestly defend pure cleane chastitie know priestes bee keepeth chastitie yea know sore haue punyshed men hath broken theyr chastitie doe defend chastitie rather fylthines abhominable lyuing ye part spiritualtie doth liue bee reported let men lest marrye wyues seyng doe lyue chast recordes kinges court also owne recordes ye bee serched bee found innumerable sort detected vncleanes matter bee open notwithstanding right sory rehearse compelled seing intollerable violece vsed agaynst poore marry cause would onely lyue vertuously beefore god also morally world let men onely vse reason man doubteth greate many doth thus lyue whiche bee greate persecutor maryed priestes would desire proue pacience sore know theyr name theyr child thess case make comparison betweene two manner lyuings consyder doth beecome polytike order common wealth best whether reason better mee defile shamefully men wyues men daughter mennes maydens man seruaunt shoulde bee safegarde mee el marry wyfe myne noble kinges duke good men world hath done doth dayly continew lyfe myne neighbour maner good neighbourhod let men heare without malyce iudge indifferetly blessed saint paule proceedeth farther matter proueth clearely man ought bee bound verginitie farther ye gift god doth strengthe hym thus hee sayth co cerning virgin haue precept lord onely geue councell thinke good ye reason present necessitie man lyue hee would say vnto verginitie inde yo farther gift doe recken thing necessary wyn heauen heauen neyther price virginity yet mariage onely reken verginitie maryed men shall testifie virginitie quyet lyfe good expedient thing liue quietly world mariage many thinges ye doth distracte disturbeth man mynde paules meanyng wel proued ye texte followeth mariage hath greater crosse virginitie virgin doth marry doth sinne vut shee shall haue much teptation flesh say many occasion disquietnes sayth paule would gladly spare occasion would haue without sorowe shee vnmaried hath care serue god shee maryed hath much care sorowe shee shall dispatch worldly busines paule doth clearely declare meaning virginity nearer way heauen mariage sauyng onely vnmaried person hath many occasyons bee disquieted maryed hath wherefore shall marke text fyrst paule hath commaundement binde men chastitie commeth therefore pope compelleth men xxxi ca nte trie ee priestes fyrst forsweare mariage vow chastitie learning able proue pope ca make preceptes god blessed paule could doe furthermore auctoritie hath pope bynde v thyng god holy apostle hath left free learned men euer wrote doth graunt ye bee two manner thinges world bee called re necessariae re necess thinges bee necessary must bee done beecause god hath commaunded thing man able make iudifferent must needes bee necessarily done thinges bee lerned cauleth re mediae thinges bee indifferent may bee done may bee left without sinne nature contrary may bee chauged thinges necessary agaynst nature paule declareth roman rom diuers place trueth virginitie thyng selfe god ordinaunce indifferet may bee vsed left without sinne wherefore virginitie state differens standeth learnyng ma law chauge nature thyng make vnto man thyng necessarie whereas god commaundement thyng different much chaunge god ordinaunce also ye nature thing stadeth learnyng pope world make god commaundement cousell god counsell make precept wherfore coclude blessed paule man chastitie god gift ought vow chastitie farther god hath geu n hym gift chastitie thyng could bee obtayned kept vowyng gift god gift vowyng whiche agaynst maister christ also agaynst math cor blessed paule farthermore let euery man thinke selfe seeyng blessed whether bee better folow paule pope paule commaundement ouer chastitie yet would geue commaundement whether bee surest way lawfullest folow pope commaundement el folow blessed paules doctrine knew perfection virginitie also dyd beecome priestes doe well pope doth moreouer men iudge priestes marry whiche foloweth paules counsell doctrine greuously sinne bee heretickes rather iudge men greuously sinne bee ten tymes worse heretickes foloweth pope commaundement marying paules doctrine lawful bee keept farre sinne pope comaundements bee paule great auctoritie churche god pope thinke yes note also paule would bynde cor corinthian virginity bycause hee would tangle snare alonely hee exhorteth virginitie vnto honest comely thyng might yt quietly serue god vpo text sayth athanasius apostle would compell athanasius cor keepe virginitie agaynst hee would make virginitie thyng necessitie wherefore must needes folow first pope byndyng men virginitie doth lay snare nothyng el except haue gift chastitie bryng men daunger damnation secodarily hee maketh thyng necessitie ye holy ghost blessed paul durst would doe thyrdly thyng paule reckened onely conduce helpe quietnes present lyfe thyng maketh pope sauiour helper heaue great blasphemy christes holy bloud also peruerse vsing god blessed creature let euery christen iudge bee charitably done pope yea whether hee hath authoritie doe let man beseche hym iudge matter parcia litie euen hee aunswere beefore god blessed paule goeth farther cocernyng haue purpose promise god virgi itatem keepe charitie hys woordes bee hee purposeth surely hys hart hauyng neede hath power ouer owne wil hath decreed hart yt hee keepe hys virginitie doth well note first paule compelleth man vow hee letteth euery man stand owne farthermore blessed paul willeth soeuer hee bee decreeth hart keepe virginity bee must first consider whether lyeth power keepe decree bee power sayth blessed paule dispenseth vnlawfull vowes paule doth hee better keepe virginitie marry lye power bee chast doth body soule willeth paule hee marry note paul notwithstandyng man decree purpose hee made keepe virginity willeth hee doe marry hee ca keepe decree purpose cotrary pope doctrine whiche rather suffereth priestes liue vnclennes yt reason foolish promise made vnto hym hee would suffer marry wyues paules holy doctrine yea pope ashamed cruelly punishe poore woman marying hee doth shee whore nunne shee marry x v q c de filia verbo de filia sayth hee shall neuer bee admitted receyue blessed sacrament christ shee bee whore sayth hee may shee penaunce bee admitted sacramet abhorryng mariage bee none compare yea make worse whoredome shee haue vowed chastitie hath shee also vowed flye fornication shee bounde vnto virginitie man law auoyde fornicatio whoredome god commaundement wherfore see hygh pope set hym selfe aboue god holy ordinaunce thess furthermore paule sayth god abstayne fornicatio euery one v know keepe vessell sanctifiing honour marke paules saying first god abhorre fornication resiste god regarde thyng god haue done trust christen man furthermore god yt euery man keepe vessell honour priestes bee men haue gift chastetie bounde regard commaundement hee sayth euery man marke also blessed paule calleth vessell maryed men honorable sanctified wherfore shuld bee vnlawful priest vse sanctified holy vessell possesse men vessel vnclennes agaynst god man lawfull man text possesse vessell hys owne god hath sanctified honored man occasion curse thyng god hath sanctified make vncleane god hath purified paule hauing yt spirite god prophecie come tim men latter dayes forbid men marry men speake lye holy hipocrisie nowe marke texte men shall forbyd maryage latter dayes trueth hath forbidden certayne state men marry pope onely wherefore texte must needes touch kingdome seeing hee also latter dayes certayne heretickes called taciani condemne fully wholy maner maryage though taciani saynt paule speaketh yet deede pope doctrine excepted seeing contayned latter dayes though twenty heresy taciani yet must texte bee applied agaynst doth codene el despise mariage whole parte text doth forbid maryage specially latter dayes hee doth forbid priest marry doth forbid much mariage pope forbyddeth mariage therefore texte maketh agaynst pope note also men shall forbid mariage shall haue holy colour hypocrisie hath pope forbidden hys priestes marry vnder colour holynes beecause hee sayth priestes must bee pure cleane shoulde say maryage vncleane vnpure priestes vse bee holy hypocrisie bee hypocrisie holy pure institution god condemned thyng vncleane holy priestes vse moreouer taciani forbid mariage vnder colour holynes said fully wholy vnlawfull thynge doctrine maner colour pope sayth mariage good laudable selfe priest bee pure holy vse simple thyng thynge sayth hee doth become yt state perfecte belogeth weake vnperfect men iudge good reader heresy eyther taciani papacy doth pretende yt greatest colour holynes yet sure yt holy ghost paul speake greatest also smallest hypocrisie hee alloweth maner fayned holynes certayne heretikes called marciani receiue man bee christen man excepte hee woulde refuse mariage marke diuersitie betweene heretickes pope learning pope receiueth priest except forsweare maryage marcianites pope one marcianites receiue man bee christen man excepte hee forsweare maryage diuersitie betweete heretikes pope heretikes doth excepte greater number yt pope doth speaketh generally thynge one marcianites iudgeth mariage vncleane sorte doth pope sorte farthermore marcian sayth among christen men may bee temporal maryages coniunctions must bee turned vnto spirituall mariage dist xxxi ca l x selfe thing saith pope priestes wherefore seeing doe graunt blessed paul tim also holy father hath condemned heresie marcian st needes also folow opinion pope lykewyse condemned yet paraduenture bee obiectio sayde doctour eckius writing matter sayth pope doth condemne maryage hee causeth men alonely keepe vowe aunswere thys small euasion pope compelleth vow much hee forbiddeth maryage first pope copelleth wyll bee priestes vowe forsweare maryage statute made beefore pope priestes forsweare maryage shoulde vowes bee made priestes mariage thing shoulde bee free vowe commeth pope decree prohibition decree vowe therfore ye probation goeth beefore vowe wherfore euasion haue place take exaple emperour maketh statute man shalbee admitted seruice excepte hee first sweare bee enemy vnto kyngs grace england emperour first enemye good example agaynst pope practises vnto kynges person also forbydder loue fauour towardes kinges grace englad thynke hys grace wyll take acte none otherwise though hee doth make men kynges enemy yet hee maketh appertayne hym bee kinges enemy lykewise pope though hee doe forbid men maryage yet hee forbyddeth many bee priestes yea hee admitte man bee priest excepte hee first forsweare maryage ye vow first made ere pristhoode geeuen hee enemy deede vnto maryage shoulde mooue hym compell hys priestes forsweare maryage doth hee well bynde hys priestes maryage hee doth chastitie yea doth hee yt least keepe hymselfe indifferent neither make decree mariage agaynst chastitie trueth protectours vncleannes filthy liuing doth know well solution strength valure deede harte doth recken matrimony vncleane vnpure though woulde make glose yet owne lawes yt bee sprong harte doth shewe much holde holy vnpolluted dist c erubescant matrimony pope doth cal clark yt bee maried impios yt wicked cursed vncleane filthy yt nought also place hee cauleth matrimony lay men fleshly carnall thyng chastitie c lex spiritualtie hee cauleth spirituall maryage saith marcian abhominable doctrine thus shameles speake holy sanctified matrimony call fleshly carnall yet hee thus content hee cauleth yt maryage priestes sinne defender sectatores libidinum dist c plurimos folowers filthy lustes preceptores viciorum teacher vice laxantes frena luxuriae geeuing libertie lechery tell mee man woulde speake reprooue yt whore stewes wordes co ld hee vse agaynst shameful yet wil bee noted condemne matrimony mischiefe deuill cloke men woulde beleeue hym farthermore let v see holy blessed hee reckeneth matrimony bee reason honour rewardes hee geueth vnto priest marry first dist c quia aliquanti saith hee priest doth marry ignoraunce reason hee knew statute pope forbidding priestes marry priest pope lawes agaynst maryage priestes fyrste shall forsake wife shall continue farther promotion long hee lyueth bee priest defed mariage example priestes ould lawe hym doth pope priuate maner ecclesiasticall honour euer moreouer new deuised sinne agaynst holy ghost helpe god hee sayth spirituall doth decree marry sinne shall neuer bee forgeuen hym may neuer afterward handle blessed sacramet mariage fylthy foule concupiscence sayth hee iudge indifferently christe reader bee dispising holy matrimony thus shamefully speake cruelly handle holyly doth liue hauing nothing hym lousy decree pope siricius men may perceaue clearely hee byndeth priestes reason vowe protectours doth say yt reason statute siricius made afore priestes vowed chastetie paule hee order byshoppes bee tim church god irrepresesible among thinges hee would hee bee man one wife hauing tit child well brought vp saint paule aloweth hym one wife commeth men say priest shall haue wyfe agreeth one none men must least wayes graunt paule dyd recken mariage vnpure vncleane byshop hee hee would haue grau ted hym one wife yea moreouer hee speaketh child well brought vp hee admitteth aloweth coniunction copulation child bee gotten lookyng woman onely beetweene two bee godly vertuous hee hath eye looke blessed holy coniunction betweene man wyfe pope hath pope rekeneth fylthy semely priest holy handes touch woman body handes conscecrate yt holy sacrament oh lord god ca deuill bring passe abhominable holynes hypocrisye recken priest vnpure vncleane beecause hee hath vsed hym selfe god holy ordinaunce much say god thou art inuenter ordayner thing maketh men vnpure vncleane thou art auctour vncleanenes haddest thou instituted men vsed pope alloweth priestes keepe whore cannot abyde haue honest wife ala fayne would chide could say thing would may neuertheles greeueth mee tell vse euell wordes shall vse abhominable execrable heresye yet pray one worde bee hads defiled handeling whore sleshe whore slesh cleane priestes may handle fleshe honest good woman vncleane burne priestes bee knowen open whore master benesices bee better chepe recken earnestly defend chastitie priest must bee burned handeling fye deuill thinkest thou men hath neyther reuerece artes toward god yet reaso iudge thing bee shameles thing shall bee thus alowed amongest christen men bee honest woman honestie abhorred despised whore comparison bee sanctified blessed oh thou lord god doe yet beleeue thou wilt bee reuenged shonour shamefulnes moreouer doth oppression violence thefte defyle priestes handes well mariage hath pure matrymonye offended alonely defyle priest hand maner vice vncleanenes doth nothing contaminate ala pitye blindly doe iudge holy ordinace institution god thus doe blaspheme men say blessed cor paule hee sayth haue power lead syster wife well bretheren lord cephas dispute whether paule wife sure text doth clearely proue yt mind great doctours peter apostle wiues wherefore bee vnlawfull priestes marry bee priest holier peter apostle mariage vnlawfull peraduenture great blasphemy agaynste christ holy apostle bee sayd apostle wiues beefore yt christ dyd chuse afterward forsooke wyues folowed christ aunswere inough say seeing haue graunted apostle wiues whe cauled standeth reaso men proue open scripture apostle theyr caulyng dyd forsake theyr wyues yea wyll goe farther wyth say playnely abhominable lye great blasphemy agaynst god holy apostle say forsaken theyr wyues christ taught forsake math wyues wyse keepe sauing alonely fornication apostle forsooke wiues men dreame election vnto apostleship neyther fornication yet like vnto fornication wherefore say boldely false lye agaynst holy apostle say forsooke wyues also place paule doth prooue false lye paule speaketh peter hys apostleshyp also disciple christ caryed theyr wyues wyth went preaching wherefore lye say forsaken christen reader haue perfourmed trust one part promise say haue proued article myne god holy worde playnely man trust deny scripture bee sufficient moue al bee doctrine second part promise proue also holy doctours vnto prepare selfe afore thinges louingly charitably desyre reader set apart parcialitie malice iudge indifferently doctrine hee aunswere dread full day doome refuse thyng truth hatred displeasure person surely myne intent neyther hurte harme yet displease much lyeth mee person though haue tymes past somwhat vehemently written agaynst thinges thought errours yet would require hartely euery man weye euery thyng indifferently hymself consider haue taken vpon mee enuey agaynst perso alonely fight agaynst deuillishe doctrine dishonour christ hys blessed bloude perillous dampnable vnto christen men soules secondarily haue beene wrongfully vncharitably handeled god good men doth knowe bee bounde prooue whensoeuer shall please god kyng assigne indifferent iudges heare mee myne aduersaries let require mee hee finde hymselfe say patiently easely beare suffer intollerable wronges ought doe yea paraduenture gladly woulde doe wherefore confesse many wordes hath beene sharpely written mee would gladly beene charitablyer written god geeue mee great patience wherefore trust god grace somethyng temperately speake desiring euery good man hys charitie helpe mee wyth deuoute prayer amen purpose fyrst commeth blessed ciprian asked question bee done ciprian pist wyth religious personnes could keepe theyr chastitie vowed bee hys wordes thou doest aske wee doe iudge vyrgins haue decreed lyue chastly afterward founde one bedde wyth man thou sayst one deacon wee doe wyth great sorow see great ruine many person cometh reaso vnlawfull perillous companying togither wherefore haue dedicate selues vnto christ fayth lyue purely chastly let remayne wyth fable strongly stedfastly abyde rewarde virginitie ciprian regarde honest liuing religious vowe wyll abyde el abyde better marry fall fier concupiscence let geeue vnto brother sisterne none occasion sclaunder c doe parte require blessed cyprian doth teach say priestes lyue sole beseeche lord rewarde geeue grace continue woulde haue snare layd theyr soules yet haue compelled thyng keepe woulde thyng shoulde bee indifferent lyue chaste remayne haue gifte lyue vse lawfull remedy god hath ordained hath men doe moueth maryage priestes allowed god therefore bee condemned men compell priestes marry long god conteted priest wedlocke let man thynke compulsion acceptable god men wyll bee conte ted doctrine good reasonable honest ca say must bee content doe say learnyng let god alone wyth hys punishment also blessed augustine writing thys matter sayth aug de b coniugal ad iulianum wordes certayne men doe affirme men bee aduoulterers doth marry haue vowed hastitie doe affirme men doe greuously sinne doth separate c note first angustine wryteth vowed chastitie yet notwithstanding hee woulde men shoulde continue maryage togither thyng hee would neuer haue suffered beene vnlawfull here e men woulde make dayes secondarily obserue dayes ee many thought greuous aug dispenseth wyth vowes dau ger fornication sinne man marry hys vowe yet opinion augustine doth condemne let men admit doctrine augustine wil require condemne let also condemne augustine haue learned hym also blessed ambrose writeth virginitie maner chastitie body ought bee desired v thyng doe geue cousell doe commaude imperiously virginitie thyng alonely ambr quest cap integritas ought bee counsayled bee commaunded rather thyng voluntary precept c note ambrose teacheth virginitie ought bee required vnder precept wherfore must needes folow pope doctrine vnlawfull whe hee commaundeth man shall bee priest except hee vow chastitie ere pope compelleth men vnder colour vow chastitie example chaunceth meete way theef sayth vnto thou shalt goe ouer bridge except thou wilt deliuer thy purse trueth may choose whether goe ouer bridge yet man doth violence copellyng mee either goe backe agayne el lose purse goe ouer doubt vowes haue vnlawfull condition bee obserued kynges lawe condemne hym doyng violence also take theefe likewise pope doth wrong hee sayth shall bee priest except first vow chastitie say condition vnlawfull wrongfully done bynde thyng vnder condition god hath left free moreouer christ require condition hys priest wherfore must needes folow thyng necessitie belongeth priesthode also hierome approoueth hi cap legan doctrine mine saying let bishop priestes read thyng hee speaketh agaynst mispendyng goodes offered helpe poore men doth teach child prophane letter maketh read commedies sing baudy songes iesters child finde charge church c obserue hierom speaketh byshops priest child whiche could haue vnmaryed bee supposed hie ome speaketh bastardes whore child hee would haue vsed wordes good reader cleare doctrine holy doctours lawful priestes haue wiues specially lyue sole goe farther see holy councels hath ordeined cause trueth deuill hath long tyme harped stryng sorbyd priestes matrimony deuotion hee virginitie hee knew well men could keepe farther theyr gift alonely hee might lay snare men soules also bryng holy institution ordinaunce god contempt despising god hath alwayes hys infinite mercy styrred vp good man resiste hym doe read authenticall storyes cou cell nicene certeine men went haue pri ated priestes wyues almighty god dyd l woordes storyes bee councell nicene holy councell willyng reforme lyfe men dyd set certayne lawes call canones among whiche certayne ex tripertita historia dist xxxi ca nicena men would haue lawe hee brought byshops priest deacon subdeacon lye wyues maryed theyr consecratio paphnutius confessour dyd withstand sayd theyr mariage honorable pure chastitie lye theyr wyues coucell persuaded make law affirmyng bee greuous occasion vnto also vnto wyues fornication thyng dyd paphnutius though hee hym selfe vnmaryed councell dyd alowe sentence nothyng decreed cocernyng thyng euery man left vnto hys freewill bounde necessitie c bee noted holy coucell dyd recken vnpure filthye thyng byshop councell nicen dyd thinke vnmeete thing byshop haue wife priest copany wyfe doe graut pure cleane chastitie priest company wife clearely agaynst pope hee sayth fleshly carnall handes bee defiled made vnworthy thereby handle blessed sacramentes bee sayd wyues theyr consecration whiche thyng also graunt maryed man may bee chosen byshop also keepe wife afterward hee may marry hys cosecration wyfe aunswere lawfull solution thus say bee lawfull keepe wyfe priesthode shall bee lawfull hym take wyfe hys cosecration thyng hys matrimony made hys consecration matrimony hys consecration cause dyd hee take wyfe hys consecration hee dyd auoyde fornication hee much bound take wyfe becommeth hym great deale worse lyue fornication hys consecratio hee dyd maketh lighte solution doe hadle matter truely god meanyng maryed men either bee byshops priestes let shew pop suffer maryed shal e chosen byshops chronicle euer maryed man chosen bee byshop since made lawes priestes haue wyues wil beleeue alonely seeke e asion defende matter dare say man goe aboute chuse maried man bee byshop el person would thinke hee mad much hath sayd mariage vnlawfull di xx ca piestes haue fayned olye apostle forsake wiues election sta deth two togeathers maryed men may bee bishop feare maryed men may byshops second brother shall longer bee beggers byshoprickes soone bee gotten handes parte also benefice wherefore woulde counsell rather graunt priestes myght haue wiues maried men bee made byshops furthermore marke holy counsell made lawe whether priest marry conse ration wherefore must needes bee taken away free indifferet thing priest marry cosecratio reckened vnlawfull hym marry would haue forbidden counsell gathered reforme thinges sse text saith clearely moreouer chaunced priest haue maried consecration hee offended lawe day forbyd hym therefore necessary artycle men bee content auctorities yet somewhat satisfye bringe lawe papistes calleth canon apostolorum wordes bee canon apost man doth teach priest reason order ought forsake wyfe cursed bee hee c marke lawe colour holines ought forsake wyues wherefore must needes folowe priest marry wiues consecration holynes note also text sayth priest wiues owne went borowing doe reade counsell consilium gangrens canon gangrens made decree man doth iudge condemne priest maried hee may reason mariage doe sacrifyce abstayne masse reason thereof cursed bee hee c fyrst shall know occasion wherfore counsell gathered certayne heretyke called eustachius dyd among eustachius hereticus heresyes teach mari man could saued also taught priest dyd marry ought bee despised wise handle blessed sacramentes heretick decree made let euery iudge diuersitie betweene heretyke pope doctrine heretyke sayth mariage vnpure vncleane maryed priest may touch sacramentes selfe doctrine sayth pope diuers place especially chapter beginneth wt nullum dist hee sayth byshop shall pre ume consecrate deacon except hee fyrst vow chastitie man ought bee admitted sayth hee serue aulter except chastitie bee fyrst knowen also chapter hee sayth dist de ernimus eyther keepe whore el marry wiues shalbe priuated benefice vnworthy bee temple god touch holy vessel church doth vse selues vncleanenes sayth hee condemning sauyng pope eustachius matrymony bee hee co pareth whordome matrymony bee like cleane neuer none heretyke pope goeth dist dist c assumi pr teria sayth man may bee eyther priest deacon maryed except promise forsake wiues c lawes make say maryed men may bee priestes dist ca sac rdotib piscopi tenere co si laicus thyng doth pope also confyrme dyuers place lawe hauing none cause hee sayth priestes must bee pure cleane cause also eustachius reckened pope doth maryage vnpure vncleane dyd therefore forbyd priest marry yea dayes dare say man forbiddeth priest marry recke mariage vncleane let goe farther see holy counsel haue decreed conserning priestes matrimony doe reade counsell called syxt sinod word sinodus considering yt decreed amongest lawes made rome deacon priest shall company wiues therefore withstanding decree folowing yt rule apostle constitution holy men wyll thys day forth maryage shal bee lawfull wyse dissoluyng matrimony betweene wiues depriuing familiarity time conuenient whosoeuer therfore shall bee founde able order cou cell doth fully establish cofirme mariage priest deacon subdeacon priesthoode wee wyll men bee prohibited ascende dignity aforesayd cohabitation wyues bee constrained receite theyr order professe chastitie abstayne company lawfull wyues foloweth man presume therfore agaynst canon apostle depriue priestes deacon copulation felowship theyr lawfull wyues let man bee deposed semblably priest deacon putteth away wyues vnder colour holynes let bee excommunicated continue let bee deposed note thys counsell doth condemne name pope decree hath commaunded spirituall men forsake wyues thys also bee obserued euasion papistes say marryed may priest false lye pope dyd neuer admit counsell witnesseth alonely driuen narrow exigent yt violence argumentes haue none euasion delude people wherefore bee compelled helpe themselues lye playnely thys counsell declared pope haue prohibited priestes yt marryed copany wyues would admit mynister beefore forsaken wiues farthermore note thys counsell doth alleadge pope doctrine condemned councell rule holy apostle co stitutions blessed men christen man wyll nowe set hym selfe agaynst thys holy counsell hath good auctoritie afterwarde bee marked counsell doth commaunde man shall vowe chastitie whe hee shall bee consecrated thing clearely agaynst pope co pelleth hys priestes vowe chastitie beefore bee sacred let euery christen iudge whether bee better surer follow pope hauing none auctoritie hym beeyng also one follow thys holy counsel hauyng auctoritie holy apostle blessed men finally marke blessed counsell doth depose doth priuate priestes companye lawfull wyfe doth follow pope hys adherentes bee ipso iur deposed errour bee excomunicated wherfore conclude counsell priestes may lawfully haue wiues wee haue also euen wordes open neither dist xxviij c diaconi deacon subdeacon ought bee forbidden maryage c thys bee playne tell dist xxviij ca de siracus playne wherfore gracianus concludeth whether hee bee priest deacon subdeacon hee may lawfully vse matrimony men bee content wyth sayinges tell satisfie reasonable men ought fight agaynst god man yet let v goe farther see pope lawe sayth innocent thirde writeth de vita honest cloricorum decretalles thys maner priestes maner countrey hath forsaken coniunctio maryage doe breake wedlocke ought greuously bee punished seeyng may vse lawfully matrimony marke maner certayne countryes priestes might mary therefore must needes follow priestes matrimony forbidden god lawe bee forbidden p god lawe charitie pope compell violently vnto thyng yt god hath bounde cruell thyng pope burne man hereticke hee keepeth commanndement lyueth open whoredome doth hee commaunde hym well neyther hunger yet thyrst hee eyther hunger thyrst doth hee forbid hym eate drinke much power vowe chastitie keepe wee haue gift god vowe wee wyll neyther hunger thyrst inclination nature implanted god cicero sayth also emperour hys lawe cicero lib officioru iustinianus lib cap ius naturale wee naturally inclined vnto coniunction matrimony cause propagation much handes neyther hunger thyrst chaunge naturall inclination wee implanted nature marry god gift doe chauge nature wee hungry thirsty ca abstayne eatyng drinking wee keepe chastitie notwythstanding vowe god haue geuen v gyft may please somthyng theselues stand theyr owne conseyte say inuent many remedy keepe chastitie dare say woulde clothes belongeth backes purenes cleannes harte writte great letter set vp yt church dore wherfore woulde desire bee contented set aside hipocrisie speake trueth written theyr harte god wyll bee deceaued yet mocked doubtles coulde shewe infinite example priestes neyther doe yet ca keepe theyr chastitie myght well blame mee mouyng thys article seeyng theyr lyuyng doth testifie doctrine yt great offence sclaunder christes holy church also great rebuke shame many good man childe yea finally dampnation many deare soule mee thynke men ought bee contet thake mee takyng great labour deliueraunce theyr soules also mayntenauce honesty good morall vertue according god lawe man lawe let v proceede farther magister se tentiaru lib ij dist prooue thys matter maister senteces wryteth thys maner weakenes prone fall filthynes helped wyth honest maryage thyng vnto whole men offece vnto sicke remedy marke sentence sayth wee ready fall filthynes maryage honest remedy men theyr owne learning condemne mariage honest thyng seeyng theyr owne clarkes cauleth honest moreouer mayster senteces perfect vnperfect may vse honest thyng first offece necessary remedy iesus woulde men cry agaynst v poore men halfe much v wee haue agaynst lorde sende hys grace molisie theyr harte amen haue also pope law ext de pres cap ad presentiam ven e proposuit transmissa title de filijs presbyterorum bee many chapter written byshops englande concernyng priestes child wherfore hee supposed priest wyues may authoritie priest compelled haue priestes nowe article theyr fayth yet wil bee sayd pope law speaketh bastardes lawfull child mee thynketh charitably aunswered doe accuse fornication many honest priest agaynst haue alonely light supposition made aunswere knew men yet theyr lyuyng text speaketh priestes child bastardes farthermore solution de holy doe graunt bastardes many honest man defamed ee basta whiche euill name thinke vncharitably layd men vnto charge wherefore note men doth sore defame priesthode agaynst order charitie rather graunt priestes law speaketh small nober bee breaker theyr vow bee open whoremaisters yea also theyr child bee bastardes rather would graut priestes lawfull wyues neither agaynst honesty yet order priesthode wherfore shoulde thus haue defamed priestes theyr child men would ore haue beene greued yea afrayde men bee displeased alonely bycause doe write agaynst priestes know surety bee naught hauyng child testifie say yt pope law place whose wordes bee thou doest aske v saith extra lib de fi presbyterum c ad pope byshop cassell whether men hath priestes theyr father may bee promoted holy order hee good honest de well learned aunswere sayth pope bee gotte lawfull marriage bee none canonicall impediment may lawfully bee promoted vnto holy order may enioy benefice father c ca deny yt law speaketh priestes child yt gotten lawfull matrimony wherfore must needes follow yt priestes maryed yea lawe calleth theyr marriage lawfull must also bee noted yt men may see doctrine myne new thyng elder theyr law also title pope sayth haue vnderstanded n borne gotten priesthode ibidem cap litteras lawfull wife hath alwayes affection serue god office spirituall man c note pope speaketh priestes child yea gotten lawfull marriage fornication wherfore pope supposeth priestes may haue lawfull matrimony therfore mee thinketh men finde law mention made priestes child rather suppose bee gotten matrimony fornicatio honesty father mother also childe specially seeyng yt priestes wyues dayes stadeth also honesty priesthode graunt wyues rather whore let v see emperours imperator constan lege omnis ad perangariam codice de epi ele lawe sayth priestes wyues sayth hee maner spirituall men shal haue prerogatiue theyr wyues child seruauntes say male female shall bee free homage whiche called peragariam bee noted emperour doth alonely admit priestes matrimony also hee honoreth priuilege prerogatiue whiche hee would haue done hee iudged matrimony vnlawfull wherefore men may see indifferent forefather hath beene vnto holy state matrimony wold become v euill learned better iudge thyngs god maker hath instituted sanctified good reader haue prooued article god holy word sayinges doctours authoritie councels certaine lawes emperiall popish wherfore wil goe farther vnto hystories prooue thing example practise holy first haue example blessed peter doubtles wyfe may bee prooued mathew sayth quod haue bad hee philip euangelist marryed wyfe thinke good recke bee bastardes whore child neither helpe saye child borne hys electio simple saying probatio inough say seeyng men haue necessary article daughter wherfore may good reason say philippes daughter may say father none euangelist doe read tripertita historia wordes priestes orientall ex tripertita historia lib cap xxxviij church doth least wise must followe priestes may haue wiues lawfully priestes may haue also god hath layde none burthen priestes neckes hee moreouer doe reade ecclesiastica li iiij ca xxiij historia penitus christes holy apostels many holy men since dayes haue liued holy estate matrymony finally hath many holy men also holy woman borne wedlocke priestes reaso wil damne thynges bee great auctoritie men wyll heare neyther god yet good reason neede men much speake learning seeing wyll heare nothyng alonely iudge good truely great high minde thus wrongfully condemne men heretikes hauyng good learnyng yet themselues grounded onely owne sensuall mynde hauyng learnyng reason wyll put matter god iudgement let men doubt beeleeue god god wyll bee reuenger wrongfull violence men doe vse thys case agaynst
