fa henry iij raygned yt yeare lord priestes myght lawfully marry wiues much yt anseline archbyshop caunterbury seane hee helde london make decree yt priestes forsake wiues agaynst god lawe man texte mayster christ cleare quos deus coniunxit homo non seperet marke two wordes deus homo howe much one passeth farthermore pope hymselfe hath greatly regarded priestes chastitie hee myght get money dispensation thyng hee coulde haue dispesed beene god lawe bee man lawe charitie pope compell men sore keepe seeyng great dau ger vnto priestes many soules beene lost thorough yea tyranny hym thus cruelly kill men breakyng alonely hys commaundement power keepe purpose pope hath often tymes dispensed wyth priestes religious men vowe hath geeuen licence marry vnknowen many men abbot sa te readyng abbot reading men perfecte lyuinge called abbot sancte man beeyng daunger certayne disease priestes hath maryed priesthode reason hee wyfe sente vnto pope desiring hym dispense wyth hym hys vowe yt pope dispensed wyth hym gaue hym licence marry wyfe vnder condition shoulde bee secretly done facie ecclesie men may see pope holdeth much priest chastitie hee woulde regarde money pope may dispence wyth thys abbot auoyding disease corporall much ought hee dispense priestes seeing bee many soules daunger yea also order priesthoode sore defamed sclaundered reaso priestes hath wyues moreouer wee doe reade n generatione xl pope celestine third dispense nunne whose name cauled constatia kyng rogers daughter cecyll gaue licence cransius canutus seuen yeares monke p iuniacensis yet pope dispenseth hym marry wife marry henry yt emperour sixt name yt yeare lorde may perceaue pope doth greatly regarde vowe hys spiritualtie thing may bee gotten pay dispensation wil helpe say pope dispense woman common wealth story maketh mention pope dispesed vnder codition hee paye hym yearely pencion kyngdome cecyll recouer owne charge handes tancredus possession beecause hee myght haue better title kyngdome hee gaue hym onely daughter cecill yt pope common wealth owne lucre graunt common wealth therefore first god commaundemet priestes liue sole god word geeueth place common wealth pope dispence como wealth doth hee dispence auoyding fornication many innumerable priestes doth recken common wealth expell fornication occasion therevnto commo wealth bee regarded beecause shyning golde offered yt mariage priestes neither agaynst god lawe man lawe least wayes mee thinketh priestes marry bee farre heresie neyther agaynst god lawe yet agaynst common wealth many example bee brought pope hath dispensed monkes frier nunnes passe ouer neare chronicle log pope hath gone bryng vow chastitie doctour eckius doth say calixtus primus dyd firste make statute priestes vow chastitie b false chronicle beareth witnesse priestes wyues councell nicene almost hundreth yeares calixtus dayes wherfore bee supposed yt statute made beefore councell nicene authenticall hystories doth make mention nicholas first whiche nicholaus byshop rome yeare lord goe thyng hee could bryng passe reason holy man huldericke episcopus augustensis wrote sharpe epistle agaynst hym reproouyng hym sore bycause hee would compell priestes vow chastitie hys woords bee thou hast swarued litle discretion yt thou oughtest haue counsayled priestes chastitie thou hast lordly violence compelled iudgement wise men compelled chastitie institution gospell great violence whe thou agaynst institution gospell agaynst ye decree holy ghost wilt compell men obserue thy priuate decree c hee reciteth also agaynst ye byshop rome scripture haue brought herein booke matter al certain counsel purpose haue brought men ought thinke first thus hath vnderstande scripture yet first hath spoken agaynst priestes vowes note also holy sayth priest ought bee admonyshed counselled chastitie compelled sayth hee great compel priestes vowe chastitie hath yt gifte halfe brother vnto heresie violence agaynst christes holy gospell yt blessed spirite god bee vehement wordes haue spoke woordes men may gather farre heresie compell priestes vow chastitie holy man proceedeth farther yt bishop rome telleth fact gregory went compell priestes vow chastitie vpon day gregory sent vnto hys pondes fish nettes lamentable horrible sight fished withall brought vp aboue sixe thousand young childrens heades thyng gregory saw stroke hym sore hart hee heauy sight perceyued anone hys decree hee made priester chastitie occasion great murther priestes could lyue sole yet durst auow theyr child feare decree sauegarde theyr honesty fell fearefull abhominable sinne kyll theyr child cause gregory sayth holy byshop dyd reuoke hys decree agayn greattly lord god byshoppes woulde nowe bee charitable alow saying apostle ii better marry burne addyng vnto hys owne better marry geue occasion murther note good reader terrible fearefully example piteous case many thousandes innocetes bee thus slayne shall chastitie keepyng priestes worlde bee occasion great goodnes law chastitie hath beene hereof mischief ala pyty e harte nothyng moued whe read horrible factes holy men writyngs doe men thinke mischief dayes done reason priest compelled chastitie men thinke come mischiefe reason men recken auoyde god vengeauce stifly strongly mayntayne haue beene informed credible person whiche neede could yet bryng foorth place religion within fewe yeares religious man dyd frute chastitie get woman child whiche woman brought bed brother chamber fayre sonne child christened cha ber soone christened hee brake necke buryed night churcheyarde horrible tale trueth ca prooue terrible thyng dooth nature abhorre yet men rather abhominablenes release litle theyr oh lorde god howe streightly shalt thou punish yet yt minde sinnes yt honest man lost daughter reason priest defiled trabbe yt tree bycause hee would bee dishonested kylled mayde priuely afterwarde cast well men bee moued lyke factes tell moue could recite great many abhominable detestable factes ashamed tell priestes hath beene doe neither recite shamefully men daughter men wyues men seruauntes hath beene dayly cast awaye reason priestes hoate courage keepe theyr chastitie would abhorre christen heare tell innumerable baudes made yt reason yt priest ca lyue chaste petious case see many young men cast away th whiche doth see dayly maisters vncleane liuyng many speake litle prety oyes folow priestes long doublet short hosen thynges bee recited honesty compelleth passe ouer thinke good man hee thinke much hym selfe either would say say could tell would occasion yt cardinal rome keepeth whore bee noted common people bee best sort cardinal passe ouer neuertheles greeueth mee lyttell may somewhat ope hart promyse chastitie court rome fro whiche god defend v proiectours fylthy chastitie doth take hand defende agaynst mee bee ashamed write haue beene ashamed doe keepe secrete certayne byshops england also country doth let whore ferme vnto priest beecause suffer marry yet heare tell one prety tale byshop lyuyng day germanye spare little speake one word neede great money could tell name would byshop called vnto hym gentilman great frend smelled littell new learning called hystory sprong chastitie priest vnto hee made complaint hee must needes make shifte shortly great somme money desyring hym helpe hym also counsell man sayde vnto hym hee would folow cou sell hee would shortly helpe man intended declare holy father honestye mayntayned priestes chastitie byshop glad grauted folowe counsell sayde gentylman lord lordship shall geue strayte commaundement priestes within diocese shall put away whore within two monethes vnder payne heresye least lordship shall send ij cousellers bee knowen bee greately fauour handle priestes owne name take vp thys matter betweene lordeship vnder condition priest shall graut vnto certayne money shall promise priestes yt bring passe lordship notwithstading strait commaundement shall bee contented suffer liue haue done tymes past olde custome church byshop prety practise finde naughty concious byshop contented counsell incontinent gaue yt commaundement afterward sent two best frendes priuelye treate priestes name hee woulde bee knowen hee vowed chastitie thinke two gather one byshoppricke within yt space ij moneths verely xx guyldens money byshop receiued deuoutly thought vowe chastitie shall men say men conscience sticke burne poore priest maryeth wife yet receyue xx guyldens mayntayne open whoredome lord god thou knowest yet doubtles thou sufferest beecause haue space respite amende vnto god geue grace amen agayne purpose men may perceaue holy byshop hulderyke agaynst pope dyd also alowe doctrine declare gregorie repet dist ca ante trienium yt statute yt hee made priest astitie wherefore conclude yet agayne god holy worde olde doctours holy counselles emperours lawe olde decree church practice holy apostels lyuing holy men god lawe man lawe nature reason doth alowe article myne wherefore trust good reasonable man withstand mee case runneth greate voyce world lye mee haue maried wife cause men doth recken something proue witte also stretch learning mayntain priestes myght haue wyues haue meruayle men ashamed come lay thing charge trueth beefore god haue wife neuer went marry thanke god grace haue noble prince bee germany beare mee witnesse also many worshipfull honest men yt doth knowe mee conuersation haue also ryght worshipfull man doctour lee kinges embassadour v seruauntes testifye mee bee honest men sufficient greater cause finally also byshop citie doe dwell conuersant heare also embassadours lubycke doth also know mee conuersation doubt testifye mee farre lawe shall require yea dare boldly say yt myne aduersaries haue good testemony keepe theyr vowe chastitie haue maryed done bringe mee defamation let god prouide neuertheles wyfe great crime men make hath many noble prince good men wyues make article saluation mee prince barnes lyued sole vnmaryed christen men haue deserued thus bee taken men haue doe mee promise shall get good may come aunswere wil bee able alwayes defend wyfe weare disposed marry agaynst keepe whore let begin notwithstandyng doe abstayne wife beecause euell vncleane marry haue lawfull consideration let man doubt trueth wyfe would haue medled article men myght haue suspected mee would haue defended article maintenaunce facte syde men think despised mariage thought vnlawfull priest marry much selfe doe marry therfore haue take labour mee wryte meaning much boldely beecause men haue cause suspect mee speake defende myne owne cause onely set veretye god helpe mee amen goe pope lawe see tyme thys thyng begunne take strength beene often time attempted alwayes repelled one good man tyll dayes saint gregory pope siricius made statute priestes haue wyues tooke none effect dist ca plurimos hym came pelagius seconde hee commaunded priestes maryed wiues abstayne wyues next hym came gregory hee thought statute pelagius sore men abstaine wyues neither vowed chastitie yet vsed selues continencie therefore hee decreed byshops consecrate subdeacon except hee woulde first vowe chastitie thys openly pope lawe beegan thyng somthyng springe dist ca ante trie ium take effecte yet fully establyshed afterwarde gregory hymselfe repented hym hulderike beareth witnesse yt reason great murther thath hee sawe come thereof wherefore remayned styll great whyle vnto commyng leo ix hee sayth priestes may keepe theyr dist ca omnino wyues may company wyth apostle sayth hee dyd forsake company wyues alonely prouided meate clothe hym commeth innocentius second regarding dist ca docerni god ordinaunce ioyneth priestes maryeth priestes keepeth whore vnder one damnation yet coulde bryng thys matter passe woulde many place priestes wyues tyll tyme gregory seueth cauled nauclerus alber hirsucid si hildebrande man euill lyuyng chronicle testifieth also great nygromancer familyar deuill chronicle sayth man poysoned pope hee myght come sooner thys man say yeare lord beganneth priest cha get hand captaine ce began attempte thys matter sharpely germany priest quietly suffered haue wyues thys man sent commau dement vnto otto byshop consta tinople commaundyng forbydde priestes yet maryed marry yt maried bee separated wyues byshop otto perceiuyng thys thyng pe gem quos deus co ux homo seperet et nemo dimittat vxore excepta fornicationis caus bee deuillishe woulde exercise hys commaundement wherfore pope gregory cursed assoiled men obedience cited hym vnto rome hee gathered counsell hee made decree prieste shoulde afterwarde marry maryed beefore shoulde forsake wyues moreouer decreed man receaue holy order afterwarde except hee first sweare lyue sole decree prouulgated ouer italy priestes byshops fraunce resisted decree ca require better auswere byshops make wordes god wordes sayde counsel contrary god worde tooke priestes god nature graunted therefore yt pope sayde hereticke auctour ofdamnable doctrine decree came god deuil alleaged saying mayster christ omnes math capiunt verbum hoc also paule de virginitate prec ptum non cor habeo saide also pope woulde compell lyke lyke angel hee dyd ope wyndow vnto fornicatio vncleannes wherfore made hym aunswere rather forsake benefice wyues hee woulde despise maryed priestes shoulde hee goe prouide angel serue cure pope hath alwayes beene pope maner teachyng doctrine hee neuer nothing moued scripture reason still wrote yt byshops straite letter comaundyng threatning vnder payne cursing priuating byshopprickes yt bring thing passe yt last parte byshoppes consented feare laboured yt coulde perswade priestes forsake wiues vowe chastitie long ere priest perswaded yea woulde neuer agree thereunto long liued pope wrote also archbyshop mentz comaunding primate germany compell maried priest forsake wiues cause vowe chastitie byshop called conuocatio hee declared pope pleasure yt priestes resisted meruaylous earnestly alleaging scripture reason counsel farre proceeded togither lyke haue beene greate tumulte priestes wyues tumulte byshop beynge wyse man consideryng stiffe earnest priestes ere desired take halfe yeares deliberation exhorting agree vnto thing wyth good vnto hee must el compell pope auctoritie halfe yeare come byshops called conuocation vniuersitie erforde required aunswere priestes stiffer sayde rather dye forsake wyues co trary god law side deuill sleepeth geueth gladly place christ archbishop earnest setting forth pope commaundement priestes required take counsel departed conuocation agreed seeyng neither scripture reason counsel yet intercessio could helpe sayd would go agayne kyll byshop byshops hym bee well aduised ere set foorth thyng byshop frendes amogst reuelated thyng vnto hym hee streight wayes sent certaine frendes vnto yt priest requiryng come agayne peaceably hee would promise entreate pope hee bee contet let passe keepe cure still done notwithstandyng archbyshop could chauge pope mynde wise yeare pope sent downe hys legate curiensen episcopum ioyned byshop mentz hym commaundyng gather conuocation mentz propounde decree agayne yet yt priestes would wise agree vnto layde scripture reasos could thynges would helpe fell entreatie intercession pope legate shall men doe agaynst violence tyranny stiffe remedy tyranny violence bee vsed soone priestes sawe gathered togither made tumulte pope legate scaped hardely lyues conuocation house conuocation broken archbyshop mentz would neuer medle committed matter pope discretion pope fayne tary conuenient tyme till hee gotten certaine byshops certaine priestes partie determinate tyme doth yt story declare alonely see nowe hee preuayled mischief wherfore proceede promise recite scripture reasos wherby prooue celibatum sacerdotu first scripture bee ye holy holy dist xxxii cap tenere sayth lord vpon scripture disputeth yt pope maner priestes old law company wyues tyme ministration wherefore priestes new law whiche doth solution reason alwayes minister must much alwayes keepe chastitie first pope doth alleage scripture pope argument yt maintenaunce constrained chastitie wrong moyses mynde text spoken compell men wiues marry thyng pope hath taken vpo hym prooue moyses speaketh whole houshold israell house israell copelled text either forsake wyues el vowe chastitie wherfore text make pope purpose farthermore text sayth bee cleane holy matrimony either vncleane vnholy thyng instituted sanctified god purest creature adam eua euer god made dyd vse therby defiled ergo text maketh pope purpose pope saith yt priest newe law shall bee cleane leuitirall cleannes lyeth much pope head graut desire god harte may bee beecause would bee therfore doe exhorte vse god holy ordinaunce may bee holy creature tim god bee good vnto bee cleane nothyng vncleane matrimony god ordinauce wherefore must needes bee cleane selfe may bee lawfully vsed thankes farthermore argument pope priestes old law abstayne fro wiues alwayes somtime tyme ministration ergo priestes must alwayes abstayne foloweth alwayes old priestes sometyme hath ot priestes sometyme wyues olde priestes thinketh pope rather take occasio place bynde hys priestes mariage lyue sole priestes law god comaundement wiues ergo god would recken mariage vncleane vnpure cleane must much bee cleaner vnto priestes thynges bee cleaner vnto v wherfore thinketh yt pope rather dispute maner priestes yt old law wyues thereby defiled ergo priestes must much rather haue wyues shall bee lesse defiled moreouer foloweth priestes old law abstained wyues tyme ministration ergo priestes must abstayne alwayes bycause bee alwayes ministration many thinges vncleane priestes old law bee vncleane vnto priestes also vnto commaundement doe el beene lawfull tary wyues priestes hath commaundement ergo bounde abstayne finally text scripture dyd bynde apostle holy father apostle till innocentes tyme abstayne theyr wyues ergo byndeth priestes god word full stregth innocentes dayes second scripture abstayne dist c nam sicut abstinete ad tempus vt vacet orationi tyme ye may better geue attendaunce prayer texte disputeth pope maner paule commaundeth sayth hee laye men abstayne tyme ergo much priestes bounde abstayne alwayes whiche must alwayes pray bee continuall sacrifiyng argument also false concluded saint paules mynde paule woulde text forbydde mariage reason prayer howe could hee saye abstayne tyme vnmaryed men must abstayne alwayes tyme onely commaundement vnto lay men pope sayth abstayne paule yt shall abstayne except agreed yea also case yt abstayning bee occasyon prayer abstayning may bee occasyon vncleanenes el one party abstayne blessed paule neyther shall defraude bounde thys case vse felues offyce matrimonye pro illo loco tempore pray yt text clere vxori vir debitum reddat let men marke saying well though bee bound pray gospell yet thynke cercumstance tyme place man lawe reddere debitum case gospell wherefore must geue place take wordes charitably learning yet graut commaundement folowe priestes shall neuer marry lay men bound pope sayth abstaine tyme doth pope pope doctine repugnaunt doctrine paule rather bynde priestes tyme place requisite matrimony auoyding fornication paule doth world knoweth yt priest doth alwayes pray wherefore doth pope graunt lybertie yt paule doth w lest yt deuyll tept incontenency yt returne againe prayer yt office matrimony lorde god would men crye agaynst mee thus pope tearer nd wrester scripture teare wringe scripture popet may doe hee lysta nd hee doth men doe recken bee article fayth stronger place scripture matrimony much learned men euer spake matter hath brought chapter paule yet yt deuill pope turne topse turuy yt maketh agaynst must needes make hym el hee wring tyll hee breake necke learning prooue priest may marry beecause boude pray doe sacrifyce doth mariage defyle prayer cotaminate sacrifyces holy patriarch prophetes haue cleane sacrifyces yea christes apostle vncleane sacrifice wonderfull iuglynge deuyll sometime pope maketh hotchpot mariage matrymony shall bee holy blessed sacramet shal geeue grace shall bee god sacrifice defyler god mynisters prayer wherefore conclude texte paule abstaine time may diligetly pray maketh nothing pope wee bee boude yt pope saith marry reason lay men bounde prayer well priestes ought pray might lay man marry wife laye men much bounde gospell prayer priestes bee tyme gospell comaundeth priest pray yet prayer commaunded priestes yt gospell lay men bonnd wherefore pope conclude priestes shall haue wiues bound pray reason prooue yt christe man may haue wife help say priestes bound pray lay men therefore haue wyues whether bounde lesse maketh matter yt argumet party bounde prayer therefore pope doctrine neyther may marry whether one bounde maketh matter mee bounde therfore must abstayne woulde desyre papistes let reason myne stande still vnassoyled reason pope dist xxxi ca omnino cor nunquid habemus potestate muliere sor circunducedi c leo ix bringefh text paule haue power leade aboute v wyfe brother lord cephas texte disputeth pope thus paule sayth haue power amplectendi muliere embrace woman circunducendi cor leade v shee may bee sustayned pope sayth husband may bee company maryage betweene euery christe man may see skle der argument pope paule sayth amplectedi sed cercu ducendi ergo non licet sacerdotious habere vxores man denye paules mening priest may lawfully haue wiues example peter doth prooue wherefore thinke man madde iudge apostels dyd myrry wyues alonely lead pope sayth put men costes charge office might haue woman neded marry leading woman wherefore must needes follow seeing paules meaning priestes may lawfully haue wiues may also lawfully vse office matrimony owne doctrine man hath power ouer owne body cor wife wherefore must followe pope maketh euell supposition hee supposeth apostle hadde wiues onely cary geue meate drinke company also marke argument pope graunteth apostle wyues wherefore must prooue apostle forsooke company wiues hee sayth content take argument pope hand pope graunteth apostle ledde wyues aboute wyth wherfore must needes follow eue pope priestes may also leade wiues aboute ye graunt content binde priestes amplectendi vxores put wiues discretion two ca agree cotent alonely let haue libertie pope graunteth holy apostle haue doubt wyll many factes could recite amplectedi folow token onely circumducendi amplectendi truely haue great maruayle yt men bee ashamed thus trifle child bee gotten might beare witnes holy scripture yea matter bee waighty wherby see dayly great offence sclaunder spring holy church god scripture pope hath dist lxxxi c proposu sti qui carne sunt deo placer non possunt fleshe please god thys text disputeth pope thus defiled fleshe priestes marry wyues defiled therefore bee yt fleshe please god men eyther feare god thier harte el reuerece god holy institution ordinaunces would thus speake iudge pure cleane matrimony trust pope accompteth whoredom bee cleane holy matrimony christe man bee graut mee matrimony god ordayning settinge wherefore must needes bee pure cleane god god vncleanenes filthines let pope iudge hym hee wyll nowe pope argument pope sayth hys minor priestes marry bee vncleane denye say stedfastly pope blasphemeth god holy giftes whe hee prooue minor true graunt vnlawfull priestes marry wyll take pope argument pope blasphemeth god prooue man shall haue wiues shall worlde soone bee ende pope maior bee flesh please god maryed pope thinketh lyue ye flesh therefore maryed man bee saued let pope rome hys adherentes aunswere argument soone aunswere sure ye scripture bringeth maketh agaynst matrimony yet priest agaynst lay men wherfore let hym conclude hee priestes conclude agaynst laye men bee scripture finde pope law matter wherefore goe reason principall reason maryed men haue wiues may bee priestes priesthode may marry men may bee chose bee priest priesthoode say may marry must first consider doctrine defend yt say intede defed ye pope doctrine yt doctrine call doctrine church none doctrine agaynst v nowe doth doctrine clearely deterne agaynst say dist x viij c nullum c assumi ca preterea c pr usquam hath wife may bee chose bee priest deaco neither ca bring mee one exaple euer pope graunt maryed man myght bee priest excepte hee got money dispensing pope dispensation hath alwayes testified law remember tyranny gregory vij compelled priestes forsake wiues maryed man bee priest wherfore defende lawes church must bee bound prooue maryed men may lawes church call bee chosen elles aunswere naught reason faine solution owne braynes say may bee must prooue church doth graut lawful bee moreouer bee scripture whereby prooue priestes may marry defilyng company priest keepeth hys mariage one priesthode wife consecration graunt pure cleane beefore consecration hath consecration made yt thyng vncleane yt pure wherfore hee may keepe wyfe men hee maryed consecration may priest lykewise marry wife priesthoode doth thys man concerning office matrimony doth farthermore wont say priestes might keepe wiues much fained yt apostle forsake wiues stadeth thys wyth solution maryed men myght bee bishop mee thinke doe trifle matter seeke light euasion helpe tyme moreouer practise lawes church declareth clearly meaning chuse maried man bee byshop custome man may bee subdeacon yeares olde man customably maryed younge hee shall subdeacon dist xxvi cap null hee must forsweare mariage pope lawe commaundeth therefore must needes folow maryed man bee priest hee hath forsworne maryage many yeares moreouer doctours doe graunt fall adam matrimony remedye fornication paule approoueth vnusquis que suam habeat vxore propter fornicatione man consecration ieopardie fornication hee beefore remedy men finde nowe infirmitie consecration taketh away naturall appetite maketh god remedy vnlawfull eyther hee must lyue fornication elles marry wife let men iudge becommeth priest best consecration farthermore man denye hystories make mention diuerse priest haue beene maryed consecration dispensation pope wherfore must folow agaynst god law priest marry consecration pope might dispense men must graunt many priestes haue wyues stadeth good reason learnyng prooue yt men dyd marry priesthode onely seeyng stockes stone liuinge creature stockes bee deade created lyue euerlasting god stockes bee made fyer sure man wil alowe one merueilous woder best holy new god yea one doth myracles euery day taken hand set againe ye caruers maker house hee bee better stock stone could doe myracles yea hee prayed practise papistes cause image worke myracles neuer much much ye house fyer saue either ye house hym selfe brieflye hee defeneth king kingdome sudden mutation beecause hee hath got hym new new place hypocrite thynke men bee blynde hipocrisie papistes hath greatly preuailed practysyng aduauncing idolatry ca see falsed would make blynde deede would make honour stockes stone yea name thing also know hath seen lady saint may lerne make similitude haue nothing lay shee woman image much ye similitude harlot stues bereth shape belongeth naturall woman wel lady notwithstanding blessed lady vergin strumpet yet exterior formes shape may bee seene iudged sens bee one yea image exterior signes great deale chapter baruch wherin shall fynde wordes stockes polished baruch carpenter bee gilded siluered false notable declaration baruch prophet idol idolatry ca speake thinke haue image property god haue golden crownes heades priest doth take away golde siluer spend themselues geeue also vnto strupets decke harlotes whe haue take away fro harlot deck god againe wherfore know bee god bee thinges fulfilled doe take away oblation therwith maintayne pompe pride decke also harlotes say nay world condemne ope lyers matter plaine god haue septer like like iudge land ca sley hym offendeth wherefore feare doth agre god note bolde prophet dare crake god sayth yt ca hurte enemy wherefore hee biddeth v shall feare think bee spoken god standing none thinges bee voyde goe cry remember crye aloude bee thicke hearing per aduenture gone forth toune occupied therefore say crye whoope aloud byd god haue honour auege themselues enemyes doe nothing lay vnto mocke profyt feare haue sworde hande axe delyuer selues battel fro theeues therfore feare righteous better hath none image shall free fro obprobriousnes thinke haue god token many theeues haue hanged robbyng good god neuer saued self fro theeues moreouer make suer locke sure dores god bee able keepe good thinke feare runnyng away farthermore keepe great bandogs god bee able saue god fro theeues mee thinketh bandogs bee mightier goddes also trust defende goddes dumme stockes reason wit wisdome policy godly faith ought haue god heauen ashamed thus groslye deceaue men yea wyth thynges neither defende scripture yet wyth reason confyrmed charitie bee deedes charitie lykewise paule heare dyd hys charitie wryte epistelles declare veretie therefore must ee much wryte afore hee wrot one epistell must hee yt least write three el hee confyrmed charitie thinke hee dyd neuer greater dede charitie wright epistell declare owne pistels world variaunce vnderstading blynd gydes hath learned declare wherein charitie sayntes doth men bee fauour king may entreate matter likewise beefore god aunswere infidelles mistrusters god make god make fleshely carnall stocke full passion affection vnto mortall prince make mediatours beecause hee knew hart beecause hee affectionat one man beecause hee iudgeth sight hys eye ye percialnes affection hart doth god alonely mere mercy grace similitude haue duke speake excepte geeue rewardes excepte haue carnall affection therfore similitude must likewyse doe saintes ambrose answereth clearly damnable reason saying men wonte vse thys ad ro c miserable excusation thinges may wee come god may come kyng erles aunswere wee doe come vnto kyng meanes duke erles kyng man knoweth hee may committe common wealth vnto god nothing bee hidde hee knoweth men merites wee neede spokesman may thereby learne ought folow image bee vnlearned men writinges learned men therefore may image bee worshipped bookes learned men reade doe learned men doe letter woulde suffer learned men come kneele offer booke sette vp candels make vowes come yearely thereunto desire petitio beefore booke saintes yt bee written therein see owne example maketh agaynst thing bringe wherefore bee grace bee shame worlde christes sake leaue false learnyng colouring idolatrie doe onely deceaue simple brother doe also blaspheme immortall god heauen doubtles auenge shortly rebuke doe amende whose violece petition bee asked hee onely yt geeueth wealth prosperitie hee must deliuer comforte v aduersities hee onely must helpe v distresse vnto saint paule sayth alonely glory honour tim euer amen excellent endeuour whiche although may bee manifest vnto thee many deedes withstanding one yt greatly boast manifest none ca dony attribute originall masse vnto iames apostle basilius ye bishop errour bee
